  2141                                  ;============================================================================
  2142                                  ; ERROR.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  2143                                  ;============================================================================
  2144                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
  2145                                  
  2146                                  ;**	ERROR.INC - DOS Error Codes
  2147                                  ;
  2148                                  ;    The newer (DOS 2.0 and above) "XENIX-style" calls
  2149                                  ;    return error codes through AX. If an error occurred then
  2150                                  ;    the carry bit will be set and the error code is in AX. If no error
  2151                                  ;    occurred then the carry bit is reset and AX contains returned info.
  2152                                  ;
  2153                                  ;    Since the set of error codes is being extended as we extend the operating
  2154                                  ;    system, we have provided a means for applications to ask the system for a
  2155                                  ;    recommended course of action when they receive an error.
  2156                                  ;
  2157                                  ;    The GetExtendedError system call returns a universal error, an error
  2158                                  ;    location and a recommended course of action. The universal error code is
  2159                                  ;    a symptom of the error REGARDLESS of the context in which GetExtendedError
  2160                                  ;    is issued.

  2269                                  ;**	The GetExtendedError call takes an error code and returns CLASS,

  2307                                  ;============================================================================
  2308                                  ; INT2A.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  2309                                  ;============================================================================
  2310                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  2311                                  
  2312                                  ;**	Int 2A functions
  2313                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2314                                  ;	Int 2A is an interface to the network code; it's also overloaded
  2315                                  ;		as a critical section handler since critical sections
  2316                                  ;		were originally created to support the net.
  2317                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2318                                  
  2319                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2320                                  ;**	This table was created by examining the source and may not be
  2321                                  ;	complete or completely accurate - JGL
  2322                                  ;
  2323                                  ;	M010	MD	8/31/90 - Added definition for AH = 5
  2324                                  
  2325                                  ;	(ah) = 0	installation check
  2326                                  ;			   (returns ah !=0 if installed)
  2327                                  ;	(ah) = 1	cooked net bios call
  2328                                  ;	(ah) = 3	query drive shared
  2329                                  ;			   (ds:si) = "n:" asciz string
  2330                                  ;	(ah) = 4	net bios
  2331                                  ;	       (al) = 0	   cooked net bios call
  2332                                  ;	       (al) = 1	   raw net bios call
  2333                                  ;	       (al) = 2	   ???
  2334                                  ;
  2335                                  ;	(ah) = 5	Get Net Adaptor Resources. CX returns the number of
  2336                                  ;			NCBs available/outstanding. DX returns the number of
  2337                                  ;			sessions. Supposedly, this is documented in an old
  2338                                  ;			IBM PC-LAN reference. Lotus Notes uses it. DOS LAN
  2339                                  ;			Manager 2.0 Enhanced responds to it. But it should
  2340                                  ;			not be used, as it is a hack, only to get Lotus
  2341                                  ;			Notes running.
  2342                                  ;
  2343                                  ;	(ah) = 80h	enter critical section
  2344                                  ;	(ah) = 81h	leave critical section
  2345                                  ;	(ah) = 82h	free all critical sections (Leave-all)
  2346                                  ;	(ah) = 84h	entering idle loop (don't understand how this works)
  2347                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2348                                  
  2349                                  ;**	Critical section definitions
  2350                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2351                                  ;	Although DOS is not designed to be reentrant there are some hacks
  2352                                  ;	which various programs use to make it so, in a limited fashion.
  2353                                  ;	Both WIN386 and some servers block copy a section of the DOS data
  2354                                  ;	area so that DOS can be reentered on behalf of another thread/program.
  2355                                  ;	DOS's global data structures, such as the memory arena, are not
  2356                                  ;	in this area, so critical section indicators are used to protect
  2357                                  ;	those areas.  DOS flags a critical section by issuing an INT_IBM
  2358                                  ;	(int 2Ah) at each critical section entry and exit.  Some clients
  2359                                  ;	(such as WIN386) just don't "context switch" the DOS when one
  2360                                  ;	of these is in effect, others, such as the IBM server, go ahead
  2361                                  ;	and reenter the DOS and if they get an int 2A to reenter the same
  2362                                  ;	critical section they then switch away from that second thread and
  2363                                  ;	let the first one finish and exit the section.
  2364                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2365                                  
  2366                                  ; These below are subject to leave-all sections
  2367                                  critDisk    EQU     1			; Disk I/O critical section
  2368                                  critShare   EQU     1			; Sharer I/O critical section
  2369                                  critMem     EQU     1			; memory maintenance critical section
  2370                                  critSFT     EQU     1			; sft table allocation
  2371                                  critDevice  EQU     2			; Device I/O critical section
  2372                                  critNet     EQU     5			; network critical section
  2373                                  critIFS     EQU     6			; ifsfunc critical section
  2374                                  ; These below are not subject to leave-all sections
  2375                                  critASSIGN  EQU     8			; Assign has munged a system call
  2376                                  
  2377                                  ;============================================================================
  2378                                  ; MULT.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)

  2386                                  ;

  2396                                  ;

  2398                                  ;      11       DOS/server      Redir       install check/redirection funcs
  2399                                  ;      12       sharer/redir    DOS         dos functions and structure maint
  2400                                  ;      13       MSNET           MSNET       movement of NCBs

  2586                                  NLSFUNC     EQU     14h 		; NLSFUNC CALL , DOS 3.3
  2587                                      ;	0   NLSInstall
  2588                                      ;	1   ChgCodePage

  2590                                      ;	3   SetCodePage

  2592                                  
  2593                                  multANSI    EQU     1Ah                 ; ANSI multiplex number
  2594                                      ;   0   INSTALL_CHECK               ; install check for ANSI
  2595                                      ;   1   IOCTL_2F                    ; 2F interface to IOCTL
  2596                                      ;   2   DA_INFO_2F                  ; J.K. Information passing to ANSI.
  2597                                  
  2598                                  multMULT        EQU     4Ah
  2599                                  multMAGIC       EQU     256*multMULT + 11h
  2600                                  multMULTRPLTOM  EQU     06h
  2601                                  
  2602                                      ;   0   swap disk function for single floppy drive m/cs
  2603                                      ;       BIOS broadcasts with cx==0, and apps who handle
  2604                                      ;       swap disk messaging set cx == -1. BIOS sets dl == requested
  2605                                      ;       drive
  2606                                      ;
  2607                                      ;   1   Get available HMA & pointer to it. Returns in BX & ES:DI
  2608                                      ;   2   Allocate HMA. BX == number of bytes in HMA to be allocated
  2609                                      ;       returns pointer in ES:DI
  2610                                      ;
  2611                                      ;   3-4 currently used by nobody
  2612                                      ;   5   Switcher API
  2613                                      ;   6   Top of Memory for RPL.
  2614                                      ;           BIOS issues INT 2f AX=4a06 & DX = Top of Mem and any RPL
  2615                                      ;           code present in TOM should respond with a new TOM in DX
  2616                                      ;           to protect itself from MSLOAD & SYSINIT tromping over it.
  2617                                      ;           SYSINIT builds an arena with owner type 8 & name 'RPL' to
  2618                                      ;           protect the RPL code from COMMAND.COM transient protion.
  2619                                      ;           It is the responsibility of RPL program to release the mem.
  2620                                      ;   7   Reserved for PROTMAN support.
  2621                                      ;  10   smartdrv 4.0
  2622                                      ;  11   dblspace api
  2623                                      ;  12   MRCI     api
  2624                                      ;  13   dblspace/mrci stealth packet api
  2625

  2770                                  ;============================================================================
  2771                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  2772                                  ;============================================================================
  2773                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  2774                                  ; 09/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (CURDIR.INC, MSDOS 3.3, 1987)
  2775                                  
  2776                                  ;BREAK <Current directory list structure>
  2777                                  
  2778                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2779                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2780                                  ;									   ;
  2781                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and ;
  2782                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually, ;
  2783                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices.  In the case  ;
  2784                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential  ;
  2785                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.		   ;
  2786                                  ;
  2787                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
  2788                                  ;
  2789                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
  2790                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
  2791                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
  2792                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
  2793                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
  2794                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
  2795                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
  2796                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /.  For net
  2797                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
  2798                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
  2799                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
  2800                                  
  2801                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
  2802                                  
  2803                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
  2804                                  
  2805                                  struc curdir	; curdir_list
  2806 00000000 <res 43h>               .text:		resb DIRSTRLEN		; text of assignment and curdir
  2807 00000043 ????                    .flags:		resw 1			; various flags
  2808 00000045 ????????                .devptr:	resd 1			; local pointer to DPB or net device
  2809 00000049 ????????                .ID:		resw 2			; cluster of current dir (net ID)
  2810 0000004D ????                    .user_word:	resw 1
  2811 0000004F ????                    .end:		resw 1			; index to ".." backup limit - see above
  2812                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
  2813 00000051 ??                      .type:		resb 1			; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
  2814 00000052 ????????                .ifs_hdr:	resd 1			; Ptr to File System Header
  2815 00000056 ????                    .fsda:		resb 2			; File System Dependent Data Area
  2816                                  .size:
  2817                                  endstruc
  2818                                  
  2819                                  curdirLen	EQU curdir.size	; 88	; Needed for screwed up
  2820                                  
  2821                                  %define curdir_netID curdir_ID  ; dword
  2822                                  
  2823                                  ;**	Flag values for CURDIR_FLAGS
  2824                                  
  2825                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
  2826                                  CURDIR_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B ; MSDOS 6.0	
  2827                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
  2828                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
  2829                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B
  2830                                  
  2831                                  ;									   ;
  2832                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2833                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2834                                  
  2835                                  ;============================================================================
  2836                                  ; CPMFCB.INC (MSDOS 3.3, 1987)
  2837                                  ;============================================================================
  2838                                  ; 09/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  2839                                  
  2840                                  ;BREAK <File Control Block definition>
  2841                                  
  2842                                  ;
  2843                                  ; Field definition for FCBs
  2844                                  ; The FCB has the following structure:
  2845                                  ;
  2846                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2847                                  ;	|   Drive indicator(byte)   |
  2848                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2849                                  ;	|    Filename (8 chars)     |
  2850                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2851                                  ;	|    Extension (3 chars)    |
  2852                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2853                                  ;	|   Current Extent(word)    |
  2854                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2855                                  ;	|    Record size (word)     |
  2856                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2857                                  ;	|    File Size (2 words)    |
  2858                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2859                                  ;	|	Date of write	    |
  2860                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2861                                  ;	|	Time of write	    |
  2862                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2863                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2864                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2865                                  ;									   ;
  2866                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2867                                  ;	|   8 bytes reserved	    |
  2868                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2869                                  ;									   ;
  2870                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2871                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2872                                  ;	|    next record number     |
  2873                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2874                                  ;	|   random record number    |
  2875                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2876                                  ;
  2877                                  
  2878                                  struc	SYS_FCB
  2879 00000000 ??                      .drive:	resb 1
  2880 00000001 ????????????????        .name:	resb 8
  2881 00000009 ??????                  .ext:	resb 3
  2882 0000000C ????                    .EXTENT: resw 1
  2883 0000000E ????                    .RECSIZ: resw 1			; Size of record (user settable)
  2884 00000010 ????                    .FILSIZ: resw 1			; Size of file in bytes; used with the
  2885                                  				; following word
  2886 00000012 ????                    .DRVBP:	resw 1			; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
  2887 00000014 ????                    .FDATE:	resw 1			; Date of last writing
  2888 00000016 ????                    .FTIME:	resw 1			; Time of last writing
  2889                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2890                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2891                                  ;									   ;
  2892 00000018 ????????????????        .reserved: resb 8		; RESERVED
  2893                                  ;									   ;
  2894                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2895                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2896 00000020 ??                      .NR:	resb 1			; Next record
  2897 00000021 ????????                .RR:	resb 4			; Random record
  2898                                  .size:
  2899                                  endstruc
  2900                                  
  2901                                  FILDIRENT EQU SYS_FCB.FILSIZ	; Used only by SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH
  2902                                  				; NEXT
  2903                                  ; 20/07/2018
  2904                                  %define fcb_sfn	SYS_FCB.reserved ; byte
  2905                                  
  2906                                  ; Note that fcb_net_handle, fcb_nsl_drive, fcb_nsld_drive and fcb_l_drive
  2907                                  ; all must point to the same byte.  Otherwise, the FCBRegen will fail.
  2908                                  ; NOTE about this byte (fcb_nsl_drive)
  2909                                  ;   The high two bits of this byte are used as follows to indicate the FCB type
  2910                                  ;	00 means a local file or device with sharing loaded
  2911                                  ;	10 means a remote (network) file
  2912                                  ;	01 means a local file with no sharing loaded
  2913                                  ;	11 means a local device with no sharing loaded
  2914                                  
  2915                                  ; 20/07/2018
  2916                                  
  2917                                  ;
  2918                                  ; Network FCB
  2919                                  ;
  2920                                  
  2921                                  %define fcb_net_drive	SYS_FCB.reserved+1  ; byte
  2922                                  %define fcb_net_handle	SYS_FCB.reserved+2  ; word
  2923                                  %define fcb_netID	SYS_FCB.reserved+4  ; dword		
  2924                                  
  2925                                  ;
  2926                                  ; No sharing local file FCB
  2927                                  ;
  2928                                  
  2929                                  %define fcb_nsl_drive	SYS_FCB.reserved+1  ; byte
  2930                                  %define fcb_nsl_bits	SYS_FCB.reserved+2  ; byte	
  2931                                  %define fcb_nsl_firclus SYS_FCB.reserved+3  ; word	
  2932                                  %define fcb_nsl_dirsec	SYS_FCB.reserved+5  ; word
  2933                                  %define fcb_nsl_dirpos  SYS_FCB.reserved+7  ; byte
  2934                                  
  2935                                  ;
  2936                                  ; No sharing local device FCB
  2937                                  ;
  2938                                  
  2939                                  %define fcb_nsld_drive	SYS_FCB.reserved+1  ; byte	
  2940                                  %define fcb_nsld_drvptr SYS_FCB.reserved+2  ; dword
  2941                                  
  2942                                  ;
  2943                                  ; Sharing local FCB
  2944                                  ;
  2945                                  
  2946                                  %define fcb_l_drive	SYS_FCB.reserved+1  ; byte
  2947                                  %define fcb_l_firclus	SYS_FCB.reserved+2  ; word
  2948                                  %define fcb_l_mfs	SYS_FCB.reserved+4  ; word
  2949                                  %define fcb_l_attr	SYS_FCB.reserved+6  ; byte
  2950                                  
  2951                                  ;
  2952                                  ; Bogusness:  the four cases are:
  2953                                  ;
  2954                                  ;   local file	    00
  2955                                  ;   local device    40
  2956                                  ;   local sharing   C0
  2957                                  ;   network	    80
  2958                                  ;
  2959                                  ; Since sharing and network collide, we cannot use a test instruction for
  2960                                  ; deciding whether a network or a share check in involved
  2961                                  ;
  2962                                  FCBDEVICE   EQU 040h
  2963                                  FCBNETWORK  EQU 080h
  2964                                  FCBSHARE    EQU 0C0h
  2965                                  
  2966                                  ; FCBSPECIAL must be able to mask off both net and share
  2967                                  FCBSPECIAL  EQU 080h
  2968                                  FCBMASK     EQU 0C0h
  2969

  3147                                  ; DOSCODE
  3148                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3149                                  ; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  3150                                  
  3151                                  ;============================================================================
  3152                                  ; MSHEAD.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  3153                                  ;============================================================================
  3154                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0
  3155                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3156                                  ; 24/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
  3157                                  
  3158                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
  3159                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3160                                  ; FILE : ORIGIN.INC
  3161                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3162                                  ; This is included in origin.asm and mshead.asm. Contains the equate that
  3163                                  ; is used for ORGing the DOS code.
  3164                                  ;
  3165                                  ; Brief Description of the necessacity of this ORG:
  3166                                  ; -------------------------------------------------
  3167                                  ;
  3168                                  ; A special problem exits when running out of the HMA. The HMA starts at 
  3169                                  ; address FFFF:10. There is no place in the HMA with an offset of zero.
  3170                                  ; This means programs running out off the HMA must use non-zero offset base
  3171                                  ; addresses. It also means that if we're running multiple programs from the
  3172                                  ; HMA, the base offset of each segment must atleast be as big as all of the
  3173                                  ; HMA segments that precede it.
  3174                                  ; 
  3175                                  ; One solution to this problem to ORG each module at 64K minus its size.
  3176                                  ; For instance a code segment 1234h bytes in length would org'd at edcbh.
  3177                                  ; This gives max. flexibility regarding it's location in the HMA. By 
  3178                                  ; selecting segment values between f124h and ffffh it could be located 
  3179                                  ; anywhere in the HMA. The problem with this is that programs with such 
  3180                                  ; high ORGs would not be able to run in low RAM.
  3181                                  ;
  3182                                  ; A compromise solution is to set the ORG address somewhere between 0010h
  3183                                  ; and ffffh - their size. In the particular case of the BIOS and the DOS 
  3184                                  ; the following solution has been implemented:
  3185                                  ;
  3186                                  ; The Bios Code segment will have a very small offset and run at the very
  3187                                  ; front of the HMA, after the VDISK header. THE Dos Code segment will have 
  3188                                  ; a base offset of (700+<min. size off RAM based BIOS>+<min. size of the DOS
  3189                                  ; DATA segment when DOS is running low>). This will reflect the lowest 
  3190                                  ; possible physical address at which DOS code will run, while still providing
  3191                                  ; max. possible flexibility in HMA positioning. This offset MUST NOT be 
  3192                                  ; smaller then that 20+size of Bios Code segment when running high. This is 
  3193                                  ; mostly true.
  3194                                  ;
  3195                                  ; Also this ORG'd value must be communicated to the BIOS. This is done by
  3196                                  ; putting this value after the first jmp instruction in the DOS code in
  3197                                  ; mshead.asm. 
  3198                                  ;
  3199                                  ; In order for the stripz utility to know how many zeroes to be stripped 
  3200                                  ; out, this value is placed at the beginning of the binary in origin.asm.
  3201                                  ;
  3202                                  ; Revision History:
  3203                                  ;
  3204                                  ; Currently this is being done manually. Therefore any change in the DOS DATA
  3205                                  ; Size or the BIOS size should be reflected here. --- Feb 90
  3206                                  ;
  3207                                  ; BDSIZE.INC contains the equates for BIODATASIZE, BIOCODESIZ and DOSDATASIZ.
  3208                                  ; A utility called getsize will obtain the corresponding values from msdos
  3209                                  ; and msbio.map and update the values in BDSIZ.INC if they are different. 
  3210                                  ; DOS should now be built using the batch file makedos.bat which invokes this
  3211                                  ; utility. The FORMAT of BDSIZE.INC should not be changed as getsize is 
  3212                                  ; dependant on that.				  --- Apr 3 '90
  3213                                  ;
  3214                                  ; For ROMDOS, however, there is no need to org the doscode to any location
  3215                                  ; other than zero.  Therefore the stripz utility will not need to be used,
  3216                                  ; so the offset will not need to be included at the beginning of the code
  3217                                  ; segment.  Also, the BIOS can just assume that the resident code begins
  3218                                  ; at offset zero within the segment.
  3219                                  ; 
  3220                                  ;
  3221                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3222                                  
  3223                                  BIODATASTART	EQU	00700h
  3224                                  ;include	bdsize.inc	; this sets the values:
  3225                                  				;	BIODATASIZ
  3226                                  				;	BIOCODESIZ
  3227                                  				;	DOSDATASIZ
  3228                                  
  3229                                  ; 05/12/2022
  3230                                  ;BIODATASIZ EQU 00910H	; 0900h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
  3231                                  			; 0900h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS
  3232                                  ;BIOCODESIZ EQU 01A70H	; 1A70h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
  3233                                  			; 1A60h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS
  3234                                  ;DOSDATASIZ EQU 01370H	; 1370h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
  3235                                  			; 1370h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS
  3236                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
  3237                                  ;
  3238                                  ;BYTSTART	EQU    	BIODATASTART+BIODATASIZ+BIOCODESIZ+DOSDATASIZ
  3239                                  ;PARASTART	EQU	(BYTSTART + 0FH) AND (NOT 0FH)	
  3240                                  ;
  3241                                  ;else
  3242                                  ;
  3243                                  ;BYTSTART	EQU	0
  3244                                  ;PARASTART	EQU	0
  3245                                  ;
  3246                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
  3247

  3249                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------
  3250                                  ;MSDAT001E equ 136Ah ; 4970 ; for MSDOS 6.21	
  3251                                  ;MSDAT001E equ 1370h ; 4976 ; for Retro DOS v4.0 modif. 25/05/2019

  3253                                  ; 05/12/2022
  3254                                  ;DOSDATASIZE equ $ ; 29/04/2019 ; -only- for RETRO DOS v4.0 :
  3255                                  ;_PARASTART_ equ DOSDATASIZE ; segment value will point to start of
  3256                                  			    ; of DOSDATA (in low memory) while
  3257                                  			    ; dos/kernel code starts just after 
  3258                                  			    ; this data block ((org = DOSDATASIZE))
  3259                                  			    ; (in low memory or in HMA)

  3331                                  ;============================================================================
  3332                                  ; MSTABLE.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  3333                                  ;============================================================================
  3334                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0
  3335                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
  3336                                  
  3337                                  	; (MSDOS version)
  3338                                  	; DOSCODE:3DE9h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  3339                                  	;db	6
  3340                                  	;db	20
  3341                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS) 
  3342                                  	; DOSCODE:3DD9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  3343                                  	;db	5
  3344                                  	;db	0	
  3345                                  
  3346                                  	; Offset 0C78h in IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987)
  3347                                  MSVERS:				; MS-DOS version in hex for $GET_VERSION
  3348 00000009 07                      MSMAJOR: DB	MAJOR_VERSION	; DOS_MAJOR_VERSION
  3349 0000000A 0A                      MSMINOR: DB	MINOR_VERSION	; DOS_MINOR_VERSION  
  3350                                  
  3351                                  ;;hkn YRTAB & MONTAB moved to DOSDATA in ms_data.asm
  3352                                  ;	I_am	YRTAB,8,<200,166,200,165,200,165,200,165>   ; [SYSTEM]
  3353                                  ;	I_am	MONTAB,12,<31,28,31,30,31,30,31,31,30,31,30,31> ; [SYSTEM]
  3354                                  
  3355                                  ; DOSTAB.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  3356                                  ; YRTAB & MONTAB moved from TABLE segment in ms_table.asm
  3357                                  ;
  3358                                  ;	I_am    YRTAB,8,<200,166,200,165,200,165,200,165>   
  3359                                  ;	I_am    MONTAB,12,<31,28,31,30,31,30,31,31,30,31,30,31> 
  3360                                  
  3361                                  ; This is the error code mapping table for INT 21 errors. This table defines
  3362                                  ; those error codes which are "allowed" for each system call. If the error
  3363                                  ; code ABOUT to be returned is not "allowed" for the call, the correct action
  3364                                  ; is to return the "real" error via Extended error, and one of the allowed
  3365                                  ; errors on the actual call.
  3366                                  ;
  3367                                  ; The table is organized as follows:
  3368                                  ;
  3369                                  ;    Each entry in the table is of variable size, but the first
  3370                                  ;       two bytes are always:
  3371                                  ;
  3372                                  ;       Call#,Cnt of bytes following this byte
  3373                                  ;
  3374                                  ; EXAMPLE:
  3375                                  ;       Call 61 (OPEN)
  3376                                  ;
  3377                                  ;       DB      61,5,12,3,2,4,5
  3378                                  ;
  3379                                  ;       61 is the AH INT 21 call value for OPEN.
  3380                                  ;        5 indicates that there are 5 bytes after this byte (12,3,2,4,5).
  3381                                  ;       Next five bytes are those error codes which are "allowed" on OPEN.
  3382                                  ;       The order of these values is not important EXCEPT FOR THE LAST ONE (in
  3383                                  ;       this case 5).  The last value will be the one returned on the call if
  3384                                  ;       the "real" error is not one of the allowed ones.
  3385                                  ;
  3386                                  ; There are a number of calls (for instance all of the FCB calls) for which
  3387                                  ;   there is NO entry.  This means that NO error codes are returned on this
  3388                                  ;   call, so set up an Extended error and leave the current error code alone.
  3389                                  ;
  3390                                  ; The table is terminated by a call value of 0FFh
  3391                                  
  3392                                  ;PUBLIC I21_MAP_E_TAB
  3393                                  	; 10/08/2018
  3394                                  
  3395                                  ; 29/04/2019
  3396                                  ; DOSCODE:3DE9h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  3397                                  ; 04/11/2022
  3398                                  ; DOSCODE:3DDBh	(MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  3399                                  ; 01/01/2024
  3400                                  ; DOSCODE:3F1Bh	(PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  3401                                  
  3402                                  I21_MAP_E_TAB:	; LABEL	BYTE

  3998                                  ; DosCode SEGMENT
  3999                                  
  4000                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4001                                  ;
  4002                                  ; $Set_CTRL_C_Trapping
  4003                                  ;
  4004                                  ; Function:
  4005                                  ;	Enable disable ^C checking in dispatcher
  4006                                  ;
  4007                                  ; Inputs:
  4008                                  ;		AL = 0 read ^C status
  4009                                  ;		AL = 1 Set ^C status, DL = 0/1 for ^C off/on
  4010                                  ;		AL = 2 Set ^C status to contents of DL.	Output is old state.
  4011                                  ;		AL = 5 get DOS boot drive
  4012                                  ;		AL = 6 Get version number
  4013                                  ;			RETURNS:
  4014                                  ;				BH = Minor version number
  4015                                  ;				BL = Major version number
  4016                                  ;				DL = DOS internal revision
  4017                                  ;				DH = DOS type flags
  4018                                  ;					Bit 3 	- DOS in ROM
  4019                                  ;					Bit 4 	- DOS in HMA
  4020                                  ;					Bit 0-2, 5-7 - Reserved
  4021                                  ; Outputs:
  4022                                  ;		If AL = 0 then DL = 0/1 for ^C off/on
  4023                                  ;
  4024                                  ; History:
  4025                                  ;      removed	AL = 3 Get CPSW state to DL	    DOS 3.4
  4026                                  ;      removed	AL = 4 Set CPSW state from DL	    DOS 3.4
  4027                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4028                                  
  4029                                  ; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  4030                                  ; DOSCODE:4045h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  4031                                  
  4032                                  ; 01/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  4033                                  ; DOSCODE:4123h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
  4034                                  
  4035                                  _$SET_CTRL_C_TRAPPING:
  4036                                  	; 01/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4037                                  
  4038 0000023D 3C07                    	cmp	al,7	; 01/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  4039                                  	;cmp	AL,6			; Is this a valid subfunction?
  4040 0000023F 7603                    	jbe	short scct_1		; If yes continue processing
  4041                                  
  4042 00000241 B0FF                    	mov	AL,0FFh			; Else set AL to -1 and
  4043 00000243 CF                      	iret
  4044                                  scct_1:
  4045 00000244 1E                      	push	DS
  4046                                  
  4047                                  	;getdseg <DS>			; DS -> DosData, ASSUME DS:DosSeg
  4048 00000245 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  4049                                  	
  4050 0000024A 50                      	push	AX			; DL only register that can change
  4051 0000024B 56                      	push	SI
  4052                                  
  4053 0000024C BE[3703]                	mov	SI,CNTCFLAG		; DS:SI --> Ctrl C Status byte
  4054 0000024F 30E4                    	xor	AH,AH			; Clear high byte of AX
  4055 00000251 09C0                    	or	AX,AX			; Check for subfunction 0
  4056 00000253 7504                    	jnz	short scct_2		; If not 0 jmp to next check
  4057                                  
  4058 00000255 8A14                    	mov	DL,[SI]			; Else move current ctrl C status
  4059 00000257 EB32                    	jmp	SHORT scct_9s		; into DL and jmp to exit
  4060                                  scct_2:
  4061 00000259 48                      	dec	AX			; Now dec AX and see if it was 1
  4062 0000025A 7507                    	jnz	short scct_3		; If not 0 it wasn't 1 so do next chk
  4063                                  
  4064 0000025C 80E201                  	and	DL,1			; Else mask off bit 0 of DL and
  4065 0000025F 8814                    	mov	[SI],DL			; save it as new Ctrl C status
  4066 00000261 EB28                    	jmp	SHORT scct_9s		; Jmp to exit
  4067                                  scct_3:
  4068 00000263 48                      	dec	AX			; Dec AX again to see if it was 2
  4069 00000264 7507                    	jnz	short scct_4		; If not 0 wasn't 2 so go to next chk
  4070                                  
  4071 00000266 80E201                  	and	DL,1			; Else mask off bit 0 of DL and
  4072 00000269 8614                    	xchg	[SI],DL			; Exchange DL with old status byte
  4073 0000026B EB1E                    	jmp	SHORT scct_9s		; Jump to exit (returning old status)
  4074                                  scct_4:
  4075 0000026D 3C03                    	cmp	al,3 ; 01/01/2024
  4076                                  	;cmp	AX,3 			; Test for 5 after it was dec twice
  4077 0000026F 7506                    	jne	short scct_5		; If not equal then not get boot drv
  4078 00000271 8A16[6900]              	mov	DL,[BOOTDRIVE]		; Else return boot drive in DL
  4079 00000275 EB14                    	jmp	SHORT scct_9s		; Jump to exit (returning boot drive)
  4080                                  scct_5:
  4081                                  	; 01/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  4082 00000277 7212                    	jb	short scct_9s ; PCDOS 7.1
  4083                                  	;
  4084 00000279 3C04                    	cmp	al,4 ; 01/01/2024
  4085                                  	;cmp	AX,4 			; Test for 6 after it was dec twice
  4086                                  	;jne	short scct_9s		; If not equal then not get version
  4087 0000027B 7512                    	jne	short scct_6 ; 01/01/2024 ; PCDOS 7.1	
  4088                                  
  4089                                  	;mov	BX,(Minor_Version SHL 8) + Major_Version
  4090                                  
  4091                                  	;;mov	bx,1406h ; 6.20	; DOSCODE:4092h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  4092                                  	;;mov	bx,1606h ; 6.22	; DOSCODE:4092h (MSDOS 6.22, MSDOS.SYS)
  4093                                  
  4094                                  	;mov	bx,0A07h ; 7.10	; DOSCODE:4163h (PCDOS 7.1, IMBDOS.COM)
  4095 0000027D BB070A                  	mov	bx,(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION  ; true dos version
  4096                                  	
  4097                                  	;mov	dl,0			; revision 0
  4098                                  	;mov	DL,DOSREVNM ; 0
  4099                                  
  4100                                  	;xor	dh,dh			; assume vanilla DOS
  4101                                  	; 01/01/2024
  4102 00000280 BA0000                  	mov	dx,0	
  4103 00000283 3836[660D]              	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],dh ; 0
  4104                                  	;cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; is DOS in HMA?  (M021)
  4105                                  	;;je	short @F
  4106                                  	;je	short scct_6
  4107 00000287 7402                    	je	short scct_9s ; 01/01/2024	
  4108                                  	; 01/01/2024
  4109 00000289 B610                    	mov	dh,10h			; version flags bit 4
  4110                                  	;or	DH,DOSINHMA ; 10h	; 'DOS in HMA' status
  4111                                  ;@@:
  4112                                  ;scct_6:
  4113                                  ;ifdef ROMDOS
  4114                                  ;	or	DH,DOSINROM ; 08h
  4115                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
  4116                                  
  4117                                  	; 01/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
  4118                                  	;jmp	short short scct_9s
  4119                                  
  4120                                  	; 01/01/2024
  4121                                  ;scct_6:
  4122                                  	; ....
  4123                                  
  4124                                  scct_9s:
  4125 0000028B 5E                      	pop	SI
  4126 0000028C 58                      	pop	AX
  4127 0000028D 1F                      	pop	DS
  4128                                  scct_9f:
  4129 0000028E CF                      	iret
  4130                                  
  4131                                  	; 01/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  4132                                  scct_6:
  4133 0000028F 8026[8600]DF            	and	byte [DOS_FLAG],0DFh	; clear bit 5 of DOS flag
  4134 00000294 80FA01                  	cmp	dl, 1
  4135 00000297 75F2                    	jne	short scct_9s
  4136 00000299 800E[8600]20            	or	byte [DOS_FLAG],20h	; set bit 5 of DOS flag
  4137 0000029E EBEB                    	jmp	short scct_9s
  4138                                  
  4139                                  SetCtrlShortEntry:			; This allows a conditional entry
  4140                                  					; from main dispatch code
  4141 000002A0 EB9B                    	jmp	SHORT _$SET_CTRL_C_TRAPPING
  4142                                  
  4143                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4144                                  ;
  4145                                  ; The following two routines are dispatched to directly with ints disabled
  4146                                  ; immediately after the int 21h entry.	no DIS state is set.
  4147                                  ;
  4148                                  ; $Set_current_PDB takes BX and sets it to be the current process
  4149                                  ;   *** THIS FUNCTION CALL IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE!!! ***
  4150                                  ;
  4151                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4152                                  
  4153                                  _$SET_CURRENT_PDB:
  4154 000002A2 1E                      	push	DS
  4155                                  	;getdseg <DS>			; DS -> DosData, ASSUME DS:DosSeg
  4156 000002A3 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  4157 000002A8 891E[3003]              	mov	[CurrentPDB],BX		; Set new PSP segment from caller's BX
  4158 000002AC 1F                      	pop	DS
  4159 000002AD CF                      	iret
  4160                                  
  4161                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4162                                  ;
  4163                                  ; $get_current_PDB returns in BX the current process
  4164                                  ;   *** THIS FUNCTION CALL IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE!!! ***
  4165                                  ;
  4166                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4167                                  
  4168                                  _$GET_CURRENT_PDB:
  4169 000002AE 1E                      	push	DS
  4170                                  	;getdseg <DS>			; DS -> DosData, ASSUME DS:DosSeg
  4171 000002AF 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  4172 000002B4 8B1E[3003]              	mov	BX,[CurrentPDB]		; Return current PSP segment in BX
  4173 000002B8 1F                      	pop	DS
  4174 000002B9 CF                      	iret
  4175                                  
  4176                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4177                                  ;
  4178                                  ; Sets the Printer Flag to whatever is in AL.
  4179                                  ; NOTE: THIS PROCEDURE IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE!!!
  4180                                  ;
  4181                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4182                                  
  4183                                  _$SET_PRINTER_FLAG:
  4184 000002BA 1E                      	push	ds
  4185                                  	;getdseg <DS>			; DS -> DosData, ASSUME DS:DosSeg
  4186 000002BB 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  4187 000002C0 A2[A00A]                	mov	[PRINTER_FLAG],AL 	; Set printer flag from caller's AL
  4188 000002C3 1F                      	pop	ds
  4189 000002C4 CF                      	iret

  4191                                  ; 01/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4192                                  ; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  4193                                  ; (MSDISP.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  4194                                  
  4195                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4196                                  ; BREAK   <System call entry points and dispatcher>
  4197                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4198                                  
  4199                                  ; DOSCODE:40CCh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  4200                                  
  4201                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4202                                  ;
  4203                                  ; The Quit entry point is where all INT 20h's come from. These are old- style
  4204                                  ; exit system calls. The CS of the caller indicates which Process is dying.
  4205                                  ; The error code is presumed to be 0. We simulate an ABORT system call.
  4206                                  ;
  4207                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4208                                  
  4209                                  SYSTEM_CALL:    ; PROC NEAR
  4210                                  
  4211                                  ; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  4212                                  ; DOSCODE:40BFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  4213                                  
  4214                                  ;entry	QUIT				
  4215                                  QUIT:				; INT 20H entry point	
  4216                                  	;MOV	AH,0
  4217 000002C5 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 08/07/2018
  4218 000002C7 EB36                    	JMP     SHORT SAVREGS
  4219                                  
  4220                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4221                                  
  4222                                  	; The system call in AH is out of the range that we know how
  4223                                  	; to handle. We arbitrarily set the contents of AL to 0 and
  4224                                  	; IRET. Note that we CANNOT set the carry flag to indicate an
  4225                                  	; error as this may break some programs compatability.
  4226                                  
  4227                                  BADCALL:
  4228                                          ;MOV	AL,0
  4229 000002C9 30C0                    	xor	al,al ; 08/07/2018
  4230                                  IRETT:	; 06/05/2019
  4231                                  _IRET:
  4232 000002CB CF                              IRET
  4233                                  
  4234                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4235                                  
  4236                                  ; 01/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4237                                  ; DOSCODE:40D3h (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
  4238                                  ; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  4239                                  ; DOSCODE:40C6h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  4240                                  
  4241                                  	; An alternative method of entering the system is to perform a
  4242                                  	; CALL 5 in the program segment prefix with the contents of CL
  4243                                  	; indicating what system call the user would like. A subset of
  4244                                  	; the possible system calls is allowed here only the
  4245                                  	; CPM-compatible calls may get dispatched.
  4246                                  
  4247                                  		; System call entry point and dispatcher
  4248                                  CALL_ENTRY:
  4249 000002CC 1E                      	push	DS
  4250                                  	;getdseg <DS>			; DS -> DosData, ASSUME DS:DosSeg
  4251 000002CD 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  4252 000002D2 8F06[EC05]              	pop	word [SAVEDS]		; Save original DS
  4253                                  
  4254 000002D6 58                              POP     AX                      ; IP from the long call at 5
  4255 000002D7 58                              POP     AX                      ; Segment from the long call at 5
  4256 000002D8 8F06[8405]              	POP	WORD [USER_SP]		; IP from the CALL 5
  4257                                  
  4258                                  		; Re-order the stack to simulate an interrupt 21.
  4259                                  
  4260 000002DC 9C                      	PUSHF				; Start re-ordering the stack
  4261 000002DD FA                      	CLI
  4262 000002DE 50                              PUSH    AX                      ; Save segment
  4263 000002DF FF36[8405]                      PUSH	WORD [USER_SP]		; Stack now ordered as if INT had been used
  4264                                  	; 04/11/2022
  4265                                  	; DOSCODE:40EAh (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
  4266                                  	; DOSCODE:40DDh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  4267 000002E3 FF36[EC05]              	push	word [SAVEDS]
  4268 000002E7 1F                      	pop	ds
  4269                                  	;
  4270                                  	;cmp	cl,36
  4271 000002E8 80F924                          CMP     CL,MAXCALL              ; This entry point doesn't get as many calls
  4272 000002EB 77DC                            JA      SHORT BADCALL
  4273 000002ED 88CC                            MOV     AH,CL
  4274                                  	; 08/07/2018
  4275 000002EF EB0E                    	jmp	short SAVREGS
  4276

  4279                                  ; 01/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

  4659 00000429 5D                      	pop	BP
  4660 0000042A 1F                      	pop	DS
  4661 0000042B 07                      	pop	ES
  4662                                  
  4663 0000042C CF                              IRET
  4664                                  
  4665                                  disa20:	   				; M068 - Start
  4666 0000042D 8B1E[6300]              	mov	bx,[A20OFF_PSP]		; bx = PSP for which a20 to be off'd
  4667 00000431 3B1E[3003]              	cmp	bx,[CurrentPDB]		; Q: do the PSP's match
  4668 00000435 75CC                    	jne	short LeaveA20On	; N: don't clear bit and don't turn 
  4669                                  					;    a20 off
  4670                                  					; Y: turn a20 off and dec a20off_count
  4671 00000437 FE0E[8500]              	dec	byte [A20OFF_COUNT]	; M068 - End
  4672                                   					; Start - M004
  4673 0000043B 1E                      	push	ds			; segment of stub
  4674 0000043C BB[4210]                	mov	bx,disa20_iret		; offset in stub
  4675 0000043F 53                      	push	bx
  4676 00000440 CB                      	retf	  			; go to stub
  4677                                  					; End - M004
  4678                                  ;SYSTEM_CALL ENDP

  4918 000004CE 02                      	DB	2			; NO RESPONSE
  4919 000004CF 06                      	DB	6			; SEEK FAILURE
  4920 000004D0 0C                      	DB	12			; GENERAL ERROR
  4921 000004D1 04                      	DB	4			; BAD CRC
  4922 000004D2 08                      	DB	8			; SECTOR NOT FOUND
  4923 000004D3 00                      	DB	0			; WRITE ATTEMPT ON WRITE-PROTECT DISK
  4924                                  ERROUT:
  4925                                  ; DISK ERRORS RETURNED FROM INT 25 and 26
  4926 000004D4 80                      	DB	80H			; NO RESPONSE
  4927 000004D5 40                      	DB	40H			; Seek failure
  4928 000004D6 02                      	DB	2			; Address Mark not found
  4929 000004D7 10                      	DB	10H			; BAD CRC
  4930 000004D8 04                      	DB	4			; SECTOR NOT FOUND
  4931 000004D9 03                      	DB	3			; WRITE ATTEMPT TO WRITE-PROTECT DISK
  4932                                  
  4933                                  NUMERR	EQU	$-ERROUT
  4934                                  	;ENDIF

  4959                                  	;
  4960 000004DD 8826[DB0A]              	mov	[absdrw_extd],ah
  4961                                  	;mov	[ss:absdrw_extd],ah	; Extended ABS Disk Read/Write flag
  4962                                  					; (AH=1 for INT 21h ax=7305h function)

  4965

  4998 000004FC E8B904                  	CALL	RW32_CONVERT		;>32mb convert 32bit format to 16bit ;AN000;

  5044                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5045                                  ;
  5046                                  ; Procedure Name : ABSDRD
  5047                                  ;
  5048                                  ; Interrupt 25 handler. Performs absolute disk read.
  5049                                  ; Inputs:	AL - 0-based drive number
  5050                                  ;		DS:BX point to destination buffer
  5051                                  ;		CX number of logical sectors to read
  5052                                  ;		DX starting logical sector number (0-based)
  5053                                  ; Outputs:	Original flags still on stack
  5054                                  ;		Carry set
  5055                                  ;		    AH error from BIOS
  5056                                  ;		    AL same as low byte of DI from INT 24
  5057                                  ;
  5058                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5059                                          ;procedure   ABSDRD,FAR
  5060                                  ABSDRD:
  5061                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5062                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:42E5h)
  5063                                  	; 04/11/2022
  5064                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 (DOSCODE:42D8h)
  5065                                  
  5066                                  	; 02/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  5067                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:43C4h
  5068                                  	
  5069                                  	;;;
  5070 0000052D 30E4                    	xor     ah,ah	; ah=0		; Interrupt 25h handler (ah=0)
  5071 0000052F 31F6                    	xor     si,si	; si=0		; clear read/write mode flags
  5072                                  					; (used with INT 21h ax=7305h)
  5073                                  FAT32_ABSDRD:	; ah=1 si=0 cf=0 (jump from '_$FAT32EXT')
  5074 00000531 FA                      	cli
  5075                                  	;clc ; not necessary
  5076                                  				; INT 21h
  5077                                  				;	AX = 7305h
  5078                                  				; FAT32 - EXTENDED ABSOLUTE DISK READ/WRITE
  5079                                  				;	CX = FFFFh
  5080                                  				;	DL = drive number (01h=A:, etc.)
  5081                                  				;	SI = read/write mode flags
  5082                                  				;	DS:BX -> disk I/O packet
  5083                                  				;
  5084                                  				; Extended Absolute Disk Read/Write mode flags:
  5085                                  				;
  5086                                  				;	Bit(s)  Description
  5087                                  				;	0	direction (0=read, 1=write)
  5088                                  				;	12-1	reserved (0)
  5089                                  				;	14-13	write type (should be 00 on reads).
  5090                                  				;		00 unknown data.
  5091                                  				;		01 FAT data.
  5092                                  				;		10 directory data.
  5093                                  				;		11 file data
  5094                                  				;	15     reserved (0)
  5095                                  				;
  5096                                  				; Format of disk read/write packet:
  5097                                  				;
  5098                                  				;	Offset Size    Description
  5099                                  				;	00h    DWORD   sector number
  5100                                  				;	04h    WORD    number of sectors to r/w
  5101                                  				;	06h    DWORD   transfer address
  5102                                  				;
  5103                                  				; ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List
  5104                                  	;;;
  5105                                  absdrd_1:
  5106                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  5107                                  	;CLI
  5108                                  	
  5109                                  ;	set up ds to point to DOSDATA
  5110                                  
  5111 00000532 50                      	push	ax			; preserve AX value
  5112 00000533 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds			; store DS value in AX
  5113                                  	;getdseg <ds>
  5114 00000535 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5115 0000053A A3[630D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax		; store DS value in TEMPSEG
  5116 0000053D 58                      	pop	ax			; restore AX value
  5117                                  
  5118                                  	; M072:
  5119                                  	; We shall save es on the user stack here. We need to use ES in
  5120                                  	; order to access the DOSDATA variables AbsRdWr_SS/SP at exit 
  5121                                  	; time in order to restore the user stack.
  5122                                  
  5123 0000053E 06                      	push	es  ; ****		; M072
  5124                                  
  5125                                  	; 02/01/2024 - Retrodos v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  5126                                  	;;;
  5127                                  	; 02/01/2024
  5128 0000053F 9C                      	pushf	; !*!
  5129 00000540 7300                    	jnc	short absdrd_2		; (not jumped from ABSDWRT) absolute disk read
  5130                                  	
  5131                                  	;(jumped from ABSDRWT)
  5132                                  	; 02/01/2023 ; (!*!)
  5133                                  	;or	ah,ah
  5134                                  	;stc				; absolute disk write
  5135                                  	;jmp	short absdrd_3
  5136                                  absdrd_2:
  5137 00000542 08E4                    	or	ah,ah
  5138                                  absdrd_3:
  5139 00000544 7510                    	jnz	short absdrd_4		; EXTENDED ABSOLUTE DISK READ/WRITE
  5140                                  	;;;
  5141                                  
  5142 00000546 8C16[1B06]              	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SS],SS		; M013

  5188                                  	; Here is a gross temporary fix to get around a serious design flaw in
  5189                                  	;  the secondary cache. The secondary cache does not check for media
  5190                                  	;  changed (it should). Hence, you can change disks, do an absolute
  5191                                  	;  read, and get data from the previous disk. To get around this,
  5192                                  	;  we just won't use the secondary cache for absolute disk reads.

  5209                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors read. (These constitute a block of
  5210                                  ;            sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
  5211                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
  5212                                  ;       [TEMP_VAR2]:[TEMP_VAR] = Transfer address (destination data address).
  5213                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
  5214                                  ;
  5215                                  ;	The Buffer Queue must now be scanned: the contents of any dirty
  5216                                  ;	buffers must be "read" into the transfer memory block, so that the
  5217                                  ;       transfer memory reflects the most recent data.

  5294                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5295                                  ;
  5296                                  ; Procedure Name : ABSDWRT
  5297                                  ;
  5298                                  ; Interrupt 26 handler. Performs absolute disk write.
  5299                                  ; Inputs:	AL - 0-based drive number
  5300                                  ;		DS:BX point to source buffer
  5301                                  ;		CX number of logical sectors to write
  5302                                  ;		DX starting logical sector number (0-based)
  5303                                  ; Outputs:	Original flags still on stack
  5304                                  ;		Carry set
  5305                                  ;		    AH error from BIOS
  5306                                  ;		    AL same as low byte of DI from INT 24
  5307                                  ;
  5308                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5309                                          ;procedure   ABSDWRT,FAR
  5310                                  ABSDWRT:
  5311                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5312                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:436Ch)
  5313                                  	; 04/11/2022
  5314                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 (DOSCODE:435Fh)
  5315                                  
  5316                                  	; 03/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  5317                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:4477h
  5318                                  
  5319                                  	;;;
  5320 000005DC 30E4                    	xor     ah,ah	; ah=0		; Interrupt 26h handler (ah=0)
  5321 000005DE BE0100                  	mov	si,1			; set direction flag/bit to write
  5322                                  					; (used with INT 21h ax=7305h)
  5323                                  FAT32_ABSDWRT:	; ah=1 si=1 cf=0 (jump from '_$FAT32EXT')
  5324                                  
  5325                                  				; INT 21h
  5326                                  				;	AX = 7305h
  5327                                  				; FAT32 - EXTENDED ABSOLUTE DISK READ/WRITE
  5328                                  				;	CX = FFFFh
  5329                                  				;	DL = drive number (01h=A:, etc.)
  5330                                  				;	SI = read/write mode flags
  5331                                  				;	DS:BX -> disk I/O packet
  5332                                  				;
  5333                                  				; Extended Absolute Disk Read/Write mode flags:
  5334                                  				;
  5335                                  				;	Bit(s)  Description
  5336                                  				;	0	direction (0=read, 1=write)
  5337                                  				;	12-1	reserved (0)
  5338                                  				;	14-13	write type (should be 00 on reads).
  5339                                  				;		00 unknown data.
  5340                                  				;		01 FAT data.
  5341                                  				;		10 directory data.
  5342                                  				;		11 file data
  5343                                  				;	15     reserved (0)
  5344                                  				;
  5345                                  				; Format of disk read/write packet:
  5346                                  				;
  5347                                  				;	Offset Size    Description
  5348                                  				;	00h    DWORD   sector number
  5349                                  				;	04h    WORD    number of sectors to r/w
  5350                                  				;	06h    DWORD   transfer address
  5351                                  				;
  5352                                  				; ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List
  5353 000005E1 3C02                    	cmp	al,2
  5354 000005E3 7220                    	jb	short absdrwt_2	; floppy disk
  5355                                  	; hard disk
  5356 000005E5 53                      	push	bx
  5357 000005E6 1E                      	push	ds
  5358 000005E7 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5359 000005EC 30FF                    	xor	bh,bh
  5360 000005EE 88C3                    	mov	bl,al			;
  5361                                  					; NOTE: PCDOS 7.1 kernel does not set
  5362                                  					; DOS_FLAG bit 6 or drive_flags bit 7
  5363                                  					; (It appears that these bits are set
  5364                                  					; by Windows or a system utility or
  5365                                  					; driver that knows the addresses of
  5366                                  					; these FLAGs in the DOSDATA segment.)
  5367                                  					; Erdogan Tan - 03/01/2024
  5368                                  					;
  5369 000005F0 F687[0813]80            	test	byte [drive_flags+bx],80h 
  5370                                  					; test bit 7 (locked bit) ; 29/01/2024
  5371 000005F5 7505                    	jnz	short absdwrt_1		; locked (logical drive) -allowed to abs write-
  5372                                  					; NOTE: lock/unlock are MSDOS/PCDOS 7 extd functions

  5374                                  					; (Windows OS running bit ?) ; 23/02/2024

  5401                                  	; We shall save es on the user stack here. We need to use ES in
  5402                                  	; order to access the DOSDATA variables AbsRdWr_SS/SP at exit 
  5403                                  	; time in order to restore the user stack.
  5404                                  
  5405                                  	push	es ; ****		; M072
  5406                                  
  5407                                  	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SS],SS		; M013
  5408                                  	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SP],SP		; M013
  5409                                  
  5410                                  	; set up ss to point to DOSDATA
  5411                                  	;
  5412                                  	; NOTE! Due to an obscure bug in the 80286, you cannot use the 
  5413                                  	; ROMDOS version of the getdseg macro with the SS register!
  5414                                  	; An interrupt will sneak through.
  5415                                  
  5416                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
  5417                                  	;getdseg <ss>			; cli in entry of routine
  5418                                  	mov     ss,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5419                                  ;else
  5420                                  ;	mov	ds, cs:[BioDataSeg]
  5421                                  ;	assume	ds:bdata
  5422                                  ;
  5423                                  ;	mov	ss, ds:[DosDataSg]
  5424                                  ;	assume	ss:DOSDATA
  5425                                  ;
  5426                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
  5427                                  
  5428                                  	MOV	SP,DSKSTACK
  5429                                  		; we are now switched to DOS's disk stack
  5430

  5438                                  %endif
