  5462                                  ;M039
  5463                                  ;       DS:BX = transfer address (source data address).
  5464                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors to write. (These constitute a block of
  5465                                  ;	     sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
  5466                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
  5467                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
  5468                                  ;       [CURSC_DRIVE] = -1 (invalid drive).
  5469                                  ;

  5485                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5486                                  ;
  5487                                  ; Procedure Name : GETBP
  5488                                  ;
  5489                                  ; Inputs:
  5490                                  ;	AL = Logical unit number (A = 0)
  5491                                  ; Function:
  5492                                  ;	Find Drive Parameter Block
  5493                                  ; Outputs:
  5494                                  ;	ES:BP points to DPB
  5495                                  ;	[THISDPB] = ES:BP
  5496                                  ;	Carry set if unit number bad or unit is a NET device.
  5497                                  ;		Later case sets extended error error_I24_not_supported
  5498                                  ; No other registers alteredjjj
  5499                                  ;
  5500                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5501                                  
  5502                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  5503                                  	; 04/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  5504                                  	; PCDOS 76.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:44C7h

  5507                                  	; 11/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  5508 0000062C 50                      	PUSH	AX

  5511 00000631 E88B75                  	CALL	GETTHISDRV

  5514                                  	
  5515                                  	; 23/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  5516                                  	;XOR	AH,AH			;DCR. ax= error code 	;AN000;
  5517                                  	;CMP	AX,error_not_DOS_disk	;DCR. is unknown media ? ;AN000;
  5518                                  	;JZ	SHORT SKIPGET 		;DCR. yes, let it go 	;AN000;
  5519                                  	;STC				;DCR.			;AN000;
  5520 00000636 B400                    	mov	ah,0	
  5521                                  
  5522 00000638 A3[2403]                	MOV	[EXTERR],AX	;PM. invalid drive or Non DOS drive ;AN000;
  5523 0000063B C706[BF0D]0102          	MOV	WORD [AbsDskErr],201h
  5524                                  SKIPGET:
  5525 00000641 58                      	POP	AX
  5526 00000642 7212                    	JC	SHORT GETBP_RETN ; 15/12/2022

  5536                                  	;TEST	WORD [ES:BP+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet ; Clears carry

  5540 00000655 F9                      	STC

  5542 00000656 C3                      	RETN

  5563                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5564                                  ;
  5565                                  ; Procedure Name : SYS_RETURN
  5566                                  ;
  5567                                  ; These are the general system call exit mechanisms. All internal system
  5568                                  ; calls will transfer (jump) to one of these at the end. Their sole purpose
  5569                                  ; is to set the user's flags and set his AX register for return.
  5570                                  ;
  5571                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5572                                  
  5573                                          ;procedure   SYS_RETURN,NEAR
  5574                                  SYS_RETURN:        
  5575                                          ;entry	SYS_RET_OK
  5576                                  SYS_RET_OK:   
  5577 0000066A E80AFE                  	call    Get_User_Stack
  5578                                  		; turn off user's carry flag
  5579                                  SYS_RET_OK_clc: ; 25/06/2019 
  5580                                          ;;and	word [SI+16h],0FFFEh 
  5581                                  	;and	word [SI+user_env.user_F],~f_Carry 
  5582                                          ; 25/06/2019
  5583 0000066D 806416FE                	and	byte [SI+user_env.user_F],~f_Carry ; 0FEh
  5584                                  	; 04/01/2024
  5585                                  	;JMP	SHORT DO_RET
  5586                                  DO_RET:

  5588 00000671 8904                    	MOV	[SI],AX
  5589 00000673 C3                      	RETN
  5590                                  
  5591                                          ;entry   SYS_RET_ERR
  5592                                  SYS_RET_ERR:

  5594 00000676 E86B00                  	call	ETAB_LK 	; Make sure code is OK, EXTERR gets set

  5647                                  ;
  5648                                  ; Procedure Name : CAL_LK

  5971                                  ; We have received a message from Win386. There are three possible
  5972                                  ; messages we could get from Win386:
  5973                                  ;
  5974                                  ; Init 		- for this, we set the IsWin386 flag and return a pointer
  5975                                  ;		  to the Win386 startup info structure.
  5976                                  ; Exit		- for this, we clear the IsWin386 flag.

  5979                                  ;		  CX to a non-zero value.

  5992                                  Win386_Msg_exit:

  6520                                  %if 0
  6521                                  win386_inst:
  6522                                  	; WIN386 check to see if DOS has identified the CDS,SFT and device
  6523                                  	; chain as instance data. Currently, we let the WIN386 DOSMGR handle
  6524                                  	; this by returning a status of not previously instanced. The basic
  6525                                  	; structure of these things have not changed and so the current 
  6526                                  	; DOSMGR code should be able to work it out

  6547                                  ; 15/05/2019
  6548                                  
  6549                                  ;M044; Start of changes
  6550                                  ; Winoldap has a bug in that its calculations for the Windows memory image
  6551                                  ; to save is off by 1 para. This para can happen to be a Windows arena if the
  6552                                  ; DOS top of memory happens to be at an odd boundary (as is the case when
  6553                                  ; UMBs are present). This is because Windows builds its arenas only at even
  6554                                  ; para boundaries. This arena now gets trashed when Windows is swapped back
  6555                                  ; in leading to a crash. Winoldap issues callouts when it swaps Windows out
  6556                                  ; and back in. We sit on these callouts. On the Windows swapout, we save the
  6557                                  ; last para of the Windows memory block and then restore this para on the
  6558                                  ; Windows swapin callout. 
  6559                                  
  6560                                  getwinlast:
  6561                                  	; 07/12/2022
  6562 0000095B 8B36[3003]              	mov	si,[CurrentPDB]
  6563 0000095F 4E                      	dec	si
  6564 00000960 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
  6565 00000962 2603360300              	add	si,[es:3]
  6566 00000967 C3                      	retn
  6567                                  
  6568                                  ; 15/12/2022
  6569                                  %if 0
  6570                                  winold_swap:
  6571                                  	push	ds
  6572                                  	push	es
  6573                                  	push	si
  6574                                  	push	di
  6575                                  	push	cx
  6576                                  
  6577                                  	;getdseg <ds>			;ds = DOSDATA
  6578                                  	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  6579                                  
  6580                                  	cmp	al,1			;swap Windows out call
  6581                                  	jne	short swapin		;no, check if Swap in call
  6582                                  	call	getwinlast
  6583                                  	push	ds
  6584                                  	pop	es
  6585                                  	mov	ds,si			;ds = memory arena of Windows
  6586                                  	xor	si,si
  6587                                  	mov	di,WinoldPatch1
  6588                                  	mov	cx,8
  6589                                  	cld
  6590                                  	push	cx
  6591                                  	rep	movsb			;save first 8 bytes
  6592                                  	pop	cx
  6593                                  	mov	di,WinoldPatch2
  6594                                  	rep	movsb			;save next 8 bytes
  6595                                  	jmp	short winold_done
  6596                                  swapin:
  6597                                  	cmp	al,2			;swap Windows in call?
  6598                                  	jne	short winold_done	;no, something else, pass it on
  6599                                  	call	getwinlast
  6600                                  	mov	es,si
  6601                                  	xor	di,di
  6602                                  	mov	si,WinoldPatch1
  6603                                  	mov	cx,8
  6604                                  	cld
  6605                                  	push	cx
  6606                                  	rep	movsb			;restore first 8 bytes
  6607                                  	pop	cx
  6608                                  	mov	si,WinoldPatch2
  6609                                  	rep	movsb			;restore next 8 bytes
  6610                                  winold_done:
  6611                                  	pop	cx
  6612                                  	pop	di
  6613                                  	pop	si
  6614                                  	pop	es
  6615                                  	pop	ds
  6616                                  	jmp	next_i2f		;chain on
  6617                                  
  6618                                  %endif
  6619                                  
  6620                                  ;M044; End of changes
  6621

  6624                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:4811h

  6626                                  	; INT 2Fh AX=1231h

  6629                                  int_2Fh_1231h:

  6634 00000972 7507                    	jnz	short not_1231_dl_0

  6637                                  
  6638                                  	;nop
  6639                                  
  6640                                  not_1231_dl_0:

  6642 0000097E 7507                    	jne	short not_1231_dl_1	; clear "IsWIN386" bit 1
  6643 00000980 800E[5B0F]02            	or	byte [IsWin386],2	; set "IsWIN386" bit 1
  6644 00000985 EB0E                    	jmp	short int_2f_1231h_retn
  6645                                  
  6646                                  	;nop
  6647                                  
  6648                                  not_1231_dl_1:

  6650 0000098A 7507                    	jne	short not_1231_dl_2
  6651 0000098C 8026[5B0F]FD            	and	byte [IsWin386],0FDh	; clear bit 1
  6652 00000991 EB02                    	jmp	short int_2f_1231h_retn

  6655 00000994 F9                      	stc
  6656                                  int_2f_1231h_retn:
  6657 00000995 1F                      	pop	ds
  6658 00000996 C3                      	retn

  6897                                  ; DOSCODE:47F4h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  6898                                  ; DOSCODE:47E7h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) - 05/11/2022 -
  6899                                  
  6900                                  ;SUBTTL EDIT FUNCTION ASSIGNMENTS AND HEADERS
  6901                                  
  6902                                  ; The following two tables implement the current buffered input editing
  6903                                  ; routines. The tables are pairwise associated in reverse order for ease
  6904                                  ; in indexing. That is; The first entry in ESCTAB corresponds to the last
  6905                                  ; entry in ESCFUNC, and the last entry in ESCTAB to the first entry in ESCFUNC.
  6906                                  
  6907                                  	;PUBLIC	CANCHAR
  6908                                  CANCHAR:
  6909 00000A8F 1B                      	DB	CANCEL	; 1Bh	;Cancel line character
  6910                                  	
  6911                                  	;PUBLIC	ESCCHAR
  6912                                  ESCCHAR:
  6913 00000A90 00                      	DB	ESCCH	; 0	;Lead-in character for escape sequences
  6914                                  	
  6915                                  	;IF	NOT Rainbow
  6916                                  
  6917                                  ESCTAB:	; LABEL BYTE
  6918                                  
  6919                                  	;IF	IBM
  6920 00000A91 40                      	DB	64		; Ctrl-Z - F6
  6921 00000A92 4D                      	DB	77		; Copy one char - -->
  6922 00000A93 3B                      	DB	59		; Copy one char - F1
  6923 00000A94 53                      	DB	83		; Skip one char - DEL
  6924 00000A95 3C                      	DB	60		; Copy to char - F2
  6925 00000A96 3E                      	DB	62		; Skip to char - F4
  6926 00000A97 3D                      	DB	61		; Copy line - F3
  6927 00000A98 3D                      	DB	61		; Kill line (no change to template ) - Not used
  6928 00000A99 3F                      	DB	63		; Reedit line (new template) - F5
  6929 00000A9A 4B                      	DB	75		; Backspace - <--
  6930 00000A9B 52                      	DB	82		; Enter insert mode - INS (toggle)
  6931 00000A9C 52                      	DB	82		; Exit insert mode - INS (toggle)
  6932 00000A9D 41                      	DB	65		; Escape character - F7
  6933 00000A9E 41                      	DB	65		; End of table
  6934                                  	;ENDIF
  6935                                  
  6936                                  ESCEND: ; LABEL BYTE
  6937                                  
  6938                                  ESCTABLEN EQU ESCEND-ESCTAB
  6939                                  
  6940                                  ESCFUNC: ; LABEL WORD
  6941                                  	
  6942 00000A9F [DF19]                  	short_addr  GETCH	; Ignore the escape sequence
  6943 00000AA1 [5C1A]                  	short_addr  TWOESC
  6944 00000AA3 [511B]                  	short_addr  EXITINS
  6945 00000AA5 [511B]                  	short_addr  ENTERINS
  6946 00000AA7 [571A]                  	short_addr  BACKSP
  6947 00000AA9 [3D1B]                  	short_addr  REEDIT
  6948 00000AAB [441A]                  	short_addr  KILNEW
  6949 00000AAD [D31A]                  	short_addr  COPYLIN
  6950 00000AAF [051B]                  	short_addr  SKIPSTR

  6958                                  
  6959                                  ; DOSMES.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  6960                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6961                                  ; DOSMES.ASM (MSDOS 2.11, 1983)
  6962                                  
  6963                                  ; OEMFunction key is expected to process a single function
  6964                                  ;   key input from a device and dispatch to the proper
  6965                                  ;   routines leaving all registers UNTOUCHED.
  6966                                  ;
  6967                                  ; Inputs:   CS, SS are DOSGROUP
  6968                                  ; Outputs:  None. This function is expected to JMP to onw of
  6969                                  ;           the following labels:
  6970                                  ;
  6971                                  ;           GetCh       - ignore the sequence
  6972                                  ;           TwoEsc      - insert an ESCChar in the buffer
  6973                                  ;           ExitIns     - toggle insert mode
  6974                                  ;           EnterIns    - toggle insert mode
  6975                                  ;           BackSp      - move backwards one space
  6976                                  ;           ReEdit      - reedit the line with a new template
  6977                                  ;           KilNew      - discard the current line and start from scratch
  6978                                  ;           CopyLin     - copy the rest of the template into the line
  6979                                  ;           SkipStr     - read the next character and skip to it in the template
  6980                                  ;           CopyStr     - read next char and copy from template to line until char
  6981                                  ;           SkipOne     - advance position in template one character
  6982                                  ;           CopyOne     - copy next character in template into line
  6983                                  ;           CtrlZ       - place a ^Z into the template
  6984                                  ; Registers that are allowed to be modified by this function are:
  6985                                  ;           AX, CX, BP
  6986                                  
  6987                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6988                                  ; -------------------------------------
  6989                                  ; DOSCODE:4820h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  6990                                  
  6991                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  6992                                  ; -------------------------------------
  6993                                  ; DOSCODE:4813h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  6994                                  
  6995                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  6996                                  ; -------------------------------------
  6997                                  ; DOSCODE:4967h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
  6998                                  
  6999                                  OEMFunctionKey:
  7000 00000ABB E8830E                  	CALL	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO	; Get the second byte of the sequence
  7001 00000ABE B10E                    	MOV     CL,ESCTABLEN ; 14	; length of table for scan
  7002 00000AC0 57                      	PUSH    DI                      ; save DI (cannot change it!)
  7003 00000AC1 BF[910A]                	MOV     DI,ESCTAB		; offset of second byte table
  7004 00000AC4 06                      	push	es
  7005 00000AC5 0E                      	push	cs
  7006 00000AC6 07                      	pop	es
  7007 00000AC7 F2AE                    	REPNE   SCASB                   ; Look it up in the table
  7008 00000AC9 07                      	pop	es
  7009 00000ACA 5F                      	POP     DI                      ; restore DI
  7010 00000ACB D1E1                    	SHL     CX,1                    ; convert byte offset to word
  7011 00000ACD 89CD                    	MOV     BP,CX                   ; move to indexable register
  7012                                  	;JMP	word [BP+ESCFUNC]	; Go to the right routine
  7013 00000ACF 2EFFA6[9F0A]            	JMP	word [CS:BP+ESCFUNC]
  7014                                  
  7015                                  ;DOSCODE ENDS
  7016

  7060                                  ;**	$SET_DATE - Set Current Date
  7061                                  ;----------------------------------------

  7063                                  ;	EXIT	(al) = -1 iff bad date
  7064                                  ;		(al) = 0 if ok

  7082                                  	; 05/11/2022

  7089                                  	; 18/12/2022

  7092                                  	;RETN

  7175                                  ;SUBTTL DATE16, READTIME, DODATE -- GUTS OF TIME AND DATE
  7176                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------
  7177                                  ; Date16 returns the current date in AX, current time in DX
  7178                                  ;   AX - YYYYYYYMMMMDDDDD  years months days
  7179                                  ;   DX - HHHHHMMMMMMSSSSS  hours minutes seconds/2
  7180                                  
  7181                                  DATE16:
  7182

  7184                                  ;

  7186                                  ; is DOSDATA

  7471                                  ;TITLE	GETSET - GETting and SETting MS-DOS system calls
  7472                                  ;NAME	GETSET
  7473

  7492                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7493                                  
  7494                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  7495                                  ; DOSCODE:4A0Fh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  7496                                  
  7497                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7498                                  ; DOSCODE:4B5Fh (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7499                                  
  7500                                  _$GET_VERSION:
  7501                                  
  7502                                  ; Inputs:
  7503                                  ;       None
  7504                                  ; Function:
  7505                                  ;       Return MS-DOS version number
  7506                                  ; Outputs:
  7507                                  ;       OEM number in BH
  7508                                  ;       User number in BL:CX (24 bits)
  7509                                  ;       Version number as AL.AH in binary
  7510                                  ;       NOTE: On pre 1.28 DOSs AL will be zero
  7511                                  
  7512                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
  7513                                  ;
  7514                                  ;	Fake_Count is used to lie about the version numbers to support
  7515                                  ;	old binarys. See ms_table.asm for more info.
  7516                                  ;
  7517                                  ;		if input al = 00
  7518                                  ;		  (bh) = OEM number			
  7519                                  ;		else if input al = 01
  7520                                  ;		  (bh) = version flags
  7521                                  ;		 
  7522                                  ;		       	 bits 0-2 = DOS internal revision
  7523                                  ;		       	 bits 3-7 = DOS type flags
  7524                                  ;		              bit 3    = DOS is in ROM
  7525                                  ;		              bit 4    = DOS in in HMA
  7526                                  ;		              bits 5-7 = reserved
  7527                                  ;               M007 change - only bit 3 is now valid. Other bits
  7528                                  ;               are 0 when AL = 1
  7529                                  
  7530                                  	; 06/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7531 00000C96 36C50E[B203]            	lds	cx, [ss:USERNUM]
  7532 00000C9B 8CDB                    	mov	bx, ds
  7533                                  
  7534                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM, offset 196Dh)
  7535                                  	;--------------------------------------
  7536                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:4A1Ch)
  7537                                  
  7538 00000C9D 16                              PUSH    SS
  7539 00000C9E 1F                              POP     DS
  7540                                          
  7541                                  	; 06/01/2024
  7542                                  	;MOV	BX,[USERNUM+2]
  7543                                          ;MOV	CX,[USERNUM]
  7544                                  
  7545                                  	; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7546                                  
  7547                                  	;If AL == 1, ROMDOS will return BH = dos internal version # &
  7548                                  	;DOS flags
  7549                                  
  7550 00000C9F 3C01                    	cmp	AL,1
  7551 00000CA1 7502                    	jne	short Norm_Vers
  7552                                  
  7553                                  ;ifdef ROMDOS
  7554                                  ;	mov	BH,DOSINROM 	; Just set the bit for ROM version
  7555                                  ;				(DOSINROM = 8)
  7556                                  ;else
  7557 00000CA3 30FF                            xor     bh,bh		; Otherwise return 0
  7558                                  ;endif				;M007 end
  7559                                  
  7560                                  Norm_Vers:
  7561                                  	;MOV	AX,[MSVERS]  ; MSDOS 3.3
  7562                                  
  7563                                          	; MSDOS 6.0	; MSVERS is a label in TABLE segment	
  7564                                  	; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

  7566 00000CA6 8E1E[3003]              	mov	ds,[CurrentPDB]	; current app's PSP segment
  7567                                  	;mov	ax,[40h]

  7569                                  	; 07/12/2022
  7570 00000CAD 1F                      	pop	ds
  7571 00000CAE E8C6F7                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  7572                                  				; Put values for return registers
  7573                                  				; in the proper place on the user's	 
  7574                                  				; stack addressed by DS:SI
  7575                                  	; 06/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7576                                  gdrvfspc_ret:

  7585 00000CB9 C3                      	RETN

  7621                                  ;BREAK <$International - return country-dependent information>
  7622                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7623                                  ;
  7624                                  ; Procedure Name : $INTERNATIONAL
  7625                                  ;
  7626                                  ; Inputs:
  7627                                  ;	MOV	AH,International
  7628                                  ;	MOV	AL,country	(al = 0 => current country)
  7629                                  ;      [MOV	BX,country]
  7630                                  ;	LDS	DX,block
  7631                                  ;	INT	21
  7632                                  ; Function:
  7633                                  ;	give users an idea of what country the application is running
  7634                                  ; Outputs:
  7635                                  ;	IF DX != -1 on input (get country)
  7636                                  ;	  AL = 0 means return current country table.
  7637                                  ;	  0<AL<0FFH means return country table for country AL
  7638                                  ;	  AL = 0FF means return country table for country BX
  7639                                  ;	  No Carry:
  7640                                  ;	     Register BX will contain the 16-bit country code.
  7641                                  ;	     Register AL will contain the low 8 bits of the country code.
  7642                                  ;	     The block pointed to by DS:DX is filled in with the information
  7643                                  ;	     for the particular country.
  7644                                  ;		BYTE  Size of this table excluding this byte and the next
  7645                                  ;		BYTE  Country code represented by this table
  7646                                  ;			A sequence of n bytes, where n is the number specified
  7647                                  ;			by the first byte above and is not > internat_block_max,
  7648                                  ;			in the correct order for being returned by the
  7649                                  ;			INTERNATIONAL call as follows:
  7650                                  ;		WORD	Date format 0=mdy, 1=dmy, 2=ymd
  7651                                  ;		5 BYTE	Currency symbol null terminated
  7652                                  ;		2 BYTE	thousands separator null terminated
  7653                                  ;		2 BYTE	Decimal point null terminated
  7654                                  ;		2 BYTE	Date separator null terminated
  7655                                  ;		2 BYTE	Time separator null terminated
  7656                                  ;		1 BYTE	Bit field.  Currency format.
  7657                                  ;			Bit 0.	=0 $ before #  =1 $ after #
  7658                                  ;			Bit 1.	no. of spaces between # and $ (0 or 1)
  7659                                  ;		1 BYTE	No. of significant decimal digits in currency
  7660                                  ;		1 BYTE	Bit field.  Time format.
  7661                                  ;			Bit 0.	=0 12 hour clock  =1 24 hour
  7662                                  ;		DWORD	Call address of case conversion routine
  7663                                  ;		2 BYTE	Data list separator null terminated.
  7664                                  ;	  Carry:
  7665                                  ;	     Register AX has the error code.
  7666                                  ;	IF DX = -1 on input (set current country)
  7667                                  ;	  AL = 0 is an error
  7668                                  ;	  0<AL<0FFH means set current country to country AL
  7669                                  ;	  AL = 0FF means set current country to country BX
  7670                                  ;	  No Carry:
  7671                                  ;	    Current country SET
  7672                                  ;	    Register AL will contain the low 8 bits of the country code.
  7673                                  ;	  Carry:
  7674                                  ;	     Register AX has the error code.
  7675                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7676                                  
  7677                                  ;procedure   $INTERNATIONAL,NEAR   ; DOS 3.3
  7678                                  
  7679                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7680                                  ; DOSCODE:4A4Dh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  7681                                  
  7682                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  7683                                  ; DOSCODE:4A40h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  7684                                  
  7685                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 PCDOS.COM)
  7686                                  ; DOSCODE:4B8Dh (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
  7687                                  
  7688                                  _$INTERNATIONAL:  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), offset 1992h
  7689                                  	 
  7690 00000CC6 3CFF                    	CMP	AL,0FFH
  7691 00000CC8 7404                    	JZ	short BX_HAS_CODE	; -1 means country code is in BX
  7692 00000CCA 88C3                    	MOV	BL,AL			; Put AL country code in BX

  7944                                  ;BREAK <$GetExtCntry - return extended country-dependent information>

  7946                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7947                                  ;
  7948                                  ; Procedure Name : $GetExtCntry
  7949                                  ;
  7950                                  ; Inputs:
  7951                                  ;	if AL >= 20H
  7952                                  ;	  AL= 20H    capitalize single char, DL= char
  7953                                  ;	      21H    capitalize string, CX= string length
  7954                                  ;	      22H    capitalize ASCIIZ string
  7955                                  ;	      23H    YES/NO check, DL=1st char DH= 2nd char (DBCS)
  7956                                  ;	      80H bit 0 = use normal upper case table
  7957                                  ;		      1 = use file upper case table
  7958                                  ;	   DS:DX points to string
  7959                                  ;
  7960                                  ;	else
  7961                                  ;
  7962                                  ;	MOV	AH,GetExtCntry	 ; DOS 3.3
  7963                                  ;	MOV	AL,INFO_ID	( info type,-1 selects all )
  7964                                  ;	MOV	BX,CODE_PAGE	( -1 = active code page )
  7965                                  ;	MOV	DX,COUNTRY_ID	( -1 = active country )
  7966                                  ;	MOV	CX,SIZE 	( amount of data to return )
  7967                                  ;	LES	DI,COUNTRY_INFO ( buffer for returned data )
  7968                                  ;	INT	21
  7969                                  ; Function:
  7970                                  ;	give users extended country dependent information
  7971                                  ;	or capitalize chars
  7972                                  ; Outputs:
  7973                                  ;	  No Carry:
  7974                                  ;	     extended country info is succesfully returned
  7975                                  ;	  Carry:
  7976                                  ;	     Register AX has the error code.
  7977                                  ;	     AX=0, NO	 for YES/NO CHECK
  7978                                  ;		1, YES
  7979                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7980

  8597                                  ;	M004, M068: Also set A20OFF_COUNT to 1 if EXECA20OFF bit has been set 
  8598                                  ;	and if A20OFF_COUNT is non-zero. See under tag M003 in inc\dossym.inc

  8645                                  ;	BREAK <$Char_Oper - hack on paths, switches so that xenix can look like PCDOS>
  8646                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8647                                  
  8648                                  ;**	$Char_Oper - Manipulate Switch Character
  8649                                  ;
  8650                                  ;	This function was put in to facilitate XENIX path/switch compatibility
  8651                                  ;
  8652                                  ;	ENTRY	AL = function:
  8653                                  ;		    0 - read switch char
  8654                                  ;		    1 - set switch char (char in DL)
  8655                                  ;		    2 - read device availability
  8656                                  ;			Always returns available
  8657                                  ;		    3 - set device availability
  8658                                  ;			No longer supported (NOP)
  8659                                  ;	EXIT	(al) = 0xff iff error
  8660                                  ;		(al) != 0xff if ok
  8661                                  ;		  (dl) = character/flag, if "read switch char" subfunction
  8662                                  ;	USES	AL, DL
  8663                                  ;
  8664                                  ;	NOTE	This already obsolete function has been deactivated in DOS 5.0
  8665                                  ;		The character / is always returned for subfunction 0,
  8666                                  ;		subfunction 2 always returns -1, all other subfunctions are ignored.
  8667                                  
  8668                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8669                                  ; DOSCODE:4CC9h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  8670                                  
  8671                                  ; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  8672                                  ; DOSCODE:4CBCh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  8673                                  
  8674                                  _$CHAR_OPER:
  8675                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  8676 00000F9D 08C0                    	or	al,al				; get switch?
  8677 00000F9F B22F                    	mov	dl,'/'				; assume yes
  8678 00000FA1 7407                    	jz	short chop_1			; jump if yes
  8679 00000FA3 3C02                    	cmp	al,2				; check device availability?
  8680 00000FA5 B2FF                    	mov	dl,-1				; assume yes
  8681 00000FA7 7401                    	jz	short chop_1			; jump if yes
  8682 00000FA9 C3                      	retn					; otherwise just quit
  8683                                  
  8684                                  ; subfunctions requiring return of value to user come here. DL holds
  8685                                  ; value to return
  8686                                  
  8687                                  chop_1:
  8688 00000FAA E8CAF4                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  8689 00000FAD 895406                  	mov	[SI+user_env.user_DX],dx	; store value for user
  8690 00000FB0 C3                      	retn
  8691

  8693                                  	; Offset 1B87h in IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987
  8694                                  	;push	ss
  8695                                  	;pop	ds
  8696                                  	;cmp	al,1
  8697                                  	;jb	short chop_1
  8698                                  	;jz	short chop_2
  8699                                  	;cmp	al,3
  8700                                  	;jb	short chop_3
  8701                                  	;jz	short chop_5

  8718                                  ;**	$GetExtendedError - Return Extended error code
  8719                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8720                                  ;	This function reads up the extended error info from the static
  8721                                  ;	variables where it was stored.
  8722                                  ;
  8723                                  ;	ENTRY	none
  8724                                  ;	EXIT	AX = Extended error code (0 means no extended error)
  8725                                  ;		BL = recommended action

  8780                                  ;BREAK	<ECS_call - Extended Code System support function>
  8781                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8782                                  ; Inputs:
  8783                                  ;	AL = 0	get lead byte table
  8784                                  ;		on return DS:SI has the table location
  8785                                  ;
  8786                                  ;	AL = 1	set / reset interim console flag
  8787                                  ;		DL = flag (00H or 01H)
  8788                                  ;		no return
  8789                                  ;
  8790                                  ;	AL = 2	get interim console flag

  9333                                  ; System calls for parsing command lines
  9334                                  ;
  9335                                  ;   $PARSE_FILE_DESCRIPTOR
  9336                                  ;
  9337                                  ;   Modification history:
  9338                                  ;
  9339                                  ;       Created: ARR 30 March 1983
  9340                                  ;               EE PathParse 10 Sept 1983
  9341                                  ;
  9342                                  
  9343                                  ;BREAK <$Parse_File_Descriptor -- Parse an arbitrary string into an FCB>
  9344                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9345                                  ; Inputs:
  9346                                  ;       DS:SI Points to a command line
  9347                                  ;       ES:DI Points to an empty FCB
  9348                                  ;       Bit 0 of AL = 1 At most one leading separator scanned off
  9349                                  ;                   = 0 Parse stops if separator encountered
  9350                                  ;       Bit 1 of AL = 1 If drive field blank in command line - leave FCB
  9351                                  ;                   = 0  "    "    "     "         "      "  - put 0 in FCB
  9352                                  ;       Bit 2 of AL = 1 If filename field blank - leave FCB
  9353                                  ;                   = 0  "       "      "       - put blanks in FCB
  9354                                  ;       Bit 3 of AL = 1 If extension field blank - leave FCB
  9355                                  ;                   = 0  "       "      "        - put blanks in FCB
  9356                                  ; Function:
  9357                                  ;       Parse command line into FCB
  9358                                  ; Returns:
  9359                                  ;       AL = 1 if '*' or '?' in filename or extension, 0 otherwise
  9360                                  ;       DS:SI points to first character after filename
  9361                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9362                                  
  9363                                  	; 13/01/2024
  9364                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:51BFh
  9365                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:4D22h
  9366                                  
  9367                                  _$PARSE_FILE_DESCRIPTOR:
  9368 000012CA E8C649                  	call	MAKEFCB
  9369 000012CD 56                      	PUSH    SI
  9370 000012CE E8A6F1                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  9371                                  	;pop	word [si+8]
  9372 000012D1 8F4408                  	POP     word [SI+user_env.user_SI]
  9373 000012D4 C3                      	retn
  9374                                  
  9375                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9376                                  ; 13/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:51CAh)
  9377                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9378                                  
  9379                                  set_exerr_locus_unk:

  9381 000012D6 B001                    	mov     al,1		; errLOC_Unk

  9384 000012DC 58                              pop	ax
  9385 000012DD C3                              retn
  9386

  9419                                  ;**	$SLEAZEFUNC - Get a Pointer to the Media Byte
  9420                                  ;
  9421                                  ;	Return Stuff sort of like old get fat call
  9422                                  ;
  9423                                  ;	ENTRY	none
  9424                                  ;	EXIT	DS:BX = Points to FAT ID byte (IBM only)
  9425                                  ;			GOD help anyone who tries to do ANYTHING except
  9426                                  ;			READ this ONE byte.
  9427                                  ;		DX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
  9428                                  ;		CX = Sector size
  9429                                  ;		AL = Sectors per allocation unit
  9430                                  ;		   = -1 if bad drive specified
  9431                                  ;	USES	all
  9432                                  ;
  9433                                  ;**	$SLEAZEFUNCDL - Get a Pointer to the Media Byte
  9434                                  ;
  9435                                  ;	Identical to $SLEAZEFUNC except (dl) = drive
  9436                                  ;
  9437                                  ;	ENTRY	(dl) = drive (0=default, 1=A, 2=B, etc.)
  9438                                  ;	EXIT	DS:BX = Points to FAT ID byte (IBM only)
  9439                                  ;			GOD help anyone who tries to do ANYTHING except
  9440                                  ;			READ this ONE byte.
  9441                                  ;		DX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
  9442                                  ;		CX = Sector size
  9443                                  ;		AL = Sectors per allocation unit
  9444                                  ;		   = -1 if bad drive specified
  9445                                  ;	USES	all
  9446                                  ;
  9447                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9448                                  ;
  9449                                  	; 10/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  9450                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:51E2h
  9451                                  
  9452                                  _$SLEAZEFUNC:
  9453                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9454 000012ED B200                    	MOV	DL,0
  9455                                  _$SLEAZEFUNCDL:
  9456 000012EF 16                      	push	ss
  9457 000012F0 1F                      	pop	ds
  9458                                  	
  9459 000012F1 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL
  9460 000012F3 E8C968                  	call	GETTHISDRV		; Get CDS structure
  9461                                  SET_AL_RET:
  9462                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
  9463                                  	;;mov	al, 0Fh
  9464                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_drive	; Assume error	;AC000;
  9465                                  	
  9466                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 & MSDOS 3.3
  9467 000012F6 7229                    	JC	short BADSLDRIVE
  9468                                  
  9469 000012F8 E86B20                  	call	DISK_INFO
  9470                                  	;JC	short SET_AL_RET	; User FAILed to I 24
  9471 000012FB 7224                    	jc	short BADSLDRIVE
  9472 000012FD 8826[9805]              	MOV	[FATBYTE],AH	; FAT (MEDIA) ID byte
  9473                                  
  9474                                  	; 10/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1)
  9475                                  	;;;
  9476 00001301 30E4                    	xor     ah, ah		; AH = 0
  9477                                  				; AL = sectors per cluster
  9478 00001303 57                      	push    di		; di:bx = number of clusters
  9479 00001304 E81805                  	call    TestNet
  9480 00001307 5F                      	pop     di
  9481 00001308 7205                    	jc      short sleazefunc1
  9482 0000130A 51                      	push    cx		; bytes per sector
  9483 0000130B E85C21                  	call    modify_cluster_count
  9484 0000130E 59                      	pop     cx		; ax = sectors per cluster (modified)
  9485                                  				; dx = number of clusters (modified)
  9486                                  				; if bytes per cluster > 16384
  9487                                  				;    and hw of cluster count > 0
  9488                                  				;    bx = 0FFFEh (invalidated parm sign)
  9489                                  sleazefunc1:
  9490                                  	;;;
  9491                                  
  9492                                  ; NOTE THAT A FIXED MEMORY CELL IS USED --> THIS CALL IS NOT
  9493                                  ; RE-ENTRANT. USERS BETTER GET THE ID BYTE BEFORE THEY MAKE THE
  9494                                  ; CALL AGAIN
  9495                                  
  9496                                  	;MOV	DI,FATBYTE
  9497                                  	; 10/01/2024 
  9498                                  	;XOR	AH,AH			; AL has sectors/cluster
  9499 0000130F E865F1                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  9500                                  	;mov	[si+4],cx
  9501                                  	;mov	[si+6],bx
  9502                                  	;mov	[si+2],di
  9503 00001312 894C04                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_CX],CX
  9504 00001315 895C06                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_DX],BX
  9505                                  	;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_BX],DI
  9506                                  	; 10/01/2024
  9507 00001318 C74402[9805]            	MOV	word [SI+user_env.user_BX],FATBYTE
  9508                                  	
  9509                                  	;mov	[si+0Eh],ss
  9510 0000131D 8C540E                  	MOV     [SI+user_env.user_DS],SS ; stash correct pointer
  9511                                  
  9512 00001320 C3                      	retn
  9513                                  
  9514                                  BADSLDRIVE:
  9515 00001321 E965F3                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR

 10131                                  setend:
 10132                                  ;	M008 - CAS
 10133                                  ;
 10134                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10135                                  	inc	bx
 10136                                  	;INC	AX			; +2 (reserved), -1 (count -> max)
 10137                                  ;
 10138                                  ;	There has been a bug in our fatsize calculation for so long
 10139                                  ;	  that we can't correct it now without causing some user to
 10140                                  ;	  experience data loss. There are even cases where allowing
 10141                                  ;	  the number of clusters to exceed the fats is the optimal
 10142                                  ;	  case -- where adding 2 more fat sectors would make the
 10143                                  ;	  data field smaller so that there's nothing to use the extra
 10144                                  ;	  fat sectors for.
 10145                                  ;
 10146                                  ;	Note that this bug had very minor known symptoms. CHKDSK would
 10147                                  ;	  still report that there was a cluster left when the disk was
 10148                                  ;	  actually full. Very graceful failure for a corrupt system
 10149                                  ;	  configuration. There may be worse cases that were never
 10150                                  ;	  properly traced back to this bug. The problem cases only
 10151                                  ;	  occurred when partition sizes were very near FAT sector
 10152                                  ;	  rounding boundaries, which were rare cases.
 10153                                  ;
 10154                                  ;	Also, it's possible that some third-party partition program might
 10155                                  ;	  create a partition that had a less-than-perfect FAT calculation
 10156                                  ;	  scheme. In this hypothetical case, the number of allocation
 10157                                  ;	  clusters which don't actually have FAT entries to represent
 10158                                  ;	  them might be larger and might create a more catastrophic
 10159                                  ;	  failure. So we'll provide the safeguard of limiting the
 10160                                  ;	  max_cluster to the amount that will fit in the FATs.
 10161                                  ;
 10162                                  ;	ax = maximum legal cluster, ES:BP -> dpb
 10163                                  
 10164                                  ;	make sure the number of fat sectors is actually enough to
 10165                                  ;	  hold that many clusters. otherwise, back the number of
 10166                                  ;	  clusters down
 10167                                  
 10168                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10169                                  	; bx = number of clusters
 10170                                  
 10171                                  	; 19/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 10172                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 10173                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10174                                  	;mov	bx,ax			; remember calculated # clusters
 10175                                  
 10176                                  	; 01/08/2018 (MSDOS 3.3)
 10177                                  	;mov	al,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
 10178                                  	;xor	ah,ah 
 10179                                  
 10180                                  	; 10/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10181                                  	;mov	ax,[ES:BP+0Fh]
 10182                                  	mov	ax,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
 10183                                  
 10184                                  	;mul	word [es:bp+2]	
 10185                                  	mul	word [ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE] ; how big is the FAT?
 10186                                  	cmp	bx,4096-10  ; 0FF6h	; test for 12 vs. 16 bit fat
 10187                                  	jb	short setend_fat12
 10188                                  	shr	dx,1
 10189                                  
 10190                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 10191                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10192                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10193                                  	jnz	short setend_faterr	; some bonehead gave us more fatspace
 10194                                  					; than enough for the maximum FAT,
 10195                                  					; so go ahead and use the calculated
 10196                                  					; number of clusters.
 10197                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10198                                  
 10199                                  	rcr	ax,1			; find number of entries
 10200                                  	cmp	ax,4096-10+1		; would this truncation move us
 10201                                  ;					;  into 12-bit fatland?
 10202                                  	jb	short setend_faterr	; then go ahead and let the
 10203                                  ;					;  inconsistency pass through
 10204                                  ;					;  rather than lose data by
 10205                                  ;					;  correcting the fat type
 10206                                  	jmp	short setend_fat16
 10207                                  
 10208                                  setend_fat12:
 10209                                  	add	ax,ax			; (fatsiz*2)/3 = # of fat entries
 10210                                  	adc	dx,dx
 10211                                  
 10212                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 10213                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10214                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10215                                  	cmp	dx,3			; if our fatspace is WAY more than
 10216                                  	jnb	short setend_faterr	; we need, we may get an overflow
 10217                                  					; here. Check for it and use
 10218                                  					; the calculated size in this case.
 10219                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10220                                  
 10221                                  	div	word [cs:word3]
 10222                                  
 10223                                  setend_fat16:
 10224                                  	dec	ax			; limit at 1
 10225                                  	cmp	ax,bx			; is fat big enough?
 10226                                  	jbe	short setend_fat	; use max value that'll fit
 10227                                  
 10228                                  setend_faterr:
 10229                                  	mov	ax,bx			; use calculated value
 10230                                  
 10231                                  setend_fat:
 10232                                  
 10233                                  ;	now ax = maximum legal cluster
 10234                                  
 10235                                  ;	end M008

 10725                                  
 10726                                  	; 17/12/2022
 10727                                  	; cx = 0
 10728                                  
 10729                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10730                                  ; Inputs:
 10731                                  ;	AX = Size of memory in paragraphs
 10732                                  ;	DX = Segment
 10733                                  ; Function:
 10734                                  ;	Completely prepares a program base at the
 10735                                  ;	specified segment.
 10736                                  ; Called at DOS init
 10737                                  ; Outputs:
 10738                                  ;	DS = DX
 10739                                  ;	ES = DX
 10740                                  ;	[0] has INT int_abort
 10741                                  ;	[2] = First unavailable segment
 10742                                  ;	[5] to [9] form a long call to the entry point
 10743                                  ;	[10] to [13] have exit address (from int_terminate)
 10744                                  ;	[14] to [17] have ctrl-C exit address (from int_ctrl_c)
 10745                                  ;	[18] to [21] have fatal error address (from int_fatal_abort)
 10746                                  ; DX,BP unchanged. All other registers destroyed.
 10747                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10748                                  
 10749                                  SETMEM:
 10750                                  	;XOR	CX,CX
 10751                                  	; 17/12/2022
 10752                                  	; cx = 0
 10753 000016BB 8ED9                    	MOV	DS,CX
 10754 000016BD 8EC2                    	MOV	ES,DX
 10755                                  	;mov	si,88h
 10756 000016BF BE8800                  	MOV	SI,addr_int_terminate
 10757                                  	;mov	di,10 ; 0Ah
 10758 000016C2 BF0A00                  	MOV	DI,SAVEXIT
 10759                                  	;MOV	CX,6
 10760                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10761 000016C5 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 10762 000016C7 F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW
 10763 000016C9 26A30200                	MOV	[ES:2],AX
 10764 000016CD 29D0                    	SUB	AX,DX
 10765 000016CF 3DFF0F                  	CMP	AX,MAXDIF ; 0FFFh
 10766 000016D2 7603                    	JBE	short HAVDIF
 10767 000016D4 B8FF0F                  	MOV	AX,MAXDIF
 10768                                  HAVDIF:
 10769 000016D7 83E810                  	SUB	AX,10h			; Allow for 100h byte "stack"
 10770 000016DA BB0C00                  	MOV	BX,ENTRYPOINTSEG ; 0Ch	;	in .COM files
 10771 000016DD 29C3                    	SUB	BX,AX
 10772 000016DF B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 10773 000016E1 D3E0                    	SHL	AX,CL
 10774 000016E3 8EDA                    	MOV	DS,DX
 10775                                  
 10776                                  	; (MSDOS 6.0 note)
 10777                                  	;
 10778                                  	; The address in BX:AX will be F01D:FEF0 if there is 64K or more 
 10779                                  	; memory in the system. This is equivalent to 0:c0 if A20 is OFF.
 10780                                  	; If DOS is in HMA this equivalence is no longer valid as A20 is ON.
 10781                                  	; But the BIOS which now resides in FFFF:30 has 5 bytes in FFFF:D0
 10782                                  	; (F01D:FEF0) which is the same as the ones in 0:C0, thereby 
 10783                                  	; making this equvalence valid for this particular case. If however
 10784                                  	; there is less than 64K remaining the address in BX:AX will not 
 10785                                  	; be the same as above. We will then stuff 0:c0, the call 5 address
 10786                                  	; into the PSP.
 10787                                  	;
 10788                                  	; Therefore for the case where there is less than 64K remaining in 
 10789                                  	; the system old CPM Apps that look at PSP:6 to determine memory
 10790                                  	; requirements will not work. Call 5, however will continue to work
 10791                                  	; for all cases.
 10792                                  	;
 10793                                  
 10794                                  	;mov	[6],ax
 10795                                  	;mov	[8],bx
 10796                                  
 10797 000016E5 A30600                  	MOV	[PDB.CPM_CALL+1],AX
 10798 000016E8 891E0800                	MOV	[PDB.CPM_CALL+3],BX
 10799                                  
 10800                                  	; 06/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10801 000016EC 3DF0FE                  	cmp	ax,WRAPOFFSET ; 0FEF0h	; Q: does the system have >= 64k of
 10802                                  					;    memory left
 10803 000016EF 740C                    	je	short addr_ok		; Y: the above calculated address is
 10804                                  					;    OK
 10805                                  					; N: 
 10806                                  
 10807 000016F1 C7060600C000            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CPM_CALL+1],0C0h
 10808 000016F7 C70608000000            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CPM_CALL+3],0
 10809                                  addr_ok:
 10810                                  	;mov	word [0],20CDh
 10811 000016FD C7060000CD20            	MOV	word [PDB.EXIT_CALL],(int_abort*256) + mi_INT
 10812                                  	;mov	byte [5],9Ah
 10813 00001703 C60605009A              	MOV	BYTE [PDB.CPM_CALL],mi_Long_CALL
 10814                                  	;mov	word [50h],21CDh
 10815 00001708 C7065000CD21            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CALL_SYSTEM],(int_command*256) + mi_INT
 10816                                  	;mov	byte [52h],0CBh
 10817 0000170E C6065200CB              	MOV	BYTE [PDB.CALL_SYSTEM+2],mi_Long_RET
 10818                                  	;mov	word [34h],18h
 10819 00001713 C70634001800            	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Pointer],PDB.JFN_TABLE
 10820                                  	;mov	word [36h],ds
 10821 00001719 8C1E3600                	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Pointer+2],DS
 10822                                  	;mov	word [32h],20
 10823 0000171D C70632001400            	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Length],FILPERPROC
 10824                                  ;
 10825                                  ; The server runs several PDB's without creating them VIA EXEC.  We need to
 10826                                  ; enumerate all PDB's at CPS time in order to find all references to a
 10827                                  ; particular SFT.  We perform this by requiring that the server link together
 10828                                  ; for us all sub-PDB's that he creates. The requirement for us, now, is to
 10829                                  ; initialize this pointer.
 10830                                  ;
 10831                                   	;mov	word [38h],-1
 10832 00001723 C7063800FFFF            	MOV	word [PDB.Next_PDB],-1
 10833                                  	;mov	word [3Ah],-1
 10834 00001729 C7063A00FFFF            	MOV	word [PDB.Next_PDB+2],-1
 10835                                  
 10836                                  	; 06/05/2019
 10837                                  	; Set the real version number in the PSP - 5.00
 10838                                  
 10839                                  	;mov	word [es:PDB.Version],1406h ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:4FB6h)
 10840                                  	; 07/12/2022
 10841 0000172F 26C7064000070A          	mov	word [ES:PDB.Version],(MINOR_VERSION*256)+MAJOR_VERSION
 10842                                  
 10843 00001736 C3                      	retn
 10844

 10847                                  ;BREAK <$GSetMediaID -- get set media ID>
 10848                                  
 10849                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10850                                  ; Inputs:
 10851                                  ;	BL= drive number as defined in IOCTL
 10852                                  ;	AL= 0 get media ID
 10853                                  ;	    1 set media ID
 10854                                  ;	DS:DX= buffer containing information
 10855                                  ;		DW  0  info level (set on input)
 10856                                  ;		DD  ?  serial #
 10857                                  ;		DB  11 dup(?)  volume id
 10858                                  ;		DB   8 dup(?)  file system type
 10859                                  ; Function:
 10860                                  ;	Get or set media ID
 10861                                  ; Returns:
 10862                                  ;	carry clear, DS:DX is filled
 10863                                  ;	carry set, error
 10864                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10865                                  
 10866                                  	; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 10867                                  
 10868                                  ; 14/01/2024
 10869                                  %if 0
 10870                                  
 10871                                  _$GSetMediaID:
 10872                                  	; RAWIO - GET_MEDIA_ID
 10873                                  	mov	cx,0866h	      ;AN000;MS.; assume get for IOCTL
 10874                                  	cmp	al,0		      ;AN001;MS.; get ?
 10875                                  	je	short doioctl 	      ;AN000;MS.; yes
 10876                                  	;cmp	al,1		      ;AN000;MS.; set ?
 10877                                  	;jne	short errorfunc	      ;AN000;MS.; no
 10878                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10879                                  	dec	al
 10880                                  	jnz	short errorfunc ; al > 1

 10882                                  	;mov	cx,0846h	      ;AN001;MS.;

 10893                                  	;error	error_invalid_function;AN000;MS. ; invalid function

 10895                                  	mov	al,error_invalid_function
 10896                                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 10897

 10970                                  ; Break <STRCMP - compare two ASCIZ strings DS:SI to ES:DI>
 10971                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10972                                  ;
 10973                                  ;   Strcmp - compare ASCIZ DS:SI to ES:DI. Case INSENSITIVE. '/' = '\'
 10974                                  ;	     Strings of different lengths don't match.
 10975                                  ;   Inputs:  DS:SI - pointer to source string  ES:DI - pointer to dest string
 10976                                  ;   Outputs: Z if strings same, NZ if different
 10977                                  ;   Registers modified: NONE
 10978                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10979                                  
 10980                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 10981                                  
 10982                                  	; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 10983                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM DOSCODE:56B6h)
 10984                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:4FD7h)
 10985                                  StrCmp:
 10986 00001785 56                      	push	si
 10987 00001786 57                      	push	di
 10988 00001787 50                      	push	ax
 10989                                  Cmplp:
 10990 00001788 AC                      	LODSB
 10991 00001789 E83A46                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
 10992 0000178C E88A46                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert '/' to '\' ; 07/12/2022 ('\')
 10993 0000178F 88C4                    	MOV	AH,AL
 10994 00001791 268A05                  	MOV	AL,[ES:DI]
 10995 00001794 47                      	INC	DI
 10996 00001795 E82E46                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
 10997 00001798 E87E46                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert '/' to '\' ; 07/12/2022 ('\')
 10998 0000179B 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL
 10999 0000179D 7504                    	JNZ	short PopRet		; Strings dif
 11000                                  
 11001 0000179F 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 11002 000017A1 75E5                    	JNZ	short Cmplp		; More string
 11003                                  PopRet:
 11004 000017A3 58                      	pop	ax
 11005 000017A4 5F                      	pop	di
 11006 000017A5 5E                      	pop	si
 11007 000017A6 C3                      	retn

 11009                                  ;Break <STRCPY - copy ASCIZ string from DS:SI to ES:DI>

 11011                                  ;
 11012                                  ;   Strcpy - copy an ASCIZ string from DS:SI to ES:DI and make uppercase
 11013                                  ;   FStrcpy - copy an ASCIZ string from DS:SI to ES:DI. no modification of
 11014                                  ;	characters.
 11015                                  ;
 11016                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI - pointer to source string
 11017                                  ;		ES:DI - pointer to destination string
 11018                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string
 11019                                  ;		DS:SI point byte after nul byte at end of source string
 11020                                  ;   Registers modified: SI,DI

 11029 000017AF AA                      	STOSB

 11149                                  ;Break	<TableDispatch - dispatch to a table>
 11150                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11151                                  ;
 11152                                  ;   TableDispatch - given a table and an index, jmp to the approptiate
 11153                                  ;   routine. Preserve all input registers to the routine.
 11154                                  ;
 11155                                  ;   Inputs:	Push	return address
 11156                                  ;		Push	Table address
 11157                                  ;		Push	index (byte)
 11158                                  ;   Outputs:	appropriate routine gets jumped to.
 11159                                  ;		return indicates invalid index
 11160                                  ;   Registers modified: none.
 11161                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11162                                  
 11163                                  struc TFrame	 ; TableFrame
 11164 00000000 ????                    .OldBP:	 resw 1  ; 0
 11165 00000002 ????                    .OldRet: resw 1  ; 2
 11166 00000004 ??                      .Index:	 resb 1  ; 4
 11167 00000005 ??                      .Pad:	 resb 1  ; 5  
 11168 00000006 ????                    .Tab:	 resw 1  ; 6
 11169 00000008 ????                    .NewRet: resw 1  ; 8
 11170                                  endstruc
 11171                                  
 11172                                  TableDispatch:

 11174 000017F5 89E5                    	MOV	BP,SP

 11176                                  	;mov	bx,[bp+6]
