 13911                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13912                                  ;
 13913                                  ;**	$FCB_Rename - Rename a File
 13914                                  ;
 13915                                  ;	$FCB_Rename - rename a file in place within a directory. Renames
 13916                                  ;	multiple files copying from the meta characters.
 13917                                  ;
 13918                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DX point to an FCB. The normal name field is the source
 13919                                  ;		    name of the files to be renamed. Starting at offset 11h
 13920                                  ;		    in the FCB is the destination name.
 13921                                  ;	EXIT	AL = 0 -> no error occurred and all files were renamed
 13922                                  ;		AL = FF -> some files may have been renamed but:
 13923                                  ;			rename to existing file or source file not found
 13924                                  ;	USES	ALL
 13925                                  ;
 13926                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13927                                  ;
 13928                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 13929                                  	; 16/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 13930                                  
 13931                                  _$FCB_RENAME:		; System call 23
 13932                                  
 13933 00001E28 E82804                  	call	GetExtended		; get pointer to real FCB
 13934 00001E2B 52                      	push	dx
 13935 00001E2C 8A04                    	MOV	AL,[SI] 		; get drive byte
 13936 00001E2E 83C610                  	ADD	SI,10h			; point to destination
 13937                                  
 13938                                  					; RenBuf is in DOSDATA
 13939 00001E31 BF[3E04]                	MOV	DI,RENBUF		; point to destination buffer
 13940 00001E34 FF34                    	push	word [SI]
 13941 00001E36 1E                      	push	ds
 13942                                  	;push	di			; save source pointer for TransFCB
 13943                                  	; 16/01/2024 (Retro DOS v4 BugFix!)
 13944 00001E37 56                      	push	si

 13984                                  ;	jmp	short fcb_close_err
 13985                                  
 13986                                  ;Break <Misbehavior fixers>
 13987                                  ;
 13988                                  ;   FCBs suffer from several problems. First, they are maintained in the
 13989                                  ;   user's space so he may move them at will. Second, they have a small
 13990                                  ;   reserved area that may be used for system information. Third, there was
 13991                                  ;   never any "rules for behavior" for FCBs; there was no protocol for their
 13992                                  ;   usage.
 13993                                  ;
 13994                                  ;   This results in the following misbehavior:
 13995                                  ;
 13996                                  ;	infinite opens of the same file:
 13997                                  ;
 13998                                  ;	While (TRUE) {			While (TRUE) {
 13999                                  ;	    FCBOpen (FCB);		    FCBOpen (FCB);
 14000                                  ;	    Read (FCB); 		    Write (FCB);
 14001                                  ;	    }				    }
 14002                                  ;
 14003                                  ;	infinite opens of different files:
 14004                                  ;
 14005                                  ;	While (TRUE) {			While (TRUE) {
 14006                                  ;	    FCBOpen (FCB[i++]); 	    FCBOpen (FCB[i++]);
 14007                                  ;	    Read (FCB); 		    Write (FCB);
 14008                                  ;	    }				    }
 14009                                  ;
 14010                                  ;	multiple closes of the same file:
 14011                                  ;
 14012                                  ;	FCBOpen (FCB);
 14013                                  ;	while (TRUE)
 14014                                  ;	    FCBClose (FCB);
 14015                                  ;
 14016                                  ;	I/O after closing file:
 14017                                  ;
 14018                                  ;	FCBOpen (FCB);
 14019                                  ;	while (TRUE) {
 14020                                  ;	    FCBWrite (FCB);
 14021                                  ;	    FCBClose (FCB);
 14022                                  ;	    }
 14023                                  ;
 14024                                  ;   The following is am implementation of a methodology for emulating the
 14025                                  ;   above with the exception of I/O after close. We are NOT attempting to
 14026                                  ;   resolve that particular misbehavior. We will enforce correct behaviour in
 14027                                  ;   FCBs when they refer to a network file or when there is file sharing on
 14028                                  ;   the local machine.
 14029                                  ;
 14030                                  ;   The reserved fields of the FCB (10 bytes worth) is divided up into various
 14031                                  ;   structures depending on the file itself and the state of operations of the
 14032                                  ;   OS. The information contained in this reserved field is enough to
 14033                                  ;   regenerate the SFT for the local non-shared file. It is assumed that this
 14034                                  ;   regeneration procedure may be expensive. The SFT for the FCB is
 14035                                  ;   maintained in a LRU cache as the ONLY performance inprovement.
 14036                                  ;
 14037                                  ;   No regeneration of SFTs is attempted for network FCBs.
 14038                                  ;
 14039                                  ;   To regenerate the SFT for a local FCB, it is necessary to determine if the
 14040                                  ;   file sharer is working. If the file sharer is present then the SFT is not
 14041                                  ;   regenerated.
 14042                                  ;
 14043                                  ;   Finally, if there is no local sharing, the full name of the file is no
 14044                                  ;   longer available. We can make up for this by using the following
 14045                                  ;   information:
 14046                                  ;
 14047                                  ;	The Drive number (from the DPB).
 14048                                  ;	The physical sector of the directory that contains the entry.
 14049                                  ;	The relative position of the entry in the sector.
 14050                                  ;	The first cluster field.
 14051                                  ;	The last used SFT.
 14052                                  ;      OR In the case of a device FCB
 14053                                  ;	The low 6 bits of sf_flags (indicating device type)
 14054                                  ;	The pointer to the device header
 14055                                  ;
 14056                                  ;   We read in the particular directory sector and examine the indicated
 14057                                  ;   directory entry. If it matches, then we are kosher; otherwise, we fail.
 14058                                  ;
 14059                                  ;   Some key items need to be remembered:
 14060                                  ;
 14061                                  ;	Even though we are caching SFTs, they may contain useful sharing
 14062                                  ;	information. We enforce good behavior on the FCBs.
 14063                                  ;
 14064                                  ;	Network support must not treat FCBs as impacting the ref counts on
 14065                                  ;	open VCs. The VCs may be closed only at process termination.
 14066                                  ;
 14067                                  ;	If this is not an installed version of the DOS, file sharing will
 14068                                  ;	always be present.
 14069                                  ;
 14070                                  ;	We MUST always initialize lstclus to = firclus when regenerating a
 14071                                  ;	file. Otherwise we start allocating clusters up the wazoo.
 14072                                  ;
 14073                                  ;	Always initialize, during regeneration, the mode field to both isFCB
 14074                                  ;	and open_for_both. This is so the FCB code in the sharer can find the
 14075                                  ;	proper OI record.
 14076                                  ;
 14077                                  ;   The test bits are:
 14078                                  ;
 14079                                  ;	00 -> local file
 14080                                  ;	40 -> sharing local
 14081                                  ;	80 -> network
 14082                                  ;	C0 -> local device
 14083                                  
 14084                                  ;Break	<SaveFCBInfo - store pertinent information from an SFT into the FCB>
 14085                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14086                                  ;
 14087                                  ;   SaveFCBInfo - given an FCB and its associated SFT, copy the relevant
 14088                                  ;	pieces of information into the FCB to allow for subsequent
 14089                                  ;	regeneration. Poke LRU also.
 14090                                  ;
 14091                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisSFT points to a complete SFT.
 14092                                  ;		DS:SI point to the FCB (not an extended one)
 14093                                  ;   Outputs:	The relevant reserved fields in the FCB are filled in.
 14094                                  ;		DS:SI preserved
 14095                                  ;		ES:DI point to sft
 14096                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 14097                                  ;
 14098                                  ;
 14099                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14100                                  ;
 14101                                  
 14102                                  	; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 14313                                  ;Break	<ResetLRU - reset overflowed lru counts>
 14314                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14315                                  ;
 14316                                  ;   ResetLRU - during lru updates, we may wrap at 64K. We must walk the
 14317                                  ;   entire set of SFTs and subtract 8000h from their lru counts and truncate
 14318                                  ;   at 0.
 14319                                  ;
 14320                                  ;   Inputs:	BX is offset into SFT field where lru firld is kept
 14321                                  ;		ES:DI point to SFT currently being updated
 14322                                  ;   Outputs:	All FCB SFTs have their lru fields truncated
 14323                                  ;		AX has 8000h
 14324                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 14325                                  ;
 14326                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14327                                  ;
 14328                                  
 14329                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14330                                  ResetLRU:
 14331                                  	; ResetLRU is only called from fcbio.asm. So SS can be assumed to be 
 14332                                  	; DOSDATA
 14333                                  
 14334 00001F10 B80080                  	MOV	AX,8000h
 14335 00001F13 06                      	push	es
 14336 00001F14 57                      	push	di
 14337                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFTFCB]		; get pointer to head
 14338 00001F15 36C43E[4000]            	LES	DI,[SS:SFTFCB] ; MSDOS 6.0
 14339                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]

 14341                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 14342 00001F1E 8D7D06                  	LEA	DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable] 	; point at table
 14343                                  ovScan:

 14345 00001F24 7703                    	JA	short ovLoop
 14346 00001F26 268901                  	MOV	[ES:DI+BX],AX		; truncate at 0
 14347                                  ovLoop:

 14395                                  ; 21/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 14396                                  ; LRUFCB for MSDOS 6.0 !
 14397                                  
 14398                                  ;Break	<LRUFCB - perform LRU on FCB sfts>
 14399                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14400                                  ;
 14401                                  ;   LRUFCB - find LRU fcb in cache. Set ThisSFT and return it. We preserve
 14402                                  ;	the first keepcount sfts if they are network sfts or if sharing is
 14403                                  ;	loaded.  If carry is set then NO BLASTING is NECESSARY.
 14404                                  ;
 14405                                  ;   Inputs:	none
 14406                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI point to SFT
 14407                                  ;		ThisSFT points to SFT
 14408                                  ;		SFT is zeroed
 14409                                  ;		Carry set of closes failed
 14410                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 14411                                  ;
 14412                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14413                                  ;
 14414                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 14415                                  ;IF 0	; rewritten this routine
 14416                                  ;
 14417                                  ;LRUFCB: ; MSDOS 3.3 - IBMDOS.COM (1987) - Offset 25ADh
 14418                                  ;	call	save_world
 14419                                  ;	
 14420                                  ; Find nth oldest NET/SHARE FCB. We want to find its age for the second scan
 14421                                  ; to find the lease recently used one that is younger than the open age.  We
 14422                                  ; operate be scanning the list n times finding the least age that is greater
 14423                                  ; or equal to the previous minimum age.

 14442                                  ;   SI is the position of the entry that corresponds to BX
 14443                                  ;

 14447                                  ;	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 14448                                  ;	MOV	CX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]

 14450                                  ;	LEA	DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable]
 14451                                  ;
 14452                                  ; Innermost loop.  If the current entry is free, then we are done.  Or, if the
 14453                                  ; current entry is busy (indicating a previous aborted allocation), then we
 14454                                  ; are done.  In both cases, we use the found entry.
 14455                                  ;

 14480                                  ;					;	  if (!net[i]
 14481                                  ;	JNZ	short lru35

 14489                                  ;

 14494                                  ;	JB	short lru5
 14495                                  ;	CMP	DX,BX
 14496                                  ;	JAE	short lru5		;	      age[i] < min) {
 14497                                  ;
 14498                                  ; entry is new minimum.  Remember his age.
 14499                                  ;
 14500                                  ;	mov	bx,DX			;	      min = age[i];
 14501                                  ;	mov	si,di			;	      pos = i;
 14502                                  ;

 14504                                  ;
 14505                                  ;lru5:
 14506                                  ;	;add	di,53
 14507                                  ;	add	di,SF_ENTRY.size
 14508                                  ;	loop	lru2			;	      }
 14509                                  ;
 14510                                  ; The scan is complete. If we have successfully found a new minimum (pos != -1)
 14511                                  ; set then threshold value to this new minimum + 1. Otherwise, the scan is
 14512                                  ; complete.  Go find LRU.
 14513                                  ;
 14514                                  ;lru6:	
 14515                                  ;	cmp	si,-1			; position not -1?
 14516                                  ;	jz	short lru75		; no, done with everything
 14517                                  ;	lea	ax,[bx+1]		; set new threshold age

 14520                                  ;	stc
 14521                                  ;	jmp	short LRUDead		;	  return -1;
 14522                                  ;
 14523                                  ; Main loop is done. We have AX being the age+1 of the nth oldest sharer or
 14524                                  ; network entry. We now make a second pass through to find the LRU entry
 14525                                  ; that is local-no-share or has age >= AX
 14526                                  ;
 14527                                  ;lru75:
 14528                                  ;	mov	bx,-1			; min = 0xffff;
 14529                                  ;	mov	si,bx			; pos = 0xffff;
 14530                                  ;	LES	DI,[CS:SFTFCB]		; for (CX=FCBCount; CX>0; CX--)
 14531                                  ;	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 14532                                  ;	MOV	CX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 14533                                  ;	;lea	di,[di+6]
 14534                                  ;	LEA	DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable]
 14535                                  ;
 14536                                  ; If this is is local-no-share then go check for LRU else if age >= threshold
 14537                                  ; then check for lru.
 14538                                  ;
 14539                                  ;lru8:
 14540                                  ;	;test	word [es:di+5],8000h
 14541                                  ;	TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet
 14542                                  ;	jnz	short lru85		; is for network, go check age
 14543                                  ;	call	CheckShare		; sharer here?
 14544                                  ;	jz	short lru86		; no, go check lru
 14545                                  ;
 14546                                  ; Network or sharer.  Check age
 14547                                  ;
 14548                                  ;lru85:
 14549                                  ;	;cmp	[es:di+17h],ax
 14550                                  ;	cmp	[es:di+sf_OpenAge],ax
 14551                                  ;	jb	short lru9		; age is before threshold, skip it
 14552                                  ;
 14553                                  ; Check LRU
 14554                                  ;
 14555                                  ;lru86:
 14556                                  ;	;cmp	[es:di+15h],bx
 14557                                  ;	cmp	[es:di+sf_LRU],bx	; is LRU less than current LRU?
 14558                                  ;	jae	short lru9		; no, skip this
 14559                                  ;	mov	si,di			; remember position
 14560                                  ;	;mov	bx,[es:di+15h]
 14561                                  ;	mov	bx,[es:di+sf_LRU]	; remember new minimum LRU
 14562                                  ;
 14563                                  ; Done with this entry, go back for more.
 14564                                  ;
 14565                                  ;lru9:
 14566                                  ;	;add	di, 53
 14567                                  ;	add	di,SF_ENTRY.size
 14568                                  ;	loop	lru8
 14569                                  ;
 14570                                  ; Scan is complete. If we found NOTHING that satisfied us then we bomb
 14571                                  ; out. The conditions here are:
 14572                                  ;
 14573                                  ;  No local-no-shares AND all net/share entries are older than threshold
 14574                                  ;
 14575                                  ;lru10:
 14576                                  ;	cmp	si,-1			; if no one f
 14577                                  ;	jz	short lru65		;     return -1;
 14578                                  ;lru11:
 14579                                  ;	mov	di,si
 14580                                  ;	MOV	[CS:THISSFT],DI		; set thissft
 14581                                  ;	MOV	[CS:THISSFT+2],ES
 14582                                  ;
 14583                                  ; If we have sharing or thisSFT is a net sft, then close it until ref count
 14584                                  ; is 0.
 14585                                  ;
 14586                                  ;	;test	word [es:di+5],8000h

 14588                                  ;	JNZ	short LRUClose

 14590                                  ;	call	CheckShare
 14591                                  ;	JZ	short LRUDone
 14592                                  ;ENDIF
 14593                                  ;
 14594                                  ; Repeat close until ref count is 0
 14595                                  ;
 14596                                  ;LRUClose:
 14597                                  ;	push	ss
 14598                                  ;	pop	ds
 14599                                  ;	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 14600                                  ;	cmp     word [es:di],0
 14601                                  ;	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SFT.sf_ref_count],0 ; is ref count still <> 0?
 14602                                  ;	JZ	short LRUDone 		; nope, all done
 14603                                  ;	call	DOS_CLOSE
 14604                                  ;	jnc	short LRUClose		; no error => clean up

 14606                                  ;	cmp	al,error_invalid_handle
 14607                                  ;	jz	short LRUClose
 14608                                  ;	stc
 14609                                  ;	JMP	short LRUDead
 14610                                  ;LRUDone:
 14611                                  ;	XOR	AL,AL
 14612                                  ;	call	BlastSFT		; fill SFT with 0 (AL), 'C' cleared
 14613                                  ;

 14616                                  ;	LES     DI,[CS:THISSFT]
 14617                                  ;	jnc	short LRUFCB_retn
 14618                                  ;LRUFCB_err:
 14619                                  ;	; mov	al, 23h	
 14620                                  ;	MOV	AL,error_FCB_unavailable

 14625                                  
 14626                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14627                                  ; LRUFCB for MSDOS 6.0 !
 14628                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14629                                  ;
 14630                                  ; LruFCB -- allocate the LRU SFT from the SFT Table. The LRU scheme
 14631                                  ; maintains separate counts for net/Share and local SFTs. We allocate a 
 14632                                  ; net/Share SFT only if we do not find a local SFT. This helps keep
 14633                                  ; net/Share SFTs which cannot be regenerated for as long as possible. We
 14634                                  ; optimize regeneration operations by keeping track of the current local
 14635                                  ; SFT. This avoids scanning of the SFTs as long as we have at least one 
 14636                                  ; local SFT in the SFT Block.
 14637                                  ;
 14638                                  ; Inputs: al = 0 => Regenerate SFT operation
 14639                                  ;	    = 1 => Allocate new SFT for Open/Create
 14640                                  ;
 14641                                  ; Outputs: Carry clear
 14642                                  ;	 	es:di = Address of allocated SFT
 14643                                  ;	  	ThisSFT = Address of allocated SFT
 14644                                  ;
 14645                                  ;	  carry set if closes of net/Share files failed 
 14646                                  ;		al = error_FCB_unavailable
 14647                                  ;
 14648                                  ; Registers affected: None
 14649                                  ;
 14650                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14651                                  
 14652                                  ;LruFCB	PROC	NEAR
 14653                                  LRUFCB:
 14654                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14655                                  	; DOSCODE:5805h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 14656                                  
 14657                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 14658                                  	; DOSCODE:57F1h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 14659                                  
 14660                                  	; 20/01/2024 Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMMDOS.COM)
 14661                                  	; DOSCODE:5E7Ch (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 14662                                  
 14663 00001F34 06                      	push	es	; * (MSDOS 6.21)
 14664                                  	
 14665 00001F35 E820E5                  	call	save_world
 14666                                  	
 14667                                  	;getdseg <ds>		;ds = DOSDATA
 14668 00001F38 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 14669                                  
 14670 00001F3D 08C0                    	or	al,al		;Check if regenerate allocation
 14671 00001F3F 7516                    	jnz	short lru1	;Try to find SFT to use
 14672                                  
 14673                                  	; This is a regen call. If LocalSFT contains the address of a valid 
 14674                                  	; local SFT, just return that SFT to reuse
 14675                                  
 14676                                  	; 20/01/2024
 14677                                  	;mov	di,[LocalSFT]
 14678                                  	;or	di,[LocalSFT+2]	;is address == 0?
 14679                                  	;jz	short lru1	;invalid local SFT, find one
 14680                                  
 14681                                  	; We have found a valid local SFT. Recycle this SFT
 14682                                  
 14683 00001F41 C43E[760F]              	les	di,[LocalSFT]
 14684                                  
 14685                                  	; 20/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 14686 00001F45 8CC1                    	mov	cx,es
 14687 00001F47 09F9                    	or	cx,di		; is address == 0?
 14688 00001F49 740C                    	jz	short lru1	; invalid local SFT, find one
 14689                                  
 14690                                  gotlocalSFT:
 14691 00001F4B 893E[9E05]              	mov	[THISSFT],di
 14692 00001F4F 8C06[A005]              	mov	[THISSFT+2],es
 14693 00001F53 F8                      	clc
 14694 00001F54 E9A900                  	jmp	LRUDone		;clear up SFT and return
 14695                                  
 14696                                  lru1:
 14697 00001F57 C43E[4000]              	les	di,[SFTFCB]	;es:di = SF Table for FCBs
 14698                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 14699 00001F5B 268B4D04                	mov	cx,[es:di+SFT.SFCount]	;cx = number of SFTs
 14700                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 14701 00001F5F 8D7D06                  	lea	di,[di+SFT.SFTable]	;es:di = first SFT
 14702                                  
 14703                                  	; We scan through all the SFTs scanning for a free one. It also 
 14704                                  	; remembers the LRU SFT for net/Share SFTs and local SFTs separately. 
 14705                                  	; bx = min. LRU for local SFTs
 14706                                  	; si = pos. of local SFT with min. LRU
 14707                                  	; dx = min. LRU for net/Share SFTs
 14708                                  	; bp = pos. of net/Share SFT with min. LRU
 14709                                  
 14710 00001F62 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,-1		; init. to 0xffff ( max. LRU value )
 14711 00001F65 89DE                    	mov	si,bx
 14712 00001F67 89DA                    	mov	dx,bx
 14713 00001F69 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 14714                                  
 14715                                  findSFT:
 14716                                  	;See if this SFT is a free one. If so, return it
 14717 00001F6B 26830D00                	or	word [es:di],0
 14718                                  	;or	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0 ;reference count = 0 ?
 14719 00001F6F 744C                    	jz	short gotSFT	;yes, SFT is free
 14720                                  	;;cmp	word [es:di],-1
 14721                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy ;Is it busy?
 14722 00001F71 26833DFF                	cmp	word [es:di],sf_busy ; -1 
 14723 00001F75 7446                    	jz	short gotSFT	;no, can use it
 14724                                  
 14725                                  	; Check if this SFT is local and store its address in LocalSFT. Can be 
 14726                                  	; used for a later regen.
 14727                                  
 14728                                  	; 16/12/2022
 14729                                  	; 08/11/2022
 14730                                  	;test	byte [es:di+6],80h
 14731 00001F77 26F6450680              	test	byte [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8) ; 80h
 14732                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 14733                                  	;;test	word [es:di+5],8000h
 14734                                  	;test	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet ; network SFT?
 14735 00001F7C 7531                    	jnz	short lru5	;yes, get net/Share LRU
 14736                                  
 14737                                  ;IF installed
 14738 00001F7E E8E864                  	call	CheckShare	;Share present?
 14739                                  ;ENDIF
 14740 00001F81 752C                    	jnz	short lru5	;yes, get net/Share LRU
 14741                                  
 14742                                  	;Local SFT, register its address
 14743                                  
 14744                                  	; !!HACK!!!
 14745                                  	; There is a slightly dirty hack out here in a desperate bid to save  
 14746                                  	; code space. There is similar code duplicated at label 'gotSFT'. We 
 14747                                  	; enter from there if al = 0, update the LocalSFT variable, and since 
 14748                                  	; al = 0, we jump out of the loop to the exit point. I have commented 
 14749                                  	; out the code that previously existed at label 'gotSFT'
 14750                                  
 14751                                  hackpoint:
 14752 00001F83 893E[760F]              	mov	[LocalSFT],di
 14753 00001F87 8C06[780F]              	mov	[LocalSFT+2],es	;store local SFT address
 14754                                  
 14755 00001F8B 08C0                    	or	al,al		;Is operation = REGEN?
 14756 00001F8D 74BC                    	jz	short gotlocalSFT ;yes, return this SFT for reuse
 14757                                  
 14758                                  	;Get LRU for local files
 14759                                  	
 14760                                  	;cmp	[es:di+15h],bx
 14761 00001F8F 26395D15                	cmp	[es:di+sf_LRU],bx ;SFT.LRU < min?
 14762 00001F93 7306                    	jae	short lru4	;no, skip 
 14763                                  
 14764                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+15h]
 14765 00001F95 268B5D15                	mov	bx,[es:di+sf_LRU] ;yes, store new minimum
 14766 00001F99 89FE                    	mov	si,di		;store SFT position
 14767                                  lru4:
 14768                                  	;add	di,59
 14769 00001F9B 83C73B                  	add	di,SF_ENTRY.size ;go to next SFT
 14770 00001F9E E2CB                    	loop	findSFT
 14771                                  	
 14772                                  	; 20/01/2024
 14773 00001FA0 49                      	dec	cx ; -1
 14774                                  
 14775                                  	; Check whether we got a net/Share or local SFT. If local SFT
 14776                                  	; available, we will reuse it instead of net/Share LRU
 14777                                  
 14778 00001FA1 89F7                    	mov	di,si
 14779                                  	;cmp	si,-1		;local SFT available?
 14780 00001FA3 39CE                    	cmp	si,cx ; 20/01/2024
 14781 00001FA5 7516                    	jnz	short gotSFT	;yes, return it
 14782                                  
 14783                                  	;No local SFT, see if we got a net/Share SFT
 14784                                  
 14785 00001FA7 89EF                    	mov	di,bp
 14786                                  
 14787 00001FA9 39CD                    	cmp	bp,cx ; -1 ; 20/01/2024
 14788                                  	;cmp	bp,-1		;net/Share SFT available?
 14789 00001FAB 752D                    	jnz	short gotnetSFT	;yes, return it
 14790                                  noSFT:
 14791                                  	; NB: This error should never occur. We always must have an LRU SFT.
 14792                                  	; This error can occur only if the SFT has been corrupted or the LRU
 14793                                  	; count is not maintained properly.
 14794                                  
 14795 00001FAD EB4E                    	jmp	short errorbadSFT ;error, no FCB available.
 14796                                  
 14797                                  	; Handle the LRU for net/Share SFTs
 14798                                  lru5:
 14799                                  	;cmp	[es:di+15h],dx
 14800 00001FAF 26395515                	cmp	[es:di+sf_LRU],dx ;SFT.LRU < min?
 14801 00001FB3 73E6                    	jae	short lru4	;no, skip
 14802                                  
 14803                                  	;mov	dx,[es:di+15h]
 14804 00001FB5 268B5515                	mov	dx,[es:di+sf_LRU] ;yes, store new minimum
 14805                                  
 14806 00001FB9 89FD                    	mov	bp,di		;store SFT position
 14807 00001FBB EBDE                    	jmp	short lru4	;continue with next SFT
 14808                                  
 14809                                  gotSFT:
 14810 00001FBD 08C0                    	or	al,al
 14811 00001FBF 74C2                    	jz	short hackpoint	;save es:di in LocalSFT
 14812                                  
 14813                                  	; HACK!!!
 14814                                  	; The code here differs from the code at 'hackpoint' only in the 
 14815                                  	; order of the check for al. If al = 0, we can jump to 'hackpoint'
 14816                                  	; and then from there jump out to 'gotlocalSFT'. The original code
 14817                                  	; has been commented out below and replaced by the code just above.
 14818                                  
 14819                                  ;If regen, then this SFT can be registered as a local one ( even if free ).
 14820                                  ;
 14821                                  ;	or	al,al		  ;Regen?
 14822                                  ;	jnz	short notlocaluse ;yes, register it and return
 14823                                  ;
 14824                                  ;Register this SFT as a local one
 14825                                  ;
 14826                                  ;	mov	[LocalSFT],di
 14827                                  ;	mov	[LocalSFT+2],es
 14828                                  ;	jmp	gotlocalSFT	;return to caller
 14829                                  ;
 14830                                  ;notlocaluse:
 14831                                  
 14832                                  	; The caller is probably going to use this SFT for a net/Share file.
 14833                                  	; We will come here only on a Open/Create when the caller($FCB_OPEN)
 14834                                  	; does not really know whether it is a local file or not. We
 14835                                  	; invalidate LocalSFT if the SFT we are going to use was previously
 14836                                  	; registered as a local SFT that can be recycled.
 14837                                  
 14838 00001FC1 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 14839 00001FC3 393E[760F]              	cmp	[LocalSFT],di		;Offset same?
 14840 00001FC7 750E                    	jne	short notinvalid
 14841 00001FC9 3906[780F]              	cmp	[LocalSFT+2],ax		;Segments same?
 14842                                  	;je	short zerolocalSFT	;no, no need to invalidate
 14843                                  	; 20/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 14844 00001FCD 7508                    	jne	short notinvalid
 14845                                  zerolocalSFT:	
 14846 00001FCF 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
 14847 00001FD1 A3[760F]                	mov	[LocalSFT],ax
 14848 00001FD4 A3[780F]                	mov	[LocalSFT+2],ax
 14849                                  	
 14850                                  notinvalid:
 14851 00001FD7 E971FF                  	jmp	gotlocalSFT
 14852                                  
 14853                                  	; The SFT we are going to use was registered in the LocalSFT variable.
 14854                                  	; Invalidate this variable i.e LocalSFT = NULL
 14855                                  
 14856                                  ;zerolocalSFT:
 14857                                  	;xor	ax,ax ; 0
 14858                                  	;mov	[LocalSFT],ax
 14859                                  	;mov	[LocalSFT+2],ax
 14860                                  	;
 14861                                  	;jmp	gotlocalSFT
 14862                                  
 14863                                  gotnetSFT:
 14864                                  	; We have an SFT that is currently net/Share. If it is going to be
 14865                                  	; used for a regen, we know it has to be a local SFT. Update the
 14866                                  	; LocalSFT variable
 14867                                  
 14868 00001FDA 08C0                    	or	al,al
 14869 00001FDC 7508                    	jnz	short closenet
 14870                                  
 14871 00001FDE 893E[760F]              	mov	[LocalSFT],di
 14872 00001FE2 8C06[780F]              	mov	[LocalSFT+2],es	;store local SFT address
 14873                                  closenet:
 14874 00001FE6 893E[9E05]              	mov	[THISSFT],di	; set thissft
 14875 00001FEA 8C06[A005]              	mov	[THISSFT+2],es	
 14876                                  
 14877                                  	; If we have sharing or thisSFT is a net sft, then close it until ref
 14878                                  	; count is 0.
 14879                                  	; NB: We come here only if it is a net/Share SFT that is going to be
 14880                                  	; recycled -- no need to check for this.
 14881                                  
 14882                                  LRUClose:
 14883 00001FEE 26833D00                	cmp	word [es:di],0
 14884                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0 ; is ref count still <> 0?
 14885 00001FF2 740C                    	jz	short LRUDone	; nope, all done
 14886                                  
 14887 00001FF4 E82C17                  	call	DOS_CLOSE

 14933                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14934                                  ;**** RegenCopyName -- This function copies the filename from the FCB to
 14935                                  ; SFT and also to DOS local buffers. There was duplicate code in FCBRegen
 14936                                  ; to copy the name to different destinations
 14937                                  ;
 14938                                  ; Inputs: ds:si = source string
 14939                                  ;	 es:di = destination string
 14940                                  ;	 cx = length of string
 14941                                  ;
 14942                                  ; Outputs: String copied to destination
 14943                                  ;
 14944                                  ; Registers affected: cx,di,si
 14945                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14946                                  
 14947                                  RegenCopyName:
 14948                                  CopyName:
 14949 00002018 AC                      	lodsb			;load character
 14950 00002019 E8AA3D                  	call	UCase		; convert char to upper case
 14951                                  StuffChar2:
 14952 0000201C AA                      	STOSB			;store converted character
 14953 0000201D E2F9                    	LOOP	CopyName	;
 14954                                  DoneName:
 14955 0000201F C3                      	retn
 14956                                  
 14957                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14958                                  
 14959                                  	; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 14960                                  	; 21/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 14961                                  
 14962                                  FCBRegen:
 14963                                  	; called from SFTFromFCB. SS already DOSDATA
 14964                                  
 14965                                  	; General data filling. Mode is sf_isFCB + open_for_both, date/time 
 14966                                  	; we do not fill, size we do no fill, position we do not fill,
 14967                                  	; bit 14 of flags = TRUE, other bits = FALSE
 14968                                  
 14969                                  	;mov	al,[si+19h]
 14970 00002020 8A4419                  	MOV	AL,[SI+fcb_l_drive]
 14971                                  
 14972                                  	; We discriminate based on the first two bits in the reserved field.
 14973                                  	
 14974                                  	;test	al,80h
 14975 00002023 A880                    	test	AL,FCBSPECIAL		; check for no sharing test
 14976 00002025 741C                    	JZ	short RegenNoSharing	; yes, go regen from no sharing
 14977                                  
 14978                                  	; The FCB is for a network or a sharing based system. At this point 
 14979                                  	; we have already closed the SFT for this guy and reconnection is 
 14980                                  	; impossible.
 14981                                  	;
 14982                                  	; Remember that he may have given us a FCB with bogus information in
 14983                                  	; it. Check to see if sharing is present or if the redir is present.
 14984                                  	; If either is around, presume that we have cycled out the FCB and 
 14985                                  	; give the hard error. Otherwise, just return with carry set.
 14986                                  
 14987 00002027 E83F64                  	call	CheckShare		; test for sharer

 14989

 14991 0000202C B80011                  	MOV	AX,MultNET<<8		; install check on multnet
 14992 0000202F CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - INSTALLATION CHECK
 14993                                  			; Return: AL = 00h  not installed, OK to install
 14994                                  			; 01h  not installed, not OK to install
 14995                                  			; FFh  installed
 14996 00002031 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL			; is it there?
 14997 00002033 740C                    	JZ	short RegenDead		; no, just fail the operation

 15228                                  ;**	BlastSFT - FIll SFT with Garbage
 15229                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15230                                  ;	BlastSFT is used when an SFT is no longer needed; it's called with
 15231                                  ;	various garbage values to put into the SFT.  I don't know why,
 15232                                  ;	presumably to help with debugging (jgl).  We clear the few fields
 15233                                  ;	necessary to show that the SFT is free after filling it.
 15234                                  ;
 15235                                  ;	ENTRY	(es:di) = address of SFT
 15236                                  ;		(al) = fill character
 15237                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = -1
 15238                                  ;		'C' clear
 15239                                  ;	USES	AX, CX, Flags
 15240                                  
 15241                                  BlastSFT:
 15242                                  	; 21/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15243                                  	;;;
 15244 00002120 E8DA29                  	call	SFT_FREE
 15245                                  	;;;
 15246 00002123 57                      	push	di
 15247                                  	;mov	cx,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 15248                                  	;mov	cx,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 15249 00002124 B93B00                  	mov	cx,SF_ENTRY.size
 15250 00002127 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 15251 00002129 5F                      	pop	di
 15252 0000212A 29C0                    	sub	ax,ax	; 0		; clear 'C'-----------------;
 15253 0000212C 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 15254                                  	;mov	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],ax ; set ref count    ;
 15255                                  	;mov	[es:di+15h],ax
 15256 0000212F 26894515                	mov	[es:di+sf_LRU],ax	; set lru		    ;
 15257 00002133 48                      	dec	ax	; -1					    ;
 15258                                  	;mov	[es:di+17h],ax ; 0FFFFh ; -1
 15259 00002134 26894517                	mov	[es:di+sf_OpenAge],ax	; set open age to -1	    ;
 15260                                  BlastSFT_retn:
 15261 00002138 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear     ;
 15262                                  
 15263                                  ;Break	<CheckFCB - see if the SFT pointed to by the FCB is still OK>
 15264                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15265                                  ;
 15266                                  ;   CheckFCB - examine an FCB and its contents to see if it needs to be
 15267                                  ;   regenerated.
 15268                                  ;
 15269                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to FCB (not extended)
 15270                                  ;		AL is SFT index
 15271                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Set - FCB needs to be regened
 15272                                  ;		Carry clear - FCB is OK. ES:DI point to SFT
 15273                                  ;   Registers modified: AX and BX
 15274                                  ;
 15275                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15276                                  
 15277                                  	; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 15278                                  	; DOSCODE:59F0h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 15279                                  
 15280                                  	; 21/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15281                                  	; DOSCODE:607Eh (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15282                                  CheckFCB:
 15283                                  		
 15284                                  	; called from $fcb_open and sftfromfcb. SS already set up to DOSDATA
 15285                                  
 15286                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 15287

 15289                                  
 15290                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 15291                                  	
 15292                                  	; SR;
 15293                                  	; We check if the given FCB is for a local file. If so, we return a 
 15294                                  	; bad SFT status forcing the caller to regenerate the SFT.
 15295                                  
 15296                                  	;test	byte [si+19h],0C0h
 15297 00002139 F64419C0                	test	byte [si+fcb_l_drive],FCBNETWORK|FCBSHARE|FCBDEVICE
 15298 0000213D 7447                    	jz	short BadSFT		;Local file, return bad SFT
 15299 0000213F 36C43E[4000]            	LES     DI,[SS:SFTFCB]		; SS override
 15300                                  
 15301                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 15302                                  	;cmp	[es:di+4],al
 15303 00002144 26384504                	CMP	[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount],AL
 15304 00002148 723C                    	JC	short BadSFT

 15306                                  	;mov	bl,59 ; MSDOS 6.0

 15308 0000214C F6E3                    	MUL	BL
 15309                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 15310 0000214E 8D7D06                  	LEA	DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable]
 15311 00002151 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX
 15312                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:PROC_ID]	; MSDOS 3.3
 15313 00002153 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID] ; MSDOS 6.0  ; SS override
 15314                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 15315 00002157 26394531                	CMP	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],AX
 15316 0000215B 7529                    	JNZ	short BadSFT		; must match process
 15317 0000215D 26833D00                	cmp	word [es:di],0
 15318                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0
 15319 00002161 7423                    	JZ	short BadSFT		; must also be in use
 15320                                  	;mov	al,[si+19h]
 15321 00002163 8A4419                  	MOV	AL,[SI+fcb_l_drive]
 15322                                  	;test	al,80h
 15323 00002166 A880                    	test	AL,FCBSPECIAL		; a special FCB?
 15324 00002168 7428                    	JZ	short CheckNoShare	; No. try local or device
 15325                                  
 15326                                  	; Since we are a special FCB, try NOT to use a bogus test instruction.
 15327                                  	; FCBSHARE is a superset of FCBNETWORK.
 15328                                  
 15329 0000216A 50                      	PUSH	AX
 15330                                  	;and	al,0C0h
 15331 0000216B 24C0                    	AND	AL,FCBMASK
 15332                                  	;cmp	al,0C0h
 15333 0000216D 3CC0                    	CMP	AL,FCBSHARE		; net FCB?
 15334 0000216F 58                      	POP	AX
 15335 00002170 7516                    	JNZ	short CheckNet		; no
 15336                                  					; yes
 15337                                  ;
 15338                                  ;----- In share support -----
 15339                                  ;
 15340                                  	;call	far [cs:JShare+(11*4)]
 15341 00002172 36FF1E[BC00]            	Call    far [ss:JShare+(11*4)] ; 11 = ShChk ; SS Override

 15479                                  ;Break	<SFTFromFCB - take a FCB and obtain a SFT from it>
 15480                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15481                                  ;
 15482                                  ;   SFTFromFCB - the workhorse of this compatability crap. Check to see if
 15483                                  ;	the SFT for the FCB is Good. If so, make ThisSFT point to it. If not
 15484                                  ;	good, get one from the cache and regenerate it. Overlay the LRU field
 15485                                  ;	with PID
 15486                                  ;
 15487                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to FCB
 15488                                  ;   Outputs:	ThisSFT point to appropriate SFT
 15489                                  ;		Carry clear -> OK ES:DI -> SFT
 15490                                  ;		Carry set -> error in ax
 15491                                  ;   Registers modified: ES,DI, AX
 15492                                  ;
 15493                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15494                                  
 15495                                  SFTFromFCB:
 15496                                  	; called from fcbio and $fcb_close. SS already set up to DOSDATA
 15497                                  
 15498                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15499

 15501 000021A7 53                      	push	bx
 15502                                  	;mov	al,[si+18h]
 15503 000021A8 8A4418                  	MOV	AL,[SI+fcb_sfn] 	; set SFN for check

 15505 000021AE 5B                      	pop	bx
 15506 000021AF 58                      	pop	ax
 15507                                  	;MOV	[CS:THISSFT],DI		; SS override
 15508                                  	;MOV	[CS:THISSFT+2],ES
 15509 000021B0 36893E[9E05]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT],DI		; SS override
 15510 000021B5 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES
 15511 000021BA 7311                    	JNC	short Set_SFT		; no problems, just set thissft
 15512

 15611                                  ;	Revision history:
 15612                                  ;
 15613                                  ;		Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 15614                                  ;			 MZ  6 June  1983 completion of functions
 15615                                  ;			 MZ 15 Dec   1983 Brain damaged programs close FCBs multiple
 15616                                  ;				  times.  Change so successive closes work by
 15617                                  ;				  always returning OK.	Also, detect I/O to
 15618                                  ;				  already closed FCB and return EOF.
 15619                                  ;		 MZ 16 Jan   1984 More braindamage.  Need to separate info
 15620                                  ;				  out of sft into FCB for reconnection
 15621                                  ;
 15622                                  ;	    A000   version 4.00	Jan. 1988

 15624                                  ; Defintions for FCBOp flags
 15625                                  
 15626                                  RANDOM	equ 2				; random operation
 15627                                  FCBREAD equ 4				; doing a read
 15628                                  BLOCK	equ 8				; doing a block I/O
 15629                                  
 15630                                  ;Break <GetRR - return the random record field in DX:AX>
 15631                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15632                                  ;
 15633                                  ;   GetRR - correctly load DX:AX with the random record field (3 or 4 bytes)
 15634                                  ;	from the FCB pointed to by DS:SI
 15635                                  ;
 15636                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to an FCB
 15637                                  ;		BX has record size
 15638                                  ;   Outputs:	DX:AX contain the contents of the random record field
 15639                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 15640                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15641                                  
 15642                                  GetRR:
 15643                                  	;mov	ax,[si+21h]
 15644 00002219 8B4421                  	MOV	AX,[SI+SYS_FCB.RR]	; get low order part
 15645                                  	;mov	dx,[si+23h]
 15646 0000221C 8B5423                  	MOV	DX,[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+2]	; get high order part
 15647 0000221F 83FB40                  	CMP	BX,64			; ignore MSB of RR if recsiz > 64
 15648 00002222 7202                    	JB	short GetRRBye
 15649                                  GetExtent_bye:	; 21/01/2024
 15650 00002224 30F6                    	XOR	DH,DH
 15651                                  GetRRBye:
 15652 00002226 C3                      	retn
 15653                                  
 15654                                  ;Break <GetExtent - retrieve next location for sequential IO>
 15655                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15656                                  ;
 15657                                  ;   GetExtent - Construct the next record to perform I/O from the EXTENT and
 15658                                  ;	NR fields in the FCB.
 15659                                  ;
 15660                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI - point to FCB
 15661                                  ;   Outputs:	DX:AX contain the contents of the random record field
 15662                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 15663                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15664                                  
 15665                                  GetExtent:
 15666                                  	;mov	al,[si+20h]
 15667 00002227 8A4420                  	MOV	AL,[SI+SYS_FCB.NR]	; get low order piece
 15668                                  	;mov	dx,[si+0Ch]
 15669 0000222A 8B540C                  	MOV	DX,[SI+SYS_FCB.EXTENT]	; get high order piece
 15670 0000222D D0E0                    	SHL	AL,1
 15671 0000222F D1EA                    	SHR	DX,1
 15672 00002231 D0D8                    	RCR	AL,1	; move low order bit of DL to high order of AH
 15673 00002233 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL
 15674 00002235 88F2                    	MOV	DL,DH
 15675                                  	; 21/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15676                                  	;XOR	DH,DH
 15677                                  	;retn
 15678 00002237 EBEB                    	jmp	short GetExtent_bye
 15679                                  
 15680                                  ;Break <SetExtent - update the extent/NR field>
 15681                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15682                                  ;
 15683                                  ;   SetExtent - change the position of an FCB by filling in the extent/NR
 15684                                  ;	fields
 15685                                  ;
 15686                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to FCB
 15687                                  ;		DX:AX is a record location in file
 15688                                  ;   Outputs:	Extent/NR fields are filled in
 15689                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 15690                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15691                                  
 15692                                  SetExtent:
 15693 00002239 50                      	push	ax
 15694 0000223A 52                      	push	dx
 15695 0000223B 89C1                    	MOV	CX,AX
 15696 0000223D 247F                    	AND	AL,7FH			; next rec field
 15697                                  	;mov	[si+20h],al
 15698 0000223F 884420                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.NR],AL
 15699 00002242 80E180                  	AND	CL,80H			; save upper bit
 15700 00002245 D1E1                    	SHL	CX,1
 15701 00002247 D1D2                    	RCL	DX,1			; move high bit of CX to low bit of DX
 15702 00002249 88E8                    	MOV	AL,CH
 15703 0000224B 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL
 15704                                  	;mov	[si+0Ch], ax
 15705 0000224D 89440C                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.EXTENT],AX	; all done
 15706 00002250 5A                      	pop	dx
 15707 00002251 58                      	pop	ax
 15708 00002252 C3                      	retn
 15709                                  
 15710                                  ;Break <GetExtended - find FCB in potential extended fcb>
 15711                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15712                                  ;
 15713                                  ;   GetExtended - Make DS:SI point to FCB from DS:DX
 15714                                  ;
 15715                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a possible extended FCB
 15716                                  ;   Outputs:	DS:SI point to the FCB part
 15717                                  ;		zeroflag set if not extended fcb
 15718                                  ;   Registers modified: SI
 15719                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15720                                  
 15721                                  GetExtended:
 15722 00002253 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; point to Something
 15723 00002255 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],-1		; look for extention
 15724 00002258 7503                    	JNZ	short GetBye		; not there
 15725 0000225A 83C607                  	ADD	SI,7			; point to FCB
 15726                                  GetBye:
 15727 0000225D 39D6                    	CMP	SI,DX			; set condition codes
 15728                                  getextd_retn:
 15729 0000225F C3                      	retn
 15730                                  
 15731                                  ;Break <GetRecSize - return in BX the FCB record size>
 15732                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15733                                  ;
 15734                                  ;   GetRecSize - return in BX the record size from the FCB at DS:SI
 15735                                  ;
 15736                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to a non-extended FCB
 15737                                  ;   Outputs:	BX contains the record size
 15738                                  ;   Registers modified: None
 15739                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15740

 15752                                  	;mov	[si+0Eh],bx
 15753 00002269 895C0E                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RECSIZ],BX	; stuff it back
 15754 0000226C C3                      	retn

 15764                                  ;   $FCB_Random_Write_Block - retrieve a location from the FCB, seek to it
 15765                                  ;	and write a number of blocks from it.

 16211                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16212                                  ;
 16213                                  ;   $FCB_Open - CPM compatability file open. The user has formatted an FCB
 16214                                  ;	for us and asked to have the rest filled in.
 16215                                  ;
 16216                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an unopenned FCB
 16217                                  ;   Outputs:	AL indicates status 0 is ok FF is error

 16430                                  
 16431                                  ; We must scan the set of FCB SFTs for one that appears to match the current
 16432                                  ; one.	We cheat and use CheckFCB to match the FCBs.
 16433                                  
 16434                                  ;hkn; 	SS override
 16435 000024E0 36C43E[4000]            	LES	DI,[SS:SFTFCB]		; get the pointer to head of the list
 16436                                  	;mov	ah,[es:di+4]
 16437 000024E5 268A6504                	MOV	AH,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; get number of SFTs to scan
 16438                                  OpenScan:
 16439                                  	;cmp	al,[si+18h]
 16440 000024E9 3A4418                  	CMP	AL,[SI+fcb_sfn]		; don't compare ourselves
 16441 000024EC 7407                    	JZ	short SkipCheck
 16442 000024EE 50                      	push	ax			; preserve count
 16443 000024EF E847FC                  	call	CheckFCB		; do they match
 16444 000024F2 58                      	pop	ax			; get count back
 16445 000024F3 7309                    	JNC	short OpenFound		; found a match!
 16446                                  SkipCheck:
 16447 000024F5 FEC0                    	INC	AL			; advance to next FCB
 16448 000024F7 38E0                    	CMP	AL,AH			; table full?
 16449 000024F9 75EE                    	JNZ	short OpenScan		; no, go for more
 16450                                  OpenDone:
 16451 000024FB 30C0                    	xor	al,al			; return success
 16452 000024FD C3                      	retn
 16453                                  
 16454                                  ; The SFT at ES:DI is the one that is already in use for this FCB. We set the
 16455                                  ; FCB to use this one. We increment its ref count. We do NOT close it at all.
 16456                                  ; Consider:
 16457                                  ;
 16458                                  ;   open (foo)	delete (foo) open (bar)
 16459                                  ;
 16460                                  ; This causes us to recycle (potentially) bar through the same local SFT as
 16461                                  ; foo even though foo is no longer needed; this is due to the server closing
 16462                                  ; foo for us when we delete it. Unfortunately, we cannot see this closure.
 16463                                  ; If we were to CLOSE bar, the server would then close the only reference to
 16464                                  ; bar and subsequent I/O would be lost to the redirector.
 16465                                  ;
 16466                                  ; This gets solved by NOT closing the sft, but zeroing the ref count
 16467                                  ; (effectively freeing the SFT) and informing the sharer (if relevant) that
 16468                                  ; the SFT is no longer in use. Note that the SHARER MUST keep its ref counts
 16469                                  ; around. This will allow us to access the same file through multiple network
 16470                                  ; connections and NOT prematurely terminate when the ref count on one
 16471                                  ; connection goes to zero.
 16472                                  
 16473                                  OpenFound:
 16474                                  	;mov	[si+18h],al
 16475 000024FE 884418                  	MOV	[SI+fcb_sfn],AL 	; assign with this
 16476 00002501 26FF05                  	inc	word [es:di]
 16477                                  	;INC	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count]
 16478                                  					; remember this new invocation
 16479                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 16480                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 16481                                  	;;;
 16482 00002504 E82325                  	call	set_sftfcb_entry
 16483                                  	;;;
 16484                                  
 16485                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16486 00002507 16                      	push	ss
 16487 00002508 1F                      	pop	ds
 16488                                  	
 16489                                  	;MOV	AX,[SS:FCBLRU]		; update LRU counts
 16490 00002509 A1[1000]                	mov	ax,[FCBLRU] ; 24/01/2024
 16491                                  	;mov	[es:di+15h],ax
 16492 0000250C 26894515                	MOV	[ES:DI+sf_LRU],AX
 16493                                  ;
 16494                                  ; We have an FCB sft that is now of no use. We release sharing info and then
 16495                                  ; blast it to prevent other reuse.
 16496                                  ;
 16497                                  	;push	ss
 16498                                  	;pop	ds
 16499                                  	
 16500 00002510 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 16501 00002514 26FF0D                  	dec	word [es:di]
 16502                                  	;DEC	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count]
 16503                                  					; free the newly allocated SFT
 16504 00002517 E8A05F                  	call	ShareEnd
 16505 0000251A B043                    	MOV	AL,'C'	 ; 43h
 16506 0000251C E801FC                  	call	BlastSFT
 16507 0000251F EBDA                    	JMP	short OpenDone

 16509                                  ;BREAK	<$FCB_Create - create a new directory entry>
 16510                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16511                                  ;
 16512                                  ;   $FCB_Create - CPM compatability file create. The user has formatted an
 16513                                  ;	FCB for us and asked to have the rest filled in.
 16514                                  ;

 16529                                  DoAccessJ:
