 16532                                  ;============================================================================
 16533                                  ; SEARCH.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 16534                                  ;============================================================================
 16535                                  ; 22/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16536                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16537                                  
 16538                                  ; DOSCODE:5DDFh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 16539                                  
 16540                                  ; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 16541                                  ; DOSCODE:5DCBh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 16542                                  
 16543                                  ;**	Search.asm
 16544                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16545                                  ;	Directory search system calls.
 16546                                  ;	These will be passed direct text of the pathname from the user. 
 16547                                  ;	They will need to be passed through the macro expander prior to
 16548                                  ;	being sent through the low-level stuff. 
 16549                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH. The system calls are:
 16550                                  ;
 16551                                  ;	$Dir_Search_First	  written
 16552                                  ;	$Dir_Search_Next	  written
 16553                                  ;	$Find_First	  written
 16554                                  ;	$Find_Next		  written
 16555                                  ;	PackName		  written
 16556                                  ;
 16557                                  ;	Modification history:
 16558                                  ;
 16559                                  ;	  Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 16560                                  
 16561                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16562                                  ; Procedure Name : $DIR_SEARCH_FIRST
 16563                                  ;
 16564                                  ; Inputs:
 16565                                  ;	DS:DX Points to unopenned FCB
 16566                                  ; Function:
 16567                                  ;	Directory is searched for first matching entry and the directory
 16568                                  ;	entry is loaded at the disk transfer address
 16569                                  ; Returns:
 16570                                  ;	AL = -1 if no entries matched, otherwise 0
 16571                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16572                                  
 16573                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 2B88h
 16574                                  	
 16575                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16576                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5DCBh
 16577                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5DDFh
 16578                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:647Bh
 16579                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:61E5h
 16580                                  
 16581                                  _$DIR_SEARCH_FIRST:
 16582 00002531 368916[A605]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB],DX
 16583 00002536 368C1E[A805]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB+2],DS
 16584 0000253B 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX
 16585 0000253D 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0FFH
 16586 00002540 7503                    	JNZ	short NORMFCB4
 16587 00002542 83C607                  	ADD	SI,7			; Point to drive select byte
 16588                                  NORMFCB4:
 16589 00002545 FF34                    	push	word [SI]		; Save original drive byte for later
 16590                                  
 16591 00002547 16                      	push	ss
 16592 00002548 07                      	pop	es			; get es to address DOSGroup
 16593                                  
 16594 00002549 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 16595 0000254C E8DF56                  	call	TransFCB		; convert the FCB, set SATTRIB EXTFCB
 16596 0000254F 7304                    	JNC	short SearchIt		; no error, go and look
 16597 00002551 5B                      	pop	bx			; Clean stack
 16598                                  
 16599                                  ; Error code is in AX
 16600                                  
 16601                                  	; 09/11/2022
 16602                                  dcf_errj:
 16603 00002552 E934E1                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR		; error
 16604                                  
 16605                                  SearchIt:
 16606 00002555 16                      	push	ss
 16607 00002556 1F                      	pop	ds			; get ready for search
 16608                                  	;push	word [DMAADD]
 16609                                  	;push	word [DMAADD+2]
 16610                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16611 00002557 C43E[2C03]              	les	di,[DMAADD]
 16612 0000255B 57                      	push	di
 16613 0000255C 06                      	push	es
 16614 0000255D C706[2C03][BE04]        	MOV	WORD [DMAADD],SEARCHBUF
 16615 00002563 8C1E[2E03]              	MOV	WORD [DMAADD+2],DS
 16616                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 16617                                  	;call	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 16618                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 16619 00002567 E8B70F                  	call	GET_FAST_SEARCH		; search
 16620 0000256A 8F06[2E03]              	pop	word [DMAADD+2]
 16621 0000256E 8F06[2C03]              	pop	word [DMAADD]
 16622 00002572 735A                    	JNC	short SearchSet		; no error, transfer info
 16623 00002574 5B                      	pop	bx			; Clean stack
 16624                                  
 16625                                  ; Error code is in AX
 16626                                  
 16627                                  	; 09/11/2022
 16628                                  	;jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
 16629 00002575 EBDB                    	jmp	short dcf_errj
 16630                                  
 16631                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16632                                  ;
 16633                                  ; Procedure Name : $DIR_SEARCH_NEXT
 16634                                  ;
 16635                                  ; Inputs:
 16636                                  ;	DS:DX points to unopenned FCB returned by $DIR_SEARCH_FIRST
 16637                                  ; Function:
 16638                                  ;	Directory is searched for the next matching entry and the directory
 16639                                  ;	entry is loaded at the disk transfer address
 16640                                  ; Returns:
 16641                                  ;	AL = -1 if no entries matched, otherwise 0
 16642                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16643                                  
 16644                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16645                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5E5Fh
 16646                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5E73h
 16647                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6517h
 16648                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:6273h
 16649                                  
 16650                                  _$DIR_SEARCH_NEXT:
 16651 00002577 368916[A605]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB],DX
 16652 0000257C 368C1E[A805]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB+2],DS
 16653                                  	; 24/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 16654                                  	;MOV	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0
 16655                                  	;MOV	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0
 16656 00002581 B000                    	mov	al,0
 16657 00002583 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],al ; 0
 16658 00002587 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],al ; 0
 16659                                  
 16660 0000258B 16                      	push	ss
 16661 0000258C 07                      	pop	es
 16662                                  
 16663 0000258D BF[BE04]                	MOV	DI,SEARCHBUF
 16664                                  
 16665 00002590 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX
 16666 00002592 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0FFh
 16667 00002595 750D                    	JNZ	short NORMFCB6
 16668 00002597 83C606                  	ADD	SI,6
 16669 0000259A AC                      	LODSB
 16670                                  
 16671 0000259B 36A2[6D05]              	MOV	[SS:SATTRIB],AL
 16672 0000259F 36FE0E[6C05]            	DEC	byte [SS:EXTFCB]
 16673                                  NORMFCB6:
 16674 000025A4 AC                      	LODSB				; Get original user drive byte
 16675 000025A5 50                      	push	ax			; Put it on stack
 16676 000025A6 8A4414                  	MOV	AL,[SI+20]		; Get correct search contin drive byte
 16677 000025A9 AA                      	STOSB				; Put in correct place
 16678 000025AA B90A00                  	MOV	CX,20/2
 16679 000025AD F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW			; Transfer in rest of search contin info
 16680                                  
 16681 000025AF 16                      	push	ss
 16682 000025B0 1F                      	pop	ds
 16683                                  
 16684                                  	;push	word [DMAADD]
 16685                                  	;push	word [DMAADD+2]
 16686                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16687 000025B1 C43E[2C03]              	les	di,[DMAADD]
 16688 000025B5 57                      	push	di
 16689 000025B6 06                      	push	es
 16690 000025B7 C706[2C03][BE04]        	MOV	WORD [DMAADD],SEARCHBUF
 16691 000025BD 8C1E[2E03]              	MOV	WORD [DMAADD+2],DS
 16692 000025C1 E85D10                  	call	DOS_SEARCH_NEXT 	; Find it
 16693 000025C4 8F06[2E03]              	pop	word [DMAADD+2]
 16694 000025C8 8F06[2C03]              	pop	word [DMAADD]
 16695 000025CC 724A                    	JC	short SearchNoMore
 16696                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16697                                  	;JMP	SearchSet		; Ok set return
 16698                                  
 16699                                  ;;;	; 24/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 16700                                  
 16701                                  ; The search was successful (or the search-next). We store the information
 16702                                  ; into the user's FCB for continuation.
 16703                                  
 16704                                  SearchSet:
 16705 000025CE BE[BE04]                	MOV	SI,SEARCHBUF
 16706 000025D1 C43E[A605]              	LES	DI,[THISFCB]		; point to the FCB
 16707 000025D5 F606[6C05]FF            	TEST	byte [EXTFCB],0FFh
 16708 000025DA 7403                    	JZ	short NORMFCB1
 16709 000025DC 83C707                  	ADD	DI,7			; Point past the extension
 16710                                  NORMFCB1:
 16711 000025DF 5B                      	pop	bx			; Get original drive byte
 16712 000025E0 08DB                    	OR	BL,BL
 16713 000025E2 7506                    	JNZ	short SearchDrv
 16714 000025E4 8A1E[3603]              	MOV	BL,[CURDRV]
 16715 000025E8 FEC3                    	INC	BL
 16716                                  SearchDrv:
 16717 000025EA AC                      	LODSB				; Get correct search contin drive byte
 16718 000025EB 86C3                    	XCHG	AL,BL			; Search byte to BL, user byte to AL
 16719 000025ED 47                      	INC	DI
 16720                                  	;STOSB				; Store the correct "user" drive byte
 16721                                  					;  at the start of the search info
 16722 000025EE B90A00                  	MOV	CX,20/2
 16723 000025F1 F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW			; Rest of search cont info, SI -> entry
 16724 000025F3 86C3                    	XCHG	AL,BL			; User drive byte back to BL, search
 16725                                  					;   byte to AL

 16904                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16905                                  ;**	PackName - Convert file names from FCB to ASCIZ format.
 16906                                  ;
 16907                                  ;	PackName transfers a file name from DS:SI to ES:DI and converts it to
 16908                                  ;	the ASCIZ format.
 16909                                  ;
 16910                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:SI) = 11 character FCB or dir entry name
 16911                                  ;		(ES:DI) = destination area (13 bytes)
 16912                                  ;	EXIT	(ds:SI) and (es:DI) advanced
 16913                                  ;	USES	al, CX, SI, DI, Flags  (BUGBUG - not verified - jgl)
 16914                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16915                                  
 16916                                  	; 25/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 16917                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6627h
 16918                                  
 16919                                  PackName:
 16920                                  ;	Move over 8 characters to cover the name component, then trim it's
 16921                                  ;	trailing blanks.
 16922                                  
 16923                                  	;MOV	CX,8			; Pack the name
 16924                                  	;REP	MOVSB			; Move all of it
 16925                                  	; 25/01/2024
 16926 000026B1 B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 16927 000026B4 F3A5                    	rep	movsw
 16928                                  main_kill_tail:
 16929 000026B6 26807DFF20              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1]," "
 16930 000026BB 7507                    	JNZ	short find_check_dot
 16931 000026BD 4F                      	DEC	DI			; Back up over trailing space
 16932 000026BE 41                      	INC	CX
 16933 000026BF 83F908                  	CMP	CX,8
 16934 000026C2 72F2                    	JB	short main_kill_tail
 16935                                  find_check_dot:
 16936                                  	;CMP	WORD [SI],(" " << 8) | " "
 16937 000026C4 813C2020                	cmp     word [si],2020h 
 16938 000026C8 7506                    	JNZ	short got_ext 		; Some chars in extension
 16939 000026CA 807C0220                	CMP	BYTE [SI+2]," "
 16940 000026CE 740F                    	JZ	short find_done		; No extension
 16941                                  got_ext:
 16942 000026D0 B02E                    	MOV	AL,"."	; 2Eh
 16943 000026D2 AA                      	STOSB
 16944                                  	;MOV	CX,3
 16945                                  	;; 18/12/2022
 16946                                  	;;mov	cl,3
 16947                                  	;;REP	MOVSB
 16948                                  	;movsb
 16949                                  	;movsb
 16950                                  	;movsb
 16951                                  	; 25/01/2024
 16952 000026D3 A5                      	movsw
 16953 000026D4 A4                      	movsb
 16954                                  ext_kill_tail:
 16955 000026D5 26807DFF20              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1]," "
 16956 000026DA 7503                    	JNZ	short find_done
 16957 000026DC 4F                      	DEC	DI			; Back up over trailing space
 16958 000026DD EBF6                    	JMP	short ext_kill_tail
 16959                                  find_done:
 16960 000026DF 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 16961 000026E1 AA                      	STOSB				; NUL terminate
 16962 000026E2 C3                      	retn

 16988                                  ; DOSCODE:5FB0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)

 16990                                  ;**	Directory related system calls. These will be passed direct text of the
 16991                                  ;	pathname from the user. They will need to be passed through the macro
 16992                                  ;	expander prior to being sent through the low-level stuff. I/O specs are
 16993                                  ;	defined in DISPATCH. The system calls are:
 16994                                  ;
 16995                                  ;	$CURRENT_DIR  Written
 16996                                  ;	$RMDIR	  Written
 16997                                  ;	$CHDIR	  Written
 16998                                  ;	$MKDIR	  Written
 16999                                  ;
 17000                                  ;
 17001                                  ;	Modification history:
 17002                                  ;
 17003                                  ;	    Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 17004                                  ;		 MZ 10 May 1983     CurrentDir implemented
 17005                                  ;		 MZ 11 May 1983     RmDir, ChDir, MkDir implemented
 17006                                  ;		 EE 19 Oct 1983     RmDir no longer allows you to delete a
 17007                                  ;				    current directory.
 17008                                  ;		 MZ 19 Jan 1983     Brain damaged applications rely on success

 17012                                  ;	I_Need	Curr_Dir_End,WORD	; offset to end of directory part
 17013                                  ;	I_Need	OpenBuf,128		; temp spot for translated name
 17014                                  ;	I_need	fSplice,BYTE		; TRUE => do splice
 17015                                  ;	I_Need	NoSetDir,BYTE		; TRUE => no exact match on splice
 17016                                  ;	I_Need	cMeta,BYTE
 17017                                  ;	I_Need	DrvErr,BYTE					;AN000;

 17019                                  ;BREAK <$CURRENT_DIR - dump the current directory into user space>
 17020                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 17022                                  ;   Procedure Name : $CURRENT_DIR
 17023                                  ;
 17024                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 17025                                  ;		LDS	SI,area
 17026                                  ;		MOV	DL,drive
 17027                                  ;		INT	21h
 17028                                  ;	    ; DS:SI is a pointer to 64 byte area that contains drive
 17029                                  ;	    ; current directory.
 17030                                  ;   Error returns:
 17031                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_drive
 17032                                  ;
 17033                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17034                                  
 17035                                  	; 06/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17036                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 2D4Eh

 17038                                  	; 25/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 17039                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5F9Ch  ; Retro DOS v4.1 (& v4.0)

 17042                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6664h ; Retro DOS v5.0

 17160                                  ; DOSCODE:6029h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)

 17162                                  ;BREAK <$RmDir -- Remove a directory>
 17163                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17164                                  ;
 17165                                  ; Procedure Name : $RmDir
 17166                                  ;
 17167                                  ; Inputs:
 17168                                  ;	DS:DX Points to asciz name
 17169                                  ; Function:
 17170                                  ;	Delete directory if empty
 17171                                  ; Returns:
 17172                                  ;	STD XENIX Return
 17173                                  ;	AX = error_path_not_found If path bad
 17174                                  ;	AX = error_access_denied If
 17175                                  ;		Directory not empty
 17176                                  ;		Path not directory
 17177                                  ;		Root directory specified
 17178                                  ;		Directory malformed (. and .. not first two entries)
 17179                                  ;		User tries to delete a current directory
 17180                                  ;	AX = error_current_directory
 17181                                  ;
 17182                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17183                                  
 17184                                  	; 10/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 17185                                  	; DOSCODE:6015h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 17186                                  
 17187                                  	; 25/01/2025 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17188                                  	; DOSCODE:66C8h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 17189                                  
 17190                                  _$RMDIR:
 17191 00002747 52                      	push	dx			; Save ptr to name
 17192 00002748 1E                      	push	ds
 17193 00002749 89D6                    	mov	si,dx			; Load ptr into si
 17194 0000274B BF[BE03]                	mov	di,OPENBUF		; di = ptr to buf for trans name
 17195 0000274E 57                      	push	di
 17196 0000274F E84A55                  	call	TransPathNoSet		; Translate the name
 17197 00002752 5F                      	pop	di			; di = ptr to buf for trans name
 17198 00002753 7306                    	jnc	short rmlset		; If transpath succeeded, continue
 17199 00002755 1F                      	pop	ds
 17200 00002756 5A                      	pop	dx			; Restore the name
 17201                                  	;mov	al,3
 17202 00002757 B003                    	mov	al,error_path_not_found ; Otherwise, return an error
 17203                                  	; 16/12/2022
 17204                                  rmdir_errj: ; 10/08/2018
 17205                                  chdir_errj:
 17206 00002759 EB9F                    	jmp	short curdir_errj
 17207                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 17208                                  rmlset:
 17209 0000275B 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1	;   if (cMeta >= 0)

 17259                                  ; DOSCODE:6065h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 17260                                  
 17261                                  ;BREAK <$ChDir -- Change current directory on a drive>
 17262                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17263                                  ;
 17264                                  ; $ChDir - Top-level change directory system call.  This call is responsible
 17265                                  ; for setting up the CDS for the specified drive appropriately.  There are
 17266                                  ; several cases to consider:
 17267                                  ;
 17268                                  ;   o	Local, simple CDS.  In this case, we take the input path and convert
 17269                                  ;	it into a WFP.	We verify the existance of this directory and then
 17270                                  ;	copy the WFP into the CDS and set up the ID field to point to the
 17271                                  ;	directory cluster.
 17272                                  ;   o	Net CDS.  We form the path from the root (including network prefix)
 17273                                  ;	and verify its existance (via DOS_Chdir).  If successful, we copy the
 17274                                  ;	WFP back into the CDS.
 17275                                  ;   o	SUBST'ed CDS.  This is no different than the local, simple CDS.
 17276                                  ;   o	JOIN'ed CDS.  This is trouble as there are two CDS's at work.  If we
 17277                                  ;	call TransPath, we will get the PHYSICAL CDS that the path refers to
 17278                                  ;	and the PHYSICAL WFP that the input path refers to.  This is perfectly
 17279                                  ;	good for the validation but not for currency.  We call TransPathNoSet
 17280                                  ;	to process the path but to return the logical CDS and the logical
 17281                                  ;	path.  We then copy the logical path into the logical CDS.
 17282                                  ;
 17283                                  ; Inputs:
 17284                                  ;	DS:DX Points to asciz name
 17285                                  ; Returns:
 17286                                  ;	STD XENIX Return
 17287                                  ;	AX = chdir_path_not_found if error
 17288                                  ;
 17289                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17290                                  	
 17291                                  	; 25/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17292                                  	
 17293                                  _$CHDIR:
 17294                                  	; 25/01/2024
 17295                                  	;;;
 17296 00002794 36C606[5411]43          	mov	byte [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67 ; Retro DOS v5.0
 17297                                  	;mov	word [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67 ; DIRSTRLEN = 67
 17298                                  	;;;
 17299 0000279A BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; spot for translated name
 17300 0000279D 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get source
 17301 0000279F E8EE54                  	call	TransPath		; go munge the path and get real CDS
 17302 000027A2 7304                    	JNC	short ChDirCrack	; no errors, try path
 17303                                  ChDirErrP:
 17304                                  	;mov	al,3
 17305 000027A4 B003                    	MOV	AL,error_path_not_found
 17306                                  ChDirErr:
 17307                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR 	; oops!

 17316                                  ; found.

 17330                                  ; not network). If one was seen, all we need to do is copy in the text

 17343

 17347

 17358                                  	
 17359 000027D8 BE[BE03]                	MOV	SI,OPENBUF		; spot for translated name
 17360 000027DB 87F7                    	XCHG	SI,DI
 17361 000027DD 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL			; do no splicing
 17362 000027DF 57                      	push	di

 17364 000027E3 5E                      	pop	si

 17553                                  ;============================================================================
 17554                                  ; IOCTL.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 17555                                  ;============================================================================
 17556                                  ; 07/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17557                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17558                                  
 17559                                  ;**	IOCTL system call.
 17560                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17561                                  ;	$IOCTL
 17562                                  ;
 17563                                  ;	  Revision history:
 17564                                  ;
 17565                                  ;		Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 17566                                  ;
 17567                                  ;		GenericIOCTL added:		KGS	22 April 1985
 17568                                  ;
 17569                                  ;		A000	version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 17570                                  ;
 17571                                  ;		Used jump table to dispatch IOCTL functions. HKN 3/12/90
 17572                                  ;
 17573                                  
 17574                                  ;BREAK <IOCTL - munge on a handle to do device specific stuff>
 17575                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17576                                  ;
 17577                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 17578                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 17579                                  ;	    MOV     DX, Data
 17580                                  ;
 17581                                  ;	(or LDS     DX,BUF
 17582                                  ;	    MOV     CX,COUNT)
 17583                                  ;
 17584                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Ioctl
 17585                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 17586                                  ;	    INT     21h
 17587                                  ;
 17588                                  ;   AH = 0  Return a combination of low byte of sf_flags and device driver
 17589                                  ;	    attribute word in DX, handle in BX:
 17590                                  ;	    DH = high word of device driver attributes
 17591                                  ;	    DL = low byte of sf_flags
 17592                                  ;	 1  Set the bits contained in DX to sf_flags.  DH MUST be 0.  Handle
 17593                                  ;	    in BX.
 17594                                  ;	 2  Read CX bytes from the device control channel for handle in BX
 17595                                  ;	    into DS:DX.  Return number read in AX.
 17596                                  ;	 3  Write CX bytes to the device control channel for handle in BX from
 17597                                  ;	    DS:DX.  Return bytes written in AX.
 17598                                  ;	 4  Read CX bytes from the device control channel for drive in BX
 17599                                  ;	    into DS:DX.  Return number read in AX.
 17600                                  ;	 5  Write CX bytes to the device control channel for drive in BX from
 17601                                  ;	    DS:DX.  Return bytes written in AX.
 17602                                  ;	 6  Return input status of handle in BX. If a read will go to the
 17603                                  ;	    device, AL = 0FFh, otherwise 0.
 17604                                  ;	 7  Return output status of handle in BX. If a write will go to the
 17605                                  ;	    device, AL = 0FFh, otherwise 0.
 17606                                  ;	 8  Given a drive in BX, return 1 if the device contains non-
 17607                                  ;	    removable media, 0 otherwise.
 17608                                  ;	 9  Return the contents of the device attribute word in DX for the
 17609                                  ;	    drive in BX.  0200h is the bit for shared.	1000h is the bit for
 17610                                  ;	    network. 8000h is the bit for local use.
 17611                                  ;	 A  Return 8000h if the handle in BX is for the network or not.
 17612                                  ;	 B  Change the retry delay and the retry count for the system. BX is
 17613                                  ;	    the count and CX is the delay.
 17614                                  ;
 17615                                  ;   Error returns:
 17616                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 17617                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 17618                                  ;	       = error_invalid_data
 17619                                  ;
 17620                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17621                                  ;
 17622                                  ;   This is the documentation copied from DOS 4.0 it is much better
 17623                                  ;   than the above
 17624                                  ;
 17625                                  ;	There are several basic forms of IOCTL calls:
 17626                                  ;
 17627                                  ;
 17628                                  ;	** Get/Set device information:	**
 17629                                  ;
 17630                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17631                                  ;		  0 - Get device information
 17632                                  ;		  1 - Set device information
 17633                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17634                                  ;		(DX) = info for "Set Device Information"
 17635                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17636                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17637                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17638                                  ;		  (DX) = info for "Get Device Information"
 17639                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17640                                  ;
 17641                                  ;
 17642                                  ;	**  Read/Write Control Data From/To Handle  **
 17643                                  ;
 17644                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17645                                  ;		  2 - Read device control info
 17646                                  ;		  3 - Write device control info
 17647                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17648                                  ;		(CX) = transfer count
 17649                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data
 17650                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17651                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17652                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17653                                  ;		  (AX) = count of bytes transfered
 17654                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17655                                  ;
 17656                                  ;
 17657                                  ;	**  Read/Write Control Data From/To Block Device  **
 17658                                  ;
 17659                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17660                                  ;		  4 - Read device control info
 17661                                  ;		  5 - Write device control info
 17662                                  ;		(BL) = Drive number (0=default, 1='A', 2='B', etc)
 17663                                  ;		(CX) = transfer count
 17664                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data
 17665                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17666                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17667                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17668                                  ;		  (AX) = count of bytes transfered
 17669                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17670                                  ;
 17671                                  ;
 17672                                  ;	**  Get Input/Output Status  **
 17673                                  ;
 17674                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17675                                  ;		  6 - Get Input status
 17676                                  ;		  7 - Get Output Status
 17677                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17678                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17679                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17680                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17681                                  ;		  (AL) = 00 if not ready
 17682                                  ;		  (AL) = FF if ready
 17683                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17684                                  ;
 17685                                  ;
 17686                                  ;	**  Get Drive Information  **
 17687                                  ;
 17688                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17689                                  ;		  8 - Check for removable media
 17690                                  ;		  9 - Get device attributes
 17691                                  ;		(BL) = Drive number (0=default, 1='A', 2='B', etc)
 17692                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17693                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17694                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17695                                  ;		  (AX) = 0/1 media is removable/fixed (func. 8)
 17696                                  ;		  (DX) = device attribute word (func. 9)
 17697                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17698                                  ;
 17699                                  ;
 17700                                  ;	**  Get Redirected bit	**
 17701                                  ;
 17702                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17703                                  ;		  0Ah - Network stuff
 17704                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17705                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17706                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17707                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17708                                  ;		  (DX) = SFT flags word, 8000h set if network file
 17709                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17710                                  ;
 17711                                  ;
 17712                                  ;	**  Change sharer retry parameters  **
 17713                                  ;
 17714                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17715                                  ;		  0Bh - Set retry parameters
 17716                                  ;		(CX) = retry loop count
 17717                                  ;		(DX) = number of retries
 17718                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17719                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17720                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17721                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17722                                  ;
 17723                                  ;
 17724                                  ;   =================================================================
 17725                                  ;
 17726                                  ;	**  New Standard Control  **
 17727                                  ;
 17728                                  ;	ALL NEW IOCTL FACILITIES SHOULD USE THIS FORM.	THE OTHER
 17729                                  ;	FORMS ARE OBSOLETE.
 17730                                  ;
 17731                                  ;   =================================================================
 17732                                  ;
 17733                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17734                                  ;		  0Ch - Control Function subcode
 17735                                  ;		(BX) = File Handle
 17736                                  ;		(CH) = Category Indicator
 17737                                  ;		(CL) = Function within category
 17738                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data, if any
 17739                                  ;		(SI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17740                                  ;		(DI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17741                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17742                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17743                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17744                                  ;		  (SI) = Return value, meaning is function dependent
 17745                                  ;		  (DI) = Return value, meaning is function dependent
 17746                                  ;		  (DS:DX) = Return address, use is function dependent
 17747                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17748                                  ;
 17749                                  ;    ============== Generic IOCTL Definitions for DOS 3.2 ============
 17750                                  ;     (See inc\ioctl.inc for more info)
 17751                                  ;
 17752                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17753                                  ;		  0Dh - Control Function subcode
 17754                                  ;		(BL) = Drive Number (0 = Default, 1= 'A')
 17755                                  ;		(CH) = Category Indicator
 17756                                  ;		(CL) = Function within category
 17757                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data, if any
 17758                                  ;		(SI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17759                                  ;		(DI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17760                                  ;
 17761                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17762                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17763                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17764                                  ;		  (DS:DX) = Return address, use is function dependent
 17765                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17766                                  ;
 17767                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17768                                  	
 17769                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 17863                                  					;   device bit!! He can muck with the

 17971                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17972                                  ;
 17973                                  ; Generic IOCTL entry point. AL = C, D, 10h, 11h
 17974                                  ;
 17975                                  ;	here we invoke the Generic IOCTL using the IOCTL_Req structure.
 17976                                  ;	SI:DX -> Users Device Parameter Table
 17977                                  ;	IOCALL -> IOCTL_Req structure
 17978                                  ;
 17979                                  ; 	If on entry AL >= IOCTL_QUERY_HANDLE the function is a
 17980                                  ;	QueryIOCtlSupport call ELSE it's a standard generic IOCtl
 17981                                  ;	call.
 17982                                  ;
 17983                                  ; BUGBUG: Don't push anything on the stack between GENERIOCTL: and 
 17984                                  ;         the call to Check_If_Net because Check_If_Net gets our
 17985                                  ;         return address off the stack if the drive is invalid.
 17986                                  ;
 17987                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17988                                  
 17989                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 17990                                  
 17991                                  query_handle_support:	; Entry point for handles
 17992                                  GENERICIOCTLHANDLE:
 17993 00002922 E8DD4D                  	call	SFFromHandle		; Get SFT for device.
 17994 00002925 727E                    	jc	short ioctl_bad_handlej
 17995                                  
 17996                                  	;test	word [es:di+5],8000h
 17997                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet	; M031;
 17998                                  	;test	byte [es:di+6],80h
 17999 00002927 26F6450680              	test	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8)
 18000 0000292C 757A                    	jnz	short ioctl_bad_fun	; Cannot do this over net.
 18001                                  
 18002                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_SerDev ; 4
 18003                                  	; 29/01/2024
 18004                                  	;;;
 18005 0000292E E8B2E9                  	call	set_exerr_locus_ser ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 18006                                  	;;;
 18007                                  
 18008                                  	;les	di,[es:di+7]
 18009 00002931 26C47D07                	les	di,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]	; Get pointer to device.
 18010                                  	;;;
 18011                                  	; 29/01/2024 - PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 18012 00002935 C606[B103]FF            	mov	byte [IOCTL_drvnum],0FFh	; invalidate drive number
 18013                                  					; (for extended -lock/unlock- functions)
 18014                                  	;;;
 18015 0000293A EB16                    	jmp	short Do_GenIOCTL
 18016                                  
 18017                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18018                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:68DAh

 18020                                  
 18021                                  query_device_support:	; Entry point for devices:
 18022                                  GENERICIOCTL:
 18023                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk ; 2
 18024                                  	; 29/01/2024
 18025                                  	;;;

 18027 0000293F 80FD48                  	cmp	ch,48h			; category (extended, disk lock/unlock)
 18028 00002942 7405                    	je      short GenIOCTL_chk_net	; extended (MSDOS/PCDOS 7)
 18029                                  	;;;
 18030                                  
 18031 00002944 80FD08                  	cmp	ch,IOC_DC ; 8		; Only disk devices are allowed to use
 18032 00002947 755F                    	jne	short ioctl_bad_fun	; no handles with Generic IOCTL.
 18033                                  
 18034                                  	; 29/01/2024 
 18035                                  	;;;
 18036                                  GenIOCTL_chk_net:

 18038                                  	;;;
 18039                                  
 18040 0000294D E8C301                  	CALL	Check_If_Net		; ES:DI := Get_hdr_block of device in BL
 18041 00002950 7556                    	JNZ	short ioctl_bad_fun	; There are no "net devices", and they
 18042                                  
 18043                                  Do_GenIOCTL:
 18044                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 
 18045                                  	;;;
 18046 00002952 80FD48                  	cmp	ch,48h			; category code 48h for FAT32
 18047 00002955 7456                    	je	short GenIOCTL_extended ; MSDOS/PCDOS 7 functions (lock/unlock)
 18048                                  	;cmp	ch,8
 18049 00002957 80FD08                  	cmp	ch,IOC_DC ; 8          	; disk control
 18050 0000295A 7451                    	je	short GenIOCTL_extended
 18051                                  GenIOCTL_normal:			; MSDOS 5-6.22 functions
 18052                                  	;;;

 18080 00002979 57                      	PUSH	DI			; in DS:SI

 18092 0000298F 893E[8D03]              	MOV	[IOCALL+IOCTL_REQ.REG_DI],DI

 18106                                  	
 18107                                  ioctl_bad_handlej:
 18108 000029A5 E901FF                  	jmp	ioctl_bad_handle
 18109                                  
 18110                                  	; 29/01/2024
 18111                                  ioctl_bad_fun:
 18112 000029A8 B001                    	mov	al, error_invalid_function  ; 1
 18113 000029AA E9C7DC                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR	
 18114                                  
 18115                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 18116                                  GenIOCTL_extended:
 18117 000029AD 80F96A                  	cmp	cl,6Ah			; UNLOCK LOGICAL VOLUME
 18118                                  	;je	short GenIOCTL_chk_lock
 18119 000029B0 740E                    	je	short GenIOCTL_lock_unlock
 18120 000029B2 80F94A                  	cmp	cl,4Ah			; LOCK LOGICAL VOLUME
 18121 000029B5 75A5                    	jne	short GenIOCTL_normal
 18122                                  ;GenIOCTL_chk_lock:
 18123                                  	;cmp	cl,4Ah			; LOCK LOGICAL VOLUME
 18124                                  	;jne	short GenIOCTL_lock_unlock
 18125 000029B7 80FF04                  	cmp	bh,4			; lock level (0-4)
 18126 000029BA 7404                    	je	short GenIOCTL_lock_unlock
 18127 000029BC 08FF                    	or	bh,bh
 18128 000029BE 75E8                    	jnz	short ioctl_bad_fun
 18129                                  GenIOCTL_lock_unlock:
 18130 000029C0 8A1E[B103]              	mov	bl,[IOCTL_drvnum]	; drive number (1=A:, 2=B: ..)
 18131 000029C4 30FF                    	xor	bh,bh
 18132 000029C6 4B                      	dec	bx
 18133 000029C7 80FB1A                  	cmp	bl,26			; logical disk number limit
 18134 000029CA 73DC                    	jnb	short ioctl_bad_fun

 18523                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18524                                  ; Proc Name : Check_If_Net:
 18525                                  ;
 18526                                  ;
 18527                                  ; Checks if the device is over the net or not. Returns result in ZERO flag.
 18528                                  ; If no device is found, the return address is popped off the stack, and a
 18529                                  ; jump is made to ioctl_drv_err.
 18530                                  ;
 18531                                  ; On Entry:
 18532                                  ; Registers same as those for Get_Driver_BL
 18533                                  ;
 18534                                  ; On Exit:
 18535                                  ; ZERO flag	- set if not a net device
 18536                                  ;		- reset if net device
 18537                                  ; ES:DI -> the device
 18538                                  ;
 18539                                  ;
 18540                                  ; BUGBUG: This function assumes the following stack setup on entry
 18541                                  ;
 18542                                  ;	  SP+2 -> Error return address
 18543                                  ;	  SP   -> Normal return address
 18544                                  ;
 18545                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18546                                  
 18547                                  	; 30/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18548                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:639Ch
 18549                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6A91h
 18550                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:68E1h
 18551                                  
 18552                                  Check_If_Net:
 18553                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 18554 00002B13 E8D2FF                  	CALL	Get_Driver_BL
 18555 00002B16 7201                    	JC	short ioctl_drv_err_pop	; invalid drive letter
 18556                                  
 18557                                  ; 30/01/2024 ('Get_Driver_BL' returns with
 18558                                  ;	      'curdir_isnet' condition/ZF, no need to a second test)
 18559                                  %if 0
 18560                                  	;;;
 18561                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM, Windows ME IO.SYS)
 18562                                  	PUSH	ES
 18563                                  	PUSH	DI
 18564                                  	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 18565                                  	;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 18566                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 18567                                  	;test	byte [es:di+44h],80h
 18568                                  	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 18569                                  	POP	DI
 18570                                  	POP	ES
 18571                                  	;;;
 18572                                  %endif
 18573 00002B18 C3                      	retn
 18574                                  
 18575                                  ioctl_drv_err_pop:
 18576 00002B19 58                      	pop	ax			; pop off return address
 18577 00002B1A E951FF                  	jmp	ioctl_drv_err
 18578                                  
 18579                                  ioctl_bad_funj3:
 18580 00002B1D E988FE                  	jmp	ioctl_bad_fun
 18581                                  
 18582                                  ioctl_string_errj:
 18583 00002B20 EBB2                    	jmp	short ioctl_string_err  ; 25/05/2019
 18584

 18592                                  ; BUGBUG: Don't push anything on the stack between ioctl_drive_owner: and

 18594                                  ;         return address off the stack if the drive is invalid.

 18601 00002B25 75F6                    	JNZ	short ioctl_bad_funj3 	; There are no "net devices", and they
 18602                                  					;   certainly don't know how to do this
 18603                                  					;   call.
 18604                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEV320	; See if device can handle this
 18605                                  	; 09/09/2018
 18606                                  	;test	byte [es:di+4],40h
 18607 00002B27 26F6450440              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEV320 ; 0040h
 18608 00002B2C 74EF                    	JZ	short ioctl_bad_funj3 	; NO
 18609                                  	;mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],23
 18610 00002B2E C606[7E03]17            	mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],DEVGETOWN	; default to get owner
 18611 00002B33 3C0E                    	cmp	al,0Eh			; Get Owner ?
 18612 00002B35 7405                    	jz	short GetOwner
 18613                                  SetOwner:
 18614 00002B37 C606[7E03]18            	MOV	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],DEVSETOWN ; 24
 18615                                  GetOwner:
 18616 00002B3C B00D                    	MOV	AL,OWNHL ; 13
 18617 00002B3E 88DC                    	MOV	AH,BL			; Unit number
 18618 00002B40 A3[7C03]                	MOV	[IOCALL_REQLEN],AX
 18619 00002B43 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 18620 00002B45 A3[7F03]                	MOV	[IOCALL_REQSTAT],AX
 18621 00002B48 06                      	PUSH	ES
 18622 00002B49 1F                      	POP	DS
 18623 00002B4A 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI			; DS:SI -> driver
 18624 00002B4C 16                      	PUSH	SS
 18625 00002B4D 07                      	POP	ES
 18626 00002B4E BB[7C03]                	MOV	BX,IOCALL		; ES:BX -> Call header
 18627 00002B51 1E                      	push	ds
 18628 00002B52 56                      	push	si
 18629 00002B53 E86327                  	call	DEVIOCALL2
 18630 00002B56 5E                      	pop	si
 18631 00002B57 1F                      	pop	ds
 18632                                  ;hkn; SS override
 18633                                  	;TEST	word [SS:IOCALL_REQSTAT],STERR ;Error?
 18634                                  	;test	byte [SS:IOCALL_REQSTAT+1],80h
 18635 00002B58 36F606[8003]80          	TEST	byte [SS:IOCALL_REQSTAT+1],(STERR>>8)
 18636 00002B5E 75C0                    	jnz	short ioctl_string_errj
 18637 00002B60 36A0[7D03]              	MOV	AL,[SS:IOCALL_REQUNIT]	; Get owner returned by device
 18638                                  					; owner returned is 1-based.
 18639 00002B64 E903DB                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
