 28755                                  
 28756                                  ;============================================================================
 28757                                  ; DIR2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 28758                                  ;============================================================================
 28759                                  ; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28760                                  ; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28761                                  ; 14/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28762                                  
 28763                                  ;	TITLE	DIR2 - Directory and path cracking
 28764                                  ;	NAME	Dir2
 28765                                  
 28766                                  ;Break	<GETPATH -- PARSE A WFP>
 28767                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28768                                  ;
 28769                                  ; Procedure Name : GETPATH
 28770                                  ;
 28771                                  ; Inputs:
 28772                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:\" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 28773                                  ;		terminated; d:/ (note forward slash) indicates a real device).
 28774                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 28775                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 28776                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 28777                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 28778                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 28779                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 28780                                  ;	[THISDPB] set to DPB if disk otherwise garbage.
 28781                                  ; Function:
 28782                                  ;	Crack the path
 28783                                  ; Outputs:
 28784                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Disk if disk file
 28785                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Unk if char device
 28786                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 28787                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 28788                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28789                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 28790                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 28791                                  ;	   Zero set
 28792                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 28793                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 28794                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 28795                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 28796                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 28797                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 28798                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 28799                                  ;	   Zero reset
 28800                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path or attribute mismatch
 28801                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 28802                                  ;	ELSE
 28803                                  ;	   [CurBuf] = -1 if root directory
 28804                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 28805                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 28806                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points into [CURBUF] to dir_first field for entry
 28807                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 28808                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 28809                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 28810                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 28811                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 28812                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 28813                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 28814                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it.
 28815                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 28816                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 28817                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 28818                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 28819                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 28820                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 28821                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 28822                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 28823                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 28824                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28825                                  
 28826                                  ;hkn; called from delete.asm, finfo.asm, mknode.asm and rename.asm.
 28827                                  ;hkn; DS already set up at this point.
 28828                                  
 28829                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28830                                  
 28831                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28832                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8B99h
 28833                                  
 28834                                  GETPATH:
 28835                                  	;mov	word [CREATING],0E500h
 28836 00004B25 C706[7E05]00E5          	MOV	WORD [CREATING],DIRFREE*256+0 ; Not Creating, not DEL *.*
 28837                                  
 28838                                  ; Same as GetPath only CREATING and DELALL already set
 28839                                  
 28840                                  	;entry	GetPathNoSet
 28841                                  GetPathNoSet:
 28842                                  	;;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],2
 28843                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk
 28844                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28845 00004B2B E8B0C7                  	call	set_exerr_locus_disk
 28846                                  	;
 28847 00004B2E C706[E205]FFFF          	MOV	word [CURBUF],-1	; initial setting
 28848                                  
 28849                                  ; See if the input indicates a device that has already been detected. If so,
 28850                                  ; go build the guy quickly. Otherwise, let findpath find the device.
 28851                                  
 28852 00004B34 8B3E[B205]              	MOV	DI,[WFP_START]		; point to the beginning of the name
 28853                                  	;cmp	word [DI+1],5C3Ah
 28854                                  	;CMP	WORD [DI+1],'\' << 8 + ':'
 28855 00004B38 817D013A5C              	cmp	word [DI+1],':\'
 28856 00004B3D 7435                    	JZ	short CrackIt
 28857                                  
 28858                                  ; Let ChkDev find it in the device list
 28859                                  
 28860 00004B3F 83C703                  	ADD	DI,3
 28861                                  	; 18/08/2018
 28862                                  	;MOV	SI,DI			; let CHKDEV see the original name
 28863                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28864                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28865                                  	;mov	si,di ; not required ! (it is written in CHKDEV proc already!)
 28866 00004B42 E8B200                  	CALL	CHKDEV
 28867 00004B45 722B                    	JC	short InternalError
 28868                                  
 28869                                  Build_devJ:
 28870 00004B47 A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 28871 00004B4A A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 28872                                  	; 15/02/2024
 28873                                  	;;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],1
 28874                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; In the particular case of
 28875                                  					; "finding" a char device
 28876                                  					; set LOCUS to Unknown. This makes
 28877                                  					; certain idiotic problems reported
 28878                                  					; by a certain 3 letter OEM go away.
 28879                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28880 00004B4D E885C7                  	call	set_exerr_locus_unk
 28881                                  
 28882                                  
 28883                                  ; Take name in name1 and pack it back into where wfp_start points. This
 28884                                  ; guarantees wfp_start pointing to a canonical representation of a device.
 28885                                  ; We are allowed to do this as GetPath is *ALWAYS* called before entering a
 28886                                  ; wfp into the share set.
 28887                                  ;
 28888                                  ; We copy chars from name1 to wfp_start remembering the position of the last
 28889                                  ; non-space seen +1.  This position is kept in DX.
 28890                                  
 28891                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 28892 00004B50 16                      	push	ss
 28893 00004B51 07                      	pop	es
 28894                                  
 28895                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 28896 00004B52 BE[4B05]                	mov	si,NAME1
 28897 00004B55 8B3E[B205]              	mov	di,[WFP_START]
 28898 00004B59 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 28899 00004B5B B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; 8 chars in device name
 28900                                  MoveLoop:
 28901 00004B5E AC                      	lodsb
 28902 00004B5F AA                      	stosb
 28903 00004B60 3C20                    	cmp	al," "
 28904 00004B62 7402                    	jz	short NoSave
 28905                                  
 28906 00004B64 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 28907                                  NoSave:
 28908 00004B66 E2F6                    	loop	MoveLoop
 28909                                  
 28910                                  ; DX is the position of the last seen non-space + 1. We terminate the name
 28911                                  ; at this point.
 28912                                  
 28913 00004B68 89D7                    	mov	di,dx
 28914                                  	;mov	byte [di],0		; end of string
 28915                                  	; 15/02/2024
 28916 00004B6A 880D                    	mov	[di],cl ; 0
 28917 00004B6C E8E102                  	call	Build_device_ent	; Clears carry sets zero
 28918 00004B6F FEC0                    	INC	AL			; reset zero
 28919 00004B71 C3                      	retn
 28920                                  
 28921                                  InternalError:
 28922                                  InternalError_loop:
 28923 00004B72 EBFE                    	JMP	short InternalError_loop ; freeze
 28924                                  
 28925                                  ; Start off at the correct spot. Optimize if the current dir part is valid.
 28926                                  
 28927                                  CrackIt:
 28928                                  ; 15/02/2024
 28929                                  %if 0
 28930                                  	MOV	SI,[CURR_DIR_END]	; get current directory pointer
 28931                                  	CMP	SI,-1			; valid?
 28932                                  	JNZ	short LOOK_SING		; Yes, use it.
 28933                                  	LEA	SI,[DI+3]		; skip D:\.
 28934                                  LOOK_SING:
 28935                                  %endif
 28936                                  	;mov	byte [ATTRIB],16h
 28937 00004B74 C606[6B05]16            	MOV	byte [ATTRIB],attr_directory+attr_system+attr_hidden
 28938                                  					; Attributes to search through Dirs
 28939 00004B79 C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 28940 00004B7D B8FFFF                  	MOV	AX,-1 ; 0FFFFh
 28941                                  	;;;
 28942                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28943                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+4Bh]
 28944 00004B80 268B5D4B                	mov	bx,[es:di+curdir.ID+2]
 28945 00004B84 891E[EE0A]              	mov	[ROOTCLUST_HW],bx
 28946                                  	;;;
 28947                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+73]
 28948 00004B88 268B5D49                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+curdir.ID]
 28949 00004B8C 8B36[B605]              	MOV	SI,[CURR_DIR_END]
 28950                                  
 28951                                  ; AX = -1
 28952                                  ; BX = cluster number of current directory. THis number is -1 if the media
 28953                                  ;      has been uncertainly changed.
 28954                                  ; SI = offset in DOSGroup into path to end of current directory text. This
 28955                                  ;      may be -1 if no current directory part has been used.
 28956                                  
 28957 00004B90 39C6                    	CMP	SI,AX			; if Current directory is not part
 28958 00004B92 7449                    	JZ	short NO_CURR_D		; then we must crack from root
 28959                                  	;;;
 28960                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28961 00004B94 3906[EE0A]              	cmp	[ROOTCLUST_HW],ax ; 0FFFFh
 28962 00004B98 7504                    	jnz	short CrackIt2
 28963                                  	;;;
 28964 00004B9A 39C3                    	CMP	BX,AX			; is the current directory cluster valid
 28965                                  
 28966                                  ; DOS 3.3  6/25/86
 28967 00004B9C 743F                    	JZ	short NO_CURR_D		; no, crack from the root
 28968                                  
 28969                                  CrackIt2:	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28970                                  
 28971                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],1
 28972 00004B9E F606[4611]01            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],FastOpen_Set ; for fastopen ?
 28973 00004BA3 7445                    	JZ	short GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER	; no
 28974 00004BA5 06                      	PUSH	ES			; save registers
 28975 00004BA6 57                      	PUSH	DI
 28976 00004BA7 51                      	PUSH	CX
 28977 00004BA8 FF74FF                  	PUSH	word [SI-1]		; save \ and 1st char of next element
 28978 00004BAB 56                      	PUSH	SI
 28979 00004BAC 53                      	PUSH	BX
 28980                                  	;;; 15/02/2024
 28981 00004BAD FF36[EE0A]              	push	word [ROOTCLUST_HW]
 28982                                  	;;;

 28996 00004BC9 7203                    	JC	short GO_Chk_end1 	;fastopen not installed, or wrong drive.

 29017                                  	;;;
 29018 00004BD3 5B                      	POP	BX
 29019 00004BD4 5E                      	POP	SI
 29020 00004BD5 8F44FF                  	POP	word [SI-1]
 29021 00004BD8 59                      	POP	CX
 29022 00004BD9 5F                      	POP	DI
 29023 00004BDA 07                      	POP	ES
 29024 00004BDB 730D                    	JNC	short GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER ; crack based on cur dir
 29025                                  
 29026                                  ; DOS 3.3  6/25/86
 29027                                  ;
 29028                                  ; We must cract the path beginning at the root. Advance pointer to beginning
 29029                                  ; of path and go crack from root.
 29030                                  
 29031                                  NO_CURR_D:
 29032 00004BDD 8B36[B205]              	MOV	SI,[WFP_START]
 29033                                  	;LEA	SI,[SI+3]		; Skip "d:/"
 29034                                  	; 15/02/2024
 29035 00004BE1 83C603                  	add	si,3
 29036 00004BE4 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; Get ES:BP
 29037 00004BE8 EB3B                    	JMP	short ROOTPATH
 29038                                  
 29039                                  ; We are able to crack from the current directory part. Go set up for search
 29040                                  ; of specified cluster.
 29041                                  
 29042                                  GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER:
 29043 00004BEA C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; Get ES:BP
 29044 00004BEE E87CFD                  	call	SETDIRSRCH
 29045                                  	;JC	short SETFERR
 29046                                  	;JMP	short FINDPATH
 29047                                  	; 16/12/2022
 29048 00004BF1 7342                    	jnc	short FINDPATH ; 17/08/2018
 29049                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 29050                                  	;JC	short SETFERR
 29051                                  	;JMP	short FINDPATH
 29052                                  SETFERR:
 29053 00004BF3 30C9                    	XOR	CL,CL			; set zero
 29054 00004BF5 F9                      	STC
 29055 00004BF6 C3                      	retn
 29056                                  
 29057                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29058                                  ;
 29059                                  ; Procedure Name : ChkDev
 29060                                  ;
 29061                                  ; Check to see if the name at DS:DI is a device. Returns carry set if not a
 29062                                  ;   device.
 29063                                  ; Blasts CX,SI,DI,AX,BX
 29064                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29065                                  
 29066                                  CHKDEV:
 29067 00004BF7 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 29068 00004BF9 8CD7                    	MOV	DI,SS
 29069 00004BFB 8EC7                    	MOV	ES,DI
 29070                                  
 29071 00004BFD BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 29072 00004C00 B90900                  	MOV	CX,9
 29073                                  TESTLOOP:
 29074 00004C03 E8BF11                  	call	GETLET
 29075                                  
 29076 00004C06 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'
 29077 00004C08 740E                    	JZ	short TESTDEVICE
 29078 00004C0A E80C12                  	call	PATHCHRCMP
 29079 00004C0D 7407                    	JZ	short NOTDEV
 29080 00004C0F 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 29081 00004C11 7405                    	JZ	short TESTDEVICE
 29082                                  
 29083 00004C13 AA                      	STOSB
 29084 00004C14 E2ED                    	LOOP	TESTLOOP
 29085                                  NOTDEV:
 29086 00004C16 F9                      	STC
 29087 00004C17 C3                      	retn
 29088                                  
 29089                                  TESTDEVICE:
 29090                                  	;ADD	CX,2
 29091                                  	; 24/09/2023
 29092 00004C18 41                      	inc	cx
 29093 00004C19 41                      	inc	cx
 29094 00004C1A B020                    	MOV	AL,' '
 29095 00004C1C F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 29096 00004C1E 8CD0                    	MOV	AX,SS
 29097 00004C20 8ED8                    	MOV	DS,AX
 29098                                  	;call	DEVNAME
 29099                                  	;retn
 29100                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29101 00004C22 E9CC01                  	jmp	DEVNAME
 29102                                  
 29103                                  ;Break	<ROOTPATH, FINDPATH -- PARSE A PATH>
 29104                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29105                                  ;
 29106                                  ; Procedure Name : ROOTPATH,FINDPATH
 29107                                  ;
 29108                                  ; Inputs:
 29109                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but,
 29110                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path which is assumed to start at
 29111                                  ;		the root (no leading '/').
 29112                                  ; Function:
 29113                                  ;	Search from root for path
 29114                                  ; Outputs:
 29115                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but:
 29116                                  ;	If root directory specified, [CURBUF] and [NAME1] are NOT set, and
 29117                                  ;	[NoSetDir] is ignored.
 29118                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29119                                  
 29120                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 29121                                  	; DOSCODE:7F47h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 29122                                  
 29123                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 29124                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8C9Dh
 29125                                  
 29126                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:7F82h)
 29127                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:829Eh)
 29128                                  
 29129                                  ROOTPATH:
 29130 00004C25 E871FD                  	call	SETROOTSRCH
 29131                                  	; 24/09/2023
 29132 00004C28 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 29133                                  	;CMP	BYTE [SI],0
 29134 00004C2A 3824                    	cmp	[si],ah ; 0
 29135 00004C2C 7507                    	JNZ	short FINDPATH
 29136                                  
 29137                                  	;;;
 29138                                  	;; 15/02/2024
 29139                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:82A6h
 29140                                  	;mov	word [CURBUF],0FFFFh
 29141                                  	;;;
 29142                                  
 29143                                  ; Root dir specified
 29144 00004C2E A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 29145 00004C31 A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 29146                                  	; 24/09/2023
 29147                                  	;XOR	AH,AH			; Sets "device ID" byte, sets zero
 29148                                  					; (dir), clears carry.
 29149 00004C34 C3                      	retn
 29150                                  
 29151                                  ; Inputs:
 29152                                  ;	[ATTRIB] Set to get through directories
 29153                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Set to find last element
 29154                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 29155                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path (no leading '/').
 29156                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] = 0
 29157                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = Phys sec # of first sector of directory
 29158                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Cluster # of next cluster
 29159                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors per cluster
 29160                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 29161                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 29162                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 29163                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 29164                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 29165                                  ;	[CREATING] and [DELALL] set
 29166                                  ; Function:
 29167                                  ;	Parse path name
 29168                                  ; Outputs:
 29169                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 29170                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 29171                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 29172                                  ;	[THISDPB] = ES:BP
 29173                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 29174                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 29175                                  ;	   Zero set
 29176                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 29177                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 29178                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 29179                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 29180                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 29181                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 29182                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 29183                                  ;	   Zero reset
 29184                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path
 29185                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 29186                                  ;	ELSE
 29187                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 29188                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 29189                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points to fcb_FIRCLUS field for entry
 29190                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 29191                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 29192                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 29193                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 29194                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 29195                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 29196                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 29197                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it,
 29198                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 29199                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 29200                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 29201                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 29202                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 29203                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 29204                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 29205                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 29206                                  ; Destroys all other registers
 29207                                  
 29208                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 29209                                  	; DOSCODE:7F58h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 29210                                  
 29211                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 29212                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8CAEh
 29213                                  
 29214                                      	;entry	FINDPATH
 29215                                  FINDPATH:
 29216 00004C35 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 29217 00004C36 56                      	PUSH	SI
 29218 00004C37 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 29219 00004C39 8B0E[C205]              	MOV	CX,[DIRSTART]		; Get start clus of dir being searched
 29220 00004C3D 833E[B605]FF            	CMP	word [CURR_DIR_END],-1
 29221 00004C42 7415                    	JZ	short NOIDS		; No current dir part
 29222 00004C44 3B3E[B605]              	CMP	DI,[CURR_DIR_END]
 29223 00004C48 750F                    	JNZ	short NOIDS		; Not to current dir end yet
 29224 00004C4A C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 29225                                  	;;;
 29226                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 29227 00004C4E A1[DC0A]                	mov	ax,[DIRSTART_HW]
 29228                                  	;mov	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 29229 00004C51 2689454B                	mov	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],ax
 29230                                  	;;;
 29231                                  	;mov	[es:di+73],cx
 29232 00004C55 26894D49                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],CX	; Set current directory cluster
 29233                                  NOIDS:
 29234                                  
 29235                                  ; Parse the name off of DS:SI into NAME1. AL = 1 if there was a meta
 29236                                  ; character in the string. CX,DI may be destroyed.
 29237                                  ;
 29238                                  ;	invoke	NAMETRANS
 29239                                  ;	MOV	CL,AL
 29240                                  ;
 29241                                  ; The above is the slow method. The name has *already* been munged by
 29242                                  ; TransPath so no special casing needs to be done. All we do is try to copy
 29243                                  ; the name until ., \ or 0 is hit.
 29244                                  
 29245                                  	;MOV	AX,SS
 29246                                  	;MOV	ES,AX
 29247                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 29248 00004C59 16                      	push	ss
 29249 00004C5A 07                      	pop	es
 29250                                  
 29251                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 29252 00004C5B BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 29253 00004C5E B82020                  	MOV	AX,'  ' ; 2020h
 29254 00004C61 AA                      	STOSB
 29255 00004C62 AB                      	STOSW
 29256 00004C63 AB                      	STOSW
 29257 00004C64 AB                      	STOSW
 29258 00004C65 AB                      	STOSW
 29259 00004C66 AB                      	STOSW
 29260                                  
 29261                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 29262 00004C67 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 29263 00004C6A 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; bits for CL
 29264                                  GetNam:
 29265                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29266                                  	;INC	CL ; ?*! ; MSDOS 6.0	;AN000; KK increment volid count
 29267                                  
 29268                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 29269                                  	; 16/12/2022
 29270                                  	;inc	cl ; not required !	
 29271                                  	
 29272 00004C6C AC                      	LODSB
 29273 00004C6D 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'	; 2Eh
 29274 00004C6F 7412                    	JZ	short _SetExt
 29275 00004C71 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 29276 00004C73 7424                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29277 00004C75 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 29278 00004C77 7420                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29279 00004C79 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'	; 3Fh
 29280 00004C7B 7503                    	JNZ	short StoNam
 29281 00004C7D 80CC01                  	OR	AH,1
 29282                                  StoNam: 
 29283 00004C80 AA                      	STOSB
 29284 00004C81 EBE9                    	JMP	short GetNam
 29285                                  _SetExt:
 29286 00004C83 BF[5305]                	MOV	DI,NAME1+8
 29287                                  GetExt:
 29288 00004C86 AC                      	LODSB
 29289 00004C87 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 29290 00004C89 740E                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29291 00004C8B 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'
 29292 00004C8D 740A                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29293 00004C8F 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'
 29294 00004C91 7503                    	JNZ	short StoExt
 29295 00004C93 80CC01                  	OR	AH,1
 29296                                  StoExt: 
 29297 00004C96 AA                      	STOSB
 29298 00004C97 EBED                    	JMP	short GetExt
 29299                                  _GetDone:
 29300 00004C99 4E                      	DEC	SI
 29301 00004C9A 88E1                    	MOV	CL,AH  ; 0 or 1 ; 29/12/2022
 29302 00004C9C 80C980                  	OR	CL,80H
 29303 00004C9F 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of this element
 29304 00004CA0 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 29305 00004CA1 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 29306 00004CA3 7503                    	JNZ	short check_device
 29307 00004CA5 E9F000                  	JMP	_BADPATH		; NUL parse (two delims most likely)
 29308                                  check_device:
 29309 00004CA8 56                      	PUSH	SI			; Start of next element
 29310                                  	;MOV	AL,[SI]
 29311                                  	; 15/02/2024
 29312 00004CA9 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 29313                                  	; 23/09/2023
 29314                                  	;cmp	byte [si],0
 29315 00004CAB 7508                    	JNZ	short NOT_LAST
 29316                                  
 29317                                  ; for last element of the path switch to the correct search attributes
 29318                                  
 29319 00004CAD 8A3E[6D05]              	MOV	BH,[SATTRIB]
 29320 00004CB1 883E[6B05]              	MOV	[ATTRIB],BH
 29321                                  
 29322                                  NOT_LAST:
 29323                                  
 29324                                  ; check name1 to see if we have a device...
 29325                                  
 29326 00004CB5 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 29327                                  
 29328                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 29329                                  	;context ES
 29330 00004CB6 16                      	push	ss
 29331 00004CB7 07                      	pop	es
 29332 00004CB8 E83601                  	call	DEVNAME 		; blast BX
 29333 00004CBB 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 29334 00004CBC 720B                    	JC	short FindFile		; Not a device
 29335 00004CBE 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL			; Test next char again
 29336 00004CC0 7403                    	JZ	short GO_BDEV
 29337 00004CC2 E9D700                  	JMP	FILEINPATH		; Device name in middle of path
 29338                                  
 29339                                  GO_BDEV:
 29340 00004CC5 5E                      	POP	SI			; Points to NUL at end of path
 29341 00004CC6 E97EFE                  	JMP	Build_devJ
 29342                                  
 29343                                  FindFile:
 29344                                  ;;;; 7/28/86
 29345 00004CC9 803E[4B05]E5            	CMP	BYTE [NAME1],0E5H	; if 1st char = E5
 29346 00004CCE 7505                    	JNZ	short NOE5		; no
 29347 00004CD0 C606[4B05]05            	MOV	BYTE [NAME1],05H	; change it to 05
 29348                                  NOE5:
 29349                                  ;;;; 7/28/86
 29350 00004CD5 57                      	PUSH	DI			; Start of this element
 29351 00004CD6 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 29352 00004CD7 51                      	PUSH	CX			; CL return from NameTrans
 29353                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 29354                                  
 29355 00004CD8 E8B502                  	CALL	LookupPath		; call fastopen to get dir entry
 29356 00004CDB 7303                    	JNC	short DIR_FOUND		; found dir entry
 29357                                  
 29358                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 29359 00004CDD E86FFA                  	call	FINDENTRY
 29360                                  DIR_FOUND:
 29361 00004CE0 59                      	POP	CX
 29362 00004CE1 07                      	POP	ES
 29363 00004CE2 5F                      	POP	DI
 29364 00004CE3 7303                    	JNC	short LOAD_BUF
 29365 00004CE5 E9D900                  	JMP	BADPATHPOP
 29366                                  
 29367                                  LOAD_BUF:
 29368 00004CE8 C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 29369                                  	;test	byte [bx+0Bh],10h
 29370 00004CEC F6470B10                	TEST	BYTE [BX+dir_entry.dir_attr],attr_directory
 29371 00004CF0 7503                    	JNZ	short GO_NEXT 		; DOS 3.3
 29372 00004CF2 E9A700                  	JMP	FILEINPATH		; Error or end of path
 29373                                  
 29374                                  ; if we are not setting the directory, then check for end of string
 29375                                  
 29376                                  GO_NEXT:
 29377                                  ;hkn; SS override
 29378 00004CF5 36803E[4C03]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:NoSetDir],0
 29379 00004CFB 7423                    	JZ	short SetDir
 29380 00004CFD 89FA                    	MOV	DX,DI			; Save pointer to entry
 29381 00004CFF 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS
 29382                                  
 29383                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 29384                                  	;context DS
 29385 00004D01 16                      	push	ss
 29386 00004D02 1F                      	pop	ds
 29387 00004D03 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of next element
 29388                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29389                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29390 00004D04 F606[4611]01            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],FastOpen_Set ;only DOSOPEN can take advantage of
 29391 00004D09 740B                    	JZ	short _nofast			; the FastOpen
 29392 00004D0B F606[4611]02            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success ; Lookup just happened
 29393 00004D10 7404                    	JZ	short _nofast			; no
 29394 00004D12 8B3E[9C0D]              	MOV	DI,[Next_Element_Start]	; no need to insert it again
 29395                                  _nofast:
 29396 00004D16 803D00                  	CMP	BYTE [DI],0
 29397                                  	;;JNZ	short NEXT_ONE		; DOS 3.3
 29398                                  	;;JMP	_SETRET  ; retn		; Got it
 29399                                  	;retn	; 05/09/2018
 29400                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 29401                                  	;jmp	_SETRET
 29402                                  	; 16/12/2022
 29403 00004D19 7431                    	jz	short _SETRET
 29404                                  
 29405                                  NEXT_ONE:
 29406 00004D1B 57                      	PUSH	DI			; Put start of next element back on stack
 29407 00004D1C 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 29408 00004D1E 8ED9                    	MOV	DS,CX			; Get back pointer to entry
 29409                                  SetDir:
 29410                                  	;;;
 29411                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 29412 00004D20 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx ; 0
 29413                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],dx
 29414 00004D22 2639560F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],dx ; 0
 29415 00004D26 7503                    	jnz     short SetDir2 ; not FAT32
 29416 00004D28 8B54FA                  	mov     dx,[si-6]		; dir_entry.dir_fclus_hi
 29417                                  SetDir2:
 29418 00004D2B 368916[EE0A]            	mov	[ss:ROOTCLUST_HW],dx
 29419                                  	;;;
 29420 00004D30 8B14                    	MOV	DX,[SI] 		; dir_entry.dir_first
 29421                                  
 29422                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 29423 00004D32 1E                      	PUSH	DS		      ; save [curbuf+2]
 29424                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 29425 00004D33 16                      	push	ss
 29426 00004D34 1F                      	pop	ds		      ; set DS Dosgroup
 29427                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],2
 29428 00004D35 F606[4611]02            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success
 29429 00004D3A 7411                    	JZ	short DO_NORMAL	      ; fastopen not in memory or path not
 29430 00004D3C 89D3                    	MOV	BX,DX		      ; not found
 29431 00004D3E 8B3E[BC05]              	MOV	DI,[CLUSNUM]	      ; clusnum was set in LookupPath
 29432 00004D42 50                      	PUSH	AX		      ; save device id (AH)

 29434 00004D46 58                      	POP	AX		      ; restore device id (AH)
 29435 00004D47 83C402                  	ADD	SP,2		      ; pop ds in stack
 29436 00004D4A EB36                    	JMP	short FAST_OPEN_SKIP
 29437                                  
 29438                                  	; 16/12/2022
 29439                                  _SETRET:
 29440 00004D4C C3                      	retn

 29640                                  ;
 29641                                  ; Inputs:
 29642                                  ;	DS,ES:DOSDATA

 29644                                  ;	ATTRIB set so that we can error out if looking for Volume IDs
 29645                                  ; Function:
 29646                                  ;	Determine if file is in list of I/O drivers
 29647                                  ; Outputs:
 29648                                  ;	Carry set if not a device
 29649                                  ;	ELSE

 29729                                  ;

 29800                                  ;Break	<ValidateCDS - given a CDS, validate the media and the current directory>
 29801                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 29803                                  ;   ValidateCDS - Get current CDS. Splice it. Call FatReadCDS to check
 29804                                  ;   media. If media has been changed, do DOS_Chdir to validate path.

 29998                                  ; 28/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 29999                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - offset 43BDh
 30000                                  
 30001                                  ;Break	<CheckThisDevice - Check for being a device>
 30002                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30003                                  ;
 30004                                  ;   CheckThisDevice - Examine the area at DS:SI to see if there is a valid
 30005                                  ;   device specified. We will return carry if there is a device present. 
 30006                                  ;   The forms of devices we will recognize are:
 30007                                  ;
 30008                                  ;	[path]device
 30009                                  ;
 30010                                  ;   Note that the drive letter has *already* been removed. All other forms
 30011                                  ;   are not considered to be devices. If such a device is found we change
 30012                                  ;   the source pointer to point to the device component.
 30013                                  ;
 30014                                  ;   Inputs:	ES is DOSDATA
 30015                                  ;		DS:SI contains name
 30016                                  ;   Outputs:	ES is DOSDATA
 30017                                  ;		DS:SI point to name or device
 30018                                  ;		Carry flag set if device was found
 30019                                  ;		Carry flag reset otherwise
 30020                                  ;   Registers Modified: all except ES:DI, DS
 30021                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30022                                  
 30023                                  CheckThisDevice:
 30024 00004F4B 57                      	push	di
 30025 00004F4C 56                      	push	si
 30026 00004F4D 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 30027                                  
 30028                                  ; Check for presence of \dev\ (Dam multiplan!)
 30029                                  
 30030 00004F4F 8A04                    	MOV	AL,[SI]
 30031 00004F51 E8C50E                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; is it a path char?
 30032 00004F54 7517                    	JNZ	short ParseDev		; no, go attempt to parse device
 30033 00004F56 46                      	INC	SI			; simulate LODSB
 30034                                  
 30035                                  ; We have the leading path separator. Look for DEV part.
 30036                                  
 30037 00004F57 AD                      	LODSW
 30038 00004F58 0D2020                  	OR	AX,2020h
 30039 00004F5B 3D6465                  	cmp	ax,"de"
 30040                                  	;CMP	AX,"e"<< 8 + "d"
 30041 00004F5E 752D                    	JNZ	short NotDevice		; not "de", assume not device
 30042 00004F60 AC                      	LODSB
 30043 00004F61 0C20                    	OR	AL,20h
 30044 00004F63 3C76                    	CMP	AL,"v"                  ; Not "v", assume not device
 30045 00004F65 7526                    	JNZ	short NotDevice
 30046 00004F67 AC                      	LODSB
 30047 00004F68 E8AE0E                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; do we have the last path separator?
 30048 00004F6B 7520                    	JNZ	short NotDevice		; no. go for it.
 30049                                  
 30050                                  ; DS:SI now points to a potential drive. Preserve them as NameTrans advances
 30051                                  ; SI and DevName may destroy DS.
 30052                                  
 30053                                  ParseDev:
 30054 00004F6D 1E                      	push	ds
 30055 00004F6E 56                      	push	si			; preserve the source pointer
 30056 00004F6F E8EB0D                  	call	NameTrans		; advance DS:SI
 30057 00004F72 803C00                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0		; parse entire string?
 30058 00004F75 F9                      	STC				; simulate a Carry return from DevName
 30059 00004F76 750B                    	JNZ	short SkipSearch	; no parse. simulate a file return.
 30060                                  
 30061                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30062 00004F78 16                      	push	ss
 30063 00004F79 1F                      	pop	ds
 30064                                  
 30065                                  ; M026 - start - fix ported from ROMDOS2 for bug # 2849
 30066                                  ;
 30067                                  ; SR;
 30068                                  ; We have to set Attrib before invoking DevName. Otherwise, the value from
 30069                                  ; a previous DOS call is used and DevName thinks it is not a device if the
 30070                                  ; old call set the volume attribute bit.
 30071                                  
 30072 00004F7A A0[6D05]                	mov	al,[SATTRIB]
 30073 00004F7D A2[6B05]                	mov	[ATTRIB],al		;set Attrib for DevName
 30074                                  
 30075                                  ; M026 - end
 30076                                  
 30077 00004F80 E86EFE                  	call	DEVNAME
 30078                                  
 30079                                  SkipSearch:
 30080 00004F83 5E                      	pop	si
 30081 00004F84 1F                      	pop	ds
 30082                                  
 30083                                  ; SI points to the beginning of the potential device. If we have a device
 30084                                  ; then we do not change SI. If we have a file, then we reset SI back to the
 30085                                  ; original value. At this point Carry set indicates FILE.
 30086                                  
 30087                                  CheckReturn:
 30088 00004F85 5F                      	pop	di			; get original SI
 30089 00004F86 7302                    	JNC	short Check_Done	; if device then do not reset pointer
 30090 00004F88 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 30091                                  Check_Done:
 30092 00004F8A 5F                      	pop	di
 30093 00004F8B F5                      	CMC				; invert carry. Carry => device
 30094 00004F8C C3                      	retn
 30095                                  NotDevice:
 30096 00004F8D F9                      	STC
 30097 00004F8E EBF5                    	JMP	short CheckReturn

 30468                                  ;Break	<IOFUNC -- DO FUNCTION 1-12 I/O>
 30469                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30470                                  ;
 30471                                  ; Procedure Name : IOFUNC
 30472                                  ;
 30473                                  ; Inputs:
 30474                                  ;	DS:SI Points to SFT
 30475                                  ;	AH is function code
 30476                                  ;		= 0 Input
 30477                                  ;		= 1 Input Status
 30478                                  ;		= 2 Output
 30479                                  ;		= 3 Output Status
 30480                                  ;		= 4 Flush
 30481                                  ;		= 5 Input Status - System WAIT invoked for K09 if no char
 30482                                  ;				   present.
 30483                                  ;	AL = character if output
 30484                                  ; Function:
 30485                                  ;	Perform indicated I/O to device or file
 30486                                  ; Outputs:
 30487                                  ;	AL is character if input
 30488                                  ;	If a status call
 30489                                  ;		zero set if not ready
 30490                                  ;		zero reset if ready (character in AL for input status)
 30491                                  ; For regular files:
 30492                                  ;	Input Status
 30493                                  ;		Gets character but restores position
 30494                                  ;		Zero set on EOF
 30495                                  ;	Input
 30496                                  ;		Gets character advances position
 30497                                  ;		Returns ^Z on EOF
 30498                                  ;	Output Status
 30499                                  ;		Always ready
 30500                                  ; AX altered, all other registers preserved
 30501                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30502                                  
 30503                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 30771                                  
 30772                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30773                                  ;**	Dev_Open_SFT - Open the Device for an SFT
 30774                                  ;
 30775                                  ;	Dev_Open_SFT issues an open call to the device associated with
 30776                                  ;	the SFT.
 30777                                  ;
 30778                                  ;	ENTRY	(ES:DI) = SFT
 30779                                  ;	EXIT	none
 30780                                  ;	USES	all
 30781                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30782                                  
 30783                                  DEV_OPEN_SFT:
 30784 00005238 06                      	push	es ; * (MSDOS 6.21)
 30785 00005239 E81CB2                  	call	save_world
 30786                                  	;mov	al,0Dh	
 30787 0000523C B00D                    	MOV	AL,DEVOPN
 30788 0000523E EB06                    	JMP	SHORT DO_OPCLS
 30789                                  
 30790                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30791                                  ; Procedure Name : DEV_CLOSE_SFT
 30792                                  ;
 30793                                  ; Inputs:
 30794                                  ;	ES:DI Points to SFT
 30795                                  ; Function:
 30796                                  ;	Issue a CLOSE call to the correct device
 30797                                  ; Outputs:
 30798                                  ;	None
 30799                                  ; ALL preserved
 30800                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30801                                  
 30802                                  DEV_CLOSE_SFT:
 30803 00005240 06                      	push	es ; * (MSDOS 6.21)
 30804 00005241 E814B2                  	call	save_world
 30805                                  	;mov	al,0Eh	
 30806 00005244 B00E                    	MOV	AL,DEVCLS
 30807                                  
 30808                                  	; Main entry for device open and close. AL contains the function 
 30809                                  	; requested. Subtlety: if Sharing is NOT loaded then we do NOT issue 
 30810                                  	; open/close to block devices. This allows networks to function but 
 30811                                  	; does NOT hang up with bogus change-line code.
 30812                                  
 30813                                  	;entry	DO_OPCLS
 30814                                  DO_OPCLS:
 30815                                  	; Is the SFT for the net? If so, no action necessary.
 30816                                  
 30817                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30818                                  	;test	word [es:di+5],8000h
 30819                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet
 30820 00005246 26F6450680              	test	byte [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8)
 30821 0000524B 7564                    	jnz	short OPCLS_DONE	; NOP on net SFTs
 30822 0000524D 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; Unit
 30823                                  	;test	byte [es:di+5],80h
 30824 0000524F 26F6450580              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device
 30825                                  	;les	di,[es:di+7]
 30826 00005254 26C47D07                	LES	DI,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr] ; Get DPB or device

 31151                                  	;entry	SETWRITE
 31152                                  SETWRITE:
 31153                                  
 31154                                  ; Inputs:
 31155                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer Address
 31156                                  ;	CX = Record Count
 31157                                  ;	DX = Starting Record
 31158                                  ;	AH = Media Byte
 31159                                  ;	AL = Unit Code
 31160                                  ; Function:

 31162                                  ; Output:

 31168 0000536F 50                      	PUSH	AX

 31170 00005372 36020E[FF02]            	ADD	CL,[SS:VERFLG]		; SS override
