 33850 00005A72 26C7461D0200            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 33851 00005A78 43                      	inc	bx ; 1
 33852                                  	;or	[es:bp+18h],bl
 33853 00005A79 26085E18                	or	[es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],bl ; 1	
 33854                                  	;;;
 33855                                  %endif
 33856                                  
 33857                                  ;   Scanning both forwards and backwards for a free cluster
 33858                                  ;
 33859                                  ;       (BX) = forwards scan pointer
 33860                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 33861                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 33862                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file
 33863                                  
 33864                                  FINDFRE:
 33865                                  %if 0
 33866                                          INC     BX
 33867                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 33868                                          CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 33869                                  	ja	short ads7	; at end of disk
 33870                                          call	UNPACK          ; check out this cluster
 33871                                          jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 33872                                          jnz	short FINDFRE	; not free, keep on truckin
 33873                                  
 33874                                  ;   Have found a free cluster. Chain it to the file
 33875                                  ;
 33876                                  ;       (BX) = found free cluster #
 33877                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 33878                                  
 33879                                  	;;mov	[es:bp+1Ch],bx
 33880                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1Dh],bx ; MSDOS 6.0
 33881                                          mov	[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],bx ; next time start search here
 33882                                          xchg    ax,dx           ; save (dx) in ax
 33883                                          mov     dx,1            ; mark this free guy as "1"
 33884                                  	call	PACK            ; set special "temporary" mark
 33885                                          jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 33886                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 33887                                          ;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 33888                                  	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 33889                                          JZ	short NO_ALLOC	; No
 33890                                  	;;dec	word [es:bp+1Eh]
 33891                                          ;dec	word [es:bp+1Fh] ; MSDOS 6.0
 33892                                          DEC     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Reduce free count by 1
 33893                                  NO_ALLOC:
 33894                                          xchg    ax,dx           ; (dx) = current last cluster in file
 33895                                          XCHG    BX,DX
 33896                                          MOV     AX,DX
 33897                                  	call	PACK            ; link free cluster onto file
 33898                                                                  ;  CAVEAT.. On Nul file, first pass stuffs
 33899                                                                  ;    cluster 0 with FIRCLUS value.
 33900                                          jc	short ads4	; FAT error [INTERR?]

 33903                                          LOOP    FINDFRE         ; alloc more if needed
 33904                                  %else

 34078                                  ;   2 whole bytes. Hope its worth it...

 34092                                          jc	short figrec_retn

 34108                                  ads_ret:
 34109 00005B5C C3                      	retn
 34110                                  ads14:
 34111 00005B5D E8B207                  	call	UNPACK		; Get first cluster allocated for return
 34112 00005B60 72FA                    	jc	short ads_ret
 34113 00005B62 E87200                  	call    RESTFATBYT      ; Restore correct cluster 0 value
 34114 00005B65 72F5                    	jc	short ads_ret
 34115 00005B67 50                      	push	ax
 34116 00005B68 A1[EC0A]                	mov	ax,[CCONTENT_HW]
 34117 00005B6B 8706[E80A]              	xchg	ax,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 34118 00005B6F 87DF                    	xchg	bx,di		; CLUSTNUM_HW:DI = last cluster in file upon our entry
 34119 00005B71 09F8                    	or	ax,di
 34120 00005B73 58                      	pop	ax
 34121 00005B74 75E6                    	jnz	short ads_ret	; we were extending an existing file
 34122                                  	;;;
 34123                                  %endif
 34124                                  
 34125                                  ;   We were doing the first allocation for a new file. Update the SFT cluster
 34126                                  ;   info
 34127                                  dofastk:
 34128                                  ; 27/02/2024
 34129                                  %if 0
 34130                                  	; 20/05/2019
 34131                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34132                                  	;push	dx ; * MSDOS 6.0
 34133                                  	;;mov	dl,[es:bp+0]
 34134                                  	;;MOV	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]	; get drive #
 34135                                  	;mov	dl,[es:bp]
 34136                                  
 34137                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34138                                  	; DOSCODE:8DF9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34139                                  	
 34140                                  	; 16/12/2022
 34141                                  	;push	dx ; *
 34142                                  	;mov	dl,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] 
 34143                                  	; 15/12/2022
 34144                                  	;mov	dl,[es:bp]
 34145                                  
 34146                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 34147                                  	PUSH	ES
 34148                                  	LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 34149                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Bh],bx
 34150                                  	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_firclus],BX
 34151                                  	;;mov	[es:di+1Bh],bx ; MSDOS 3.3
 34152                                  	;mov	[es:di+35h],bx ; MSDOS 6.0
 34153                                  	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_lstclus],BX
 34154                                  	POP	ES
 34155                                  	;retn
 34156                                  
 34157                                  	;pop	dx ; * MSDOS 6.0
 34158                                  
 34159                                  	; 16/12/2022
 34160                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34161                                  	;pop	dx ; *
 34162                                  %else
 34163                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34164                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34165                                  	;;;
 34166 00005B76 52                      	push	dx
 34167 00005B77 06                      	push	es
 34168 00005B78 C43E[9E05]              	les	di,[THISSFT]
 34169 00005B7C 8B16[E80A]              	mov	dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 34170 00005B80 26895D2B                	mov	[es:di+2Bh],bx	; [es:di+SF_ENTRYT.sf_chain]
 34171                                  				; 32 bit first cluster, lw
 34172 00005B84 2689552D                	mov	[es:di+2Dh],dx	; [es:di+SF_ENTRYT.sf_chain+2]
 34173                                  				; 32 bit first cluster, hw
 34174 00005B88 26895D35                	mov	[es:di+35h],bx	; [es:di+SF_ENTRYT.sf_lstclus]
 34175                                  				; 32 bit last cluster, lw
 34176 00005B8C 26895537                	mov	[es:di+37h],dx	; [es:di+SF_ENTRYT.sf_lstclus+2]
 34177                                  				; 32 bit last cluster, hw
 34178 00005B90 07                      	pop	es
 34179 00005B91 5A                      	pop	dx
 34180                                  	;;;
 34181                                  %endif	
 34182                                  
 34183 00005B92 C3                      	retn
 34184                                  
 34185                                  ;** we're at the end of the disk, and not satisfied. See if we've scanned ALL
 34186                                  ;   of the disk...
 34187                                  
 34188                                  ; 27/02/2024
 34189                                  %if 0
 34190                                  ads7:
 34191                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Dh],2   
 34192                                  	cmp	word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 34193                                  	jnz	short ads1	; start scan from front of disk
 34194                                  %else	
 34195                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34196                                  	;;;
 34197                                  ads15:
 34198                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 34199 00005B93 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0
 34200 00005B98 7407                    	jz	short ads16 ; FAT32
 34201                                  	; FAT
 34202                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Dh],2
 34203 00005B9A 26837E1D02              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 34204 00005B9F EB0C                    	jmp	short ads17
 34205                                  ads16:
 34206                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+3Bh],0
 34207 00005BA1 26837E3B00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE+2],0
 34208                                  	;jnz	short ads17
 34209 00005BA6 7507                    	jnz	short ads19 ; 27/02/2024
 34210                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+39h],2
 34211 00005BA8 26837E3902              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE],2
 34212                                  ads17:
 34213 00005BAD 7403                    	jz	short ads18
 34214                                  ads19:
 34215 00005BAF E9AAFE                  	jmp	ads2		; start scan from front of disk
 34216                                  	;;;
 34217                                  %endif
 34218                                  
 34219                                  ;   Sorry, we've gone over the whole disk, with insufficient luck. Lets give
 34220                                  ;   the space back to the free list and tell the caller how much he could have
 34221                                  ;   had.  We have to make sure we remove the "special mark" we put on the last
 34222                                  ;   cluster we were able to allocate, so it doesn't become orphaned.
 34223                                  ;
 34224                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 34225                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file (before call to ALLOCATE)
 34226                                  ;       (TOS+1) = # of clusters wanted to allocate
 34227                                  
 34228                                  ads18:		; 27/02/2024
 34229 00005BB2 5B                              POP     BX              ; (BX) = last cluster of file
 34230 00005BB3 BAFFFF                          MOV     DX,0FFFFH
 34231                                  
 34232                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34233                                  	;;;
 34234 00005BB6 8916[EA0A]              	mov	[CLUSDATA_HW],dx
 34235 00005BBA 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 34236                                  	;;;
 34237                                  
 34238 00005BBE E84400                  	call	RELBLKS         ; give back any clusters just alloced
 34239 00005BC1 58                              POP     AX              ; No. of clusters requested
 34240                                                                  ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 34241                                                                  ;   Alloc failed, so proceed with return CX
 34242                                                                  ;   setup.
 34243                                  	;;;	; 27/02/2024
 34244 00005BC2 8F06[F20A]              	pop	word [CLUSTERS_HW]
 34245                                  	;;;
 34246                                  
 34247 00005BC6 29C8                            SUB     AX,CX           ; AX=No. of clusters allocated
 34248                                  
 34249                                  	;;;	; 27/02/2024
 34250 00005BC8 831E[F20A]00            	sbb	word [CLUSTERS_HW],0
 34251                                  	;;;
 34252                                  
 34253 00005BCD E80700                  	call	RESTFATBYT      ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 34254                                                                  ;   Alloc failed.
 34255                                  Disk_Full_Return:               ;label added for magic patch 8-6-92 scottq
 34256                                          ; MSDOS 6.0
 34257 00005BD0 C606[0B06]01            	MOV	byte [DISK_FULL],1 ;MS. indicating disk full
 34258 00005BD5 F9                              STC
 34259 00005BD6 C3                              retn
 34260                                  
 34261                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 34262                                  ;
 34263                                  ; Procedure Name : RESTFATBYT
 34264                                  ;
 34265                                  ; SEE ALLOCATE CAVEAT
 34266                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 34267                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 34268                                  
 34269                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34270                                  
 34271                                  RESTFATBYT:
 34272 00005BD7 53                              PUSH    BX
 34273 00005BD8 52                              PUSH    DX
 34274 00005BD9 57                              PUSH    DI
 34275                                  
 34276 00005BDA 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 34277                                  
 34278                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34279                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34280                                  	;;;
 34281                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 34282                                  	;push	word [CLUSDATA_HW]
 34283                                  	;push	word [CCONTENT_HW]  ; (not necessary ?)
 34284 00005BDC 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0
 34285 00005BE0 8B16[E40A]              	mov	dx,[FATBYT_HW]
 34286 00005BE4 8916[EA0A]              	mov	[CLUSDATA_HW],dx
 34287                                  	;;;
 34288                                  
 34289 00005BE8 8B16[9605]                      MOV     DX,[FATBYT]
 34290                                  
 34291 00005BEC E8D107                  	call	PACK
 34292                                  
 34293                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34294                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34295                                  	;;;
 34296 00005BEF 8F06[EC0A]              	pop	word [CCONTENT_HW]
 34297 00005BF3 8F06[EA0A]              	pop	word [CLUSDATA_HW]
 34298 00005BF7 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 34299                                  	;;;
 34300                                  
 34301 00005BFB 5F                              POP     DI
 34302 00005BFC 5A                              POP     DX
 34303 00005BFD 5B                              POP     BX
 34304                                  
 34305                                  ; 16/12/2022
 34306                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34307                                  ;RELEASE_flush:
 34308 00005BFE C3                      	retn
 34309                                  
 34310                                  ;Break	<RELEASE -- DEASSIGN DISK SPACE>
 34311                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34312                                  ;
 34313                                  ; Procedure Name : RELEASE
 34314                                  ;
 34315                                  ; Inputs:
 34316                                  ;       BX = Cluster in file
 34317                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 34318                                  ; Function:
 34319                                  ;       Frees cluster chain starting with [BX]
 34320                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 34321                                  ; AX,BX,DX,DI all destroyed. Other registers unchanged.
 34322                                  ;
 34323                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34324                                  
 34325                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34326                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D13h
 34327                                  
 34328                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8E86h)
 34329                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C27Fh)
 34330                                  
 34331                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34332                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34333                                  RELEASE:
 34334 00005BFF 31D2                            XOR     DX,DX
 34335                                  	
 34336                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34337                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34338                                  	;;;
 34339 00005C01 8916[EA0A]              	mov	[CLUSDATA_HW],dx ; (dx = 0, release)
 34340                                  	;;;
 34341                                  
 34342                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D19h
 34343                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8E88h)
 34344                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C285h)
 34345                                  
 34346                                  	;entry	RELBLKS
 34347                                  RELBLKS:
 34348                                  
 34349                                  ;   Enter here with DX=0FFFFH to put an end-of-file mark in the first cluster
 34350                                  ;   and free the rest in the chain.
 34351                                  
 34352 00005C05 E80A07                  	call	UNPACK
 34353                                  	;jc	short RELEASE_flush
 34354                                  	;jz	short RELEASE_flush
 34355                                  	; 28/12/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34356 00005C08 7652                            jbe	short RET12 ; jna short RET12
 34357                                  				; CCONTENT_HW:DI= Content of FAT
 34358                                   				; for given cluster (next cluster)
 34359 00005C0A 89F8                    	MOV     AX,DI
 34360 00005C0C 52                              PUSH    DX
 34361                                  
 34362                                  	;;; 28/12/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34363                                  	;push	ax
 34364                                  	;;;
 34365                                  
 34366 00005C0D E8B007                  	call	PACK
 34367                                  
 34368                                  	;;; 28/12/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34369                                  	;pop	ax
 34370 00005C10 8B16[EC0A]              	mov	dx,[CCONTENT_HW]
 34371 00005C14 8916[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],dx ; next cluster (hw) to be released
 34372 00005C18 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax		 ; next cluster (lw) to be released
 34373                                  	;;;
 34374                                          
 34375 00005C1A 5A                      	POP     DX
 34376                                  	;jc	short RELEASE_flush
 34377                                  	; 28/12/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34378 00005C1B 723F                    	jc	short RET12
 34379                                          
 34380 00005C1D 09D2                    	OR      DX,DX
 34381 00005C1F 751F                            JNZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; Was putting EOF mark
 34382                                  
 34383                                  ; 28/02/2024
 34384                                  %if 0
 34385                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 34386                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 34387                                  	CMP     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 34388                                          JZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; No
 34389                                          INC	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 34390                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 34391                                          MOV     BX,AX
 34392                                          dec     ax              ; check for "1"
 34393                                  	jz	short RELEASE_flush	; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 34394                                  %else
 34395                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34396                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34397                                  	;;;
 34398 00005C21 3B16[EA0A]              	cmp	dx,[CLUSDATA_HW]	; > 0 ? (delete, release)
 34399 00005C25 7519                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC	; no, EOF (allocate, -1), (dx = 0)
 34400                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh
 34401 00005C27 26837E1FFF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 34402                                  					; Free count valid?
 34403 00005C2C 7412                    	jz	short NO_DEALLOC	; No (dx = 0)
 34404                                  relblks_ifc:
 34405                                  	;inc	word ptr es:[bp+1Fh]
 34406 00005C2E 26FF461F                	inc	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 34407 00005C32 7519                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2
 34408                                  
 34409                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],dx
 34410 00005C34 2639560F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],dx
 34411 00005C38 7513                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2	; not FAT32
 34412                                  
 34413                                  	;inc	word [es:bp+21h]
 34414 00005C3A 26FF4621                	inc	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2]
 34415 00005C3E EB0D                    	jmp	short NO_DEALLOC2
 34416                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 34417                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],dx
 34418 00005C40 2639560F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],dx	; dx is -1 or 0
 34419                                  					; (valid 16 bit fat size is another number)
 34420 00005C44 7507                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2 ; FAT (FAT16 or FAT12)
 34421                                  					; dx = 0, FAT32
 34422                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh
 34423 00005C46 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2],0FFFFh
 34424 00005C4B 75E1                    	jnz	short relblks_ifc
 34425                                  NO_DEALLOC2:
 34426 00005C4D 833E[E80A]00            	cmp	word [CLUSTNUM_HW],0
 34427 00005C52 7503                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC3
 34428 00005C54 48                      	dec	ax			; check for "1"	
 34429 00005C55 7405                    	jz	short RET12		; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 34430                                  NO_DEALLOC3:
 34431                                  	;;;
 34432                                  %endif
 34433                                  
 34434 00005C57 E88F06                  	call	IsEOF
 34435 00005C5A 72A3                            JB	short RELEASE	; Carry clear if JMP not taken
 34436                                  
 34437                                  	; 16/12/2022
 34438                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34439                                  ; 28/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34440                                  %if 0
 34441                                  RELEASE_flush:
 34442                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34443                                  	mov	al,[es:bp]
 34444                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 34445                                  	push	si		; FLUSHBUF may trash these and we guarantee
 34446                                  	push	cx		;  them to be preserved.
 34447                                  	push	es
 34448                                  	push	bp
 34449                                  	call	FLUSHBUF	; commit buffers for this drive
 34450                                  	pop	bp
 34451                                  	pop	es
 34452                                  	pop	cx
 34453                                  	pop	si
 34454                                  %endif		; 28/02/2024
 34455                                  
 34456                                  RET12:
 34457 00005C5C C3                      	retn
 34458                                  
 34459                                  ;Break	<GETEOF -- Find the end of a file>
 34460                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34461                                  ;
 34462                                  ; Procedure Name : GETEOF
 34463                                  ;
 34464                                  ; Inputs:
 34465                                  ;       ES:BP Points to DPB
 34466                                  ;       BX = Cluster in a file
 34467                                  ;       DS = CS
 34468                                  ; Outputs:
 34469                                  ;       BX = Last cluster in the file
 34470                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 34471                                  ; DI destroyed. No other registers affected.
 34472                                  ;
 34473                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34474                                  
 34475                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34476                                  %if 0
 34477                                  GETEOF:
 34478                                  	call	UNPACK
 34479                                          jc	short RET12
 34480                                          PUSH    BX
 34481                                          MOV     BX,DI
 34482                                  	call	IsEOF
 34483                                          POP     BX
 34484                                          JAE     short RET12
 34485                                          MOV     BX,DI
 34486                                          JMP     short GETEOF
 34487                                  %else
 34488                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34489                                  	;;;
 34490                                  GETEOF4:	; **
 34491 00005C5D 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 34492                                  GETEOF1:
 34493 00005C61 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 34494 00005C63 8916[F20A]              	mov	[CLUSTERS_HW],dx ; CLUSTERS_HW:DI = Cluster Count
 34495 00005C67 58                      	pop	ax
 34496 00005C68 5A                      	pop	dx
 34497 00005C69 C3                      	retn
 34498                                  
 34499                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D7Ch
 34500                                  GETEOF:
 34501 00005C6A 52                      	push	dx
 34502 00005C6B 50                      	push	ax
 34503 00005C6C 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx ; 0	; cluster count = 0
 34504 00005C6E 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
 34505                                  GETEOF2:
 34506 00005C70 E89F06                  	call	UNPACK
 34507 00005C73 72EC                    	jc	short GETEOF1
 34508                                  		; CCONTENT_HW:DI = next cluster (cluster content)
 34509 00005C75 40                      	inc	ax
 34510 00005C76 7501                    	jnz	short GETEOF3
 34511 00005C78 42                      	inc	dx
 34512                                  GETEOF3:
 34513 00005C79 FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 34514 00005C7D 53                      	push    bx
 34515                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 34516 00005C7E 8B1E[EC0A]              	mov	bx,[CCONTENT_HW]
 34517 00005C82 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 34518 00005C86 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 34519 00005C88 E85E06                  	call	IsEOF
 34520                                  	;pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 34521 00005C8B 5B                      	pop	bx
 34522                                  	;jae	short GETEOF1   ; EOF
 34523 00005C8C 73CF                    	jae	short GETEOF4 ; ** ; 28/02/2024
 34524                                  	;mov	bx,[CCONTENT_HW] ; not EOF
 34525                                  	;mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 34526 00005C8E 5B                      	pop	bx	; * ; 28/02/2024
 34527 00005C8F 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 34528 00005C91 EBDD                    	jmp	short GETEOF2   ; get next cluster
 34529                                  	;;;
 34530                                  %endif

 34542                                  ;**	FCB.ASM - Low level routines for parsing names into FCBs and analyzing
 34543                                  ;		  filename characters
 34544                                  ;
 34545                                  ;	MakeFcb
 34546                                  ;	NameTrans
 34547                                  ;	PATHCHRCMP
 34548                                  ;	GetLet
 34549                                  ;	UCase
 34550                                  ;	GetLet3
 34551                                  ;	GetCharType
 34552                                  ;	TESTKANJ
 34553                                  ;	NORMSCAN
 34554                                  ;	DELIM
 34555                                  ;
 34556                                  ;	Revision history:
 34557                                  ;
 34558                                  ;		A000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 34559                                  ;	
 34560                                  ;	M048 - access FILE_UCASE_TAB using DS rather than SS.
 34561                                  
 34562                                  TableLook	EQU	-1
 34563                                  
 34564                                  SCANSEPARATOR	EQU	1
 34565                                  DRVBIT		EQU	2
 34566                                  NAMBIT		EQU	4
 34567                                  EXTBIT		EQU	8
 34568                                  
 34569                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34570                                  ;
 34571                                  ; Procedure : MakeFcb
 34572                                  ;
 34573                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34574                                  
 34575                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34576                                  	; DOSCODE:8E77h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34577                                  
 34578                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34579                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9DB0h
 34580                                  
 34581                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8ED3h)
 34582                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:8D92h)
 34583                                  
 34584                                  MAKEFCB:
 34585                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34586                                  	;MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0
 34587 00005C93 30D2                    	XOR	DL,DL		; Flag--not ambiguous file name
 34588                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34589 00005C95 368816[4E03]            	mov	[ss:SpaceFlag],dl ; 0
 34590                                  	;test	al,2
 34591 00005C9A A802                    	test	AL,DRVBIT	; Use current drive field if default?

 34593                                  	;MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0	; No - use default drive

 34635 00005CE3 760F                    	JBE	short BADDRV	; Drive letter out of range

 34639 00005CE9 58                      	POP	AX
 34640 00005CEA 730A                    	JNC	short HAVDRV
 34641

 34752                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34753                                  ;
 34754                                  ; Procedure Name : NameTrans
 34755                                  ;
 34756                                  ; NameTrans is used by FindPath to scan off an element of a path. We must
 34757                                  ; allow spaces in pathnames
 34758                                  ;
 34759                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI points to start of path element
 34760                                  ;   Outputs:	Name1 has unpacked name, uppercased
 34761                                  ;		ES = DOSGroup
 34762                                  ;		DS:SI advanced after name
 34763                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AX,DX,CX
 34764                                  ;
 34765                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34766                                  
 34767                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34768                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34769                                  
 34770                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34771                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9E7Ch
 34772                                  
 34773                                  NameTrans:
 34774                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34775 00005D5D 36C606[4E03]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],1
 34776 00005D63 16                      	push	ss
 34777 00005D64 07                      	pop	es
 34778                                  
 34779                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 34780 00005D65 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 34781 00005D68 57                      	PUSH	DI
 34782                                  
 34783                                  ; 29/02/2024
 34784                                  %if 0
 34785                                  	MOV	AX,'  '	; 2020h
 34786                                  	MOV	CX,5
 34787                                  	STOSB
 34788                                  	REP	STOSW		; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 34789                                  	XOR	AL,AL		; Set stuff for NORMSCAN
 34790                                  	MOV	DL,AL
 34791                                  %else
 34792                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34793                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34794                                  	;;;
 34795 00005D69 B020                    	mov     al, 20h ; ' '
 34796 00005D6B B90B00                  	mov     cx, 11
 34797 00005D6E F3AA                    	rep stosb               ; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 34798 00005D70 91                      	xchg    ax, cx
 34799 00005D71 99                      	cwd
 34800                                  	;;;
 34801                                  %endif
 34802                                  
 34803 00005D72 AA                      	STOSB
 34804 00005D73 5F                      	POP	DI
 34805                                  
 34806 00005D74 E884FF                  	CALL	NORMSCAN
 34807                                  
 34808                                  ;hkn; SS override for NAME1
 34809 00005D77 36803E[4B05]E5          	CMP	byte [SS:NAME1],0E5H
 34810 00005D7D 75DD                    	jnz	short scanb_retn
 34811 00005D7F 36C606[4B05]05          	MOV	byte [SS:NAME1],5 ; Magic name translation
 34812 00005D85 C3                      	retn

 34818                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)

 34820                                  ;If TableLook
 34821                                  
 34822                                  ;hkn; Table	SEGMENT
 34823                                  ;	PUBLIC	CharType
 34824                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34825                                  
 34826                                  ; Character type table for file name scanning
 34827                                  ; Table provides a mapping of characters to validity bits.
 34828                                  ; Four bits are provided for each character. Values 7Dh and above
 34829                                  ; have all bits set, so that part of the table is chopped off, and
 34830                                  ; the translation routine is responsible for screening these values.
 34831                                  ; The bit values are defined in DOSSYM.INC
 34832                                  
 34833                                  ;	      ; ^A and NUL
 34834                                  ;CharType:
 34835                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34836                                  ;	      ; ^C and ^B
 34837                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34838                                  ;	      ; ^E and ^D
 34839                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34840                                  ;	      ; ^G and ^F
 34841                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34842                                  ;	      ; TAB and BS
 34843                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34844                                  ;	      ; ^K and ^J
 34845                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34846                                  ;	      ; ^M and ^L
 34847                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34848                                  ;	      ; ^O and ^N
 34849                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34850                                  ;	      ; ^Q and ^P
 34851                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34852                                  ;	      ; ^S and ^R
 34853                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34854                                  ;	      ; ^U and ^T
 34855                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34856                                  ;	      ; ^W and ^V
 34857                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34858                                  ;	      ; ^Y and ^X
 34859                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34860                                  ;	      ; ESC and ^Z
 34861                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34862                                  ;	      ; ^] and ^;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34864                                  ;	      ; ^_ and ^^
 34865                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34866                                  ;	      ; ! and SPACE
 34867                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK)
 34868                                  ;	      ; # and "
 34869                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK)
 34870                                  ;	      ; $ - )
 34871                                  ;	 db   3 dup (0FFh)
 34872                                  ;	      ; + and *
 34873                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 34874                                  ;	      ; - and '
 34875                                  ;	 db   NOT (FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM)
 34876                                  ;	      ; / and .
 34877                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34878                                  ;	      ; 0 - 9
 34879                                  ;	 db   5 dup (0FFh)
 34880                                  ;	      ; ; and :
 34881                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 34882                                  ;	      ; = and <
 34883                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 34884                                  ;	      ; ? and >
 34885                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 34886                                  ;	      ; A - Z
 34887                                  ;	 db   13 dup (0FFh)
 34888                                  ;	      ; \ and [
 34889                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 34890                                  ;	      ; ^ and ]
 34891                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34892                                  ;	      ; _ - {
 34893                                  ;	 db   15 dup (0FFh)
 34894                                  ;	      ; } and |
 34895                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 34896                                  
 34897                                  ;CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2	; This is the value of the last
 34898                                  ;					; character in the table
 34899                                  
 34900                                  ;FCHK	equ 1		; normal name char, no chks needed
 34901                                  ;FDELIM	equ 2		; is a delimiter
 34902                                  ;FSPCHK	equ 4		; set if character is not a space or equivalent
 34903                                  ;FFCB	equ 8		; is valid in an FCB

 34961                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34962                                  ; DOSCODE:9011h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34963                                  
 34964                                  ; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34965                                  ; DOSCODE:8FB5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34966                                  
 34967                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34968                                  ;
 34969                                  ; Procedure Names : GetLet, UCase, GetLet3
 34970                                  ;
 34971                                  ; These routines take a character, convert it to upper case, and check
 34972                                  ; for delimiters.  Three different entry points:
 34973                                  ;	GetLet -  DS:[SI] = character to convert
 34974                                  ;	UCase  -  AL = character to convert
 34975                                  ;	GetLet3 - AL = character
 34976                                  ;		  [BX] = translation table to use
 34977                                  ;
 34978                                  ;	Exit (in all cases) : AL = upper case character
 34979                                  ;			      CY set if char is control char other than TAB
 34980                                  ;			      ZF set if char is a delimiter
 34981                                  ;	Uses : AX, flags
 34982                                  ;
 34983                                  ; NOTE: This routine exists in a fast table lookup version, and a slow
 34984                                  ; inline version.  Return with carry set is only possible in the inline
 34985                                  ; version. The table lookup version is the one in use.
 34986                                  ;
 34987                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34988                                  
 34989                                  ; This entry point has character at [SI]
 34990

 35003 00005DC7 BB[7E0B]                	MOV	BX,FILE_UCASE_TAB+2

 35006

 35020

 35024                                  	; preserve it.

 35039                                  
 35040                                  	; M048 - End

 35043                                  
 35044                                  ;If TableLook

 35060 00005DE8 58                      	POP	AX
 35061                                  
 35062 00005DE9 5B                      	POP	BX
 35063 00005DEA C3                      	RETN

 35177                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35178                                  ;
 35179                                  ;  GetCharType - return flag bits indicating character type
 35180                                  ;	Bits are defined in DOSSYM.INC. Uses lookup table
 35181                                  ;	defined above at label CharType.
 35182                                  ;
 35183                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to return type flags for
 35184                                  ;	Exit  : AL = type flags
 35185                                  ;	Uses  : AL, flags
 35186                                  ;
 35187                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35188                                  
 35189                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35190                                  
 35191                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35192                                  
 35193                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35194                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35195                                  
 35196                                  GetCharType:
 35197                                  	;cmp	al,7Eh
 35198 00005DFE 3C7E                    	cmp	al,CharType_last 	; beyond end of table?
 35199 00005E00 7314                    	jae	short gct_90		; return standard value
 35200                                  
 35201 00005E02 53                      	push	bx
 35202 00005E03 BB[865D]                	mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 35203 00005E06 D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; adjust for half-byte table entry size
 35204                                  	;xlat	cs:[bx] 		; get flags
 35205 00005E08 2ED7                    	cs	xlat	
 35206 00005E0A 5B                      	pop	bx
 35207                                  
 35208                                  ; carry clear from previous shift means we want the low nibble.  Otherwise
 35209                                  ; we have to shift the flags down to the low nibble
 35210                                  
 35211 00005E0B 7306                    	jnc	short gct_80		; carry clear, no shift needed
 35212                                  
 35213                                  ; 29/02/2024
 35214                                  %if 0
 35215                                  	shr	al,1			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 35216                                  	shr	al,1
 35217                                  	shr	al,1
 35218                                  	shr	al,1
 35219                                  %else
 35220                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35221                                  	;;;
 35222 00005E0D 51                      	push	cx
 35223 00005E0E B104                    	mov	cl,4			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 35224 00005E10 D2E8                    	shr	al,cl
 35225 00005E12 59                      	pop	cx
 35226                                  	;;;
 35227                                  %endif
 35228                                  
 35229                                  gct_80:
 35230 00005E13 240F                    	and	al,0Fh			; clear the unused nibble
 35231 00005E15 C3                      	retn
 35232                                  gct_90:
 35233 00005E16 B00F                    	mov	al,0Fh			; set all flags
 35234 00005E18 C3                      	retn

 35289                                  ; 	M011: NEC's 8086 clone chip uses Intel's undocumented bit number in

 35500                                  ;
 35501                                  ; Procedure Name : SpoolInt
 35502                                  ;
 35503                                  ; SpoolInt - signal processes that the DOS is truly idle. We are allowed to
 35504                                  ; do this ONLY if we are working on a 1-12 system call AND if we are not in
 35505                                  ; the middle of an INT 24.
 35506                                  ;
 35507                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35508                                  
 35509                                  SPOOLINT:
 35510 00005EB3 9C                      	PUSHF
 35511                                  	; 15/03/2018
 35512 00005EB4 36803E[5803]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:IDLEINT],0	; SS override
 35513 00005EBA 7423                    	JZ	SHORT POPFRET
 35514 00005EBC 36803E[2003]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE],0
 35515 00005EC2 751B                    	JNZ	SHORT POPFRET		; No spool ints in error mode
 35516                                  
 35517                                  	; 30/07/2018
 35518                                  
 35519                                  	; Note that we are going to allow an external program to issue system 
 35520                                  	; calls at this time. We MUST preserve IdleInt across this.
 35521                                  
 35522 00005EC4 36FF36[5803]            	PUSH	WORD [SS:IDLEINT]
 35523                                  
 35524                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35525                                   
 35526                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35527 00005EC9 36803E[660D]00          	cmp	byte [SS:DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 35528 00005ECF 7504                    	jne	short do_low_int28	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 35529 00005ED1 CD28                    	INT	int_spooler  ; int 28h	; N: Execute user int 28 handler
 35530 00005ED3 EB05                    	jmp	short spool_ret_addr
 35531                                  
 35532                                  do_low_int28:
 35533                                  	;call	far [ss:LowInt28Addr]
 35534 00005ED5 2EFF1E[2E5E]            	call	far [cs:LowInt28Addr]	; 05/05/2019
 35535

 35672                                  	; !! NOTE: FALL THROUGH !!
 35673                                  
 35674                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35675                                  ;
 35676                                  ; Procedure Name : CNTHAND ( CTRLC_C HANDLER )
 35677                                  ;
 35678                                  ; "^C" and CR/LF is printed. Then the user registers are restored and the
 35679                                  ; user CTRL-C handler is executed. At this point the top of the stack has 1)
 35680                                  ; the interrupt return address should the user CTRL-C handler wish to allow
 35681                                  ; processing to continue; 2) the original interrupt return address to the code
 35682                                  ; that performed the function call in the first place. If the user CTRL-C
 35683                                  ; handler wishes to continue, it must leave all registers unchanged and RET
 35684                                  ; (not IRET) with carry CLEAR. If carry is SET then an terminate system call
 35685                                  ; is simulated.
 35686                                  ;
 35687                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35688                                  
 35689                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 35690                                  
 35691                                  CNTCHAND:
 35692                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; SS override
 35693                                  					; AN002; from RAWOUT
 35694                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],CTRL_BREAK_FLAG  
 35695                                  	;JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35696                                  
 35697                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35698                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:91C4h, 29/12/2022)
 35699 00005F6E 36F606[1206]02          	TEST	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(CTRL_BREAK_FLAG>>8)  ; 2 
 35700 00005F74 7508                    	JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35701                                  
 35702 00005F76 B003                            MOV     AL,3			; Display "^C"
 35703 00005F78 E848BD                          CALL	BUFOUT
 35704 00005F7B E8DFBB                          CALL	CRLF
 35705                                  around_deadlock:
 35706 00005F7E 16                              PUSH    SS
 35707 00005F7F 1F                              POP     DS
 35708 00005F80 803E[5703]00                    CMP     BYTE [CONSWAP],0
 35709 00005F85 7403                            JZ      SHORT NOSWAP

 35725                                  	;;int	23h	; DOS - CONTROL "C" EXIT ADDRESS
 35726                                  			; Return: return via RETF 2 with CF set
 35727                                  			; DOS will abort program with errorlevel 0
 35728                                  			; else
 35729                                  			; interrupted DOS call continues
 35730                                  
 35731                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 35733

 35735

 35743                                  	;;;

 35745                                  	;;;

 35748                                  	; User SP has changed because of push. Adjust for it

 35750

 35753 00005FBB 7505                    	jne	short do_low_int23	; Y: the int must be done from low mem

 35767                                  ; The user has returned to us. The circumstances we allow are:
 35768                                  ;
 35769                                  ;   IRET	We retry the operation by redispatching the system call
 35770                                  ;   CLC/RETF	POP the stack and retry
 35771                                  ;   ... 	Exit the current process with ^C exit

 36042                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErr
 36043                                  ;
 36044                                  ; Hard disk error handler. Entry conditions:
 36045                                  ;	DS:BX = Original disk transfer address
 36046                                  ;	DX = Original logical sector number
 36047                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors to go (first one gave the error)
 36048                                  ;	AX = Hardware error code

 36386                                  
 36387                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36388                                  ;
 36389                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 36390                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 36391                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 36392                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 36393                                  ;
 36394                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 36395                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 36396                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 36397                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 36398                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 36399                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 36400                                  ;
 36401                                  ; output:   none.
 36402                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36403                                  
 36404                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 36405                                  	
 36406                                  reset_environment:
 36407                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36408                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 588Ah 
 36409                                  
 36410                                  ;***	invoke	Reset_Version		; AN007 ;MS. reset version number
 36411                                  
 36412 00006220 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save PDB of process
 36413                                  
 36414                                  	; There are no critical sections in force. Although we may enter
 36415                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 36416                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.
 36417                                  
 36418 00006221 B482                    	MOV	AH,82h
 36419                                  		; Microsoft Networks - END DOS CRITICAL SECTIONS 0 THROUGH 7
 36420                                  	;int	2Ah 	
 36421 00006223 CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM
 36422                                  
 36423                                  					; SS override
 36424 00006225 36C606[5903]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:fAborting],-1	; signal abort in progress
 36425                                  
 36426                                  					; DOS 4.00 doesn't need it
 36427                                  	;CallInstall NetResetEnvironment, MultNET, 34  
 36428                                  					; Allow REDIR to clear some stuff
 36429                                  					; On process exit.
 36430 0000622B B82211                  	mov	ax, 1122h
 36431 0000622E CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - PROCESS TERMINATION HOOK
 36432                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 36433                                  	;mov	al,22h	
 36434 00006230 B022                    	MOV	AL,int_terminate
 36435 00006232 E82CAD                  	call	_$GET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR	; and who to go to
 36436                                  
 36437 00006235 59                      	POP	CX			; get ThisPDB
 36438 00006236 06                      	push	es
 36439 00006237 53                      	push	bx			; save return address
 36440                                  
 36441 00006238 368B1E[3003]            	MOV	BX,[SS:CurrentPDB] 	; get currentPDB
 36442 0000623D 8EDB                    	MOV	DS,BX
 36443 0000623F A11600                  	MOV	AX,[PDB.PARENT_PID]	; get parentPDB
 36444                                  
 36445                                  	; AX = parentPDB, BX = CurrentPDB, CX = ThisPDB
 36446                                  	; Only free handles if AX <> BX and BX = CX and [exit_code].upper
 36447                                  	; is not Exit_keep_process
 36448

 36452 00006248 7514                    	JNZ	short reset_return	; CurrentPDB <> ThisPDB

 36454                                  
 36455                                  					; SS override
 36456                                  	;cmp	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 36457 0000624B 36803E[7C05]03          	CMP	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS ; 15/08/2018
 36458 00006251 7406                    	JZ	short reset_to_parent 	; keeping this process
 36459                                  
 36460                                  	; We are truly removing a process. Free all allocation blocks
 36461                                  	; belonging to this PDB
 36462                                  
 36463                                  	;invoke	arena_free_process
 36464 00006253 E87910                  	call	arena_free_process
 36465                                  
 36466                                  	; Kill off remainder of this process. Close file handles and signal
 36467                                  	; to relevant network folks that this process is dead. Remember that
 36468                                  	; CurrentPDB is STILL the current process!
 36469                                  
 36470                                  	;invoke	DOS_ABORT
 36471 00006256 E85BD4                  	call	DOS_ABORT
 36472                                  
 36473                                  reset_to_parent:
 36474                                  					; SS override
 36475 00006259 368F06[3003]            	POP	word [SS:CurrentPDB]	; set up process as parent
 36476                                  
 36477                                  reset_return:				; come here for normal return
 36478                                  	;Context DS			; DS is used to refer to DOSDATA
 36479 0000625E 16                      	push	ss
 36480 0000625F 1F                      	pop	ds	
 36481                                  
 36482 00006260 B0FF                    	MOV	AL,-1
 36483                                  
 36484                                  	; make sure that everything is clean In this case ignore any errors,
 36485                                  	; we cannot "FAIL" the abort, the program being aborted is dead.
 36486                                  
 36487                                  	;EnterCrit critDisk
 36488 00006262 E87CB6                  	call	ECritDisk
 36489                                  	;invoke	FLUSHBUF
 36490 00006265 E85F08                  	call	FLUSHBUF
 36491                                  	;LeaveCrit critDisk
 36492 00006268 E8A3B6                  	call	LCritDisk
 36493                                  
 36494                                  ; 29/02/2024 - Retrto DOS v5.0
 36495                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36496                                  %if 0
 36497                                  	; Decrement open ref. count if we had done a virtual open earlier.
 36498                                  
 36499                                  	call	CHECK_VIRT_OPEN
 36500                                  %endif
 36501                                  
 36502 0000626B FA                      	CLI
 36503 0000626C C606[2103]00            	MOV	BYTE [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 36504                                  
 36505                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36506                                  	;;;
 36507 00006271 C606[B812]00            	mov	byte [INDOS_FLAG],0
 36508                                  	;;;
 36509                                  
 36510 00006276 C606[2203]FF            	MOV	BYTE [WPERR],-1		; Forget about WP error
 36511 0000627B C606[5903]00            	MOV	byte [fAborting],0	; let aborts occur
 36512 00006280 8F06[8005]              	POP	WORD [EXITHOLD]
 36513 00006284 8F06[8205]              	POP	WORD [EXITHOLD+2]
 36514                                  
 36515                                  	; Snake into multitasking... Get stack from CurrentPDB person
 36516

 36518 0000628C 8E163000                	MOV	SS,[PDB.USER_STACK+2]
 36519 00006290 8B262E00                	MOV	SP,[PDB.USER_STACK]
 36520                                  
 36521 00006294 E8AAA1                  	call	restore_world
 36522                                  
 36523                                  	; 05/05/2019
 36524 00006297 07                      	pop	es ; * ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:94A8h, MSDOS.SYS)
 36525                                  
 36526                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36527 00006298 50                      	push	ax			; set up ds, but save ds in TEMPSEG
 36528 00006299 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds			; and not on stack.
 36529                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 36530 0000629B 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg] 
 36531 000062A0 A3[630D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax
 36532 000062A3 58                      	pop	ax
 36533                                  					; set up ds to DOSDATA
 36534                                  	;MOV	[CS:USER_SP],AX ; MSDOS 3.3
 36535 000062A4 A3[8405]                	mov	[USER_SP],ax
 36536                                  
 36537 000062A7 58                      	POP	AX			; suck off CS:IP of interrupt...
 36538 000062A8 58                      	POP	AX
 36539 000062A9 58                      	POP	AX
 36540                                  
 36541                                  ; M011 : BEGIN
 36542                                  
 36543                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36544                                  ;	MOV	AX,0F202h	; STI
 36545                                  
 36546                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36547 000062AA 9F                      	LAHF
 36548 000062AB 86E0                    	XCHG	AH,AL
 36549 000062AD 2402                    	AND	AL,2
 36550 000062AF B4F2                    	MOV	AH,0F2h
 36551                                  
 36552                                  ; M011 : END
 36553                                  
 36554                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36555 000062B1 50                      	PUSH	AX
 36556                                   
 36557                                  	;PUSH	word [CS:EXITHOLD+2]
 36558                                  	;PUSH	word [CS:EXITHOLD]
 36559                                  	
 36560                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36561 000062B2 FF36[8205]              	PUSH	word [EXITHOLD+2]
 36562 000062B6 FF36[8005]              	PUSH	word [EXITHOLD]
 36563                                  
 36564                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:USER_SP]
 36565                                  
 36566                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36567 000062BA A1[8405]                	MOV	AX,[USER_SP]
 36568 000062BD 8E1E[630D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]	; restore ds
 36569                                  
 36570 000062C1 CF                      	IRET			; Long return back to user terminate address
 36571                                  
 36572                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36573                                  ;
 36574                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 36575                                  ;
 36576                                  ; This routine handles extended error codes.
 36577                                  ; Input : DI = error code from device
 36578                                  ; Output: All EXTERR fields are set
 36579                                  ;
 36580                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36581                                  
 36582                                  SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR:
 36583 000062C2 50                      	PUSH	AX
 36584                                  					; ErrMap24End is in DOSDATA
 36585 000062C3 B8[BB0E]                	MOV	AX,ErrMap24End
 36586 000062C6 2D[AB0E]                	SUB	AX,ErrMap24
 36587                                  					; Change to dosdata to access
 36588                                  					; ErrMap24 and EXTERR -SR
 36589                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36590                                  	
 36591                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36592 000062C9 1E                      	push	ds
 36593                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds ->dosdata
 36594 000062CA 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 36595                                  
 36596                                  	; AX is the index of the first unavailable error. Do not translate
 36597                                  	; if greater or equal to AX.
 36598                                  
 36599 000062CF 39C7                    	CMP	DI,AX
 36600 000062D1 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI
 36601 000062D3 7306                    	JAE	short NoTrans
 36602                                  
 36603                                  	;MOV	AL,[CS:DI+ErrMap24]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 36604 000062D5 8A85[AB0E]              	mov	al,[ErrMap24+di] ; MSDOS 6.0
 36605 000062D9 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 36606                                  NoTrans:
 36607                                  	;MOV	[CS:EXTERR],AX
 36608 000062DB A3[2403]                	mov	[EXTERR],AX
 36609 000062DE 1F                      	pop	ds
 36610                                  	;assume	ds:nothing
 36611 000062DF 58                      	POP	AX
 36612                                  
 36613                                  	; Now Extended error is set correctly. Translate it to get correct
 36614                                  	; error locus class and recommended action.
 36615                                  
 36616 000062E0 56                      	PUSH	SI
 36617                                  					; ERR_TABLE_24 is in DOSCODE 
 36618 000062E1 BE[5B0E]                	MOV	SI,ERR_TABLE_24
 36619 000062E4 E8C6A3                  	call	CAL_LK			; Set other extended error fields
 36620 000062E7 5E                      	POP	SI
 36621 000062E8 C3                      	retn
