 36623                                  ;============================================================================
 36624                                  ; FAT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 36625                                  ;============================================================================
 36626                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36627                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36628                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36629                                  
 36630                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 36631                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 36632                                  
 36633                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 36634                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36635                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 36636                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 36637                                  ;
 36638                                  ;	IsEof
 36639                                  ;	UNPACK
 36640                                  ;	PACK
 36641                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 36642                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 36643                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 36644                                  ;	FAT_operation
 36645                                  ;
 36646                                  ;	Revision history:
 36647                                  ;
 36648                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 36649                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 36650                                  ;
 36651                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 36652                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 36653                                  
 36654                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36655                                  
 36656                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36657                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A40Ch
 36658                                  
 36659                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 36660                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36661                                  ;
 36662                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 36663                                  ;
 36664                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 36665                                  ;
 36666                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 36667                                  ;		BX has fat value
 36668                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 36669                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 36670                                  ;
 36671                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36672                                  
 36673                                  IsEOF:
 36674                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36675                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36676                                  	;;;
 36677 000062E9 E89901                  	call	IsFAT32			; is it FAT32 drive ?
 36678 000062EC 730D                    	jnc	short IsEOF_FAT		; no, it has 12 or 16 bit FAT
 36679                                  
 36680                                  	; FAT32 fs
 36681 000062EE 36813E[E80A]FF0F        	cmp	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW],0FFFh
 36682 000062F5 7503                    	jnz     short IsEOF_other1	; not EOF
 36683 000062F7 83FBF8                  	cmp     bx,0FFF8h		; 32 bit compare
 36684                                  IsEOF_other1:
 36685 000062FA C3                      	retn 				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36686                                  
 36687                                  IsEOF_FAT:
 36688                                  	;;;
 36689                                  
 36690                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 36691 000062FB 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 36692 00006301 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 36693                                  
 36694                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 36695                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 36696                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 36697                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 36698                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 36699                                  
 36700 00006303 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 36701 00006307 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 36702                                  
 36703 00006309 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 36704                                  IsEOF_other:
 36705 0000630D C3                      	retn
 36706                                  EOF16:
 36707 0000630E 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 36708 00006311 C3                      	retn				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36709                                  
 36710                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36711                                  
 36712                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36713                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36714                                  ;
 36715                                  ; Procedure Name : UNPACK
 36716                                  ;
 36717                                  ; Inputs:
 36718                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36719                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 36720                                  ; Outputs:
 36721                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36722                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 36723                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36724                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 36725                                  ;
 36726                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 36727                                  ;
 36728                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36729                                  
 36730                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36731                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A44Eh
 36732                                  	;
 36733                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS .SYS - DOSCODE:9511h)
 36734                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C368h)
 36735                                  
 36736                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36737                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36738                                  
 36739                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36740                                  UNPACK:
 36741                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 36742 00006312 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 36743 00006314 7519                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 36744                                  
 36745                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36746                                  %if 0
 36747                                  	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 36748                                  	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0
 36749                                  	retn				; done
 36750                                  %else
 36751                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A435h
 36752                                  	;;;
 36753                                  up_1:
 36754 00006316 391E[E80A]              	cmp	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0
 36755 0000631A 7513                    	jne	short up_cont
 36756 0000631C 8B3E[3B0F]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY_HW]
 36757 00006320 09FF                    	or	di,di
 36758 00006322 893E[EC0A]              	mov	[CCONTENT_HW],di
 36759 00006326 8B3E[8100]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]
 36760 0000632A 7502                    	jnz	short unpack_retn
 36761 0000632C 09FF                    	or	di,di
 36762                                  unpack_retn:
 36763 0000632E C3                      	retn	; [CCONTENT_HW]:DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 36764                                  	;;;	
 36765                                  
 36766                                  %endif
 36767                                  
 36768                                  up_cont:				; M014 - End
 36769                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36770                                  	;;;
 36771                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 36772 0000632F 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0
 36773 00006334 7510                    	jnz	short up_fat		; not FAT32
 36774                                  	; FAT32
 36775                                  	;mov	si,[es:bp+2Fh]
 36776 00006336 268B762F                	mov	si,[es:bp+DPB.LAST_CLUSTER+2]
 36777 0000633A 3936[E80A]              	cmp	[CLUSTNUM_HW],si
 36778 0000633E 750A                    	jne	short up_2
 36779                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+2Dh]
 36780 00006340 263B5E2D                	cmp	bx,[es:bp+DPB.LAST_CLUSTER]
 36781 00006344 EB04                    	jmp	short up_2
 36782                                  up_fat:
 36783                                  	;;;
 36784                                  
 36785                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 36786                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 36787 00006346 263B5E0D                	CMP	BX,[es:bp+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 36788                                  up_2:		; 02/03/2024
 36789 0000634A 7748                    	JA	short HURTFAT
 36790 0000634C E84B01                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 36791 0000634F 7240                    	jc	short _DoContext
 36792                                  
 36793                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36794                                  	;;;
 36795 00006351 FF7502                  	push	word [di+2]		; offset CLUSSAVE+2
 36796 00006354 368F06[EC0A]            	pop	word [ss:CCONTENT_HW]	; high word of cluster number
 36797                                  	;;;
 36798                                  
 36799 00006359 8B3D                    	MOV	DI,[DI]
 36800 0000635B 7521                    	JNZ	short High12		; MZ if high 12 bits, go get 'em
 36801                                  
 36802                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36803                                  	;;;
 36804 0000635D E82501                  	call	IsFAT32
 36805 00006360 7211                    	jc	short up_fat32		; FAT32 volume (drive)
 36806 00006362 36C706[EC0A]0000        	mov	word [ss:CCONTENT_HW],0
 36807                                  	;;;
 36808                                  
 36809 00006369 268B760D                	MOV	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER] ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 36810 0000636D 81FEF60F                	CMP	SI,4096-10 ; 0FF6h
 36811 00006371 721A                    	JB	short Unpack12		; MZ No, go 'AND' off bits
 36812                                  
 36813                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36814                                  %if 0
 36815                                  	OR	DI,DI			; MZ set zero condition code, clears carry
 36816                                  	JMP	SHORT _DoContext 	; MZ go do context
 36817                                  High12:
 36818                                  	SHR	DI,1
 36819                                  	SHR	DI,1
 36820                                  	SHR	DI,1
 36821                                  	SHR	DI,1
 36822                                  %else
 36823                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36824                                  	;;;
 36825                                  up_fat32:
 36826 00006373 09FF                    	or	di,di			; set zero condition code, clears carry
 36827                                  	;mov	si,ss
 36828                                  	;mov	ds,si
 36829 00006375 16                      	push	ss
 36830 00006376 1F                      	pop	ds
 36831 00006377 7504                    	jnz	short up_retn
 36832 00006379 093E[EC0A]              	or	[CCONTENT_HW],di	; [CCONTENT_HW]:DI = 0 -> zf = 1
 36833                                  up_retn:
 36834 0000637D C3                      	retn
 36835                                  
 36836                                  High12:
 36837 0000637E 36C706[EC0A]0000        	mov	word [ss:CCONTENT_HW],0
 36838 00006385 D1EF                    	shr     di,1
 36839 00006387 D1EF                    	shr     di,1
 36840 00006389 D1EF                    	shr     di,1
 36841 0000638B D1EF                    	shr     di,1
 36842                                  	;;;
 36843                                  %endif
 36844                                  
 36845                                  Unpack12:
 36846 0000638D 81E7FF0F                	AND	DI,0FFFh		; Clears carry
 36847                                  _DoContext:
 36848 00006391 16                      	PUSH	SS
 36849 00006392 1F                      	POP	DS
 36850 00006393 C3                      	retn
 36851                                  
 36852                                  HURTFAT:
 36853                                  
 36854                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36855                                  %if 0
 36856                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],0FFFFh
 36857                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh  ; MSDOS 6.0
 36858                                  	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 36859                                  %else
 36860                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36861                                  	;;;
 36862 00006394 E84D02                  	call	chk_set_first_access
 36863                                  	;;;
 36864                                  %endif
 36865                                  
 36866 00006397 50                      	PUSH	AX
 36867 00006398 B488                    	MOV	AH,Allowed_FAIL+80h ; 88h
 36868                                  
 36869                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36870                                  %if 0
 36871                                  
 36872                                  ;hkn; SS override
 36873                                  	MOV	byte [SS:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL ; 8
 36874                                  ;
 36875                                  ; Signal Bad FAT to INT int_fatal_abort handler. We have an invalid cluster.
 36876                                  ;
 36877                                  	MOV	DI,0FFFh		; In case INT int_fatal_abort returns (it shouldn't)
 36878                                  	call	FATAL
 36879                                  %else
 36880                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36881                                  	;;;
 36882                                  	;mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],8
 36883 0000639A 36C606[4B03]08          	mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL
 36884                                  	;
 36885                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36886 000063A0 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 36887 000063A2 4F                      	dec	di	; 0FFFFh
 36888 000063A3 57                      	push	di
 36889                                  	;
 36890 000063A4 36FF36[E80A]            	push	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW] ; (necessary!?)
 36891 000063A9 53                      	push	bx	; (necessary!?)
 36892 000063AA E85DFD                  	call	FATAL
 36893 000063AD 5B                      	pop	bx
 36894 000063AE 368F06[E80A]            	pop	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36895                                  	;xor	di,di
 36896                                  	;dec	di	; 0FFFFh
 36897                                  	;mov	word [ss:CCONTENT_HW],di
 36898                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36899 000063B3 368F06[EC0A]            	pop	word [ss:CCONTENT_HW]
 36900                                  	;;;
 36901                                  %endif
 36902                                  
 36903 000063B8 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 36904 000063BA F8                      	CLC
 36905 000063BB 7501                    	JNZ	short OKU_RET 		; Try to ignore bad FAT
 36906 000063BD F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 36907                                  OKU_RET:
 36908 000063BE 58                      	POP	AX
 36909                                  hurtfat_retn:
 36910 000063BF C3                      	retn
 36911                                  
 36912                                  ; DOSCODE:9565h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36913                                  
 36914                                  ;Break	<PACK -- PACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36915                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36916                                  ;
 36917                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 36918                                  ;
 36919                                  ; Inputs:
 36920                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 36921                                  ;	DX = Data
 36922                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 36923                                  ; Outputs:
 36924                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 36925                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 36926                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36927                                  ;	No other registers affected
 36928                                  ;
 36929                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is stored in CL0FATENTRY.
 36930                                  ;
 36931                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36932                                  
 36933                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36934                                  
 36935                                  	; INPUT:
 36936                                  	;  [CLUSDATA_HW]:DX = cluster data/content
 36937                                  	;  [CLUSTNUM_HW]:BX = cluster number (to be updated)
 36938                                  	;  ES:BP = pointer to DPB
 36939                                  
 36940                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36941                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36942                                  PACK:
 36943                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - start
 36944 000063C0 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we packing cluster 0
 36945 000063C2 7513                    	jnz	short p_cont		; N: proceed with normal pack
 36946                                  
 36947                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36948                                  %if 0
 36949                                  	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx	; Y: place value in CL0FATENTRY
 36950                                  	retn				; done
 36951                                  %else
 36952                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36953                                  	;;;
 36954 000063C4 391E[E80A]              	cmp	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0

 36967                                  %endif

 36978 000063E5 59                      	POP	CX

 37003 0000640F 81E2FF0F                	AND	DX,0FFFh		; MZ store only 12 bits

 37124                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37125                                  
 37126                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37127                                  
 37128                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 37129                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37130                                  ;
 37131                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 37132                                  ;
 37133                                  ; Inputs:
 37134                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 37135                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 37136                                  ; Function:
 37137                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 37138                                  ; Outputs:
 37139                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 37140                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 37141                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 37142                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 37143                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 37144                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 37145                                  ;
 37146                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37147                                  
 37148                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37149                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37150                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37151                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37152                                  
 37153                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37154                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A5D7h
 37155                                  
 37156                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 37157                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 37158 0000649A C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 37159                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 37160 0000649F 50                      	push	ax
 37161 000064A0 53                      	push	bx
 37162 000064A1 51                      	push	cx
 37163 000064A2 52                      	push	dx
 37164                                  	; 02/03/2024
 37165                                  	;MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 37166                                  
 37167                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37168                                  	;;;
 37169                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 37170 000064A3 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx
 37171 000064A5 8B16[E80A]              	mov	dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 37172                                  	;
 37173 000064A9 52                      	push	dx ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37174                                  	;
 37175 000064AA 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 37176 000064AC E8D6FF                  	call	IsFAT32
 37177 000064AF 730E                    	jnc	short mapcl1 ; not FAT32
 37178                                  	; FAT32
 37179 000064B1 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 37180 000064B3 D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 37181 000064B5 D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 37182 000064B7 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 37183 000064B9 D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 37184 000064BB D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 37185                                  	; DI:DX:AX = 4*(DX:AX)
 37186 000064BD EB14                    	jmp	short Map16		; 32 bit FAT	
 37187                                  mapcl1:
 37188                                  	;;;
 37189                                  
 37190 000064BF 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 37191                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37192                                  	;JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 37193                                  	;SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 37194                                  	;
 37195                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37196                                  	;;;
 37197 000064C5 7304                    	jae	short mapcl2		; 16 bit FAT
 37198                                  	; 12 bit FAT
 37199 000064C7 D1EA                    	shr	dx,1
 37200 000064C9 D1D8                    	rcr     ax,1
 37201                                  mapcl2:
 37202 000064CB 01D8                    	add     ax,bx
 37203 000064CD 1316[E80A]              	adc     dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 37204 000064D1 11FF                    	adc	di,di
 37205                                  	;;;
 37206                                  Map16:	
 37207                                  
 37208                                  ; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37209                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37210                                  %if 0
 37211                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 37212                                  	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 37213                                  	
 37214                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 37215                                  	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 37216                                  	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 37217                                  %endif
 37218                                  
 37219 000064D3 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 37220                                  
 37221                                  ;IF FastDiv
 37222                                  ;
 37223                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 37224                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 37225                                  ;
 37226                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 37227                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 37228                                  ;
 37229                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 37230                                  
 37231 000064D7 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 37232 000064DB 751C                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 37233                                  
 37234                                  ; 02/04/2024
 37235                                  %if 0
 37236                                  	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 37237                                  	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 37238                                  	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 37239                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 37240                                  	;shr	al,1	
 37241                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 37242                                  	shr	di,1			; 2
 37243                                  	rcr	al,1			; 2
 37244                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 37245                                  	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 37246                                  %else
 37247                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37248                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37249                                  	;;;
 37250 000064DD 50                      	push	ax
 37251 000064DE D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 37252 000064E0 D1DA                    	rcr	dx,1
 37253 000064E2 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 37254 000064E4 88E0                    	mov	al,ah			; 9 bit shift to right
 37255 000064E6 88D4                    	mov	ah,dl
 37256 000064E8 88F2                    	mov	dl,dh
 37257 000064EA 30F6                    	xor	dh,dh
 37258 000064EC D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 37259 000064EE 10F6                    	adc	dh,dh
 37260 000064F0 87D7                    	xchg	dx,di		; DI:AX = sector contains requested cluster data
 37261 000064F2 5A                      	pop	dx
 37262 000064F3 81E2FF01                	and	dx,1FFh			; offset in sector
 37263                                  	;;;
 37264                                  %endif
 37265 000064F7 EB07                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 37266                                  
 37267                                  _DoDiv:
 37268                                  ;ENDIF
 37269                                  
 37270                                  ; 02/04/2024
 37271                                  %if 0
 37272                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 37273                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 37274                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37275                                  	mov	dx,di			; 2
 37276                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)	
 37277                                  	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 37278                                  %else
 37279                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37280                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37281                                  	;;;
 37282 000064F9 97                      	xchg	ax,di
 37283 000064FA 92                      	xchg	ax,dx
 37284 000064FB F7F1                    	div	cx
 37285 000064FD 97                      	xchg	ax,di
 37286 000064FE F7F1                    	div	cx
 37287                                  	;jmp	short DivDone
 37288                                  	;;;
 37289                                  %endif
 37290                                  
 37291                                  ;IF FastDiv
 37292                                  DivDone:
 37293                                  ;ENDIF
 37294                                  	;add	ax,[es:bp+6]
 37295 00006500 26034606                	ADD	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 37296                                  	
 37297                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37298                                  	;;;
 37299 00006504 83D700                  	adc	di,0
 37300                                  	;;;
 37301                                  
 37302 00006507 49                      	DEC	CX			; CX is sector size - 1
 37303                                  
 37304                                  	;SAVE	<AX,DX,CX>
 37305                                  
 37306                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37307                                  	;;;
 37308 00006508 57                      	push	di ; 4*
 37309                                  	;;;
 37310 00006509 50                      	push	ax ; 3*
 37311 0000650A 52                      	push	dx ; 2*
 37312 0000650B 51                      	push	cx ; 1*
 37313                                  
 37314 0000650C 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX
 37315                                  
 37316                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37317                                  	; mov [HIGH_SECTOR],di ; *!* ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 37318 0000650E 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 37319                                  	;
 37320                                  
 37321                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37322                                  	; 22/09/2023
 37323                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb  low sector #
 37324                                  	;
 37325                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 37326                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 37327                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 37328                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 37329                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 37330                                  	; 22/09/2023
 37331 00006510 E83D04                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *! ; *!* ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37332                                  
 37333                                  	;RESTORE <CX,AX,DX>		; CX is sec siz-1, AX is offset in sec
 37334 00006513 59                      	pop	cx ; 1*
 37335 00006514 58                      	pop	ax ; 2*
 37336 00006515 5A                      	pop	dx ; 3*
 37337                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37338                                  	;;;
 37339 00006516 5B                      	pop	bx ; 4*
 37340                                  	;;;
 37341                                  
 37342 00006517 725A                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 37343                                  
 37344 00006519 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 37345                                  	;;;lea	di,[si+16]
 37346                                  	;;lea	di,[si+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 37347                                  	;lea	di,[si+24] ; PCDOS 7.1	; 02/03/2024
 37348 0000651D 8D7C18                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 37349 00006520 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX
 37350 00006522 39C8                    	CMP	AX,CX
 37351 00006524 7530                    	JNZ	short MAPRET	; ds<>ss
 37352 00006526 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 37353                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 37354 00006528 16                      	push	ss
 37355 00006529 1F                      	pop	ds	
 37356 0000652A FE06[7805]              	INC	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT]
 37357 0000652E A2[8E05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE],AL
 37358 00006531 8916[9005]              	MOV	[CLUSSEC],DX
 37359                                  	
 37360                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37361                                  	;MOV	WORD [CLUSSEC+2],0      ;F.C. >32mb	;AN000;
 37362                                  	;INC	DX
 37363                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37364                                  	;;;

 37366 00006537 83C201                  	add     dx,1
 37367 0000653A 891E[9205]              	mov	word [CLUSSEC+2],bx
 37368 0000653E 11C3                    	adc	bx,ax

 37370                                  	;;;
 37371                                  
 37372                                  	; 22/09/2023
 37373                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb FAT sector <32mb ;AN000;
 37374                                  	;

 37376                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *

 37379                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *

 37381 00006540 E80D04                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *! ; *!* ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37382 00006543 722E                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 37383

 37385 00006549 8D7C18                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 37386 0000654C 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]

 37388 0000654E 16                      	push	ss
 37389 0000654F 1F                      	pop	ds

 37391                                  
 37392                                  ;hkn; CLUSSAVE is in DOSDATA
 37393 00006553 BF[8E05]                	MOV	DI,CLUSSAVE
 37394                                  MAPRET:
 37395                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37396                                  	;;;
 37397 00006556 368F06[E80A]            	pop	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW]	; (ds<>ss)
 37398                                  	;;;
 37399                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX>
 37400 0000655B 5A                      	pop	dx
 37401 0000655C 59                      	pop	cx
 37402 0000655D 5B                      	pop	bx
 37403                                  
 37404 0000655E 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; MZ allow shift to clear carry
 37405                                  
 37406                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37407                                  	;;;
 37408 00006560 E822FF                  	call	IsFAT32
 37409 00006563 720A                    	jc	short MapSet	; FAT32 fs
 37410                                  	;;;
 37411                                  
 37412 00006565 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 37413 0000656B 7302                    	JAE	short MapSet		; MZ no, set flags
 37414 0000656D 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX
 37415                                  MapSet:
 37416 0000656F A801                    	TEST	AL,1			; set zero flag if not on boundary
 37417                                  	;RESTORE <AX>
 37418 00006571 58                      	pop	ax
 37419 00006572 C3                      	retn
 37420                                  
 37421                                  MAP_POP:
 37422                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37423                                  	;;;
 37424                                  	;pop	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW]
 37425                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37426 00006573 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; (ds=ss)
 37427                                  	;;;
 37428                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX,AX>
 37429 00006577 5A                      	pop	dx
 37430 00006578 59                      	pop	cx
 37431 00006579 5B                      	pop	bx
 37432 0000657A 58                      	pop	ax
 37433                                  fatread_sft_retn: ; 17/12/2022
 37434 0000657B C3                      	retn
 37435                                  
 37436                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37437                                  ; DOSCODE:96B3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37438                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37439                                  ; DOSCODE:9657h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37440                                  
 37441                                  ; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 37443                                  
 37444                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>
 37445                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37446                                  ;
 37447                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 37448                                  ;
 37449                                  ; Inputs:
 37450                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of interest (local only,
 37451                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 37452                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 37453                                  ; Function:
 37454                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 37455                                  ;	if disk changed.
 37456                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 37457                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 37458                                  ; Outputs:
 37459                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 37460                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 37461                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 37462                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 37463                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 37464                                  ;
 37465                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37466                                  
 37467                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 37468 0000657C 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 37469                                  
 37470                                  fatread_gotdpb:	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37471                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37472                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 37473                                  	; 15/12/2022
 37474 00006580 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 37475 00006584 A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 37476 00006587 E8D7A0                  	call	GOTDPB			; Set THISDPB
 37477                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 37478                                  	; 17/12/2022
 37479 0000658A E99C00                  	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 37480                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 37481                                  	;retn
 37482                                  
 37483                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37484                                  ;
 37485                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 37486                                  ;
 37487                                  ; Inputs:
 37488                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 37489                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of interest (local only,
 37490                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 37491                                  ; Function:
 37492                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 37493                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 37494                                  ; Outputs:
 37495                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 37496                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 37497                                  ;	THISDRV set
 37498                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 37499                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 37500                                  ;
 37501                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37502                                  
 37503                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37504                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37505                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37506                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37507                                  
 37508                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37509                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A6D8h
 37510                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C644h)
 37511                                  
 37512                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 37513 0000658D 06                      	PUSH	ES
 37514 0000658E 57                      	PUSH	DI
 37515                                  
 37516                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 37517 0000658F 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 37518                                  
 37519                                  ; 03/03/2024
 37520                                  %if 0
 37521                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37522                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 37523                                  	; 15/12/2022
 37524                                  	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 37525                                  	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 37526                                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 37527                                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 37528                                  %else
 37529                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37530                                  	;;;
 37531 00006593 E8EAFF                  	call	fatread_gotdpb
 37532                                  	;;;
 37533                                  %endif
 37534 00006596 5F                      	POP	DI			;Get back CDS pointer
 37535 00006597 07                      	POP	ES
 37536 00006598 72E1                    	jc	short fatread_sft_retn
 37537 0000659A 7542                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 37538                                  
 37539                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 37540                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 37541                                  
 37542                                  MED_CHANGE:
 37543                                  	;XOR	AX,AX
 37544                                  	;DEC	AX			; AX = -1
 37545                                  	; 03/03/2024

 37547

 37549 000065A0 8A0E[4700]              	MOV	CL,[CDSCOUNT]

 37551                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+45h]
 37552 000065A6 26C57545                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; Find all CDS with this devptr
 37553                                  
 37554                                  ;hkn; SS override
 37555                                  
 37556                                  ;	Find all CDSs with this DevPtr
 37557                                  ;
 37558                                  ;	(ax) = -1
 37559                                  ;	(ds:si) = DevPtr
 37560                                  
 37561 000065AA 36C43E[3C00]            	LES	DI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; (es:di) = CDS pointer
 37562                                  frcd20: 
 37563                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 37564                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 37565 000065AF 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 37566 000065B4 7522                    	JNZ	short frcd25		; Leave NET guys alone!!
 37567                                  
 37568                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 37569                                  	;push	es
 37570                                  	;push	di
 37571                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 37572                                  	;;les	di,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 37573                                  	;call	POINTCOMP
 37574                                  	;pop	di
 37575                                  	;pop	es
 37576                                  	;jnz	short frcd25
 37577                                  
 37578                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37579 000065B6 263B7545                	cmp	si,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 37580 000065BA 751C                    	jne	short frcd25		; no match
 37581 000065BC 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds
 37582 000065BE 263B5D47                	cmp	bx,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr+2]
 37583 000065C2 7514                    	jne	short frcd25		; CDS not for this drive
 37584

 37588                                  	;JZ	short frcd25 ; = 0	; If root (0), leave root
 37589                                  		; !!! test es:[di+49h],ax
 37590                                  		; !!! jz short frcd25	
 37591                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM bug (!?) ; Erdogan Tan - 03/03/2024
 37592                                  		; test dword ptr es:[di+49h],-1 ; Win ME - BIOSCODE:0C694h
 37593                                  		; jz short frcd25

 37599                                  	;;;

 37603                                  frcd24:		; 03/03/2024

 37608                                  	;;;
 37609                                  	;mov	[es:di+4Bh],ax

 37611                                  	;;;

 37614                                  	;add	di,88  ; MSDOS 6.0

 37618                                  NO_CHANGE:

 37640                                  chk_set_fa_2:

 37645 00006605 26804E1801              	or	byte [es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],1
 37646                                  chk_set_fa_3:

 37658                                  
 37659                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37660

 37662                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37663                                  
 37664                                  FAT_operation:
 37665                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37666                                  FATERR:
 37667                                  
 37668                                  ; 03/03/2024
 37669                                  %if 0
 37670                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 37671                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 37672                                  	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 
 37673                                  					; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 37674                                  %else
 37675                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37676                                  	;;;
 37677 0000660B E8D6FF                  	call    chk_set_first_access
 37678                                  	;;;
 37679                                  %endif
 37680                                  	;and	di,0FFh
 37681 0000660E 81E7FF00                	AND	DI,STECODE		; Put error code in DI
 37682                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 37683 00006612 C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 37684                                  	;mov	ah,1Ah
 37685 00006617 B41A                    	MOV	AH,2+Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY ; While trying to read FAT
 37686 00006619 A0[7605]                	MOV	AL,[THISDRV]		; Tell which drive
 37687 0000661C E8EFFA                  	call	FATAL1
 37688 0000661F C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 37689 00006623 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 37690 00006625 7502                    	JNZ	short FAT_GOT_DPB	; User said retry
 37691                                  
 37692                                  FATERR_fail:	; 03/03/2024
 37693 00006627 F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 37694 00006628 C3                      	retn
 37695                                  
 37696                                  FAT_GOT_DPB:
 37697                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 37698 00006629 16                      	push	ss
 37699 0000662A 1F                      	pop	ds
 37700                                  
 37701                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37702                                  	;;;
 37703 0000662B 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 37704 0000662D 09E8                    	or	ax,bp
 37705 0000662F 74F6                    	jz	short FATERR_fail
 37706                                  	;;;
 37707                                  
 37708                                  	;;mov	al,0Fh
 37709                                  	;MOV	AL,DMEDHL
 37710                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37711                                  	;;;
 37712 00006631 B013                    	mov	al,19
 37713                                  	;;;
 37714                                  
 37715                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+1]
 37716 00006633 268A6601                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT]
 37717 00006637 A3[5A03]                	MOV	[DEVCALL_REQLEN],AX ; 09/09/2018 
 37718 0000663A C606[5C03]01            	MOV	BYTE [DEVCALL_REQFUNC],DEVMDCH
 37719 0000663F C706[5D03]0000          	MOV	word [DEVCALL_REQSTAT],0
 37720                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+16h]
 37721                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+17h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 37722 00006645 268A4617                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 37723 00006649 A2[6703]                	MOV	[CALLMED],AL
 37724 0000664C 06                      	PUSH	ES
 37725 0000664D 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 37726

 37728 0000664E BB[5A03]                	MOV	BX,DEVCALL
 37729                                  	;;lds	si,[es:bp+12h]
 37730                                  	;lds	si,[es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 37731 00006651 26C57613                	LDS	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR] ; DS:SI Points to device header
 37732 00006655 07                      	POP	ES			; ES:BX Points to call header
 37733 00006656 E860EC                  	call	DEVIOCALL2
 37734                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 37735 00006659 16                      	push	ss
 37736 0000665A 1F                      	pop	ds
 37737 0000665B 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 37738 0000665C 8B3E[5D03]              	MOV	DI,[DEVCALL_REQSTAT]
 37739                                  	;test	di,8000h
 37740                                  	;jnz	short FATERR
 37741 00006660 09FF                    	or	di,di
 37742 00006662 78A7                    	js	short FATERR		; have error
 37743                                  
 37744                                  ; 03/03/2024
 37745                                  %if 0
 37746                                  	XOR	AH,AH
 37747                                  	;xchg	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 37748                                  	;xchg	ah,[es:bp+18h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 37749                                  	XCHG	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS] ; Reset dpb_first_access
 37750                                  %else
 37751                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 37756                                  	;and	byte [es:bp+18h],7Fh
 37757 0000666B 268066187F              	and	byte [es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],7Fh
 37758                                  				; clear first access (FAT) bit 7
 37759                                  	;;; 
 37760                                  %endif
 37761                                  
 37762 00006670 A0[7605]                	MOV	AL,[THISDRV]		; Use physical unit number
 37763                                  ; See if we had changed volume id by creating one on the diskette
 37764 00006673 3806[A10A]              	cmp	[VOLCHNG_FLAG],AL
 37765 00006677 7508                    	jnz	short CHECK_BYT
 37766 00006679 C606[A10A]FF            	mov	byte [VOLCHNG_FLAG],-1 ; 0FFh
 37767 0000667E E9B000                  	jmp	GOGETBPB		; Need to get device driver to read in
 37768                                  					; new volume label.
 37769                                  CHECK_BYT:

 37771                                  	;JNS	short CHECK_ZR		; ns = 0 or 1
 37772                                  	;JMP	short NEWDSK
 37773                                  	; 17/12/2022
 37774 00006685 785E                    	js	short NEWDSK
 37775                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37776                                  	;JNS	short CHECK_ZR		; ns = 0 or 1
 37777                                  	;JMP	short NEWDSK
 37778                                  
 37779                                  CHECK_ZR:

 37782                                  	; cf=0 (after 'or' instruction)
 37783                                  	;CLC
 37784 00006689 C3                      	retn				; If Media not changed (NZ)
 37785                                  
 37786                                  DISK_CHNG_ERR:

 37790                                  	;les	bp,[es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0

 37801 0000669A 57                      	PUSH	DI

 37817 000066BC 1F                      	POP	DS

 37824                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 37842                                  	;test   byte [di+5],40h
 37843 000066D3 F6450540                	TEST	byte [di+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty	; is the buffer dirty ?
 37844 000066D7 7403                    	jz	short lfnxt			; no, go for next buffer

 37846                                  FAIL_OP2:	; 03/03/2024

 37856                                  	; 15/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37857                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 37858                                  	;lds	di,[di]
 37859                                  
 37860                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37861 000066DC 8B3D                    	mov	di,[di]
 37862                                  	;;mov	di,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]	; get next buffer
 37863                                  	
 37864                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 37865                                  	;cmp	di,-1
 37866                                  	;jne	short nbuffer
 37867                                  	
 37868                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37869 000066DE 36393E[7E11]            	cmp	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di		; is this where we started ?;hkn;
 37870 000066E3 75E9                    	jne	short nbuffer			; no, check this guy also
 37871                                  
 37872                                  ; If no dirty buffers, assume Media changed

 38286 000068C9 268B460F                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE]	; 16 bit FAT size field
 38287 000068CD 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 38288 000068CF 750D                    	jnz	short gotgetbuf14 ; FAT (FAT12 or FAT16) fs
 38289                                  	
 38290                                  	; FAT32 fs
 38291                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+31h]		; FAT sectors (per one FAT)
 38292 000068D1 268B4631                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_SIZE] 
 38293                                  	;mov	[di-13],ax 	; BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcntinc ; # sectors between each write
 38294 000068D5 8945F3                  	mov	[di+BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcntinc-BUFINSIZ],ax
 38295                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+33h]
 38296 000068D8 268B4633                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_SIZE+2]
 38297 000068DC EB05                    	jmp	short gotgetbuf15
 38298                                  
 38299                                  gotgetbuf14:
 38300                                  	;mov	[di-13],ax		; BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcntinc
 38301 000068DE 8945F3                  	mov	[di+BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcntinc-BUFINSIZ],ax
 38302                                  
 38303                                  	;xor	ax,ax			; 0
 38304 000068E1 29C0                    	sub	ax,ax ; 0
 38305                                  
 38306                                  gotgetbuf15:
 38307                                  	;;mov	[di-15],ax		; BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcntinc+2 ; hw of sectors per FAT
 38308                                  					; PCDOS 7.1 BUG !? This would be 'mov [di-11],ax'
 38309                                  					; Erdogan Tan - 03/03/2024
 38310                                  	;mov	[di-11],ax
 38311 000068E3 8945F5                  	mov	[di+BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcntinc+2-BUFINSIZ],ax
 38312                                  
 38313                                  gotgetbuf16:
 38314                                  	;mov	ax,ss			; SS is DOSDATA
 38315                                  	;mov	ds,ax
 38316 000068E6 16                      	push	ss
 38317 000068E7 1F                      	pop	ds
 38318                                  	;xor	al,al			; Media changed (Z),Carry clear
 38319 000068E8 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 38320 000068EA C3                      	retn

 38455                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 38457                                  ; Inputs:
 38458                                  ;	 No Inputs
 38459                                  ; Function:
 38460                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 38461                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 38462                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 38463                                  ; Outputs:
 38464                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue

 38481 000068F7 36893E[7E11]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	; save first buffer address
 38482 000068FC C3                      	retn

 38652                                  ; BUGBUG ---- one instruction. This routine is called from

 38654                                  ; BUGBUG ---- if coded in line = 3 * 5 = 15 bytes
 38655                                  ; BUGBUG ---- But kept as it is for modularity
 38656                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 38659                                  ;	ret
 38660                                  ;EndProc PLACEHEAD

 38665                                  ;

 38707                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38708                                  ; DOSCODE:9928h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 38709                                  
 38710                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 38711                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38712                                  ;
 38713                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 38714                                  ; Inputs:
 38715                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 38716                                  ; Function:
 38717                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 38718                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 38719                                  ;	   same segment
 38720                                  ;
 38721                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 38722                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 38723                                  ; No Registers altered
 38724                                  ;
 38725                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38726                                  
 38727                                  POINTCOMP:
 38728                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38729                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D84h
 38730 00006941 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 38731 00006943 750A                    	jnz	short _ret_label	; return if nz
 38732                                  	;jnz	short placehead_retn 
 38733 00006945 51                      	PUSH	CX
 38734 00006946 52                      	PUSH	DX
 38735 00006947 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS
 38736 00006949 8CC2                    	MOV	DX,ES
 38737 0000694B 39D1                    	CMP	CX,DX
 38738 0000694D 5A                      	POP	DX
 38739 0000694E 59                      	POP	CX
 38740                                  _ret_label:
 38741 0000694F C3                      	retn
 38742                                  
 38743                                  ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38744                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D93h 
 38745                                  
 38746                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 38747                                  
 38748                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38749                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38750                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 38751                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38752                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 38753                                  ; 
 38754                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38755                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38756                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 38757                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38758                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38759                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38760                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38761                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38762                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38763                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38764                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38765                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38766                                  
 38767                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38768                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38769                                  ;	GetBuffrb reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 38770                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38771                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 38772                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 38773                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 38774                                  ; 
 38775                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38776                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38777                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 38778                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 38779                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38780                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38781                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38782                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38783                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38784                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector

 39284                                  ;Break	<FLUSHBUF -- WRITE OUT DIRTY BUFFERS>

 39289                                  ;	   = -1 for all units and all remote buffers

 39292                                  ;	Carry set if error (user FAILed to I 24)
 39293                                  ;	    Flush operation completed.

 39295                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39296

 39399                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39400                                  ;
 39401                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECKFLUSH
 39402                                  ;
 39403                                  ; Inputs : AL - Drive number, -1 means do not check for drive
 39404                                  ;	   DS:DI - pointer to buffer
 39405                                  ;
 39406                                  ; Function : Write out a buffer if it is dirty
 39407                                  ;
 39408                                  ; Carry set if problem (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 39409                                  ;
 39410                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39411                                  
 39412                                  	; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 39413                                  
 39414                                  CHECKFLUSH:
 39415                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39416 00006B16 B4FF                    	mov	ah,-1	; 01/08/2018 Retro DOS v3.0
 39417                                  	;cmp	[di+4],ah
 39418 00006B18 386504                  	CMP	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AH
 39419 00006B1B 74F8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Skip free buffer, carry clear
 39420 00006B1D 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL			; 
 39421 00006B1F 7412                    	JZ	short DOBUFFER		; do this buffer
 39422                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 39423 00006B21 3A4504                  	CMP	AL,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 39424 00006B24 F8                      	CLC
 39425 00006B25 75EE                    	jnz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not for this unit or SFT
 39426                                  
 39427                                  	; 07/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 39428                                  	;;;
 39429 00006B27 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 39430 00006B29 88C3                    	mov	bl,al
 39431                                  	;test	ss:drive_flags[bx],8 
 39432 00006B2B 36F687[0813]08          	test	byte [ss:bx+drive_flags],8 ; bit 3
 39433 00006B31 75E2                    	jnz	short flushbuf_retn
 39434                                  	;;;
 39435                                  
 39436                                  DOBUFFER:
 39437                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 39438 00006B33 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 39439 00006B37 74DC                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not dirty, carry clear by TEST
 39440 00006B39 50                      	PUSH	AX
 39441                                  	;push	word [di+4]
 39442 00006B3A FF7504                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 39443 00006B3D E80B00                  	CALL	BUFWRITE
 39444 00006B40 58                      	POP	AX
 39445 00006B41 7206                    	JC	short LEAVE_BUF		; Leave buffer marked free (lost).
 39446                                  	;and	ah,0BFh
 39447 00006B43 80E4BF                  	AND	AH,~buf_dirty		; Buffer is clean, clears carry
 39448                                  	;mov	[di+4],ax
 39449 00006B46 894504                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AX
 39450                                  LEAVE_BUF:
 39451 00006B49 58                      	POP	AX			; Search info
 39452                                  checkflush_retn:
 39453 00006B4A C3                      	retn

 39456                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39457                                  ;
 39458                                  ;	BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk, if it's dirty.
 39459                                  ;
 39460                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DI Points to the buffer
 39461                                  ;

 39660                                  ;**	Set_RQ_SC_Parms - Set Secondary Cache Parameters
 39661                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39662                                  ;	Set_RQ_SC_Parms sets the sector size and drive number value
 39663                                  ;	for the secondary cache. This updates SC_SECTOR_SIZE &
 39664                                  ;	SC_DRIVE even if SC is disabled to save the testing
 39665                                  ;	code and time
 39666                                  ;
 39667                                  ;	ENTRY	ES:BP = drive parameter block
 39668                                  ;
 39669                                  ;	EXIT	[SC_SECTOR_SIZE]= drive sector size
 39670                                  ;		[SC_DRIVE]= drive #
 39671                                  ;
 39672                                  ;	USES	Flags
 39673                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39674                                  
 39675                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39676                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39677                                  
 39678                                  SET_RQ_SC_PARMS:
 39679                                  ;hkn; SS override for all variables used in this procedure.

 39682                                  	MOV	ax,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]	; save sector size
 39683                                  	MOV	[ss:SC_SECTOR_SIZE],ax

 39690                                  	pop	ax
 39691                                  srspx:	
 39692                                  	retn					;LB. return
 39693                                  
 39694                                  %endif
