 39760                                  ; MSPROC.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1992
 39761                                  ;============================================================================
 39762                                  ; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39763                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39764                                  ; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 39765                                  
 39766                                  ; (15/04/2018 - RetrO DOS v2.0, MSDOS 2.11 - PROC.ASM - 1983)
 39767                                  
 39768                                  ; Pseudo EXEC system call for DOS
 39769                                  
 39770                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 39771                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 39772                                  
 39773                                  ; =========================================================================
 39774                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 39775                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 39776                                  ;
 39777                                  ;	$WAIT
 39778                                  ;	$EXEC
 39779                                  ;	$Keep_process
 39780                                  ;	Stay_resident
 39781                                  ;	$EXIT
 39782                                  ;	$ABORT
 39783                                  ;	abort_inner
 39784                                  ;
 39785                                  ;	Modification history:
 39786                                  ;
 39787                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 39788                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 39789                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 39790                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 39791                                  ;
 39792                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 39793                                  ;
 39794                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 39795                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 39796                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 39797                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 39798                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 39799                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 39800                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 39801                                  ;
 39802                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 39803                                  ;
 39804                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 39805                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 39806                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 39807                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 39808                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 39809                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 39810                                  ;
 39811                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 39812                                  ;
 39813                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 39814                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 39815                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 39816                                  ;
 39817                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 39818                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 39819                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 39820                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 39821                                  ;
 39822                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 39823                                  ;
 39824                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 39825                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 39826                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 39827                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 39828                                  ;
 39829                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 39830                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 39831                                  ;		       UMBs.
 39832                                  ;
 39833                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 39834                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 39835                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 39836                                  ;
 39837                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 39838                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 39839                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 39840                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 39841                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 39842                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 39843                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 39844                                  ;
 39845                                  ; =========================================================================
 39846                                  
 39847                                  ;SAVEXIT  EQU  10
 39848                                  
 39849                                  ;BREAK	<$WAIT - return previous process error code>
 39850                                  ; =========================================================================
 39851                                  ;	$WAIT - Return previous process error code.
 39852                                  ;
 39853                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 39854                                  ;
 39855                                  ;	    MOV     AH, WaitProcess
 39856                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 39857                                  ;
 39858                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 39859                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = exit code
 39860                                  ;	USES	all
 39861                                  ; =========================================================================
 39862                                  
 39863                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39864                                  	; DOSCODE:9B55h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 39865                                  
 39866                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39867                                  	; DOSCODE:9A5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 39868                                  
 39869                                  	; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 39870                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AD78h	
 39871                                  
 39872                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:9B55h)
 39873                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:944Ch)
 39874                                  
 39875                                  _$WAIT:
 39876                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39877                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 39878                                  
 39879 00006C0D 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 39880 00006C0F 368706[3403]            	xchg	AX,[ss:exit_code]
 39881 00006C14 E9539A                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 39882                                  
 39883                                  ; =========================================================================
 39884                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 39885                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 39886                                  ;
 39887                                  ;
 39888                                  ; Assembler usage:
 39889                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 39890                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 39891                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 39892                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 39893                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 39894                                  ;
 39895                                  ;	AL  Function
 39896                                  ;	--  --------
 39897                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 39898                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 39899                                  ;	    begin execution.
 39900                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 39901                                  ;
 39902                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 39903                                  ;
 39904                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39905                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39906                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39907                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39908                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39909                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39910                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39911                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39912                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39913                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39914                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39915                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39916                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39917                                  ;
 39918                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 39919                                  ;
 39920                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39921                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39922                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39923                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39924                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39925                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39926                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39927                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39928                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39929                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39930                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39931                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39932                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39933                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39934                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 39935                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39936                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39937                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 39938                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39939                                  ;
 39940                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 39941                                  ;
 39942                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39943                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 39944                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 39945                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39946                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 39947                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 39948                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39949                                  ;
 39950                                  ; Returns:
 39951                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 39952                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 39953                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 39954                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 39955                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 39956                                  ; =========================================================================
 39957                                  ;
 39958                                  ;   Revision history:
 39959                                  ;
 39960                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 39961                                  ;
 39962                                  ; =========================================================================
 39963                                  
 39964                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 39965                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)
 39966

 39970                                  ;%out	Please make sure that the following are contiguous and of the
 39971                                  ;%out	following sizes:
 39972                                  ;%out
 39973                                  ;%out	OpenBuf     128
 39974                                  ;%out	RenBuf	    128
 39975                                  ;%out	SearchBuf    53
 39976                                  ;%out	DummyCDS    curdirLen
 39977                                  ;ENDIF

 39987                                  
 39988                                  	; 30/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39989                                  	; DOSCODE:9B04h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 39990                                  
 39991                                  	; 08/03/2024
 39992                                  	; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 39998                                  _$EXEC:
 39999                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 40000                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5EF1h
 40001                                  
 40002                                  EXEC001S:
 40003                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Blk		,DWORD
 40004                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Func		,BYTE
 40005                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_High	,BYTE

 40015                                  	;

 40017                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_NoStack	,BYTE
 40018                                  
 40019                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 40020                                  	;%define	Exec_Blk	dword [bp-4]
 40021                                  	%define		Exec_Blk	[bp-4] ; 09/08/2018
 40022                                  	%define		Exec_BlkL	word [bp-4]	
 40023                                  	%define		Exec_BlkH	word [bp-2]
 40024                                  	%define		Exec_Func	byte [bp-5]
 40025                                  	%define		Exec_Load_High	byte [bp-6]
 40026                                  	%define		Exec_FH		word [bp-8]
 40027                                  	%define		Exec_Rel_Fac	word [bp-10]
 40028                                  	%define		Exec_Res_Len_Para word [bp-12]
 40029                                  	%define		Exec_Environ	word [bp-14]
 40030                                  	%define		Exec_Size	word [bp-16]
 40031                                  	%define		Exec_Load_Block	word [bp-18]
 40032                                  	%define		Exec_DMA	word [bp-20]
 40033                                  	%define		ExecNameLen	word [bp-22]
 40034                                  	;%define	ExecName	dword [bp-26]
 40035                                  	%define		ExecName	[bp-26] ; 09/08/2018
 40036                                  	%define		ExecNameL	word [bp-26]	
 40037                                  	%define		ExecNameH	word [bp-24]
 40038                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40039                                  	%define		Exec_DMA_Save	word [bp-28]

 40041                                  	
 40042                                  	; ==================================================================
 40043                                  	; validate function
 40044                                  	; ==================================================================
 40045                                  		      	
 40046                                  	; M068 - Start
 40047                                  	;
 40048                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a 
 40049                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 40050                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep 
 40051                                  	; the A20 off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 40052                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 40053                                  
 40054                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40055 00006C17 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 40056                                  
 40057                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack	
 40058                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 40059                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExecReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 40060                                  
 40061 00006C1D 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 40062                                  	;jne	short @f
 40063 00006C1F 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 40064                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 40065 00006C21 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 40066 00006C22 B9[F603]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 40067 00006C25 51                      	push	cx
 40068                                  ;@@:
 40069                                  Exec_@f:
 40070                                  	; M068 - End
 40071                                  	
 40072                                  	;Enter
 40073                                  
 40074 00006C26 55                      	push	bp
 40075 00006C27 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 40076                                  	;;sub	sp,26	; MSDOS 3.3
 40077                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)	
 40078                                  	;sub	sp,29	; MSDOS 6.0 & MSDOS 6.22 & PCDOS 7.1 ; 07/03/2024
 40079                                  	; 17/12/2022
 40080                                  	; 20/05/2019
 40081 00006C29 83EC1E                  	sub	sp,30	; Retro DOS v4.0	
 40082                                  
 40083                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40084 00006C2C 3C05                    	cmp	AL,5			; only 0, 1, 3 or 5 are allowed ;M028
 40085                                  					; M030
 40086 00006C2E 7614                    	jna	short Exec_Check_2
 40087                                  
 40088                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 40089                                  	;cmp	AL,3
 40090                                  	;jna	short Exec_Check_2
 40091                                  
 40092                                  Exec_Bad_Fun:
 40093 00006C30 36C606[2303]01          	mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; 1
 40094                                  					; Extended Error Locus	;smr;SS Override
 40095                                  	;mov	al,1
 40096 00006C36 B001                    	mov	al,error_invalid_function
 40097                                  
 40098                                  Exec_Ret_Err:
 40099                                  	;Leave
 40100 00006C38 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 40101 00006C3A 5D                      	pop	bp
 40102                                  	;transfer SYS_RET_ERR
 40103 00006C3B E9369A                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 40104                                  
 40105                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40106                                  ExecReadyJ:
 40107 00006C3E E8A018                  	call	ExecReady		; M028
 40108 00006C41 E91204                  	jmp	norm_ovl		; do a Leave & xfer sysret_OK ; M028
 40109                                  
 40110                                  Exec_Check_2:
 40111 00006C44 3C02                    	cmp	AL,2			
 40112 00006C46 74E8                    	je	short Exec_Bad_Fun
 40113                                  
 40114                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40115 00006C48 3C04                    	cmp	al,4			; 2 & 4 are not allowed
 40116 00006C4A 74E4                    	je	short Exec_Bad_Fun
 40117                                  	
 40118 00006C4C 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; M028 ; M030
 40119 00006C4E 74EE                    	je	short ExecReadyJ	; M028
 40120                                  
 40121                                  	;mov	[bp-4],bx
 40122 00006C50 895EFC                  	mov	Exec_BlkL,BX		; stash args
 40123                                  	;mov	[bp-2],es
 40124 00006C53 8C46FE                  	mov	Exec_BlkH,ES
 40125                                  	;mov	[bp-5],al
 40126 00006C56 8846FB                  	mov	Exec_Func,AL
 40127                                  	;mov	byte [bp-6],0
 40128 00006C59 C646FA00                	mov	Exec_Load_High,0
 40129                                  
 40130                                  	;mov	[bp-26],dx
 40131 00006C5D 8956E6                  	mov	ExecNameL,DX		; set up length of exec name
 40132                                  	;mov	[bp-24],ds
 40133 00006C60 8C5EE8                  	mov	ExecNameH,DS
 40134 00006C63 89D6                    	mov	SI,DX			; move pointer to convenient place
 40135                                  	;invoke	DStrLen
 40136 00006C65 E865AB                  	call	DStrLen
 40137                                  	;mov	[bp-22],cx
 40138 00006C68 894EEA                  	mov	ExecNameLen,CX		; save length
 40139                                  
 40140                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40141 00006C6B 36A0[0203]              	mov	al,[ss:AllocMethod]	; M063: save alloc method in 
 40142 00006C6F 36A2[8400]              	mov	[ss:ALLOCMSAVE],al	; M063: AllocMsave
 40143                                  
 40144                                  	;xor	AL,AL			; open for reading
 40145                                  	; 07/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 40146                                  	;;;
 40147 00006C73 B0A0                    	mov	al,0A0h			; Access mode bits: (0 to 2)
 40148                                  					; 000  read access
 40149                                  
 40150                                  					; Sharing mode bits: (4 to 6)
 40151                                  					; 010  deny others write access
 40152                                  
 40153                                  					; bit 7 - private
 40154                                  	;;;
 40155                                  
 40156 00006C75 55                      	push	BP
 40157                                  
 40158                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40159                                  	;or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],1
 40160 00006C76 36800E[8600]01          	or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECOPEN ; this flag is set to indicate to 
 40161                                  					; the redir that this open call is
 40162                                  					; due to an exec.
 40163                                  	
 40164                                  	; 07/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 40165                                  	;;;
 40166 00006C7C 1E                      	push	ds
 40167 00006C7D 52                      	push	dx
 40168                                  	;;;

 40170                                  	;invoke	$OPEN			; is the file there?
 40171 00006C7E E87E13                  	call	_$OPEN
 40172                                  
 40173                                  	; 07/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 40174                                  	;;;
 40175 00006C81 5A                      	pop	dx
 40176 00006C82 1F                      	pop	ds
 40177 00006C83 7305                    	jnc	short Exec_Open_Ok
 40178                                  
 40179 00006C85 30C0                    	xor	al,al			; open for reading
 40180 00006C87 E87513                  	call	_$OPEN
 40181                                  
 40182                                  Exec_Open_Ok:
 40183                                  	;;;	
 40184                                  
 40185                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40186 00006C8A 9C                      	pushf
 40187                                  	; 02/06/2019
 40188                                  	;and	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],0FEh
 40189 00006C8B 368026[8600]FE          	and	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],~EXECOPEN ; reset flag
 40190 00006C91 9D                      	popf
 40191                                  
 40192 00006C92 5D                      	pop	BP
 40193

 40195 00006C93 72A3                    	jc	short Exec_Ret_Err
 40196

 40208                                  
 40209                                  	;mov	al,2
 40210 00006CA6 B002                    	mov	AL,error_file_not_found
 40211                                  Exec_BombJ:

 40213                                  
 40214                                  BadEnv:

 41079                                  ;SR;
 41080                                  ;The current lie strategy uses the PSP to store the lie version. However,
 41081                                  ;device drivers are loaded as overlays and have no PSP. To handle them, we
 41082                                  ;use the Sysinit flag provided by the BIOS as part of a structure pointed at
 41083                                  ;by BiosDataPtr. If this flag is set, the overlay call has been issued from
 41084                                  ;Sysinit and therefore must be a device driver load. We then get the lie 
 41085                                  ;version for this driver and put it into the Sysinit PSP. When the driver
 41086                                  ;issues the version check, it gets the lie version until the next overlay
 41087                                  ;call is issued.
 41088

 41092 00007031 06                      	push	es
 41093 00007032 36C436[2313]            	les	si,[ss:BiosDataPtr]	;get ptr to BIOS data block
 41094                                  	 
 41095                                  	; (es:si points to 'SysinitPresent' address/flag in retrodos4.s)
 41096 00007037 26803C00                	cmp	byte [es:si],0		;in Sysinit?
 41097 0000703B 7411                    	je	short sysinit_done	;no, Sysinit is finished
 41098

 41978                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 41979                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41980                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 41981                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41982                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 41983                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 41984                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41985                                  
 41986                                  arena_next:
 41987 00007301 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 41988 00007303 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 41989 00007307 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 41990                                  
 41991                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 41992                                  ;
 41993                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 41994                                  ;       RETN
 41995                                  
 41996                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 41997                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41998                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 41999                                  ;		(di) = 0
 42000                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 42001                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 42002                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 42003                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 42004                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42005                                  
 42006                                  check_signature:        
 42007                                  
 42008 00007308 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 42009                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 42010 0000730A 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 42011                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 42012 0000730E 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 42013                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 42014 00007310 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 42015                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 42016 00007314 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 42017 00007316 F9                              STC                             ; set error
 42018                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 42019                                  ;AFP_RETN:	; 10/03/2024
 42020                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 42021                                  check_signature_ok:
 42022                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 42023 00007317 C3                      	RETN
 42024                                  
 42025                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 42026                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42027                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 42028                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 42029                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 42030                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 42031                                  ;
 42032                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 42033                                  ;		(di) = 0
 42034                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42035                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 42036                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 42037                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 42038                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 42039                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42040                                          
 42041                                  Coalesce:
 42042                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 42043 00007318 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 42044                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 42045                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 42046 0000731B 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 42047 0000731D E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 42048                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 42049 00007320 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 42050                                  
 42051                                  coalesce_check:
 42052                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 42053 00007322 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 42054                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 42055 00007327 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 42056                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 42057 00007329 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 42058 0000732E 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 42059                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 42060 0000732F 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 42061 00007333 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 42062 00007336 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 42063 00007338 EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again
 42064                                  
 42065                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42066                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 42067                                  
 42068                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 42069                                  
 42070                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42071                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42072                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 42073                                  ;
 42074                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 42075                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 42076                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 42077                                  ;
 42078                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 42079                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 42080                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 42081                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 42082                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 42083                                  ;
 42084                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 42085                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 42086                                  ;
 42087                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42088                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 42089                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 42090                                  ;           INT     21h
 42091                                  ;
 42092                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 42093                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 42094                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 42095                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 42096                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 42097                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 42098                                  ;
 42099                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 42100                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP

 42102                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 42103                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 42104                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 42105                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 42106                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed

 42123                                  ;       memory that has the requested  size  in  paragraphs.

 42468                                  
 42469                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 42470                                  
 42471                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42472                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42473                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 42474                                  ;
 42475                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 42476                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 42477                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 42478                                  ;
 42479                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 42480                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 42481                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 42482                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 42483                                  ;
 42484                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 42485                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 42486                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 42487                                  ;		code.
 42488                                  ;
 42489                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 42490                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 42491                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 42492                                  ;
 42493                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42494                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42495                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 42496                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 42497                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 42498                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 42499                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 42500                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 42501                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42502                                  
 42503                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42504                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42505                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 42506                                  ;
 42507                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42508                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 42509                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 42510                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 42511                                  ;           INT     21h
 42512                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 42513                                  ;         size possible
 42514                                  ;   Error return:
 42515                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 42516                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 42517                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 42518                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 42519                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42520                                  
 42521                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 42522                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42523                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 42524 0000748B E853A4                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 42525                                  
 42526 0000748E BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE
 42527 00007491 8CC0                            MOV     AX,ES
 42528 00007493 48                              DEC     AX
 42529 00007494 E871FE                          CALL    check_signature
 42530 00007497 7303                            JNC     SHORT setblock_grab
 42531                                  
 42532                                  setblock_bad:
 42533 00007499 E905FF                          JMP     alloc_trashed
 42534                                  
 42535                                  setblock_grab:
 42536 0000749C 8ED8                            MOV     DS,AX
 42537 0000749E E877FE                          CALL    Coalesce
 42538 000074A1 72F6                            JC      SHORT setblock_bad
 42539 000074A3 8B0E0300                        MOV     CX,[ARENA.SIZE]
 42540 000074A7 51                              PUSH    CX
 42541 000074A8 39CB                            CMP     BX,CX
 42542 000074AA 76A5                            JBE     SHORT alloc_get_size
 42543 000074AC E91EFF                          JMP     alloc_fail

 42545                                  ;	BREAK $DEALLOC - free previously allocated piece of memory
 42546                                  
 42547                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42548                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42549                                  ;**	$DEALLOC - Free Heap Memory
 42550                                  ;
 42551                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = address of item
 42552                                  ;
 42553                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear of OK
 42554                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42555                                  ;		  (AX) = error_invalid_block
 42556                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 42557                                  
 42558                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42559                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42560                                  ;SUBTTL $DEALLOC - free previously allocated piece of memory
 42561                                  ;
 42562                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42563                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 42564                                  ;           MOV     AH,dealloc
 42565                                  ;           INT     21h
 42566                                  ;
 42567                                  ;   Error return:
 42568                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 42569                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 42570                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 42571                                  
 42572                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42573                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42574                                  _$DEALLOC:
 42575                                  	; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0    
 42576                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42577                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 42578 000074AF E82FA4                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 42579                                  
 42580                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M016, M068 - Start
 42581 000074B2 36F606[8600]04          	test	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECA20OFF
 42582                                  					; Q: was the previous call an int 21
 42583                                  					;    exec call
 42584 000074B8 740D                    	jz	short deallocate	; N: continue
 42585 000074BA 36803E[8500]00          	cmp	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT], 0 ; Q: is count 0
 42586 000074C0 7505                    	jne	short deallocate	; N: continue
 42587                                  	;mov	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT], 1 ; Y: set count to 1
 42588                                  	; 25/09/2023
 42589 000074C2 36FE06[8500]            	inc	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT]
 42590                                  deallocate:				; M016, M068 - End

 42616                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42617                                  
 42618                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42619                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42620                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 42621                                  ;
 42622                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42623                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42624                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42625                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42626                                  ;           INT     21h
 42627                                  ;
 42628                                  ;	ENTRY	
 42629                                  ;		(al) = 0
 42630                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 42631                                  ;
 42632                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 42633                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 42634                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 42635                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 42636                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 42637                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 42638                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 42639                                  ;
 42640                                  ;		(al) = 2
 42641                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 42642                                  ;
 42643                                  ;		(al) = 3
 42644                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 42645                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 42646                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 42647                                  ;
 42648                                  ;
 42649                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42650                                  ;
 42651                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 42652                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 42653                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 42654                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 42655                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 42656                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 42657                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 42658                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 42659                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 42660                                  ;
 42661                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42662                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 42663                                  ;
 42664                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 42665                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 42666                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 42667                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 42668                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 42669                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42670                                  
 42671                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42672                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42673                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42674                                  ;
 42675                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42676                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42677                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42678                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42679                                  ;           INT     21h
 42680                                  ;
 42681                                  ;   Error return:
 42682                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 42683                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42684                                  
 42685                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42686                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42687                                  _$ALLOCOPER:

 42904                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42905                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42906                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 42907                                  ;
 42908                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 42909                                  ;
 42910                                  ;
 42911                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 42912                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 42913                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 42914                                  ;		   else
 42915                                  ;			DS = last arena
 42916                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 42917                                  ;
 42918                                  ;		   CY if error
 42919                                  ;
 42920                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 42921                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42922                                  
 42923                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42924                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 42925                                  
 42926                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42927                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 42928                                  
 42929                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42930                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B6D9h
 42931                                  
 42932                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A4D6h)
 42933                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:9F25h)
 42934                                  
 42935                                  GetLastArena:
 42936 00007554 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 42937                                  
 42938 00007555 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 42939 00007559 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 42940 0000755B 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 42941                                  
 42942 0000755D 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42943                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42944 00007561 7416                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES
 42945                                  
 42946                                  GLA_next:
 42947 00007563 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42948 00007565 E899FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42949                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42950                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42951                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42952 00007568 7222                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42953                                  
 42954                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42955                                  %if 0
 42956                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42957                                  	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is
 42958                                  					;    umb_head
 42959                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 42960                                  %else
 42961                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42962                                  	;;;
 42963 0000756A E85BFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42964 0000756D 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb
 42965                                  	;;;
 42966                                  %endif
 42967 0000756F 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42968                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42969 00007573 EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 42970                                  GLA_chkumb:
 42971 00007575 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42972                                  GLA_@f:
 42973 00007577 75EA                    	jne	short GLA_next		; N: get next arena
 42974                                  
 42975                                  GLA_done:
 42976                                  
 42977                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42978                                  %if 0
 42979                                  					; M061 - Start
 42980                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42981                                  	jnz	short GLA_ret		; Y: we're done
 42982                                  					; N: let us confirm that the next
 42983                                  					;    arena is umb_head
 42984                                  %else
 42985                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42986                                  	;;;
 42987 00007579 E84CFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42988 0000757C 750B                    	jnz	short GLA_ret ; cf=0
 42989                                  	;;;
 42990                                  %endif
 42991 0000757E 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42992 00007580 E87EFD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42993                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42994 00007583 7207                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42995 00007585 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42996 00007587 7502                    	jne	short GLA_err		; N: error
 42997                                  					; M061 - End
 42998                                  GLA_ret:
 42999                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43000                                  	;clc
 43001                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43002                                  	;clc
 43003 00007589 58                      	pop	ax			; M061
 43004 0000758A C3                      	retn				; M061
 43005                                  
 43006                                  GLA_err:
 43007 0000758B F9                      	stc				; M061
 43008                                  GLA_err2:
 43009 0000758C 58                      	pop	ax
 43010                                  
 43011                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 
 43012                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43013                                  	;;;
 43014 0000758D 58                      	pop	ax	; return address to _$ALLOCOPER (the caller)
 43015 0000758E E8579D                  	call	set_exerr_locus_mem
 43016 00007591 E910FE                  	jmp	alloc_trashed2	; (error return from _$ALLOCOPER)
 43017                                  	;;;
 43018                                  
 43019                                  	; 10/03/2024
 43020                                  	;retn

 43030                                  ;**	SRVCALL.ASM - Server DOS call functions

 43033                                  ;	$ServerCall

 43035                                  ;	Modification history:
 43036                                  ;

 43038                                  
 43039                                  ;AsmVars <Installed>
 43040                                  
 43041                                  ;include dpl.asm
 43042                                  
 43043                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 43044                                  
 43045                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSDOS 6.21)
 43046                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43047                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43048                                  
 43049                                  ;BREAK <ServerCall -- Server DOS call>
 43050                                  
 43051                                  ; DOSCODE:A517h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 43052                                  ; DOSCODE:A4B7h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 43053                                  
 43054                                  ; 10/03/2024
 43055                                  ; DOSCODE:B71Ah (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM) ; Retro DOS v5.0
 43056                                  ; DOSCODE:A517h (MSDOS 6.22, MSDOS.SYS) ; Retro DOS v4.2
 43057                                  ; BIOSCODE:9F66h (Windows ME, IO.SYS)
 43058                                  
 43059                                  ;hkn; TABLE	SEGMENT
 43060                                  ;Public SRVC001S,SRVC001E
 43061                                  ;SRVC001S label byte
 43062                                  
 43063                                  SRVC001S:
 43064                                  
 43065 00007594 [9875]                  SERVERTAB:	dw	SERVER_DISP
 43066 00007596 [EA75]                  SERVERLEAVE:	dw	SERVERRETURN
 43067 00007598 0B                      SERVER_DISP:	db	(SERVER_DISP_END-SERVER_DISP-1)/2 ; = 11
 43068 00007599 [5076]                  		dw	SRV_CALL	; 0
 43069 0000759B [EB75]                  		dw	COMMIT_ALL	; 1

 43090                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 43091                                  ;
 43092                                  ; Inputs:
 43093                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 43094                                  ; Function:
 43095                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 43096                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 43097                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 43098                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 43099                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 43100                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 43101                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 43102                                  ;			CX User Index
 43103                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 43104                                  ;			BX = UID
 43105                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 43106                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 43107                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start

 43109                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always

 43438                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 43439                                  
 43440                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 43441                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43442                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 43443                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 43444                                  ;
 43445                                  ;	NOTE:
 43446                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 43447                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 43448                                  ;
 43449                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 43450                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 43451                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 43452                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43453                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 43454                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 43455                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43456                                  
 43457                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43458                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43459                                  
 43460                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 43461                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43462                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 43463 000076E5 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 43464                                  	
 43465                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 43466 000076EA 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 43467                                  
 43468                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 43469 000076EF 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 43470 000076F4 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 43471                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43472                                  	;mov	al,6
 43473 000076F6 B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 43474                                  ReturnCarry:
 43475 000076F8 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 43476 000076F9 C3                      	retn				; go back
 43477                                  pjfn10: 
 43478                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 43479 000076FA 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 43480 000076FF 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'

 43482                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 43483 00007701 C3                      	retn
