 43485                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 43486                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43487                                  ;
 43488                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 43489                                  ;
 43490                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 43491                                  ;
 43492                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 43493                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 43494                                  ;                   AX has error code
 43495                                  ;               Carry Reset
 43496                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 43497                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 43498                                  ; NOTE:
 43499                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 43500                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 43501                                  ;
 43502                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43503                                  
 43504                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43505                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43506                                  
 43507                                  SFFromHandle:
 43508 00007702 E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 43509                                  	;retc				; return if error
 43510 00007705 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 43511 00007707 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 43512                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 43513                                  	;;mov	al,6
 43514                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 43515                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 43516                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43517                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43518 0000770B 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 43519                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 43520                                  	;;mov	al,6
 43521                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 43522                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 43523                                  GetSF:
 43524 0000770D 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 43525 0000770E 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 43526 00007711 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 43527 00007713 E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 43528 00007716 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 43529 00007717 C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 43530                                  
 43531                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 43532                                  
 43533                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 43534                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43535                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 43536                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 43537                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 43538                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 43539                                  ;
 43540                                  ;   NOTE:
 43541                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 43542                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 43543                                  ;
 43544                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 43545                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 43546                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 43547                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 43548                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 43549                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43550                                  
 43551                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43552                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43553                                  
 43554                                  SFFromSFN:
 43555                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43556                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 43557 00007718 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 43558                                  
 43559                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 43560 0000771D 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 43561                                  sfsfn5:	
 43562                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 43563 00007722 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 43564 00007726 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 43565                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 43566 00007728 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 43567 0000772C 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 43568                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 43569 0000772F 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 43570 00007732 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 43571 00007734 F9                      	STC
 43572 00007735 C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 43573                                  sfsfn7:
 43574 00007736 50                      	push	ax
 43575                                  	;;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 43576                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 5.0 to PCDOS 7.1 (to Win ME) ; 11/03/2024
 43577                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 43578                                  	
 43579                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43580 00007737 B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 43581                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43582                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 43583                                  	
 43584 00007739 F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 43585 0000773B 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 43586 0000773D 58                      	pop	ax
 43587                                  	;add	di,6
 43588 0000773E 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 43589 00007741 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 43590                                  
 43591                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 43592                                  
 43593                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 43594                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43595                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 43596                                  ;
 43597                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43598                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 43599                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 43600                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 43601                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43602                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43603                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 43604                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43605                                  
 43606                                  JFNFree:
 43607 00007742 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 43608                                  jfnf1:	
 43609 00007744 E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 43610 00007747 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 43611 00007749 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 43612 0000774D 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 43613 0000774F 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 43614 00007750 EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 43615                                  
 43616                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 43617                                  jfnf5:	
 43618                                  	;mov	al,4
 43619 00007752 B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 43620                                  jfnfx:	
 43621 00007754 C3                      	retn				; bye
 43622                                  
 43623                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 43624                                  
 43625                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 43626                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43627                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 43628                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43629                                  ;
 43630                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 43631                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 43632                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 43633                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 43634                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 43635                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 43636                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 43637                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 43638                                  ;
 43639                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 43640                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 43641                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 43642                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 43643                                  ;
 43644                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43645                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 43646                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 43647                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43648                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43649                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43650                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43651                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 43652                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43653                                  
 43654                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43655                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43656                                  
 43657                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43658                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B8DEh
 43659                                  
 43660                                  SFNFree:
 43661                                  	; 12/08/2018
 43662                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43663                                  	;
 43664                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 43665 00007755 50                      	push	ax
 43666 00007756 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 43667                                  sfnf5:	
 43668 00007758 53                      	push	bx
 43669 00007759 E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 43670 0000775C 5B                      	pop	bx
 43671 0000775D 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 43672 0000775F 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 43673                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 43674 00007763 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 43675                                  	
 43676                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 43677 00007765 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43678                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43679 00007769 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 43680                                  sfnf7:	
 43681 0000776B 43                      	inc	bx			; try the next one
 43682 0000776C EBEA                    	jmp	short sfnf5
 43683                                  
 43684                                  ;	The SFT has the special "busy" mark; if it belongs to us then
 43685                                  ;	it was abandoned during a earlier call and we can use it.
 43686                                  ;
 43687                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43688                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43689                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43690                                  
 43691                                  sfnf10:	
 43692 0000776E 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43693                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43694 00007772 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43695 00007776 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 43696 00007778 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43697                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 43698 0000777C 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43699 00007780 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 43700                                  
 43701                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 43702                                  ;
 43703                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43704                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43705                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43706                                  
 43707                                  sfnf20:
 43708                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43709                                  
 43710                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 43711 00007782 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43712                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 43713                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43714                                  
 43715 00007787 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43716                                  	;mov	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43717 0000778B 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43718 0000778F 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43719                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 43720 00007793 26894531                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43721                                  sfnf21: ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43722                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43723                                  	;pop	ax
 43724                                  	;;clc
 43725                                  	;retn				; return with no error
 43726                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43727 00007797 58                      	pop	ax
 43728                                  	;clc
 43729 00007798 C3                      	retn
 43730                                  
 43731                                  ;**	Error - no more free SFNs
 43732                                  ;
 43733                                  ;	'C' set
 43734                                  ;	(TOS) = saved ax
 43735                                  
 43736                                  sfnf95: 
 43737 00007799 58                      	pop	ax
 43738                                  
 43739                                  ; 11/03/2024
 43740                                  %if 0
 43741                                  	;mov	al,4
 43742                                  	mov	al,error_too_many_open_files
 43743                                  	retn				; return with 'C' and error
 43744                                  %else
 43745                                  	; 11/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43746                                  	;;;

 43748                                  	;;;

 43760                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 43761                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43762                                  ;
 43763                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 43764                                  ;
 43765                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 43766                                  ;		path
 43767                                  ;
 43768                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 43769                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 43770                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 43771                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 43772                                  ;
 43773                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 43774                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 43775                                  ;	USES	all
 43776                                  ;
 43777                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43778                                  
 43779                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43780                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43781                                  
 43782                                  ; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43783                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B926h
 43784                                  
 43785                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0A145h)
 43786                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A72Bh)
 43787                                  
 43788                                  _$CLOSE:
 43789                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 43790                                  
 43791 0000779C E8F702                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 43792 0000779F 722B                    	jc	short CloseError	; error return
 43793 000077A1 16                      	push	ss
 43794 000077A2 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_CLOSE
 43795 000077A3 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 43796 000077A7 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 43797                                  
 43798                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 43799                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 43800                                  ;
 43801                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 43802                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT; if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 43803                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.
 43804                                  
 43805                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1
 43806 000077AB 26833D01                	cmp	word [ES:DI],1		; will the SFT become free?
 43807 000077AF 740A                    	jz	short FreeJFN 		; yes, free JFN anyway.
 43808                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 43809 000077B1 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 43810                                  	;and	al,0F0h
 43811 000077B5 24F0                    	AND	AL,SHARING_MASK
 43812                                  	;cmp	al,70h
 43813 000077B7 3C70                    	CMP	AL,SHARING_NET_FCB
 43814 000077B9 7407                    	JZ	short PostFree		; 70-mode and big ref count => free it
 43815                                  
 43816                                  ; The JFN must be freed. Get the pointer to it and replace the contents with
 43817                                  ; -1.
 43818                                  
 43819                                  FreeJFN:
 43820 000077BB E827FF                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; d = pJFN (handle);
 43821 000077BE 26C605FF                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0FFh	; release the JFN
 43822                                  PostFree:
 43823                                  
 43824                                  ; ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_CLOSE!
 43825                                  
 43826 000077C2 E85EBF                  	call	DOS_CLOSE
 43827                                  
 43828                                  ; DOS_Close may return an error. If we see such an error, we report it but
 43829                                  ; the JFN stays closed because DOS_Close always frees the SFT!
 43830                                  
 43831 000077C5 7205                    	JC	short CloseError
 43832                                  	;mov	ah,3Eh
 43833 000077C7 B43E                    	MOV	AH,CLOSE		; MZ Bogus multiplan fix
 43834                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43835                                  CloseOk:
 43836 000077C9 E99E8E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 43837                                  CloseError:
 43838                                  CommitError:	; 11/03/2024
 43839 000077CC E9A58E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 43840                                  
 43841                                  ;	BREAK <$Commit - commit the file>
 43842                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43843                                  ;
 43844                                  ;**	$Commit - Commit a File
 43845                                  ;
 43846                                  ;	$Commit "commits" a file to disk - all of it's buffers are
 43847                                  ;	flushed out. BUGBUG - I'm pretty sure that $Commit doesn't update
 43848                                  ;	the directory entry, etc., so this commit is pretty useless. check
 43849                                  ;	and fix this!! jgl
 43850                                  ;
 43851                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 43852                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 43853                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Commit
 43854                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 43855                                  ;
 43856                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 43857                                  ;	EXIT	none
 43858                                  ;	USES	all
 43859                                  ;;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43860                                  
 43861                                  _$COMMIT:

 43863                                  
 43864 000077CF E8C402                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 43865                                  	;JC	short CommitError	; error return
 43866                                  	; 11/03/2024
 43867 000077D2 72F8                    	jc	short CommitError
 43868                                  
 43869 000077D4 16                      	push	ss
 43870 000077D5 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_COMMIT
 43871 000077D6 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 43872 000077DA 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 43873                                  
 43874                                  ;	ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_COMMIT
 43875                                  ;
 43876                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 43877                                  
 43878 000077DE E8F5C0                  	call	DOS_COMMIT
 43879 000077E1 72E9                    	JC	short CommitError
 43880                                  	; 07/12/2022
 43881                                  	;jc	short CloseError
 43882                                  	;mov	ah,68h
 43883 000077E3 B468                    	MOV	AH,COMMIT

 43895                                  ;	BREAK <$ExtHandle - extend handle count>
 43896                                  
 43897                                  ;**	$ExtHandle - Extend Handle Count
 43898                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43899                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 43900                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Number of Opens Allowed (MAX=65534;66535 is
 43901                                  ;	    MOV     AX, 6700H			 reserved to mark SFT
 43902                                  ;	    INT     int_command 		 busy )
 43903                                  ;
 43904                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = new number of handles
 43905                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 43906                                  ;		'C' set iff err
 43907                                  ;		  (ax) = error code

 43911                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43912

 43916 000077E7 31ED                    	XOR	BP,BP			; 0: enlarge  1: shrink  2:psp
 43917                                  	;cmp	bx,20

 43919 000077EC 7303                    	JAE	short exth2		; Don't set less than FilPerProc no
 43920 000077EE BB1400                  	MOV	BX,FILPERPROC
 43921                                  exth2:	
 43922 000077F1 368E06[3003]            	MOV	ES,[ss:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block;smr;SS Override
 43923                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:32h]

 43925 000077FB 39CB                    	CMP	BX,CX			; the requested == current
 43926                                  	;JE	short ok_done 		; yes and exit
 43927                                  	; 11/03/2024
 43928 000077FD 74CA                    	je	short CloseOk
 43929 000077FF 771E                    	JA	short larger		; go allocate new table
 43930                                  
 43931                                  ;	We're going to shrink the # of handles available
 43932

 43936                                  
 43937                                  	;mov	ds,[ES:36h]
 43938 00007802 268E1E3600              	MOV	DS,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer+2] ;
 43939 00007807 89DE                    	MOV	SI,BX			;
 43940 00007809 29D9                    	SUB	CX,BX			; get difference
 43941                                  
 43942                                  ;	BUGBUG - code a SCASB here, should be a bit smaller
 43943                                  chck_handles:

 44483                                  ;	       = dup_too_many_open_files

 44486                                  
 44487                                  	; 12/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 44488                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0BBEBh
 44489

 44493                                  _$DUP:

 44495 0000796C E8D3FD                  	call	JFNFree 		; free handle? into ES:DI, new in BX

 44501 00007974 1F                      	pop	ds

 44519                                  ;BREAK <$DUP2 - force a dup on a particular jfn>
 44520                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44521                                  ;
 44522                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 44523                                  ;	    MOV     BX, fh
 44524                                  ;	    MOV     CX, newfh
 44525                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Dup2
 44526                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 44527                                  ;   Error returns:
 44528                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 44529                                  ;
 44530                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44531                                  
 44532                                  _$DUP2:
 44533 00007988 53                      	push	bx
 44534 00007989 51                      	push	cx			; save source
 44535 0000798A 89CB                    	MOV	BX,CX			; get one to close
 44536 0000798C E80DFE                  	call	_$CLOSE			; close destination handle
 44537 0000798F 5B                      	pop	bx
 44538 00007990 58                      	pop	ax			; old in AX, new in BX
 44539 00007991 E851FD                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; get pointer
 44540 00007994 EBD9                    	JMP	short DupErrorCheck	; check error and do dup
 44541                                  
 44542                                  ;BREAK <FileTimes - modify write times on a handle>
 44543                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44544                                  ;
 44545                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 44546                                  ;	    MOV AH, FileTimes (57H)
 44547                                  ;	    MOV AL, func
 44548                                  ;	    MOV BX, handle
 44549                                  ;	; if AL = 1 then then next two are mandatory
 44550                                  ;	    MOV CX, time
 44551                                  ;	    MOV DX, date
 44552                                  ;	    INT 21h
 44553                                  ;	; if AL = 0 then CX/DX has the last write time/date
 44554                                  ;	; for the handle.
 44555                                  ;
 44556                                  ;	AL=02		 get extended attributes
 44557                                  ;	   BX=handle
 44558                                  ;	   CX=size of buffer (0, return max size )
 44559                                  ;	   DS:SI query list (si=-1, selects all EA)
 44560                                  ;	   ES:DI buffer to hold EA list
 44561                                  ;
 44562                                  ;	AL=03		 get EA name list
 44563                                  ;	   BX=handle
 44564                                  ;	   CX=size of buffer (0, return max size )
 44565                                  ;	   ES:DI buffer to hold name list
 44566                                  ;
 44567                                  ;	AL=04		 set extended attributes
 44568                                  ;	   BX=handle
 44569                                  ;	   ES:DI buffer of EA list
 44570                                  ;
 44571                                  ;
 44572                                  ;   Error returns:
 44573                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 44574                                  ;	       = error_invalid_handle

 44576                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 44889                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 44890                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44891                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 44892                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 44893                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 44894                                  ;   that it soes not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 44895                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 44896                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 44897                                  ;
 44898                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 44899                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 44900                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 44901                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 44902                                  ;	USES	none
 44903                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44904                                  
 44905                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44906                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44907                                  CheckOwner:
 44908                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44909                                  
 44910 00007A96 E869FC                  	call	SFFromHandle
 44911 00007A99 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 44912                                  
 44913 00007A9B 50                      	push	ax
 44914                                  
 44915                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 44916                                  
 44917                                  ;SR; WIN386 patch - Do not check for USER_ID for using handles since these 
 44918                                  ;SR; are shared across multiple VMs in win386.
 44919                                  
 44920 00007A9C 36F606[5B0F]01          	test	byte [ss:IsWin386],1 ; 02/06/2019
 44921 00007AA2 7404                    	jz	short no_win386		;win386 is not present
 44922 00007AA4 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			;set the zero flag
 44923 00007AA6 EB08                    	jmp	short _skip_win386	
 44924                                  
 44925                                  no_win386:
 44926 00007AA8 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]		;smr;SS Override
 44927                                  	;cmp	ax,[es:di+47]
 44928 00007AAC 263B452F                	cmp	ax,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID]
 44929                                  
 44930                                  _skip_win386:
 44931 00007AB0 58                      	pop	ax
 44932                                  	
 44933                                  	; 17/12/2022
 44934 00007AB1 7403                    	jz	short co_ret_label
 44935                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 44936                                  	;jnz	short CheckOwner_err
 44937                                  	;retn

 44944                                  co_ret_label:
 44945 00007AB6 C3                      	retn

 44948                                  ; MACRO.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 44949                                  ;============================================================================
 44950                                  ; Retro	DOS v3.0 - 11/07/2018
 44951                                  ; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44952                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 44953                                  
 44954                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 44955                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 44956                                  
 44957                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 44958                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 44959                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 44960                                  
 44961                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 44962                                  ;
 44963                                  ;	$AssignOper
 44964                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 44965                                  ;	InitCDS
 44966                                  ;	$UserOper
 44967                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 44968                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 44969                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 44970                                  ;
 44971                                  ;   Revision history:
 44972                                  ;
 44973                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 44974                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 44975                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 44976                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 44977                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 44978                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 44979                                  ;				    aliasing.
 44980                                  ;
 44981                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 44982                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 44983                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 44984                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 44985                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 44986                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 44987                                  ;
 44988                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 44989                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 44990                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 44991                                  ;
 44992                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 44993                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 44994                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 44995                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 44996                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 44997                                  ;
 44998                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 44999                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 45000                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 45001                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 45002                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 45003                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 45004                                  ;
 45005                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 45006                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 45007                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 45008                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 45009                                  ;   number.
 45010                                  ;
 45011                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 45012                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 45013                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 45014                                  ;   TransPath.
 45015                                  ;
 45016                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 45017                                  
 45018                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 45019                                  
 45020                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 45021                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 45022                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 45023                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 45024                                  ;					; current drive)
 45025                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 45026                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 45027                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 45028                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 45029                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 45030                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 45031                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 45032                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 45033                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error
 45034                                  
 45035                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 45036                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45037                                  ; Inputs:
 45038                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 45039                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 45040                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 45041                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 45042                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 45043                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 45044                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 45045                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 45046                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 45047                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 45048                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 45049                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 45050                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 45051                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 45052                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 45053                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 45054                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 45055                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 45056                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 45057                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 45058                                  ; Function:
 45059                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 45060                                  ; Returns:
 45061                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 45062                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45063                                  
 45064                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45065                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 45076                                  	;cmp	word [si+45h],0

 45085                                  	;OR	word [SI+curdir.flags],curdir_inuse ; set in_use	;AN000;

 45087                                  resetdrv:
 45088                                  	;and	word [si+43h],0BFFFh					;AN000;

 45134                                  ;Break <FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a drive number>
 45135                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45136                                  ;**	FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a Drive #
 45137                                  ;
 45138                                  ;	ENTRY	AL has drive number A = 0
 45139                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set
 45140                                  ;		    No DPB for this drive number
 45141                                  ;		'C' clear
 45142                                  ;		    DS:SI points to DPB for drive
 45143                                  ;	USES	SI, DS, Flags
 45144                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45145                                  
 45146                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45147                                  FIND_DPB:
 45148 00007AF0 36C536[2600]            	LDS	SI,[SS:DPBHEAD]		;smr;SS Override
 45149                                  fdpb5:	
 45150 00007AF5 83FEFF                  	CMP	SI,-1
 45151 00007AF8 7409                    	JZ	short fdpb10
 45152 00007AFA 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si]
 45153                                  	;CMP	AL,[SI+DPB.DRIVE]
 45154 00007AFC 7406                    	jz	short ret_label15	; Carry clear (retz)
 45155                                  	;;lds	si,[si+18h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 45156                                  	;lds	si,[si+19h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 45157 00007AFE C57419                  	LDS	SI,[SI+DPB.NEXT_DPB]
 45158 00007B01 EBF2                    	JMP	short fdpb5
 45159                                  fdpb10:	
 45160 00007B03 F9                      	STC
 45161                                  ret_label15:
 45162 00007B04 C3                      	retn

 45171                                  ;		(ES:DI) = CDS

 45234                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 45235                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45236                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 45237                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 45238                                  ;
 45239                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 45240                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 45241                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 45242                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 45243                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 45244                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 45245                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 45246                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 45247                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 45248                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 45249                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word
 45250                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45251                                  
 45252                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45253                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45254                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45255                                  _$UserOper:
 45256                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45257                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 45258 00007B52 50                      	PUSH	AX
 45259 00007B53 2C01                    	SUB	AL,1			; quick dispatch on 0,1
 45260 00007B55 58                      	POP	AX
 45261 00007B56 720E                    	JB	short UserGet 		; return to user the string
 45262 00007B58 742B                    	JZ	short UserSet 		; set the current user
 45263 00007B5A 3C05                    	CMP	AL,5			; test for 2,3,4 or 5
 45264 00007B5C 763A                    	JBE	short UserPrint		; yep
 45265                                  
 45266                                  ; 13/03/2024
 45267                                  %if 0
 45268                                  	;mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],1
 45269                                  	MOV	byte [SS:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ;smr;SS Override 
 45270                                  					; Extended Error Locus
 45271                                  %else
 45272                                  	; 13/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45273                                  	;;;
 45274 00007B5E E87497                  	call	set_exerr_locus_unk	; Extended Error Locus
 45275                                  	;;;
 45276                                  %endif					
 45277                                  	;error	error_invalid_function	; not 0,1,2,3
 45278                                  	;mov	al,1
 45279 00007B61 B001                    	MOV	AL,error_invalid_function

 45282                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45283 00007B63 E90E8B                  	JMP	SYS_RET_ERR

 45313 00007B8D 07                      	pop	es

 45544                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 45545                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45546                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 45547                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 45548                                  ;
 45549                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 45550                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 45551                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 45552                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 45553                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 45554                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 45555                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 45556                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45557                                  
 45558                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45559                                  TransFCB:
 45560                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45561                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45562                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 45563                                  	;ENTER
 45564 00007C2E 55                      	push	bp
 45565 00007C2F 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 45566                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 45567 00007C31 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 45568 00007C34 16                      	push	ss
 45569 00007C35 07                      	pop	es
 45570 00007C36 06                      	push	es
 45571 00007C37 57                      	push	di
 45572                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 45573                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 45574 00007C38 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 45575 00007C3B 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 45576 00007C41 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 45577 00007C47 E809A6                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 45578                                  	; 06/12/2022
 45579 00007C4A 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 45580 00007C4C 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 45581 00007C4F 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 45582 00007C53 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 45583                                  GetDrive:
 45584 00007C59 AC                      	lodsb				; get drive byte
 45585 00007C5A E862FF                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 45586 00007C5D 722A                    	jc	short BadPack
 45587 00007C5F E87303                  	call	TextFromDrive           ; convert 0-based drive to text
 45588                                  
 45589                                  ; Scan the source to see if there are any illegal chars
 45590                                  
 45591                                  	;mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 45592 00007C62 B90B00                  	mov	cx,11
 45593 00007C65 56                      	push	si			; back over name, ext
 45594                                  FCBScan:
 45595 00007C66 AC                      	lodsb				; get a byte
 45596                                  	
 45597                                  	; 09/08/2018
 45598                                  	;;xlat	byte [es:bx]
 45599                                  	;es	xlat
 45600                                  
 45601                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 45602 00007C67 E894E1                  	call	GetCharType		; get flags
 45603                                  
 45604                                  	;test	al,8	
 45605 00007C6A A808                    	test	al,FFCB
 45606 00007C6C 741B                    	jz	short BadPack
 45607                                  NextCh: 
 45608 00007C6E E2F6                    	loop	FCBScan
 45609 00007C70 5E                      	pop	si
 45610 00007C71 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 45611 00007C73 E83BAA                  	call	PackName                ; crunch the path
 45612 00007C76 5F                      	pop	di			; get original destination
 45613 00007C77 07                      	pop	es
 45614 00007C78 16                      	push	ss			; get DS addressability
 45615 00007C79 1F                      	pop	ds
 45616                                  	;lea	si,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 45617                                  	;LEA	SI,FCBTmp		; point at new pathname
 45618 00007C7A 8D76F0                  	lea	si,[bp-16]
 45619 00007C7D 803F00                  	cmp	byte [bx],0
 45620 00007C80 7407                    	jz	short BadPack
 45621 00007C82 55                      	push	bp
 45622 00007C83 E80E00                  	call	TransPathSet            ; convert the path
 45623 00007C86 5D                      	pop	bp

 45625                                  BadPack:

 45638                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 45639                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45640                                  ;
 45641                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 45642                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 45643                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 45644                                  ;       exactly.
 45645                                  ;
 45646                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 45647                                  ;       matches splice.
 45648                                  ;
 45649                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 45650                                  ;
 45651                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 45652                                  ;
 45653                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 45654                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 45655                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 45656                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 45657                                  ;
 45658                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 45659                                  ;
 45660                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 45661                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 45662                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 45663                                  ;
 45664                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 45665                                  ;
 45666                                  ;       if fSharing then
 45667                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45668                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45669                                  ;           splice
 45670                                  ;           fatRead
 45671                                  ;           return
 45672                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 45673                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 45674                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45675                                  ;           return
 45676                                  ;       if device then
 45677                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45678                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45679                                  ;           return
 45680                                  ;       if file then
 45681                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 45682                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 45683                                  ;           Copy current dir
 45684                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 45685                                  ;           splice
 45686                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 45687                                  ;           if local then
 45688                                  ;               fatread
 45689                                  ;           return
 45690                                  ;
 45691                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45692                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 45693                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45694                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 45695                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 45696                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 45697                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 45698                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 45699                                  ;
 45700                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45701                                  
 45702                                  ; 22/05/2019
 45703                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45704                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45705                                  
 45706                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45707                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45708                                  
 45709                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45710                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0BE1Dh
 45711                                  
 45712                                  TransPath:
 45713 00007C90 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 45714 00007C92 EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 45715                                  TransPathSet:
 45716 00007C94 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45717                                  SetSplice:
 45718 00007C96 36A2[4C03]              	MOV	[SS:NoSetDir],AL	; NoSetDir = !fExact;	;smr;SS Override
 45719 00007C9A B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45720                                  TransPathNoSet:

 45722 00007CA0 36C606[7A05]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CMETA],-1      			;smr;SS Override
 45723 00007CA6 36893E[B205]            	MOV     [SS:WFP_START],DI 				;smr;SS Override
 45724 00007CAB 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override
 45725 00007CB2 16                      	push	ss
 45726 00007CB3 07                      	pop	es
 45727                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 45728 00007CB4 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; end of buffer
 45729                                  ;
 45730                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 45731                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 45732                                  ;
 45733                                  	;TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; if no sharing		;smr;SS Override
 45734                                  	;JZ	short CheckUNC		; skip to UNC check
 45735                                  	; 13/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45736                                  	;;;
 45737 00007CB8 36803E[7205]00          	cmp	byte [ss:FSHARING],0
 45738 00007CBE 7435                    	jz	short CheckUNC
 45739                                  	;;;
 45740                                  ;
 45741                                  ; ES:DI point to buffer
 45742                                  ;
 45743 00007CC0 E8FC02                  	CALL	DriveFromText           ; get drive and advance DS:SI
 45744 00007CC3 E8F9FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; Set ThisCDS and convert to 0-based
 45745 00007CC6 722A                    	jc	short NoPath

 45747 00007CCB 8D5D01                  	LEA	BX,[DI+1]               ; backup limit
 45748 00007CCE E83401                  	CALL	Canonicalize            ; copy and canonicalize
 45749 00007CD1 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors
 45750                                  ;
 45751                                  ; Perform splices for net guys.
 45752                                  ;
 45753 00007CD3 16                      	push	ss
 45754 00007CD4 1F                      	pop	ds
 45755 00007CD5 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START] 		; point to name
 45756 00007CD9 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 45757 00007CDE 7403                    	JZ	short NoServerSplice
 45758 00007CE0 E83102                  	CALL    Splice
 45759                                  NoServerSplice:
 45760 00007CE3 16                      	push	ss
 45761 00007CE4 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; for FATREAD
 45762 00007CE5 C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; for fatread
 45763 00007CE9 E8F59B                  	call	ECritDisk
 45764 00007CEC E89EE8                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 45765 00007CEF E81C9C                  	call	LCritDisk
 45766                                  NoPath:
 45767                                  	;mov	al,3
 45768 00007CF2 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45769 00007CF4 C3                      	retn				; any errors are in Carry flag
 45770                                  
 45771                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 45772                                  ; the name if so.
 45773                                  
 45774                                  CheckUNC:
 45775 00007CF5 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override
 45776                                  	;CallInstall NetSpoolCheck,MultNET,35
 45777 00007CFC B82311                  	mov	ax,1123h
 45778 00007CFF CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - QUALIFY REMOTE FILENAME
 45779                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize
 45780                                  			; ES:DI -> 128-byte buffer for qualified name
 45781                                  			; Return: CF set if not resolved
 45782 00007D01 7329                    	JNC	short UNCDone
 45783                                  
 45784                                  ; At this point the name is either a UNC-style name (prefixed with two leading
 45785                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 45786                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net
 45787                                  ; call. Also, there may be a drive in front of the \\.
 45788                                  
 45789                                  NO_CHECK:
 45790 00007D03 E8B902                  	CALL    DriveFromText		; eat drive letter
 45791 00007D06 50                      	PUSH    AX                      ; save it
 45792 00007D07 8B04                    	MOV     AX,[SI]			; get first two bytes of path
 45793 00007D09 E80DE1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45794 00007D0C 86E0                    	XCHG    AH,AL                   ; swap for second byte
 45795 00007D0E E808E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45796 00007D11 751F                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; not a path char
 45797 00007D13 38C4                    	CMP     AH,AL                   ; are they same?
 45798 00007D15 751B                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; nope
 45799                                  
 45800                                  ; We have a UNC request. We must copy the string up to the beginning of the
 45801                                  ; local machine root path
 45802                                  
 45803 00007D17 58                      	POP     AX
 45804 00007D18 A5                      	MOVSW                           ; get the lead \\.
 45805                                  UNCCpy:
 45806 00007D19 AC                      	LODSB                           ; get a byte
 45807 00007D1A E8A9E0                   	call	UCase                   ;AN000;; convert the char
 45808 00007D1D 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 45809 00007D1F 740E                    	JZ	short UNCTerm		; end of string. All done.
 45810 00007D21 E8F5E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char?
 45811 00007D24 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; backup position
 45812 00007D26 AA                      	STOSB
 45813 00007D27 75F0                    	JNZ	short UNCCpy		; no, go copy
 45814 00007D29 E8D900                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham (and set cMeta)
 45815                                  UNCDone:
 45816 00007D2C 16                      	push	ss
 45817 00007D2D 1F                      	pop	ds
 45818 00007D2E C3                       	retn				; return error code
 45819                                  UNCTerm:
 45820 00007D2F AA                      	STOSB                           ;AN000;
 45821 00007D30 EBFA                    	JMP	short UNCDone		;AN000;
 45822                                  
 45823                                  CheckDevice:
 45824                                  
 45825                                  ; Check DS:SI for device. First eat any path stuff
 45826                                  
 45827 00007D32 58                      	POP     AX                      ; retrieve drive info
 45828 00007D33 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		; check for null file

 45840                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45841                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 45842                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 45843                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 45844                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 45845                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 45846                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 45847                                  ;;;
 45848                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 45849                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 45850                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 45851                                  ;;;
 45852                                  ;;;More info:
 45853                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 45854                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 45855                                  ;;;

 45858                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice

 46075                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 46076                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46077                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 46078                                  ;
 46079                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 46080                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 46081                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 46082                                  ;               BP - end of buffer

 46084                                  ;                   syntax, etc.

 46089                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46090                                  
 46091                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 46248                                  ;   CopyComponent - copy a file component from a path string (DS:SI) into ES:DI

 46364                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 46365                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46366                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 46367                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 46368                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 46369                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 46370                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 46371                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB
 46372                                  ;               String at DS:SI may be reduced in length by removing prefix
 46373                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.
 46374                                  ;               CX = 0 If no splice done
 46375                                  ;               CX <> 0 otherwise
 46376                                  ;               ThisCDS points to proper CDS if spliced, otherwise it is
 46377                                  ;                   left alone
 46378                                  ;               ThisDPB points to proper DPB
 46379                                  ;   Registers modified: DS:SI, ES:DI, BX,AX,CX
 46380                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 46461                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 46462                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46463                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 46464                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 46465                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 46466                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 46467                                  ;
 46468                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source string for translation
 46469                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer
 46470                                  ;   Outputs:
 46471                                  ;       Carry Clear
 46472                                  ;               Buffer at ES:DI is filled in with data
 46473                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer
 46474                                  ;       Carry Set
 46475                                  ;               AX = error_path_not_found
 46476                                  ;   Registers modified: all

 46481 00007F9B 56                      	push	si
 46482 00007F9C 06                      	push	es

 46484 00007F9E 51                      	push	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 46485                                  	
 46486                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 46488                                  ;
 46489                                  ; Sattrib must be set up with default values here. Otherwise, the value from
 46490                                  ; a previous DOS call is used for attrib and DevName thinks it is not a 
 46491                                  ; device if the old call set the volume attribute bit. Note that devname in
 46492                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 46493                                  ; and restore CX.
 46494                                  
 46495                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 46496 00007F9F B516                    	mov     ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 46497 00007FA1 E8E702                  	call	SetAttrib

 46504 00007FAA 59                      	pop	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 46505 00007FAB 5F                      	pop     di

 46507 00007FAD 5E                      	pop     si
