 48530                                  
 48531                                  ; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48532                                  ;%if 1
 48533                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48534                                  ;%if 0
 48535                                  
 48536                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48537                                  ;
 48538                                  ; procedure : Rational386Patch
 48539                                  ;
 48540                                  ; Older versions of the Rational DOS Extender have several bugs which trash
 48541                                  ; 386 registers (usually just the high word of 32 bit registers) during
 48542                                  ; interrupt processing. Lotus 123 3.1+ is a popular application that uses a
 48543                                  ; version of the Rational extender with the 32 bit register trashing bugs.
 48544                                  ;
 48545                                  ; This routine applies patches to the Rational DOS Extender to work around
 48546                                  ; most of the register trashing bugs.
 48547                                  ;
 48548                                  ; Note that there are additional register trashing bugs not fixed by these
 48549                                  ; patches. In particular, the high word of ESP and the FS and GS registers
 48550                                  ; may be modified on interrupts.
 48551                                  ;
 48552                                  ; There are two different Rational DOS Extender patchs in this module.
 48553                                  ; Rational386Patch is to correct 386 register trashing bugs on 386 or later
 48554                                  ; processors. This patch code is executed when MS-DOS is running on a 386
 48555                                  ; or later processor, regardless of whether MS-DOS is running in the HMA
 48556                                  ; or not.
 48557                                  ;
 48558                                  ; The other Rational patch routine (RationalPatch, below) fixes a register
 48559                                  ; trashing problem on 286 processors, and is only executed if MS-DOS is
 48560                                  ; running in the HMA.
 48561                                  ;
 48562                                  ; This patch detection and replacement is based on an example supplied by
 48563                                  ; Ben Williams at Rational.
 48564                                  ;
 48565                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48566                                  
 48567                                  ; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48568                                  ; DOSCODE:B448h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 48569                                  
 48570                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48571                                  ;
 48572                                  ; INPUT : ES = segment where program got loaded
 48573                                  ;
 48574                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48575                                  
 48576                                  rpFind1:
 48577 00008549 FAE4216033C0E6438B-     	db	0FAh, 0E4h, 21h, 60h, 33h, 0C0h, 0E6h, 43h, 8Bh, 16h
 48577 00008552 16                 
 48578                                  
 48579                                  rpFind1Len equ	$ - rpFind1
 48580                                  
 48581                                  ;	cli
 48582                                  ;	in	al, 21h
 48583                                  ;	pusha
 48584                                  ;	xor	ax, ax
 48585                                  ;	out	43h, al
 48586                                  ;	mov	dx, ...
 48587                                  
 48588                                  rpFind1a:
 48589 00008553 B00EE63733C0E6F2        	db	0B0h, 0Eh, 0E6h, 37h, 33h, 0C0h, 0E6h, 0F2h
 48590                                  
 48591                                  rpFind1aLen equ	$ - rpFind1a
 48592                                  
 48593                                  ;	mov	al, 0Eh
 48594                                  ;	out	37h, al
 48595                                  ;	xor	ax, ax
 48596                                  ;	out	0F2h, al
 48597                                  
 48598                                  ; bug # 1 -- loss of high EAX on 386+ if not VCPI or DPMI
 48599                                  
 48600                                  rpFind2:
 48601 0000855B 0F20C0                  	db	0Fh, 20h, 0C0h
 48602                                  
 48603                                  rpFind2Len equ	$ - rpFind2
 48604                                  
 48605                                  ;	mov	eax, cr0	;may be preceeded by PUSH CX (51h)
 48606                                  
 48607                                  rpFind3:
 48608 0000855E 0F22C0EA                	db	0Fh, 22h, 0C0h, 0EAh
 48609                                  
 48610                                  rpFind3Len equ	$ - rpFind3
 48611                                  
 48612                                  ;	mov	cr0, eax	;may be preceeded by POP CX (59h)
 48613                                  ;	jmp	far ptr xxx	;change far ptr to go to replace3
 48614                                  ;	mov	ss, bx		;8E D3 ... and come back at or after this
 48615                                  
 48616                                  ; note, there is no rpRepl1 string
 48617                                  
 48618                                  rpRepl2:
 48619 00008562 6650510F20C0             	db	66h, 50h, 51h, 0Fh, 20h, 0C0h
 48620                                  
 48621                                  rpRepl2Len equ	$ - rpRepl2
 48622                                  
 48623                                  ;	push	eax
 48624                                  ;	push	cx
 48625                                  ;	mov	eax, cr0
 48626                                  
 48627                                  rpRepl3:
 48628 00008568 8ED3596658              	db	8Eh, 0D3h, 59h, 66h, 58h
 48629                                  
 48630                                  rpRepl3Len equ	$ - rpRepl3
 48631                                  
 48632                                  ;	mov	ss, bx
 48633                                  ;	pop	cx
 48634                                  ;	pop	eax
 48635                                  
 48636                                  ; bug # 2 -- loss of high EAX and ESI on 386+ only if VCPI
 48637                                  
 48638                                  rpFind4:
 48639 0000856D 93588BCC                	db	93h, 58h, 8Bh, 0CCh
 48640                                  
 48641                                  rpFind4Len equ	$ - rpFind4
 48642                                  
 48643                                  ;	xchg	bx, ax
 48644                                  ;	pop	ax
 48645                                  ;	mov	cx, sp
 48646                                  
 48647                                  rpFind5:
 48648 00008571 B80CDECD678BE1FFE3      	db	0B8h, 0Ch, 0DEh, 0CDh, 67h, 8Bh, 0E1h, 0FFh, 0E3h
 48649                                  
 48650                                  rpFind5Len equ	$ - rpFind5
 48651                                  
 48652                                  ;	mov	ax, DE0Ch
 48653                                  ;	int	67h
 48654                                  ;	mov	sp, cx
 48655                                  ;	jmp	bx
 48656                                  
 48657                                  rpRepl4:
 48658 0000857A 93588BCC                	db	93h, 58h, 8Bh, 0CCh
 48659 0000857E 2E66A3                  	db	02Eh, 066h, 0A3h
 48660                                  
 48661                                  rpRepl4o1Len equ $ - rpRepl4
 48662                                  
 48663 00008581 0000                    	db	00h, 00h
 48664 00008583 2E668936                	db	02Eh, 066h, 89h, 36h
 48665                                  
 48666                                  rpRepl4o2Len equ $ - rpRepl4
 48667                                  
 48668 00008587 0000                    	db	00h, 00h
 48669                                  
 48670                                  rpRepl4Len equ	$ - rpRepl4
 48671                                  
 48672                                  ;	xchg	bx, ax
 48673                                  ;	pop	ax
 48674                                  ;	mov	cx, sp
 48675                                  ;	mov	dword ptr cs:[xxxx], eax
 48676                                  ;	mov	dword ptr cs:[xxxx], esi
 48677                                  
 48678                                  rpRepl5:
 48679 00008589 8BE1                    	db	8Bh, 0E1h
 48680 0000858B 2E66A1                  	db	2Eh, 66h, 0A1h
 48681                                  
 48682                                  rpRepl5o1Len equ $ - rpRepl5
 48683                                  
 48684 0000858E 0000                    	db	00h, 00h
 48685 00008590 2E668B36                	db	2Eh, 66h, 8Bh, 36h
 48686                                  
 48687                                  rpRepl5o2Len equ $ - rpRepl5
 48688                                  
 48689 00008594 0000                    	db	00h, 00h
 48690 00008596 FFE3                    	db	0FFh, 0E3h
 48691                                  
 48692                                  rpRepl5Len equ	$ - rpRepl5
 48693                                  
 48694                                  ;	mov	sp, cx
 48695                                  ;	mov	eax, dword ptr cs:[xxxx]
 48696                                  ;	mov	esi, dword ptr cs:[xxxx]
 48697                                  ;	jmp	bx
 48698                                  
 48699                                  ; bug # 3 -- loss of high EAX, EBX, ECX, EDX on 386+ only if VCPI
 48700                                  
 48701                                  rpFind6:
 48702 00008598 FA5251                  	db	0FAh, 52h, 51h
 48703                                  
 48704                                  rpFind6Len equ	$ - rpFind6
 48705                                  
 48706                                  ;	cli
 48707                                  ;	push	dx
 48708                                  ;	push	cx
 48709                                  
 48710                                  rpFind7a:
 48711 0000859B B80CDE6626FF1E          	db	0B8h, 0Ch, 0DEh, 66h, 26h, 0FFh, 1Eh
 48712                                  
 48713                                  rpFind7aLen equ	$ - rpFind7a
 48714                                  
 48715                                  ;	mov	ax, 0DE0Ch
 48716                                  ;	call	fword ptr es:[xxxx]
 48717                                  
 48718                                  rpFind7b:
 48719 000085A2 595A5B                  	db	59h, 5Ah, 5Bh
 48720                                  
 48721                                  rpFind7bLen equ	$ - rpFind7b
 48722                                  
 48723                                  ;	pop	cx
 48724                                  ;	pop	dx
 48725                                  ;	pop	bx
 48726                                  
 48727                                  rpRepl6:
 48728 000085A5 FA6650665366516652      	db	0FAh, 66h, 50h, 66h, 53h, 66h, 51h, 66h, 52h
 48729                                  
 48730                                  rpRepl6Len equ	$ - rpRepl6
 48731                                  
 48732                                  ;	cli
 48733                                  ;	push	eax
 48734                                  ;	push	ebx
 48735                                  ;	push	ecx
 48736                                  ;	push	edx
 48737                                  
 48738                                  rpRepl7:
 48739 000085AE 665A6659665B66585B      	db	66h, 5Ah, 66h, 59h, 66h, 5Bh, 66h, 58h, 5Bh
 48740                                  
 48741                                  rpRepl7Len equ	$ - rpRepl7
 48742                                  
 48743                                  ;	pop	edx
 48744                                  ;	pop	ecx
 48745                                  ;	pop	ebx
 48746                                  ;	pop	eax
 48747                                  ;	pop	bx
 48748                                  
 48749                                  ; bug # 4 -- loss of high EAX and EBX on 386+ only if VCPI
 48750                                  
 48751                                  rpFind8:
 48752 000085B7 60061EB800008ED8         	db	60h, 06h, 1Eh, 0B8h, 00h, 00h, 8Eh, 0D8h
 48753                                  
 48754                                  rpFind8Len equ	$ - rpFind8
 48755                                  
 48756                                  ;	pusha
 48757                                  ;	push	es
 48758                                  ;	push	ds
 48759                                  ;	mov	ax, dgroup	;jump back to here from replace8
 48760                                  ;	mov	ds, ax
 48761                                  
 48762                                  rpFind9 :
 48763 000085BF 1F0761                  	db	1Fh, 07h, 61h
 48764                                  
 48765                                  rpFind9Len equ	$ - rpFind9
 48766                                  
 48767                                  ;	pop	ds
 48768                                  ;	pop	es
 48769                                  ;	popa
 48770                                  
 48771                                  rpRepl8:
 48772 000085C2 6660061E                 	db	66h, 60h, 06h, 1Eh
 48773                                  
 48774                                  rpRepl8Len equ	$ - rpRepl8
 48775                                  
 48776                                  ;	pushad
 48777                                  ;	push	es
 48778                                  ;	push	ds
 48779                                  
 48780                                  rpRepl9:
 48781 000085C6 1F076661C3              	db	1Fh, 07h, 66h, 61h, 0C3h
 48782                                  
 48783                                  rpRepl9Len equ	$ - rpRepl9
 48784                                  
 48785                                  ;	pop	ds
 48786                                  ;	pop	es
 48787                                  ;	popad
 48788                                  ;	retn			;no need to jmp back to main-line
 48789                                  
 48790                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48791                                  
 48792                                  struc SearchPair
 48793 00000000 ????                     .sp_off1: resw 1	; offset of 1st search string
 48794 00000002 ????                     .sp_len1: resw 1	; length of 1st search string
 48795 00000004 ????                     .sp_off2: resw 1	; 2nd string
 48796 00000006 ????                     .sp_len2: resw 1	; 2nd string
 48797 00000008 ????                     .sp_diff: resw 1	; max difference between offsets
 48798                                   .size:
 48799                                  endstruc
 48800                                  
 48801                                  ;rpBug1Strs SearchPair	<offset rpFind2, rpFind2Len, offset rpFind3, rpFind3Len, 20h>
 48802                                  
 48803                                  rpBug1Strs:
 48804 000085CB [5B85]                  	dw	rpFind2
 48805 000085CD 0300                    	dw	rpFind2Len ; 3
 48806 000085CF [5E85]                  	dw	rpFind3
 48807 000085D1 0400                    	dw	rpFind3Len ; 4
 48808 000085D3 2000                    	dw	20h
 48809                                  
 48810                                  ;rpBug2Strs SearchPair	<offset rpFind4, rpFind4Len, offset rpFind5, rpFind5Len, 80h>
 48811                                  
 48812                                  rpBug2Strs:
 48813 000085D5 [6D85]                  	dw	rpFind4
 48814 000085D7 0400                    	dw	rpFind4Len ; 4
 48815 000085D9 [7185]                  	dw	rpFind5
 48816 000085DB 0900                    	dw	rpFind5Len ; 9
 48817 000085DD 8000                    	dw	80h
 48818                                  
 48819                                  ;rpBug3Strs SearchPair	<offset rpFind6, rpFind6Len, offset rpFind7a, rpFind7aLen, 80h>
 48820                                  
 48821                                  rpBug3Strs:
 48822 000085DF [9885]                  	dw	rpFind6
 48823 000085E1 0300                    	dw	rpFind6Len ; 3
 48824 000085E3 [9B85]                  	dw	rpFind7a
 48825 000085E5 0700                    	dw	rpFind7aLen ; 7
 48826 000085E7 8000                    	dw	80h
 48827                                  
 48828                                  ;rpBug4Strs SearchPair	<offset rpFind8, 4, offset rpFind9, rpFind9Len, 80h>
 48829                                  
 48830                                  rpBug4Strs:
 48831 000085E9 [B785]                  	dw	rpFind8
 48832 000085EB 0400                    	dw	rpRepl8Len ; 4	; 20/03/2024
 48833 000085ED [BF85]                  	dw	rpFind9
 48834 000085EF 0300                    	dw	rpFind9Len ; 3
 48835 000085F1 8000                    	dw	80h
 48836                                  
 48837                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48838                                  
 48839                                  struc StackVars
 48840 00000000 ????                     .sv_wVersion:	resw 1		; Rational extender version #
 48841 00000002 ????                     .sv_cbCodeSeg: resw 1		; code seg size to scan
 48842 00000004 ????                     .sv_pPatch:	resw 1		; offset of next avail patch byte
 48843                                   .size:
 48844                                  endstruc
 48845                                  
 48846                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48847                                  
 48848                                  ; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48849                                  
 48850                                  Rational386Patch:
 48851                                  	; Do a few quick checks to see if this looks like a Rational
 48852                                  	; Extended application. Hopefully this will quickly weed out
 48853                                  	; most non Rational apps.
 48854                                  
 48855 000085F3 26813E00008B01          	cmp	word [es:0],395		; version number goes here - versions
 48856 000085FA 7322                    	jae	short rp3QuickOut	;   3.95+ don't need patching
 48857                                  
 48858 000085FC 26833E0C0020            	cmp	word [es:0Ch],20h	; always has this value here
 48859 00008602 751A                    	jne	short rp3QuickOut
 48860                                  
 48861 00008604 50                      	push	ax ; *
 48862                                  
 48863 00008605 B81800                  	mov	ax,18h 			; extender has 18h at
 48864 00008608 2639061800              	cmp	[es:24],ax		;   offsets 24, 28, & 36
 48865 0000860D 750E                    	jne	short rp3QO_ax
 48866 0000860F 2639061C00              	cmp	[es:28],ax
 48867 00008614 7507                    	jne	short rp3QO_ax
 48868 00008616 2639062400              	cmp	[es:36],ax
 48869 0000861B 7402                    	je	short rp3Maybe
 48870                                  rp3QO_ax:
 48871 0000861D 58                      	pop	ax
 48872                                  rp3QuickOut:
 48873 0000861E C3                      	retn
 48874                                  
 48875                                  ; It might be the rational extender, do more extensive checking
 48876                                  
 48877                                  rp3Maybe:
 48878 0000861F FC                      	cld
 48879                                  
 48880                                  ; 20/03/2024
 48881                                  %if 0
 48882                                  	push	bx			; note ax pushed above
 48883                                  	push	cx
 48884                                  	push	dx
 48885                                  	push	si
 48886                                  	push	di
 48887                                  	push	es
 48888                                  	push	ds			; we use all of them
 48889                                  	push	bp
 48890                                  %else
 48891                                  	; 20/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48892                                  	;;;
 48893 00008620 60                      	pusha
 48894 00008621 06                      	push	es
 48895 00008622 1E                      	push	ds
 48896                                  	;;;	
 48897                                  %endif
 48898 00008623 83EC06                  	sub	sp,StackVars.size  ; 6	; make space for stack variables
 48899 00008626 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 48900                                  
 48901 00008628 0E                      	push	cs
 48902 00008629 1F                      	pop	ds
 48903                                  
 48904 0000862A 26A10000                	mov	ax,[es:0]		; save version #
 48905                                  	;mov	[bp+StackVars.sv_wVersion],ax
 48906 0000862E 894600                  	mov	[bp],ax	
 48907                                  					; check that binary version # matches
 48908 00008631 E89901                  	call	VerifyVersion		;   ascii string
 48909 00008634 7521                    	jne	short rp3Exit_j
 48910                                  
 48911                                  ; Looks like this is it, find where to put the patch code.  The
 48912                                  ; patch will be located on top of Rational code specific to 80286
 48913                                  ; processors, so these patchs MUST NOT be applied if running on
 48914                                  ; an 80286 system.
 48915                                  
 48916                                  	; Rational says the code to patch will never be beyond offset 46xxh
 48917                                  
 48918 00008636 B90045                  	mov	cx,4500h		; force search len to 4700h (searches
 48919                                  	;mov	[bp+2],cx
 48920 00008639 894E02                  	mov	[bp+StackVars.sv_cbCodeSeg],cx	; start at offset 200h)
 48921                                  
 48922 0000863C 268E062000              	mov	es,[es:20h]		; es=code segment
 48923                                  
 48924 00008641 BE[4985]                	mov	si,rpFind1		; string to find
 48925 00008644 BA0A00                  	mov	dx,rpFind1Len ; 10	; length to match
 48926 00008647 E86B01                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq
 48927 0000864A 740E                    	jz	short rpGotPatch
 48928                                  
 48929                                  ; According to Rational, some very old versions of the extender may not
 48930                                  ; have the find1 code sequence. If the find1 code wasn't found above,
 48931                                  ; try an alternative patch area which is on top of NEC 98xx switching code.
 48932                                  
 48933 0000864C BE[5385]                	mov	si,rpFind1a
 48934 0000864F BA0800                  	mov	dx,rpFind1aLen  ;8
 48935 00008652 E86001                  	call	ScanCodeSeq
 48936 00008655 7403                    	jz	short rpGotPatch
 48937                                  
 48938                                  rp3Exit_j:
 48939 00008657 E9FE00                  	jmp	rp3Exit
 48940                                  
 48941                                  ; Found the location to write patch code! DI = offset in code seg.
 48942                                  
 48943                                  rpGotPatch:
 48944                                  	;mov	[bp+4],di
 48945 0000865A 897EFC                  	mov	[bp-StackVars.sv_pPatch],di	; save patch pointer
 48946                                  
 48947                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48948                                  ; Bug # 1 -- loss of high EAX on 386+ if not VCPI or DPMI
 48949                                  
 48950                                  	;cmp	word [bp+0],381
 48951                                  	;cmp	word [bp+StackVars.sv_wVersion],381 ; only need bug 1 if version
 48952 0000865D 817E007D01              	cmp	word [bp],381
 48953 00008662 7348                    	jae	short rpBug2			;   < 3.81
 48954                                  
 48955 00008664 BB[CB85]                	mov	bx,rpBug1Strs			; locate find2 & find3 code
 48956 00008667 E8F600                  	call	FindBadCode
 48957 0000866A 7240                    	jc	short rpBug2
 48958                                  
 48959                                  ; si = rpFind2 offset, di = rpFind3 offset
 48960                                  
 48961 0000866C 57                      	push	di
 48962 0000866D 89F7                    	mov	di,si				; rpFind2 offset
 48963 0000866F BA0300                  	mov	dx,rpFind2Len ; 3
 48964                                  
 48965 00008672 26807DFF51              	cmp	byte [es:di-1],51h	 	; find2 preceeded by push cx?
 48966 00008677 7502                    	jne	short rp_no_cx
 48967                                  
 48968 00008679 4F                      	dec	di				;   yes, gobble up push cx too
 48969 0000867A 42                      	inc	dx
 48970                                  rp_no_cx:
 48971 0000867B BE[6285]                	mov	si,rpRepl2			; patch out find2 sequence
 48972 0000867E B90600                  	mov	cx,rpRepl2Len  ; 6
 48973 00008681 E80501                  	call	GenPatch
 48974                                  
 48975 00008684 5F                      	pop	di				; rpFind3 offset
 48976 00008685 26807DFF59              	cmp	byte [es:di-1],59h 		; find3 preceeded by pop cx?
 48977 0000868A 7505                    	jne	short rp_no_cx2
 48978                                  
 48979 0000868C 26C645FF90              	mov	byte [es:di-1],90h		;   yes, no-op it
 48980                                  rp_no_cx2:
 48981                                  	;mov	ax,[bp+4]
 48982 00008691 8B4604                  	mov	ax,[bp+StackVars.sv_pPatch]	; change offset of far jmp
 48983                                  	;mov	[es:di+4],ax
 48984 00008694 26894504                	mov	[es:di+rpFind3Len],ax		;   to go to patch code
 48985                                  
 48986 00008698 57                      	push	di				; save find3 offset
 48987 00008699 BE[6885]                	mov	si,rpRepl3			; copy repl3 to patch area
 48988 0000869C B90500                  	mov	cx,rpRepl3Len ; 5
 48989 0000869F E8FB00                  	call	CopyPatch
 48990                                  
 48991 000086A2 5B                      	pop	bx				; find3 offset
 48992 000086A3 83C308                  	add	bx,rpFind3Len+4	 ; 8		; skip over find3 and far jmp
 48993 000086A6 E80001                  	call	GenJump 			; jmp back from patch area
 48994                                  	;mov	[bp+4],di
 48995 000086A9 897E04                  	mov	[bp+StackVars.sv_pPatch], di	;   to main-line, update patch
 48996                                  						;   area pointer
 48997                                  
 48998                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48999                                  ; Bug # 2 -- loss of high regs on 386+ under VCPI only
 49000                                  
 49001                                  rpBug2:
 49002 000086AC BB[D585]                	mov	bx,rpBug2Strs			; locate find4 & find5 code
 49003 000086AF E8AE00                  	call	FindBadCode
 49004 000086B2 7242                    	jc	short rpBug3
 49005                                  
 49006                                  ; si = rpFind4 offset, di = rpFind5 offset
 49007                                  
 49008                                  	;push	word [bp+4]
 49009 000086B4 FF7604                  	push	word [bp+StackVars.sv_pPatch]	; save current patch pointer
 49010                                  						;   (where repl4 goes)
 49011 000086B7 57                      	push	di				; save find5 offset
 49012                                  
 49013 000086B8 89F7                    	mov	di,si
 49014 000086BA BA0400                  	mov	dx,rpFind4Len ; 4
 49015 000086BD BE[7A85]                	mov	si,rpRepl4
 49016 000086C0 B90F00                  	mov	cx,rpRepl4Len ; 15
 49017 000086C3 E8C300                  	call	GenPatch			; patch out find4 code
 49018                                  
 49019 000086C6 5F                      	pop	di				; find5 offset
 49020 000086C7 83C705                  	add	di,5				; keep 5 bytes of find5 code
 49021                                  	;mov	bx,[bp+4]
 49022 000086CA 8B5E04                  	mov	bx,[bp+StackVars.sv_pPatch]	; jump to patch area
 49023 000086CD 53                      	push	bx				; save repl5 location
 49024 000086CE E8D800                  	call	GenJump
 49025                                  
 49026 000086D1 BE[8985]                	mov	si,rpRepl5			; copy repl5 code to patch
 49027 000086D4 B90F00                  	mov	cx,rpRepl5Len  ; 15		;   area -- it has a jmp bx
 49028 000086D7 E8C300                  	call	CopyPatch			;   so no need to jmp back to
 49029                                  						;   main-line code
 49030                                  
 49031                                  ; patches have been made, now update the patch code to store/load dwords just
 49032                                  ; after the code in the patch area
 49033                                  
 49034 000086DA 5F                      	pop	di				; repl5 location
 49035 000086DB 5E                      	pop	si				; repl4 location
 49036                                  
 49037                                  	;mov	ax,[bp+4]
 49038 000086DC 8B4604                  	mov	ax,[bp+StackVars.sv_pPatch]	; (where dwords go)
 49039                                  
 49040                                  	;mov	[es:si+7],ax
 49041 000086DF 26894407                	mov	[es:si+rpRepl4o1Len],ax		; offset for EAX
 49042                                  	;mov	[es:di+5],ax
 49043 000086E3 26894505                	mov	[es:di+rpRepl5o1Len],ax
 49044 000086E7 83C004                  	add	ax,4
 49045                                  	;mov	[es:si+0Dh],ax
 49046 000086EA 2689440D                	mov	[es:si+rpRepl4o2Len],ax		; offset for ESI
 49047                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Bh],ax
 49048 000086EE 2689450B                	mov	[es:di+rpRepl5o2Len],ax
 49049                                  
 49050                                  	;add	word [bp+4],8
 49051 000086F2 83460408                	add	word [bp+StackVars.sv_pPatch],8	; reserve space for 2 dwords in
 49052                                  						; patch area
 49053                                  
 49054                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49055                                  ; Bug # 3 -- loss of high regs on 386+ under VCPI only
 49056                                  
 49057                                  rpBug3:
 49058 000086F6 BB[DF85]                	mov	bx,rpBug3Strs			; locate find6 & find7a code
 49059 000086F9 E86400                  	call	FindBadCode
 49060 000086FC 722C                    	jc	short rpBug4
 49061                                  
 49062                                  	;add	di,9
 49063 000086FE 83C709                  	add	di,rpFind7aLen + 2		; skip over offset in find7a
 49064 00008701 56                      	push	si				;   code and locate find7b
 49065 00008702 BE[A285]                	mov	si,rpFind7b			;   sequence

 49078

 49084

 49138                                  
 49139                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49140                                  ;
 49141                                  ; FindBadCode
 49142                                  ;
 49143                                  ; Searches Rational code segment looking for a pair of find strings (all
 49144                                  ; patches have at least two find strings).
 49145                                  ;
 49146                                  ; Entry:
 49147                                  ;	ES    = code segment to search
 49148                                  ;	DS:BX = search pair structure for this search
 49149                                  ;	[bp].sv_cbCodeSeg = length of code seg to search
 49150                                  ;
 49151                                  ; Exit:
 49152                                  ;	CY flag clear if both strings found, and
 49153                                  ;	SI    = offset in ES of 1st string
 49154                                  ;	DI    = offset in ES of 2nd string
 49155                                  ;	CY set if either string not found, or strings too far apart
 49156                                  ;
 49157                                  ; Used:
 49158                                  ;	CX
 49159                                  ;
 49160                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49161                                  
 49162                                  ;struc SearchPair
 49163                                  ; .sp_off1: resw 1	; offset of 1st search string
 49164                                  ; .sp_len1: resw 1	; length of 1st search string
 49165                                  ; .sp_off2: resw 1	; 2nd string
 49166                                  ; .sp_len2: resw 1	; 2nd string
 49167                                  ; .sp_diff: resw 1	; max difference between offsets
 49168                                  ; .size:
 49169                                  ;endstruc
 49170                                  
 49171                                  FindBadCode:
 49172                                  	;mov	cx,[bp+2]
 49173 00008760 8B4E02                  	mov	cx,[bp+StackVars.sv_cbCodeSeg]	; search length
 49174                                  
 49175 00008763 8B37                    	mov	si,[bx]	; mov si,[bx+0]
 49176                                  	;mov	si,[bx+Searchpair.sp_off1] ; ds:si -> search string
 49177                                  	
 49178                                  	;mov	dx,[bx+2]
 49179 00008765 8B5702                  	mov	dx,[bx+SearchPair.sp_len1] ; dx = search len
 49180 00008768 E84A00                  	call	ScanCodeSeq
 49181 0000876B 751A                    	jnz	short fbc_error		; done if 1st not found
 49182                                  
 49183 0000876D 57                      	push	di			; save 1st string offset
 49184                                  
 49185                                  	;mov	si,[bx+4]
 49186 0000876E 8B7704                  	mov	si,[bx+SearchPair.sp_off2]
 49187                                  	;mov	dx,[bx+6]
 49188 00008771 8B5706                  	mov	dx,[bx+SearchPair.sp_len2]
 49189 00008774 E84100                  	call	ScanCodeSeq_di		; don't change flags after this!
 49190                                  
 49191 00008777 5E                      	pop	si			; restore 1st string offset
 49192 00008778 750D                    	jnz	short fbc_error
 49193                                  
 49194 0000877A 89F8                    	mov	ax,di			; sanity check that
 49195 0000877C 29F0                    	sub	ax,si			;   si < di && di - si <= allowed diff
 49196 0000877E 7207                    	jc	short fbc_error
 49197                                  	;cmp	ax,[bx+8]
 49198 00008780 3B4708                  	cmp	ax,[bx+SearchPair.sp_diff]
 49199 00008783 7702                    	ja	short fbc_error
 49200                                  
 49201 00008785 F8                      	clc
 49202 00008786 C3                      	retn
 49203                                  
 49204                                  fbc_error:
 49205 00008787 F9                      	stc
 49206 00008788 C3                      	retn
 49207                                  
 49208                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49209                                  ;
 49210                                  ; GenPatch
 49211                                  ;
 49212                                  ; Generate a patch sequence. 1) insert a jump at the buggy code location
 49213                                  ; (jumps to the patch code area), 2) copy the selected patch code to the
 49214                                  ; patch area, 3) insert a jump from the patch area back to the main-line
 49215                                  ; code.
 49216                                  ;
 49217                                  ; Entry:
 49218                                  ;	ES:DI = start of buggy code to be patched
 49219                                  ;	DX    = length of buggy code to be patched
 49220                                  ;	DS:SI = replacement patch code
 49221                                  ;	CX    = length of replacement patch code
 49222                                  ;	[bp].sv_pPatch = offset in ES of where to copy patch code
 49223                                  ;
 49224                                  ; Exit:
 49225                                  ;	DI, [bp].sv_pPatch = byte after generated patch code
 49226                                  ;
 49227                                  ; Used:
 49228                                  ;	AX, BX, SI, Flags
 49229                                  ;
 49230                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49231                                  
 49232                                  GenPatch:
 49233 00008789 57                      	push	di			;save offset of buggy code
 49234                                  
 49235                                  	;mov	bx,[bp+4]
 49236 0000878A 8B5E04                  	mov	bx,[bp+StackVars.sv_pPatch]
 49237                                  					;jump from buggy code to patch area
 49238 0000878D E81900                  	call	GenJump
 49239                                  
 49240 00008790 E80A00                  	call	CopyPatch		;copy replacement code to patch area
 49241                                  
 49242 00008793 5B                      	pop	bx			;offset of buggy code + buggy code
 49243 00008794 01D3                    	add	bx,dx			;  length = return from patch offset
 49244                                  
 49245 00008796 E81000                  	call	GenJump 		;jump from patch area back to main-
 49246                                  	;mov	[bp+4],di
 49247 00008799 897E04                  	mov	[bp+StackVars.sv_pPatch],di
 49248                                  					;  line code, update patch pointer
 49249 0000879C C3                      	retn
 49250                                  
 49251                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49252                                  ;
 49253                                  ; CopyPatch
 49254                                  ;
 49255                                  ; Copies patch code to patch location.
 49256                                  ;
 49257                                  ; Entry:
 49258                                  ;	DS:SI = patch code to be copied
 49259                                  ;	ES    = segment of code to patch
 49260                                  ;	CX    = length of code to copy
 49261                                  ;	[bp].sv_pPatch = offset in ES of where to copy patch code
 49262                                  ;
 49263                                  ; Exit:
 49264                                  ;	DI, [bp].sv_pPatch = byte after copied patch code
 49265                                  ;
 49266                                  ; Used:
 49267                                  ;	SI, Flags
 49268                                  ;
 49269                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49270                                  
 49271                                  CopyPatch:
 49272 0000879D 51                      	push	cx
 49273                                  	;mov	di,[bp+4]
 49274 0000879E 8B7E04                  	mov	di,[bp+StackVars.sv_pPatch] ;patch pointer is the dest offset
 49275 000087A1 FC                      	cld
 49276 000087A2 F3A4                    	rep movsb
 49277 000087A4 59                      	pop	cx
 49278                                  	;mov	[bp+4],di
 49279 000087A5 897E04                  	mov	[bp+StackVars.sv_pPatch],di ;update net pointer location
 49280 000087A8 C3                      	retn
 49281                                  
 49282                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49283                                  ;
 49284                                  ; GenJump
 49285                                  ;
 49286                                  ; Generates a rel16 JMP instruction at location 'from' to location 'to'.
 49287                                  ;
 49288                                  ; Entry:
 49289                                  ;	ES:DI = from location (where to put jmp instruction)
 49290                                  ;	BX    = to location (where to jump to)
 49291                                  ;
 49292                                  ; Exit:
 49293                                  ;	DI = byte after generated jump
 49294                                  ;
 49295                                  ; Used:
 49296                                  ;	AX
 49297                                  ;
 49298                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49299                                  
 49300                                  GenJump:
 49301 000087A9 B0E9                    	mov	al,0E9h		; jmp rel16 opcode
 49302 000087AB AA                      	stosb
 49303                                  
 49304 000087AC 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx		; calc offset to 'to' location
 49305 000087AE 29F8                    	sub	ax,di
 49306 000087B0 83E802                  	sub	ax,2
 49307                                  
 49308 000087B3 AB                      	stosw			; output offset
 49309                                  
 49310 000087B4 C3                      	retn
 49311                                  
 49312                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49313                                  ;
 49314                                  ; ScanCodeSeq
 49315                                  ;
 49316                                  ; Looks for a pattern pointed to by DS:SI & len DX in ES:200 to ES:200+CX-1
 49317                                  ;
 49318                                  ; returns in ES:DI the start of the pattern if Zero flag is set
 49319                                  ;
 49320                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49321                                  
 49322                                  ScanCodeSeq:
 49323 000087B5 BF0002                  	mov	di,200h
 49324                                  ScanCodeSeq_di:
 49325 000087B8 51                      	push	cx
 49326 000087B9 29D1                    	sub	cx,dx
 49327 000087BB 41                      	inc	cx
 49328                                  scsagain:
 49329 000087BC 56                      	push	si
 49330 000087BD 57                      	push	di
 49331 000087BE 51                      	push	cx
 49332 000087BF 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx
 49333 000087C1 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 49334 000087C3 59                      	pop	cx
 49335 000087C4 5F                      	pop	di
 49336 000087C5 5E                      	pop	si
 49337 000087C6 7403                    	je	short scsfound
 49338 000087C8 47                      	inc	di
 49339 000087C9 E2F1                    	loop	scsagain
 49340                                  scsfound:
 49341 000087CB 59                      	pop	cx
 49342                                  vvexit:		; 18/12/2022
 49343 000087CC C3                      	retn
 49344                                  	
 49345                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49346                                  ;
 49347                                  ; VerifyVersion
 49348                                  ;
 49349                                  ; Checks whether the binary version from ES:0 matches the ASCII version
 49350                                  ; from ES:2A.
 49351                                  ;
 49352                                  ;       Entry: AX = binary version number 
 49353                                  ;       Exit : Z flag set if version numbers match
 49354                                  ;
 49355                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49356                                  
 49357                                  VerifyVersion:
 49358 000087CD 268B362A00              	mov	si,[es:2Ah]		; offset of version number
 49359                                  					;  in ascii
 49360 000087D2 B30A                    	mov	bl,10
 49361 000087D4 83C603                  	add	si,3			; point to last digit
 49362                                  
 49363 000087D7 E80E00                  	call	VVDigit
 49364 000087DA 75F0                    	jne	short vvexit
 49365 000087DC E80900                  	call	VVDigit
 49366 000087DF 75EB                    	jne	short vvexit
 49367 000087E1 26803C2E                	cmp	byte [es:si],'.'
 49368 000087E5 75E5                    	jne	short vvexit
 49369 000087E7 4E                      	dec	si
 49370                                  	;call	VVDigit
 49371                                  	; 18/12/2022
 49372                                  	;jmp	short VVDigit
 49373                                  ;vvexit:
 49374                                  	;retn
 49375                                  VVDigit:
 49376 000087E8 F6F3                    	div	bl
 49377 000087EA 80C430                  	add	ah,'0'
 49378 000087ED 4E                      	dec	si
 49379 000087EE 26386401                	cmp	[es:si+1],ah
 49380 000087F2 B400                    	mov	ah,0			; do not xor or sub we need Z
 49381 000087F4 C3                      	retn
 49382                                  
 49383                                  ; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 49655                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 49656                                  ;
 49657                                  ; Procedure Name 	: ExePackPatch
 49658                                  ;
 49659                                  ; Inputs	 	: DS 			-> DOSDATA
 49660                                  ;			  ES:0 			-> read in image
 49661                                  ;			  ax:cx = start cs:ip of program
 49662                                  ; Output		:		
 49663                                  ;
 49664                                  ;	1. If ES <= 0fffh
 49665                                  ;	   2. if exepack signature ('RB') found
 49666                                  ;	      3. if common code to patch compares (for 3 diff. versions)
 49667                                  ;	       	 4. if rest of the code & checksum compares
 49668                                  ;	  	    5. overlay buggy code with code in 
 49669                                  ;		       doscode:str1.
 49670                                  ;		 6. endif
 49671                                  ;	      7. endif
 49672                                  ;	   8. endif
 49673                                  ;	9. endif
 49674                                  ;
 49675                                  ;
 49676                                  ; Uses			: NONE
 49677                                  ;
 49678                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 49679                                  	
 49680                                  	; 21/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 49681                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 49907                                  ; 	Procedure Name	: chk_common_str
 49908                                  ;
 49909                                  ;	Input		: DS = DOSCODE
 49910                                  ;			; ES:DI points to string in packed file
 49911                                  ;
 49912                                  ;	Output		; Z if match else NZ
 49913                                  ;

 49915

 49917                                  chk_common_str:
 49918 00008A24 BE[2589]                	mov	si,scan_com
 49919                                  					; ds:si -> scan string 
 49920                                  	;mov	cx,32
 49921 00008A27 B92000                  	mov	cx,size_scan_com
 49922                                  
 49923 00008A2A F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb
 49924                                  
 49925                                  					; M046 - start
 49926                                  	; a fourth possible version of these exepacked programs have a
 49927                                  	; 056h instead of 06Bh. See scan_com above
 49928                                  	;
 49929                                  	; 	db  75h, 6Bh		;jne CorruptExe
 49930                                  	;
 49931                                  	; If the mismatch at this point is due to a 56h instead of 6Bh
 49932                                  	; we shall try to match the rest of the string
 49933                                  	;
 49934                                  
 49935 00008A2C 7409                    	jz	short ccs_done
 49936 00008A2E 26807DFF56              	cmp	byte [es:di-1],56h

 49943                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49944                                  ;
 49945                                  ;	Procedure Name	: chk_patchsum
 49946                                  ;
 49947                                  ;	Input		: DS:SI -> string we're looking for
 49948                                  ;			: ES:DI -> offset in packed file
 49949                                  ;			: CX 	= scan length
 49950                                  ;			: BX	= length of check sum
 49951                                  ;			: AX 	= value of check sum
 49952                                  ;
 49953                                  ;	Output		: if patch & check sum compare
 49954                                  ;				NC
 49955                                  ;			  else
 49956                                  ;				CY
 49957                                  ;
 49958                                  ;	Uses		: AX, BX, CX, SI
 49959                                  ;
 49960                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49961                                  
 49962                                  	; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 49963                                  chk_patchsum:
 49964 00008A38 57                      	push	di
 49965                                  
 49966 00008A39 F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb
 49967                                  
 49968 00008A3B 7518                    	jnz	short cp_fail		; Q: does the patch match
 49969                                  					; N: exit
 49970                                  					; Y:
 49971                                  
 49972                                  		; we do a check sum starting from the location of the
 49973                                  		; exepack signature 'RB' up to 11c/2 bytes, the end of the
 49974                                  		; unpacking code.
 49975                                  
 49976 00008A3D 368B3E[8700]            	mov	di,[ss:UNPACK_OFFSET]	; di -> start of unpack code
 49977 00008A42 89D9                    	mov	cx,bx			; cx = length of check sum
 49978

 50007                                  ; M020 : BEGIN
 50008                                  ;
 50009                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50010                                  ;
 50011                                  ; procedure : RationalPatch
 50012                                  ;
 50013                                  ; A routine (in Ration DOS extender) which is invoked at hardware interrupts
 50014                                  ; clobbers CX register on 286 machines. (123 release 3 uses Rational DOS
 50015                                  ; extender). This routine identifies Buggy Rational EXEs and fixes the bug.
 50016                                  ;
 50017                                  ; THE BUG is in the following code sequence:
 50018                                  ;
 50019                                  ;8b 0e 10 00	mov	cx, ds:[10h]		; delay count
 50020                                  ;90		even				; word align
 50021                                  ;e2 fe		loop	$			; wait		CLOBBERS CX
 50022                                  ;e8 xx xx	call	set_A20			; enable A20
 50023                                  ;
 50024                                  ; This patch routine replaces the mov & the loop with a far call into a
 50025                                  ; routine in DOS data segment which is in low memory (because A20 line
 50026                                  ; is off). The routine (RatBugCode) in DOS data saves & restores CX around
 50027                                  ; a mov & loop.
 50028                                  ;
 50029                                  ; Identification of Buggy Rational EXE
 50030                                  ; ====================================
 50031                                  ;
 50032                                  ; (ALL OFFSETS ARE IN THE PROGRAM SECTION - EXCLUDING THE EXE HEADER)
 50033                                  ;
 50034                                  ; OFFSET				Contains
 50035                                  ; ------				--------
 50036                                  ; 0000h			100 times Version number in binary
 50037                                  ;			bug exists in version 3.48 thru 3.83 (both inclusive)
 50038                                  ;
 50039                                  ; 000ah			the WORDS : 0000h, 0020h, 0000h, 0040h, 0001h
 50040                                  ;
 50041                                  ; 002ah			offset where version number is stored in ASCII
 50042                                  ;				e.g. '3.48A'
 50043                                  ;
 50044                                  ; 0030h			offset of copyright string. Copyright strings either
 50045                                  ;			start with "DOS/16M Copyright...." or
 50046                                  ;			"Copyright.....". The string contains
 50047                                  ;			"Rational Systems, Inc."
 50048                                  ;
 50049                                  ; 0020h			word : Paragraph offset of the buggy code segment
 50050                                  ;				from the program image
 50051                                  ; 0016h			word : size of buggy code segment
 50052                                  ;
 50053                                  ;	Buggy code is definite to start after offset 200h in its segment
 50054                                  ;
 50055                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50056                                  
 50057                                  ; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 50058                                  ; DOSCODE:B976h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 50059                                  
 50060                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 50061                                  ; DOSCODE:B654h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 50062                                  
 50063                                  RScanPattern1:
 50064 00008A57 000020000000400001-     	db	0, 0, 20h, 0, 0, 0, 40h, 0, 1, 0
 50064 00008A60 00                 
 50065                                  
 50066                                  RLen1 equ $ - RScanPattern1
 50067                                  
 50068                                  RScanPattern2:
 50069 00008A61 8B0E100090E2FEE8        	db	8Bh, 0Eh, 10h, 00h, 90h, 0E2h, 0FEh, 0E8h
 50070                                  
 50071                                  RLen2 equ $ - RScanPattern2
 50072                                  
 50073                                  RScanPattern3:
 50074 00008A69 8B0E1000E2FEE8          	db	8Bh, 0Eh, 10h, 00h, 0E2h, 0FEh, 0E8h
 50075                                  
 50076                                  RLen3 equ $ - RScanPattern2
 50077                                  
 50078                                  ; DOSCODE:B98Fh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 50079                                  ; DOSCODE:B66Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 50080                                  
 50081                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50082                                  ;
 50083                                  ; INPUT : ES = segment where program got loaded
 50084                                  ;
 50085                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50086                                  
 50087                                  	; 21/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 50088                                  	; DOSCODE:CC2Fh (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 50089                                  
 50090                                  RationalPatch:
 50091 00008A70 FC                      	cld
 50092                                  
 50093                                  ; 21/03/2024
 50094                                  %if 0
 50095                                  	push	ax
 50096                                  	push	bx
 50097                                  	push	cx
 50098                                  	push	dx
 50099                                  	push	si
 50100                                  	push	di
 50101                                  %else
 50102                                  	; 21/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 50103                                  	;;;
 50104 00008A71 60                      	pusha
 50105                                  	;;;
 50106                                  %endif
 50107 00008A72 06                      	push	es
 50108 00008A73 1E                      	push	ds			; we use all of them
 50109 00008A74 BF0A00                  	mov	di,0Ah			; look for pat1 at offset 0Ah
 50110 00008A77 0E                      	push	cs
 50111 00008A78 1F                      	pop	ds
 50112                                  	
 50113 00008A79 BE[578A]                	mov	si,RScanPattern1
 50114                                  	;mov	cx,10
 50115 00008A7C B90A00                  	mov	cx,RLen1
 50116 00008A7F F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb			; do we have the pattern ?
 50117 00008A81 754A                    	jne	short rpexit
 50118 00008A83 26A10000                	mov	ax,[es:0]
 50119 00008A87 3D5C01                  	cmp	ax,348			; is it a buggy version ?
 50120 00008A8A 7241                    	jb	short rpexit
 50121 00008A8C 3D7F01                  	cmp	ax,383			; is it a buggy version ?
 50122 00008A8F 773C                    	ja	short rpexit
 50123

 50125 00008A94 7537                    	jne	short rpexit
 50126                                  
 50127 00008A96 268B0E1600              	mov	cx,[es:16h]		; Length of buggy code seg
 50128 00008A9B 81E90002                	sub	cx,200h			; Length we search (we start
 50129                                  					;  at offset 200h)
 50130 00008A9F 268E062000              	mov	es,[es:20h]		; es=buggy code segment
 50131 00008AA4 BE[618A]                	mov	si,RScanPattern2
 50132                                  	;mov	dx,8	
 50133 00008AA7 BA0800                  	mov	dx,RLen2
 50134 00008AAA E808FD                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq with nop
 50135 00008AAD 740B                    	jz	short rpfound
 50136                                  
 50137 00008AAF BE[698A]                	mov	si,RScanPattern3
 50138                                  	;mov	dx,15
 50139 00008AB2 BA0F00                  	mov	dx,RLen3
 50140 00008AB5 E8FDFC                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq w/o nop
 50141 00008AB8 7513                    	jnz	short rpexit
 50142                                  
 50143                                  rpfound:
 50144                                  	
 50145                                  ;	we set up a far call into DOS data
 50146                                  ;	dx has the length of the code seq we were searching for
 50147                                  
 50148 00008ABA B09A                    	mov	al,9Ah			; far call opcode
 50149 00008ABC AA                      	stosb
 50150 00008ABD B8[2611]                	mov	ax,RatBugCode
 50151 00008AC0 AB                      	stosw
 50152 00008AC1 8CD0                    	mov	ax,ss
 50153 00008AC3 AB                      	stosw
 50154 00008AC4 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx
 50155 00008AC6 83E906                  	sub	cx,6			; filler (with NOPs)
 50156 00008AC9 B090                    	mov	al,90h
 50157 00008ACB F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 50158                                  rpexit:
 50159 00008ACD 1F                      	pop	ds
 50160 00008ACE 07                      	pop	es
 50161                                  
 50162                                  ; 21/03/2024
 50163                                  %if 0
 50164                                  	pop	di
 50165                                  	pop	si
 50166                                  	pop	dx
 50167                                  	pop	cx
 50168                                  	pop	bx
 50169                                  	pop	ax
 50170                                  %else
 50171                                  	; 21/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 50172                                  	;;;
 50173 00008ACF 61                      	popa
 50174                                  	;;;
 50175                                  %endif
 50176 00008AD0 C3                      	retn

 50185                                  ;
 50186                                  ;	M068
 50187                                  ;
 50188                                  ; 	Procedure Name	: IsCopyProt
 50189                                  ;
 50190                                  ;	Inputs		: DS:100 -> start of com file just read in
 50191                                  ;
 50192                                  ;	Outputs		: sets the A20OFF_COUNT variable to 10 if 
 50193                                  ;			  the program loaded in DS:100 uses a MICROSOFT
 50194                                  ;			  copy protect scheme that relies on the A20 line
 50195                                  ;			  being turned off for it's scheme to work.
 50196                                  ;
 50197                                  ;			  Note: The int 21 function dispatcher will turn 
 50198                                  ;				a20 off, if the A20OFF_COUNT is non-zero 
 50199                                  ;				and dec the A20OFF_COUNT before	iretting 
 50200                                  ;				to the user. 
 50201                                  ;
 50202                                  ;	Uses		: ES, DI, SI, CX
 50203                                  ;
 50204                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50205                                  
 50206                                  ; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 50207                                  
 50208                                  CPStartOffset	EQU	0175h
 50209                                  CPID1Offset	EQU	011Bh
 50210                                  CPID2Offset	EQU	0173h
 50211                                  CPID3Offset	EQU	0146h
 50212                                  CPID4Offset	EQU	0124h
 50213                                  ID1		EQU	05343h
 50214                                  ID2		EQU	05044h
 50215                                  ID3		EQU	0F413h
 50216                                  ID4		EQU	08000h
 50217                                  
 50218                                  ; DOSCODE:B9FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 50219                                  
 50220                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 50221                                  ; DOSCODE:B71Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 50222                                  
 50223                                  ; 21/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 50224                                  ; DOSCODE:CC90h (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 50225                                  
 50226                                  CPScanPattern:
 50227 00008AD1 89264801                	db	89h,26h,48h,01h		 ; mov [148],sp
 50228 00008AD5 8C0E4C01                	db	8Ch,0Eh,4Ch,01h		 ; mov [14C],cs
 50229 00008AD9 C7064A010001            	db	0C7h,06h,4Ah,01h,00h,01h ; mov [14A],100h 
 50230 00008ADF 8C0E1301                	db 	8Ch,0Eh,13h,01h		 ; mov [113],cs
 50231 00008AE3 B82001                  	db	0B8h,20h,01h		 ; mov ax,120h
 50232 00008AE6 BE0001                  	db	0BEh,00h,01h		 ; mov si,100h
 50233                                  
 50234                                  CPSPlen	EQU $ - CPScanPattern
 50235                                  
 50236                                  ; DOSCODE:BA12h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 50237                                  ; DOSCODE:B734h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 50238                                  ; 21/03/2024

 50242 00008AE9 813E1B014353            	cmp	word [CPID1Offset],ID1

 50244

 50246 00008AF7 7525                    	jne	short CP_done
 50247

 50250                                  
 50251 00008B01 813E24010080            	cmp	word [CPID4Offset],ID4
 50252 00008B07 7515                    	jne	short CP_done
 50253

 50255 00008B0A 07                      	pop	es
 50256 00008B0B BF[D18A]                	mov	di,CPScanPattern	; es:di -> Pattern to find

 50259                                  					; of pattern

 50332                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50333                                  ;
 50334                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 50335                                  ;
 50336                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 50337                                  ;
 50338                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 50339                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 50340                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 50341                                  ;
 50342                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 50343                                  ;
 50344                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50345                                  
 50346                                  WhatCPUType:
 50347                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 50348                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 50349                                  
 50350                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 50351                                  
 50352                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 50353                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 50354                                  ;
 50355                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 50356                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 50357                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 50358                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 50359                                  
 50360                                  	; 04/11/2022
 50361                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 50362                                  
 50363                                  	; 22/03/2024
 50364                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0CCEDh
 50365                                  
 50366                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 50367 00008B2F 9C                      	pushf
 50368 00008B30 53                      	push	bx			; preserve bx
 50369 00008B31 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 50370                                  
 50371 00008B33 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 50372 00008B35 50                      	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 50373 00008B36 9D                      	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 50374 00008B37 9C                      	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 50375 00008B38 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 50376 00008B39 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 50377 00008B3C 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 50378 00008B3F 740E                    	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 50379                                  
 50380 00008B41 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 50381 00008B44 50                      	push	ax
 50382 00008B45 9D                      	popf
 50383 00008B46 9C                      	pushf
 50384 00008B47 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 50385 00008B48 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 50386 00008B4B 7401                    	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 50387                                  
 50388                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 50389 00008B4D 43                      	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 50390                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 50391 00008B4E 43                      	inc	bx
 50392                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 50393 00008B4F 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 50394 00008B51 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 50395 00008B52 9D                      	popf
 50396                                  	
 50397                                  	;endm
 50398                                  
 50399                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 50400 00008B53 C3                      	retn	; 19/09/2023
 50401                                  
 50402                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50403                                  %endif	; 28/12/2022

 50406                                  
 50407                                  ; MAIN ENTRY FOR DOS INITIALIZATION
 50408                                  
 50409                                  	; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 50410                                  	; DOSCODE:B779h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 50411                                  
 50412                                  	; 23/03/2024
 50413                                  	; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 50414                                  	; DOSCODE:CCEDh (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 50415                                  
 50416                                  	; DOSCODE:BA57h (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS)
 50417                                  	; BIOSCODE:CF81h (Windows ME IO.SYS)
 50418                                  	
 50419                                  	; 30/05/2019
 50420                                  	; 22/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 50421                                  	; 07/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 50422                                  	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 03/03/2018
 50423                                  	; 03/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 50424                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 79A9h
 50425                                  DOSINIT:
 50426                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 7C77h
 50427                                  	;
 50428                                  	; Far call from SYSINIT
 50429                                  	; DX = Memory size in paragraphs
 50430                                  	; DS:SI = [DEVICE_LIST] (SYSINIT.S) 
 50431                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v2.0, 16/03/2018)
 50432                                  	;
 50433                                  	; ES:DI = ptr to BIOS communication block (sysinit3.s)
 50434                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v4.0, 20/04/2019)
 50435                                  
 50436 00008B54 FA                              CLI
 50437 00008B55 FC                              CLD
 50438                                  
 50439                                  	; 03/11/2022
 50440                                  	;push	dx ; 30/05/2019		; save parameters from BIOS
 50441                                  	
 50442                                  	; 17/12/2022
 50443                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 50444                                  	;push	dx ; =*=		; save parameters from BIOS
 50445                                  	
 50446 00008B56 56                      	push	si
 50447 00008B57 1E                      	push	ds
 50448 00008B58 57                      	push	di			;save di (ptr to BiosComBlock)
 50449                                  
 50450 00008B59 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			;bx:di = ptr to BiosComBlock
 50451                                  
 50452                                  ; First, move the DOS data segment to its final location in low memory
 50453                                  
 50454                                  	;;;mov	ax,0BF69h ; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 7C7Fh
 50455                                  	;;mov	ax,0BC77h ; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 79B1h
 50456                                  	; 22/03/2024
 50457                                  	;mov	ax,0D20Fh ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM, file offset 92FFh
 50458 00008B5B B8[2490]                	mov	ax,MEMSTRT		; get offset of end of init code
 50459                                  
 50460                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 50461 00008B5E 83C00F                  	add	ax,15			; round to nearest paragraph
 50462                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; boundary
 50463                                  	; 12/04/2024
 50464 00008B61 24F0                    	and	al,0F0h
 50465                                  
 50466 00008B63 89C6                    	mov	si,ax			; si = offset of DOSDATA in current
 50467                                  					; code segment
 50468                                  	; 05/12/2022

 50471

 50474                                  					; DS:SI now points to dosdata
 50475                                  	; 22/03/2024

 50477 00008B66 1F                      	pop	ds
 50478
