 51336                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51337                                  ;
 51338                                  ;	check_XMM: routine to check presence of XMM driver
 51339                                  ;
 51340                                  ;	Exit:   Sets up the XMM entry point in XMMcontrol in DOSDATA
 51341                                  ;
 51342                                  ;	USED:	none
 51343                                  ;
 51344                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51345                                  
 51346                                  check_XMM: ; proc near
 51347                                  ;
 51348                                  ; determine whether or not an XMM driver is installed
 51349                                  ;
 51350 00008E77 50                      	push	ax
 51351                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_INSTALL_CHECK
 51352 00008E78 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 51353 00008E7B CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 51354                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 51355                                  		; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 51356                                  		; AL <> 80h no driver
 51357 00008E7D 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			; Q: installed
 51358 00008E7F 751D                    	jne	short cXMM_no_driver	; N: set error, quit
 51359                                  ;
 51360                                  ; get the XMM control functions entry point, save it, we
 51361                                  ; need to call it later.
 51362                                  ;
 51363 00008E81 53                      	push	bx
 51364 00008E82 52                      	push	dx
 51365 00008E83 1E                      	push	ds
 51366 00008E84 06                      	push	es

 51394                                  ;
 51395                                  ; Procedure Name : seg_reinit
 51396                                  ;
 51397                                  ; Inputs	 : ES has final dos code location
 51398                                  ;		   AX = 0 / 1
 51399                                  ;
 51400                                  ; Outputs	 : Patch in the sharer and other tables with seg in ES
 51401                                  ;		   if AX =0
 51402                                  ;		      if first entry

 51887                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51888                                  ;
 51889                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 51890                                  ;
 51891                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 51892                                  ;
 51893                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 51894                                  ;
 51895                                  ;	Description:
 51896                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 51897                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 51898                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 51899                                  ;
 51900                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51901                                  
 51902                                  	; 04/11/2022
 51903                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BC50h
 51904                                  
 51905                                  	; 23/03/2024
 51906                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BF42h
 51907                                  	; 23/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 51908                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0D1E9h
 51909                                  
 51910                                  patch_table:	; label	byte
 51911                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i0patch
 51912                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i20patch
 51913                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i21patch
 51914                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i25patch
 51915                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i26patch
 51916                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i27patch
 51917                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i2fpatch
 51918                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:cpmpatch
 51919 00008FF3 [9E0F]                  	dw	i0patch
 51920 00008FF5 [A80F]                  	dw	i20patch
 51921 00008FF7 [B20F]                  	dw	i21patch
 51922 00008FF9 [BC0F]                  	dw	i25patch
 51923 00008FFB [C60F]                  	dw	i26patch
 51924 00008FFD [D00F]                  	dw	i27patch
 51925 00008FFF [DA0F]                  	dw	i2fpatch
 51926 00009001 [E40F]                  	dw	cpmpatch
 51927                                  
 51928                                  patch_table_size equ ($-patch_table)/2
 51929                                  
 51930                                  patch_in_nops:
 51931 00009003 50                      	push	ax
 51932 00009004 56                      	push	si
 51933 00009005 BE[F38F]                	mov	si,patch_table
 51934 00009008 B89090                  	mov	ax,9090h ; nop, nop
 51935                                  	; 17/12/2022
 51936                                  	; cx = 0
 51937                                  	;mov	cx,8
 51938                                  	;mov	cx,patch_table_size ; 8
 51939 0000900B B108                    	mov	cl,patch_table_size ; 8
 51940                                  pin_loop:
 51941 0000900D 2E8B3C                  	mov	di,[cs:si]
 51942 00009010 AB                      	stosw
 51943                                  	;add	si,2
 51944                                  	; 17/12/2022
 51945 00009011 46                      	inc	si
 51946 00009012 46                      	inc	si
 51947 00009013 E2F8                    	loop	pin_loop
 51948 00009015 5E                      	pop	si
 51949 00009016 58                      	pop	ax
 51950 00009017 C3                      	retn
 51951

 52048                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 52049                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole. Under 3.0, the system
 52050                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code. The process data under 2.x will
 52051                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 52052                                  ;
 52053                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 52054                                  ; describing that data item.

 52149                                  ;; 16/07/2018
 52150                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 52151                                  ;; NOTE: INT 21H AH=52H !  (http://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-52.html)
 52152                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 52153                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 52154                                  ;;
 52155                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 52156                                  ;;
 52157                                  ;;	on return:
 52158                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 52159                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 52160                                  ;;
 52161                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 52162                                  ;;
 52163                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 52164                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 52165                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 52166                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 52167                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 52168                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 52169                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 52170                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 52171                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 52172                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 52173                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 52174                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 52175                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 52176                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 52177                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 52178                                  ;;
 52179                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 52180                                  
 52181                                  ; The following block of data is used by SYSINIT. 
 52182                                  ; Do not change the order or size of this block
 52183

 52191                                  BCLOCK:

 52354                                  ;	DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:BadCall, 0  ;	3   MFTclU

 52356                                  ;	DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:BadCall, 0  ;	5   MFTCloN

 52387                                  ;============================================================================
 52388                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 52389                                  ;============================================================================
 52390                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 52391                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 52392                                  
 52393                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 52394                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52395                                  
 52396                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 52397                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 52398                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 52399                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 52400                                  ;
 52401                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 52402                                  ; describing that data item.
 52403                                  
 52404                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 52405                                  
 52406                                  ;
 52407                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 52408                                  ;
 52409                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 52410                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 52411                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 52412                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 52413                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 52414                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 52415                                  ;
 52416                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 52417                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 52418                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 52419                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 52420                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 52421                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 52422                                  ;   as EOF).
 52423                                  
 52424                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 52425                                  
 52426                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 52427                                  
 52428                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 52429 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 52430 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 52431                                  		;dw 5 ; 24/03/2024
 52432 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 52433                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0 ; PCDOS 7.1  ; 24/03/2024
 52434 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 52435                                  
 52436                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 52437                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 52438                                  ; console.
 52439                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 24/03/2024
 52440 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 52441 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 52442                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 52443 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 52444 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 52445                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1
 52446 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 52447 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 52448 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b ; 3	; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 52449                                  switch_character:
 52450 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 52451 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last
 52452 00000303 00                      fShare:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] TRUE => sharing installed
 52453 00000304 01                      DIFFNAM:	db 1			; [SYSTEM] Indicates when MYNAME has changed
 52454 00000305 20<rep 10h>             MYNAME:		times 16 db 20h		; [SYSTEM] My network name
 52455                                  
 52456                                  ; The following table is a list of addresses that the sharer patches to be
 52457                                  ; PUSH AX to enable the critical sections
 52458                                  
 52459                                  		; DOSDATA:0315h (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 24/03/2024
 52460                                  
 52461                                  ;PUBLIC	CritPatch
 52462                                  
 52463                                  CritPatch:	; LABEL WORD
 52464                                  
 52465                                  ;IRP sect,<critDisk,critDevice>

 52468                                  ;

 52470                                  ;
 52471                                  ;       dw OFFSET DOSDATA: redir_patch
 52472                                  ;       dw OFFSET DOSDATA: redir_patch
 52473                                  ;
 52474                                  ;;hkn	Short_Addr  E&sect
 52475                                  ;;hkn	Short_Addr  L&sect
 52476                                  ;
 52477                                  ;ELSE
 52478                                  ;	DW	0
 52479                                  ;	DW	0
 52480                                  ;ENDIF
 52481                                  ;ENDM
 52482                                  ;	DW	0

 52538 0000033E 0000                    USER_ID:	dw 0		; Machine for sharing (0 = local)

 52540 00000342 0000                    BestArena:	dw 0		; best free block found

 52664                                  ;============================================================================
 52665                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 52666                                  ;============================================================================
 52667                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 52668                                  
 52669                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 52670                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 52671                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 52672                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 52673                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 52674                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 52675                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 52676                                  ; **********************************************************
 52677                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 52678                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 52679                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 52680                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 52681                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 52682                                  ; **********************************************************	
 52683                                  
 52684                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 52685                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52686                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 52687                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 52688                                  
 52689                                  ; 	ORG     0
 52690                                  
 52691                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 52692                                  
 52693                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 52694                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 52695 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 52696 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 52697                                  
 52698                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 52699                                  
 52700                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 52701                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 52702 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 52703                                  RENBUF:	
 52704 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 52705                                  
 52706                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 52707                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 52708 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 52709                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 52710 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 52711                                  
 52712                                  ; End of contiguous buffer
 52713                                   
 52714                                  ; Temporary directory entry for use by many routines. Device directory
 52715                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.
 52716                                  
 52717                                  ; DOSDATA:054Bh
 52718                                  
 52719                                  DEVFCB:	; LABEL   BYTE			; Uses NAME1, NAME2, combined
 52720                                  
 52721                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 52722                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 52723                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 52724                                  
 52725                                  NAME1:	
 52726 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 52727                                  NAME2:
 52728 00000557 00<rep Dh>              	times	13 db	0 		;
 52729                                  DESTSTART:
 52730 00000564 0000                    	dw	0			;
 52731                                          ;DB	((SIZE DIR_ENTRY) - ($ - DEVFCB)) DUP (?)
 52732                                  	;times	5  db	0
 52733 00000566 00<rep 5h>              	times	((dir_entry.size)-($-DEVFCB)) db 0
 52734                                  
 52735                                  ; End Temporary directory entry.
 52736                                  
 52737 0000056B 00                      ATTRIB:	db	0		; storage for file attributes
 52738                                  EXTFCB:	
 52739 0000056C 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => extended FCB in use
 52740                                  SATTRIB:
 52741 0000056D 00                      	db	0		; Storage for search attributes
 52742                                  OPEN_ACCESS:
 52743 0000056E 00                      	db	0		; access of open system call
 52744                                  FOUNDDEL:
 52745 0000056F 00                      	db	0		; true => file was deleted
 52746                                  FOUND_DEV:

 52748                                  FSPLICE:

 52750                                  FSHARING:
 52751 00000572 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => no redirection
 52752                                  SECCLUSPOS:

 52754 00000574 00                      TRANS:	db	0		;
 52755 00000575 00                      READOP:	db	0		;
 52756                                  THISDRV:
 52757 00000576 00                      	db	0		;
 52758                                  CLUSFAC:
 52759 00000577 00                      	db	0		;
 52760                                  CLUSSPLIT:
 52761 00000578 00                      	db	0		;
 52762                                  INSMODE:

 52764 0000057A 00                      CMETA:	db	0		; count of meta'ed components found
 52765 0000057B 00                      VOLID:	db	0		;

 53277                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:0CF5h
 53278                                  ; 24/03/2024
 53279                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0D6Bh
 53280                                  
 53281                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53282                                  ;
 53283                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 53284                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 53285                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 53286                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 53287                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 53288                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53289                                  ; Example:
 53290                                  
 53291                                  MAP_CASE:
 53292                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 53293                                  
 53294 00000D6B 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 53295                                  	;JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 53296                                  	;RETF
 53297                                  	; 24/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 53298                                  	;;;
 53299 00000D6D 720C                    	jb	short L_RET     ;Map no chars below 80H ever
 53300                                  	;;;
 53301                                  Map1:
 53302 00000D6F 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 53303 00000D71 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 53304 00000D72 53                      	PUSH	BX
 53305 00000D73 BB[FC0A]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 53306                                  FINISH:
 53307 00000D76 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 53308 00000D77 1F                      	POP	DS
 53309 00000D78 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 53310 00000D79 5B                      	POP	BX
 53311 00000D7A 1F                      	POP	DS
 53312                                  L_RET:	
 53313 00000D7B CB                      	RETF
 53314                                  
 53315                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 53316                                  
 53317                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 53644                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 53645                                  ; 
 53646                                  ; The redir requires the following:
 53647                                  ;
 53648                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_21	offset DDBH
 53649                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_24	offset E5BH
 53650                                  ; 	ErrMap24	offset EABH
 53651                                  ;
 53652                                  ; WARNING! WARNING!
 53653                                  ;
 53654                                  ; MARK2 SHOULD NOT BE >= 0DDBH. IF SOME VARIABLE IS TO BE ADDED ABOVE DO SO
 53655                                  ; WITHOUT VIOLATING THIS AND UPDATE THE FOLL. LINE
 53656                                  ;
 53657                                  ; CURRENTLY MARK2 = 0DD0H
 53658                                  ;
 53659                                  ;############################################################################
 53660                                  
 53661                                  	;ORG	0DDBh
 53662                                  
 53663                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 53664                                  ; 24/03/2024
 53665                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0DDBh
 53666                                  
 53667                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53668                                  ;
 53669                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 53670                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 53671                                  ;
 53672                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 53673                                  ;
 53674                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 53675                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 53676                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 53677                                  ;
 53678                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53679                                  
 53680                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 53681                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 53682                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 53683                                  ;ELSE
 53684                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 53685                                  ;ENDIF
 53686                                  ;ENDM
 53687                                  
 53688                                  ERR_TABLE_21: ; LABEL   BYTE
 53689 00000DDB 010704FF                    DB  error_invalid_function,       errCLASS_Apperr,    errACT_Abort,    0FFh
 53690 00000DDF 02080302                    DB  error_file_not_found,         errCLASS_NotFnd,    errACT_User,     errLOC_Disk
 53691 00000DE3 03080302                    DB  error_path_not_found,         errCLASS_NotFnd,    errACT_User,     errLOC_Disk
 53692 00000DE7 04010401                    DB  error_too_many_open_files,    errCLASS_OutRes,    errACT_Abort,    errLOC_Unk
 53693 00000DEB 050303FF                    DB  error_access_denied,          errCLASS_Auth,      errACT_User,     0FFh
 53694 00000DEF 06070401                    DB  error_invalid_handle,         errCLASS_Apperr,    errACT_Abort,    errLOC_Unk
 53695 00000DF3 07070505                    DB  error_arena_trashed,          errCLASS_Apperr,    errACT_Panic,    errLOC_Mem
 53696 00000DF7 08010405                    DB  error_not_enough_memory,      errCLASS_OutRes,    errACT_Abort,    errLOC_Mem
 53697 00000DFB 09070405                    DB  error_invalid_block,          errCLASS_Apperr,    errACT_Abort,    errLOC_Mem
 53698 00000DFF 0A070405                    DB  error_bad_environment,        errCLASS_Apperr,    errACT_Abort,    errLOC_Mem
 53699 00000E03 0B090301                    DB  error_bad_format,             errCLASS_BadFmt,    errACT_User,     errLOC_Unk
 53700 00000E07 0C070401                    DB  error_invalid_access,         errCLASS_Apperr,    errACT_Abort,    errLOC_Unk
 53701 00000E0B 0D090401                    DB  error_invalid_data,           errCLASS_BadFmt,    errACT_Abort,    errLOC_Unk
 53702 00000E0F 0F080302                    DB  error_invalid_drive,          errCLASS_NotFnd,    errACT_User,     errLOC_Disk
 53703 00000E13 10030302                    DB  error_current_directory,      errCLASS_Auth,      errACT_User,     errLOC_Disk
 53704 00000E17 110D0302                    DB  error_not_same_device,        errCLASS_Unk,       errACT_User,     errLOC_Disk
 53705 00000E1B 12080302                    DB  error_no_more_files,          errCLASS_NotFnd,    errACT_User,     errLOC_Disk

 53707 00000E23 200A0202                    DB  error_sharing_violation,      errCLASS_Locked,    errACT_DlyRet,   errLOC_Disk
 53708 00000E27 210A0202                    DB  error_lock_violation,         errCLASS_Locked,    errACT_DlyRet,   errLOC_Disk

 54037                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 54038                                  ; 04/11/2022
 54039                                  ; DOSDATA:1044h (MSDOS 6.21 & MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 54040                                  
 54041                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54042                                  ; Patch for Sidekick
 54043                                  ;
 54044                                  ; A documented method for finding the offset of the Errormode flag in the
 54045                                  ; dos swappable data area if for the app to scan in the dos segment (data)
 54046                                  ; for the following sequence of instructions.
 54047                                  ;
 54048                                  ; Ref: Part C, Article 11, pg 356 of MSDOS Encyclopedia
 54049                                  ;
 54050                                  ; The Offset of Errormode flag is 0320h
 54051                                  ;
 54052                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54053                                  
 54054 00000F5D 36F6062003FF            	db	036h, 0F6h, 06h, 020h, 03h, 0FFh ; test ss:[errormode], -1
 54055 00000F63 750C                    	db	075h, 0Ch			 ; jnz  NearLabel
 54056 00000F65 36FF365803              	db	036h, 0FFh, 036h, 058h, 03h	 ; push ss:[NearWord]
 54057 00000F6A CD28                    	db	0CDh, 028h			 ; int  28h
 54058                                  
 54059                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54060                                  ; Patch for PortOfEntry - M036
 54061                                  ;
 54062                                  ; PortOfEntry by Sector Technology uses an un documented way of determining
 54063                                  ; the offset of Errormode flag. The following patch is to support them in
 54064                                  ; DOS 5.0. The corresponding code is actually in msdisp.asm
 54065                                  ;
 54066                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54067                                  
 54068 00000F6C 803E200300              	db 	080h, 03Eh, 020h, 03h, 00h 	 ; cmp 	[errormode], 0
 54069 00000F71 7537                    	db	075h, 037h			 ; jnz	NearLabel
 54070 00000F73 BCA00A                  	db 	0BCh, 0A0h, 0Ah		  	 ; mov	sp, dosdata:iostack
 54071                                  
 54072                                  %endif ; 29/12/2022

 54139                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54140                                  ;
 54141                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 54142                                  ;
 54143                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts
 54144                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the
 54145                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 54146                                  ;
 54147                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 54148                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 54149                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 54150                                  ;	   4. else 
 54151                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 54152                                  ;	   6. endif
 54153                                  ;	7. else
 54154                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 54155                                  ;	9. endif
 54156                                  ;
 54157                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54158                                  
 54159                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 54190                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 54191                                  ; will be restored then.

 54320                                  
 54321                                  lirett:
 54322                                  	iret
 54323                                  
 54324                                  %endif
 54325                                  
 54326                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54327                                  ;
 54328                                  ; LowIntXX:
 54329                                  ;
 54330                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 54331                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 54332                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 54333                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 54334                                  ;
 54335                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 54336                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 54337                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 54338                                  ;
 54339                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 54340                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 54341                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 54342                                  ;
 54343                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54344                                  
 54345                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54346                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0FEEh
 54347                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:10DBh)
 54348                                  
 54349 00000FEE 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 54350 00000FF2 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 54351                                  
 54352                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54353                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 54354                                  %if 0
 54355                                  DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 54356                                  %endif
 54357                                  
 54358                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 54359                                  LowInt23:
 54360                                  					; save the return address that is on
 54361                                  					; the stack
 54362 00000FF6 2E8F06[EE0F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 54363 00000FFB 2E8F06[F00F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 54364                                  
 54365 00001000 CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 54366                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 54367                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 54368                                  
 54369 00001002 E88000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54370                                  
 54371 00001005 2EFF2E[EE0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 54372                                  
 54373                                  
 54374                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 54375                                  LowInt24:
 54376                                  					; save the return address that is on
 54377                                  					; the stack
 54378 0000100A 2E8F06[F20F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 54379 0000100F 2E8F06[F40F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 54380                                  
 54381 00001014 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 54382                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 54383                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 54384                                  
 54385 00001016 E86C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54386                                  
 54387 00001019 2EFF2E[F20F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 54388                                  
 54389                                  
 54390                                   
 54391                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 54392                                  LowInt28:
 54393 0000101E CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 54394                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 54395                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 54396                                  
 54397 00001020 E86200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54398                                  
 54399 00001023 CB                      	retf
 54400                                  
 54401                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 54402                                  
 54403                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54404                                  ;
 54405                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 54406                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 54407                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 54408                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 54409                                  ;
 54410                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 54411                                  
 54412                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54413                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1024h
 54414                                  
 54415                                  disa20_xfer:
 54416 00001024 E84800                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 54417                                  
 54418                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 54419                                  
 54420                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 54421                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 54422                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 54423                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 54424                                  
 54425 00001027 FA                      	cli
 54426 00001028 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 54427                                  
 54428                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54429                                  	;;;
 54430 0000102E 36C606[B812]00          	mov     byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG],0
 54431                                  	;;;
 54432                                  
 54433 00001034 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 54434 00001036 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 54435 00001038 FB                      	sti
 54436                                  
 54437 00001039 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 54438 0000103A 56                      	push	SI
 54439 0000103B 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 54440 0000103D 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 54441 0000103F 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 54442 00001041 CB                      	retf
 54443                                  
 54444                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54445                                  ;
 54446                                  ; M003:
 54447                                  ;
 54448                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 54449                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning
 54450                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 54451                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for
 54452                                  ; more info.
 54453                                  ;
 54454                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that
 54455                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's
 54456                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 54457                                  ;
 54458                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54459                                  
 54460                                  disa20_iret:
 54461 00001042 E82A00                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 54462 00001045 FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 54463                                  
 54464                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54465                                  	;;;
 54466 00001049 FE0E[B812]              	dec	byte [INDOS_FLAG]
 54467                                  	;;;
 54468                                  
 54469 0000104D 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 54470 00001051 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 54471 00001055 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 54472                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 54473 00001057 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 54474                                  	
 54475                                  ; 25/03/2024
 54476                                  %if 0
 54477                                  	mov	AX,[NSP]
 54478                                  	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 54479                                  	mov	AX,[NSS]
 54480                                  	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 54481                                  %else
 54482                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54483                                  	;;;
 54484                                  	;les	ax, dword ptr ds:NSS
 54485 0000105A C406[F005]              	les	ax,[NSS]
 54486 0000105E 8C06[8405]              	mov	[USER_SP],es
 54487 00001062 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],ax
 54488                                  	;;;
 54489                                  %endif
 54490 00001065 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 54491 00001066 5B                      	pop	BX
 54492 00001067 59                      	pop	CX
 54493 00001068 5A                      	pop	DX
 54494 00001069 5E                      	pop	SI
 54495 0000106A 5F                      	pop	DI
 54496 0000106B 5D                      	pop	BP
 54497 0000106C 1F                      	pop	DS
 54498 0000106D 07                      	pop	ES
 54499                                  lirett:		; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54500 0000106E CF                      	iret
 54501                                  
 54502                                  ;**************************************************************************
 54503                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line
 54504                                  ;
 54505                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in
 54506                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 54507                                  ;
 54508                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA
 54509                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled
 54510                                  ;	USES	NOTHING
 54511                                  ;
 54512                                  ;**************************************************************************
 54513                                  
 54514                                  XMMDisableA20:
 54515 0000106F 53                      	push	bx
 54516 00001070 50                      	push	ax
 54517                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 54518 00001071 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 54519 00001073 2EFF1E[7B10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 54520 00001078 58                      	pop	ax
 54521 00001079 5B                      	pop	bx
 54522 0000107A C3                      	retn
 54523                                  
 54524                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 54525                                  
 54526                                  XMMcontrol:
 54527 0000107B 00000000                	dd	0
 54528                                  
 54529                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54530                                  ; 24/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54531                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:107Fh
 54532                                  ;;;
 54533 0000107F 00000000                	dd	0
 54534                                  SC_STATUS:
 54535 00001083 0000                    	dw	0
 54536                                  ;;;
 54537                                  
 54538                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54539                                  ;
 54540                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 54541                                  ;
 54542                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in
 54543                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 54544                                  ;
 54545                                  ;	ENTRY: none
 54546                                  ;
 54547                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 54548                                  ;		
 54549                                  ; 	USES : NONE
 54550                                  ;
 54551                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54552                                  
 54553                                  ; 19/09/2023
 54554                                  ;LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 54555                                  ;	dw	00080h
 54556                                  ;	dw	00000h
 54557                                  ;
 54558                                  ;HighMemory:	; label dword
 54559                                  ;	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 54560                                  ;	dw	0FFFFh
 54561                                  
 54562                                  	; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54563                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1085h
 54564                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:116Fh)
 54565                                  
 54566                                  EnsureA20ON:
 54567 00001085 9C                      	pushf
 54568 00001086 1E                      	push    ds
 54569 00001087 06                      	push	es
 54570 00001088 51                      	push	cx
 54571 00001089 56                      	push	si
 54572 0000108A 57                      	push	di
 54573                                  
 54574                                  	; 19/09/2023
 54575                                  	;lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 54576                                  	;les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 54577                                  
 54578                                  	; 25/03/2024 
 54579                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 54580                                  	;;;
 54581 0000108B 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 54582 0000108D 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 54583 0000108F 4E                      	dec	si
 54584 00001090 BF9000                  	mov	di,90h	; 0FFFFh:0090h	; HighMemory
 54585 00001093 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
 54586 00001095 BE8000                  	mov	si,80h	; 0000h:0080h	; LowMemory
 54587                                  	;;;	
 54588                                  
 54589 00001098 B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 54590 0000109B FC                      	cld
 54591 0000109C F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 54592                                  
 54593 0000109E 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 54594                                  EA20_RET:
 54595 000010A0 5F                      	pop	di
 54596 000010A1 5E                      	pop	si
 54597 000010A2 59                      	pop	cx
 54598 000010A3 07                      	pop	es
 54599 000010A4 1F                      	pop	ds
 54600 000010A5 9D                      	popf
 54601 000010A6 C3                      	retn
 54602                                  
 54603                                  EA20_OFF:
 54604                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 54605                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 54606                                  
 54607 000010A7 53                      	push	bx
 54608 000010A8 50                      	push	ax
 54609                                  
 54610                                  ; 25/03/2024
 54611                                  %if 0
 54612                                  	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 54613                                  	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 54614                                  	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 54615                                  	mov	ax,cs
 54616                                  	mov	ss,ax
 54617                                  %else
 54618                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54619                                  	;;;
 54620 000010A9 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 54621 000010AB 2E8C16[9A0F]            	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ss
 54622 000010B0 2E8926[9C0F]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 54623 000010B5 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 54624                                  	;;;
 54625                                  %endif
 54626 000010B7 BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 54627                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 54628                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 54629 000010BA B405                    	mov	ah,5
 54630 000010BC 2EFF1E[7B10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 54631 000010C1 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 54632 000010C3 740E                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 54633                                  
 54634                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 54635                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 54636                                  	;  25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54637                                  	;;;
 54638 000010C5 2E8E16[9A0F]            	mov	ss,[cs:SS_Save]
 54639                                  	;;;
 54640 000010CA 2E8B26[9C0F]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 54641                                  
 54642 000010CF 58                      	pop	ax
 54643 000010D0 5B                      	pop	bx
 54644                                  
 54645 000010D1 EBCD                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 54646                                  
 54647                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 54648 000010D3 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 54649 000010D5 CD10                    	int	10h
 54650 000010D7 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 54651 000010D9 7405                    	je	short XMMcont		; Y: do not change mode
 54652                                  	;xor	ah,ah ; 0		; set video mode
 54653                                  	;mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 54654                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54655                                  	;;;
 54656 000010DB B80200                  	mov     ax,2
 54657                                  	;;;
 54658 000010DE CD10                    	int	10h
 54659                                  XMMcont:
 54660                                  	;mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 54661                                  	;xor	al,al			; page 0
 54662                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54663                                  	;;;
 54664 000010E0 B80005                  	mov     ax,500h
 54665                                  	;;;
 54666 000010E3 CD10                    	int	10h
 54667                                  	
 54668 000010E5 BE[1312]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 54669 000010E8 0E                      	push	cs
 54670 000010E9 1F                      	pop	ds
 54671 000010EA FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 54672                                  XMMprnt:
 54673 000010EB AC                      	lodsb
 54674 000010EC 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 54675 000010EE 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh
 54676 000010F0 B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 54677 000010F2 BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 54678 000010F5 CD10                    	int	10h
 54679 000010F7 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 54680                                  
 54681                                  XMMStall:
 54682 000010F9 FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 54683 000010FA EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End
 54684                                  
 54685                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54686

 54970                                  ;

 54972                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.

 54999                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 55000                                  ;

 55004                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 55005                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS

 55035                                  ; DOSDATA:1353h
 55036                                  
 55037                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 55038                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 55039                                  ;
 55040                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.

 55047                                  ;	    mov ah, 0Eh
 55048                                  ;	    int 10h
 55049                                  ;	    jmp l0
 55050                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 55051

 55053 00001205 3C24                    		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 55054 00001207 7408                    		db	074h,008h		;     je l1

 55095                                  ; 17/01/2024 - Note: COUNTRY_CDPG must be at DOSDATA:122Ah (to 12B8h) addr
 55096                                  ; It is fixed at 122Ah in PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM and MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS

 55098                                  
 55099                                  ;############################################################################
 55100                                  ;
 55101                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 55102                                  ;
 55103                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 55104                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 55105                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can. 
 55106                                  ;
 55107                                  ; MARK3 SHOULD NOT BE > 122AH 
 55108                                  ;
 55109                                  ; As of 9/6/90, this area is FULL!
 55110                                  ;
 55111                                  ;############################################################################
 55112                                   
 55113                                  	;ORG	0122Ah
 55114                                  
 55115                                  ; DOSDATA:122Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 55116                                  
 55117                                  ; 09/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 55118                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:122Ah
 55119                                  
 55120                                  ; 17/01/2024
 55121                                  ; MSDOS 5.0  MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 55122                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 55123                                  ; 09/03/2024
 55124                                  ; Windows ME    IO.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 55125                                  
 55126                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 55127                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 55128                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 55129                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 55130                                  
 55131                                  ; country and code page information
 55132                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55133                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 55134 0000122A 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 55135 00001232 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 55135 0000123B 53595300           
 55136                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 55137 0000123F 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 55138                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 55139                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 55140                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 55141                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 55142                                  ;  endif
 55143                                  ;  ifdef TAIWAN
 55144                                  ;	dw   938			; system code page id (TAIWAN)
 55145                                  ;  endif
 55146                                  ;  ifdef KOREA
 55147                                  ;	dw   934			; system code page id (KOREA IBM)
 55148                                  ;  endif
 55149                                  ;else
 55150 00001272 B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 55151                                  ;endif
 55152                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 55153 00001274 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 55154                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_76: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 76 
 55155 00001276 02                      	db   SetUcase  ; 2		; Ucase type
 55156 00001277 [FA0A]                  	dw   UCASE_TAB			;pointer to upper case table
 55157 00001279 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 55158 0000127B 04                      	db   SetUcaseFile  ; 4		; Ucase file char type
 55159 0000127C [7C0B]                  	dw   FILE_UCASE_TAB 		;pointer to file upper case table
 55160 0000127E 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 55161 00001280 05                      	db   SetFileList ; 5		; valid file chars type
 55162 00001281 [280D]                  	dw   FILE_CHAR_TAB 		;pointer to valid file char tab
 55163 00001283 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 55164 00001285 06                      	db   SetCollate	; 6		; collate type
 55165 00001286 [FE0B]                  	dw   COLLATE_TAB		;pointer to collate table
 55166 00001288 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 55167 0000128A 07                      	db   SetDBCS	; 7		;AN000; DBCS Ev			2/12/KK
 55168 0000128B [000D]                  	dw   DBCS_TAB			;AN000;pointer to DBCS Ev table	2/12/KK
 55169 0000128D 0000                    	dw   0				;AN000; segment of pointer	2/12/KK

 55333                                  ;

 55335                                  ;	GETBUF:
 55336                                  ;

 55338                                  ;	push	es

 55356                                  ;

 55372                                  ; DOSDATA:12F6h
 55373                                  
 55374                                  ; Seventh DOS patch - System call entry, patch USER_ID with VMid for share
 55375                                  ;
 55376                                  ; Code in disp.asm, 1 location
 55377                                  ;
 55378                                  ;
 55379                                  ;	mov [SaveDS],ds
 55380                                  ;	mov [SaveBX],bx
 55381                                  ;	mov bx,cs
 55382                                  ;	mov ds,bx
 55383                                  ;	inc [indos]
 55384                                  ;	xor ax,ax

 55386

 55388                                  DOSP7_SAVEDS:	db	07Eh,05h		; mov [SaveDS],ds
 55389                                  		db	02Eh,089h,01Eh
 55390                                  DOSP7_SAVEBX:	db	07Ch,05h		; mov [SaveBX],bx
 55391                                  		db	08Ch,0CBh		; mov bx,cs
 55392                                  		db	08Eh,0DBh		; mov ds,bx
 55393                                  		db	0FEh,006h
 55394                                  DOSP7_INDOS:	db	0CFh,002h		; inc [indos]
 55395                                  		db	033h,0C0h		; xor ax,ax
 55396                                  DOSP7_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP7_ID
 55397                                  
 55398                                  ; DOSDATA:130Ah
 55399                                  
 55400                                  ; Eighth DOS patch - OWNER check in handle calls. For share, need to NOP test
 55401                                  ;
 55402                                  ; Code in handle.asm, 1 location in routine CheckOwner
 55403                                  ;
 55404                                  ;

 55408                                  ;	cmp	ax,es:[di.sf_UID]   <- NOP
 55409                                  ;	pop	ax
 55410                                  ;	jz	????
 55411

 55413                                  		db	036h,0A1h
 55414                                  DOSP8_USER_ID:	db	0EAh,002h		; mov  ax,ss:[USER_ID]
 55415                                  		db	026h,03Bh,045h		; cmp  ax,es:[di+2F]
 55416                                  DOSP8_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP8_ID
 55417                                  		db	02Fh,058h		; pop  ax
 55418                                  
 55419                                  ; DOSDATA:1314h
 55420                                  
 55421                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 55422                                  ;
 55423                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 55424                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 55425                                  ;
 55426                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 55427                                  ;
 55428                                  ;   DVRDRAW:
 55429                                  ;	    PUSH    ES
 55430                                  ;	    POP     DS
 55431                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10
 55432                                  ;	    MOV     BX,DI
 55433                                  ;	    XOR     AX,AX			<- Reenter #2
 55434                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 55435                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 55436                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 55437                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 55438                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL
 55439                                  ;	    MOV     DX,DI
 55440                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H
 55441                                  ;	    MOV     DI,[DEVCALL.REQSTAT]
 55442                                  ;	    TEST    DI,STERR
 55443                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 55444                                  ;	    call    CHARHARD
 55445                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 55446                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 55447                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 55448                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 55449                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 55450                                  ;	    POP     DS
 55451                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 55452                                  ;
 55453                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 55454                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 55455                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 55456                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 55457                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 55458                                  ;
 55459                                  ;   CRDROK:
 55460                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 55461                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 55462                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 55463                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 55464                                  
 55465                                  DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 55466                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 55467                                  DOSP10_LOC:		db	08BH,0DFH
 55468                                  DOSP10_REENT2_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 55469                                  			db	033H,0C0H,08BH,0D0H,0E8H
 55470                                  DOSP10_ID_LEN		equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 55471                                  			db	0DFH,00EH
 55472                                  DOSP10_REENT1_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 55473                                  			db	01EH,036H,0C5H,036H,036H,005H,0E8H,0AFH,00EH
 55474                                  			db	08BH,0D7H,0B4H,086H,036H,08BH,03EH
 55475                                  DOSP10_PACKVAL_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 55476                                  			db	009H,003H
 55477                                  			db	0F7H,0C7H,000H,080H,074H,019H,0E8H,047H,017H
 55478                                  			db	08BH,0FAH,00AH,0C0H,074H,010H,03CH,003H,074H,003H
 55479                                  			db	01FH,0EBH,0CFH
 55480                                  DOSP11_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 55481                                  			db	05FH
 55482                                  DOSP11_REENT_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 55483                                  			db	036H,0C4H,03EH,036H,005H,0E9H,0A1H,004H
 55484                                  
 55485                                  DOSP12_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 55486                                  			db	05FH,08BH,0FAH
 55487                                  ; DOSDATA:1353h
 55488                                  
 55489                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 55490                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 55491                                  ;
 55492                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.
 55493                                  ;
 55494                                  ;
 55495                                  ;	l0: lodsb		<- Setfocus here
 55496                                  ;	    cmp al, '$'
 55497                                  ;	    je l1
 55498                                  ;	    mov bl, 7
 55499                                  ;	    mov ah, 0Eh
 55500                                  ;	    int 10h
 55501                                  ;	    jmp l0
 55502                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 55503                                  
 55504                                  DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 55505                                  		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 55506                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 55507                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 55508                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 55509                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 55510                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 55511                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 55512                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID
